review: Rust ) the best best i ever played also the most buggy and not optimized game i ever played ) just count....14 euro...2 games old rust legacy and new Rust every week update and they are working not more then 2 years. This game is growing going to be wonderfull but dont expect so much at this time because its still alpha only think that really me off is they are not running old Rust version it was faster with greatest map ever darker atmospheric and easier to play how you like shooting was easier and whole graphics was strange fitting more to radiactive island then new Rust graphics which is more like Borderlands series. Sooooo....if you want somethink to play it everyday with ppl Rust is the Best Choice.....but if you want to play few hours at a week...FiFa or Battlefield is probably for you... Rust gives fun also new internet Friends really great feelling about your own awesomenes....but it will for exchange sucks your time energy and you will forget sleeping for a years )EDIT very important...this game is no more for 2 0 ghz procesors it made old crap from my Xeon 3 0 quadcore 8gb ram 1gb graphics!!!!!its evolving to somethink really big and it will need normal new computers so eveone whos buying this game for low requirements will just suck up....basic and lowest pc to play it on very super low settings is 2 6 dual core 4gb ram 1gb graphic card!!!! i had it and it runs like 20 30 fps after i upgraded pc to 4core xeon fps jumped to 50 but still....i cant play it even on medium settings...soooo..yes it is best survival multiplayer game ever but no you will not play it on cheap notebook only the old version Legacy was pc friendly....you still can play it but bigger player base is obviously now on New version

review: A unique game and a very fun one at that. A fun one for about a day. The gameplay is pretty unique and extremely entertaining and most of all time consuming. You gotta survive you have to acquire weapons friends resources build a house and basically sustain yourself while other players try to raid your house or simply assassinate you while you're out in the open only to grab your goods and use it for themselves. All this only to be killed by a hacker from across the map then spawn in your house then be killed in a fraction of a second again through a wall and you lose all you've done. Its a great game but the number of hackers is insane. IN. SANE. Every game has hackers but not likt this this is just beyond words. A minimum of 4 hackers on every server. No exaggeration.Verdict Don't waste your time and money on this joke until something is actually done to ban hackers.

review: Rust is a very unique and creative game with many challanges intact. I enjoy the risks of searching Rad towns and villages exploring the powerplants hunting in the vallys and calling airdrops. Overall Rust lacks a few things protection from hackers and modders are not up to standered. I couldn't count the amount of times I have been found specificly on a map in an impossable to climb hill unless you take a certain path I found about 30 minutes into trying to find. Another downside is that once someone is OP they are next to impossable to kill. That may sound great if you yourself were OP but if the glove was on the other hand you would understand.I would recommend Rust if you are up for challenges and adventure. But don't get to hyped up as it is only in Alpha.

review: Rust has had it ups and downs. Currently it. is. bad. They've made everything much harder and time craving with the new updates. You cant demolish buildings stones are almost impossible to find and wolves are still OP as f**k. Speaking of animals before you could run and hit animals with the same speed now you get slowed down slightly when you press the hit button. When the animals travels faster than a speeding bullet getting resorces is impossible. Now we also have to repair the tools you have. REALLY?! It makes the game even more frikkishly annoying and unberable. We also have to find blue prints everywhere in barrels airdrops and whatnot. DOES THE DEVELOPERS JUST LOVE F*CKING UP THEIR GAME? It seems like it. Unless they can find a way to fix these bugs fast as humanly possible I won't recomend this game to anyone who want to have a good time. Side not to the dev team CHANGE IT BACK TO THE PREVIOUS VERSION aka how it was 2 months ago.

review: Wasn't a fan I tried this game out for about 4 days played about 7 hours tried about 12 different servers and it always ended the same. You spawn (and if you don't get murdered right away by a spawn camping troll) you go and collect materials to survive and make tools so you can build a shelter. So you run along getting things you need (if you dont get kiled by a troll) and make a house. Then you have to eat so you go hunt (if you dont get killed by a troll) then you build a fire to cook the meat (if you dont get killed by a troll) from there I cant tell you what you do becuase I kept getting KILLED BY ING TROLLS. Everyone talks no one will help you players attack you on sight for sport you spawn again with nothing and if players dont get you animals will. The game is truely the most frusterating thing I've ever encountered. I usually enjoy games like this and thought this one would be a hit but it comes down to the amount of jackasses playing it that ruins the game.

review: Great survival game that mixes elements from DayZ and Minecraft. About a 1 hour learning curve playing solo but the game is intuitive and fairly simple once you get the hang of it.The PVP is a strong selling point for the game. Once you have gathered and crafted resources built up a base you and some friends can start raiding other groups' villages and loot all their belongings or of course you can just be friendly and build up an empire and recruit. Your choice! Which is another pretty cool feature of the game.

review: Rust Legacy (1st one) It is very good the grafic are great. when it is dark out I would not recomend having the grafic at Max because you wont see anything without light. The game is a time to win game where the longer you play on the game the stronger you become and also skills will also come into play.Rust Experimental (new verison) The new version really puts the Sandbox world into Rust unlike Rust Legacy you dont need the time and effort to dominate the server all you need is some players a good spawn (Forest Grasslands) and you will have everything you need. Because there is no C4 Gernades Mods or Defences. you can break into a house with a rock (Given you have enough time) As the game progreses I am sure the dificulty of defeneding and attacking houses will be changed.

review: Как я могу поставить хорошую оценку игре которая имеет самое отбитое и злое комьюнити среди всех других игр??!При игре в одиночку вы почти всегда будете умирать на самом раннем этапе развития от других игроков. В этой игре любой человек взявший в руки дальнебойное оружие всегда попытается убить другого человека и не важно бомж ли этот человек или скиловый игрок.Вы не сможете никак развиться пока не найдете товарищей в этой игре но с учетом того что нормальных и адекватных игроков на серверах оооооооочень мало хрен вы что сможете сделать вообще! Любой ваш дом зарейдят через день после его постройки. Спасения нет!Единственный способ спокойно играть в эту игру это играть в нее с друзьями.

review: So why is the community in Rust particularly intense? Well it s a super stressful game. Anyone can kill you at any moment and take everything you ve worked for. At best you have a verbal agreement with someone and all you can do is hope that they don t betray you. Rust is turned into more than a survival game it s a social experiment in humanity. It s an exercise in trust stress loss and disappointment all the time.if you love to farm on hours on end this is the game for you

review: It's a funny and great game however you really do want to play with friends. Those who cry about clans being OP need to wake up and actually talk about the flaws of the game and the benefits of owning this game. For example the flaws are the poor optimization and the lack of stability of the game which ends up with quite a few glitches per day. However the benifits of owning a game such as Rust is that you can enjoy playing a game which has such a little developers team to play with friends and just have a laugh. I would only suggest that the Dev team worry about the glitches for now the ones that they can fix anyway. THEN they should worry about adding new things if they update the game and add more and more things without fixing glitches and errors I have a bad feeling that people will spend time catching up instead of just playing the game whilst things are being stabilized. Honestly in my opinion I would recommend this game as long as you don't mind losing your gear and to be honest if you can put up with glitches then yeah enjoy the game. Once again it's not about the clans it's about the game itself and how it's being developed as a game in a whole.#CarryOnFacePunch

This is game that literally makes money by encouraging players to grief each other. review: Great game! Haven't had any real "alpha" issues or the lag issues some have. I decided to join a PVE server with a little protection just to get the hang of things. Dealing with animals was rough at first and I bet i died 6 or 7 times before I finally got some food and built my first fire. I agree with most reviews the future of the game is endless. Cheating seems to be an overall issue I haven't seen it. Most of the poeple I have run across have been helpful. If you understand as this page clearly states that you may run into issues because this is hardly a finished game then you will have a lot of fun. It has been frustrating but I cannot walk away. PERMADEATH isn't for everyone but you have to try to find out. I would say this is not a good game for someone just getting into games it is geared towards experienced players. I am very pleased with that as every year we see mega FPS games pumped out and they are all the same. At least here you decide what your play time is used for. Great game for Minecraft players too.

review: My old review had become...well old. Time again for a refresh. I'm one of the "old" players the ones who were around when people were still trying to figure out what this new fangled "Early Access" crap was. I've been with Rust since the days when there was only one map the rock lasted for ever and the sun meant salvation (praise be). So...I know what I'm talking about (my hours prove it).BREAKDOWN (for lazy bums) Rust is a survival game. You hit trees rocks people...yeah you get the picture. It's good. Buy it. Don't become a tower sniper or I KEEL YOU.PROS Great dev team. These guys (unlike literally every other survival game dev team who are out to rob you and run) deliver on promises and are constantly improving the game. Landscape. Rust has very good graphics (unless you run on a potato in which case it might be time to upgrade that Apple 1 you're running it on and stop blaming the servers) which makes the landscapes turn out nice. Trees water mountains...all very capturing. Brings a tear to my virtual eye. Player interaction. This all really depends on what kind of player YOU are. If you're a COD/CS GO player who wants to make some guns and "rock and roll" then you should OFF and go back to playing that because we don't need more trigger happy animals running around. If you're a sweet farmer who wants to peacefully build you will likely be chewed up and destroyed.If you're an engineer or minecraft player you'll enjoy this game because building is logical and similar.If you are a trader forget every server except RP ones.If you enjoy a game that gives you stories like DayZ this is the one for you. Hell here's a story right now. I was the leader of the Knights Templar Legion X Arcani BARON Oil and the Father Abbot of the Church of the Great Divine One in the Sky all in the span of like 4 months in Rust (all were successful except for Legion X because of a Roman crackdown). RP Servers. By far the best portion of the players in this game go to the roleplay servers. I highly recommend finding one and playing on those. You can even meet devs or s (looking at you Maejohl (jk I love you don't kill me))CONS Lag. Yep. I'm complaining about lag (gunshot). Grinding. It must be said. This game requires some devotion on non modded server for solo or small group players. I'd recommend not setting extreme goals which need millions of resources to accomplish or it just won't be fun. Incentive not to KOS. This is a biggie. I feel like crafting needs new directions like those in Life is Feudal that take awhile to acquire and make people specialists in some fields (herbalist cook mason miner weaponsmith jeweller...) After all killing a master mason isn't the best move when you need a house. Lack of Dynamic Weather. Rain and snow just don't cut it (and meteor showers but 'em). I want a sea storm from hell or an earthquake that devastates the land. No vehicles yet. I WANT SHIPS AND CARS GODAMMIT. Caves. These BS ground caverns are the first places to be taken on a server and are ridiculously easy to fortify. That being said the problem is that there are only like 3 per map. I'd like to see 30 40 caves per map not exactly minechafts or dwarven expanses but something to light a fire in and get out of the rain with. BP (blueprint) system is a . This needs a complete revision (which the devs have planned).MIXED BLESSINGS Building. Don't get me wrong I like Rust's building system a LOT more than some others but there are a few minor problems. Certain locations won't let you place a wall or roof when there's an open space after you BUILT A 20 ING STORY WALL. Another problem is not being able to connect a building to the landscape too well (building a wall into a rock) but that's slowly being fixed. Slowly. Landscape Altering. I want the ability to at least smooth land temporarily to place a building or cut that pesky hill off the top of a mountain so I can make my mountain retreat. Or summer home below. Or maybe a slave plantation like I did that one time (don't ask but people DID volunteer to be slaves.) Radtowns. They can be walled off they're for the most part inaccessible (building wise) ugly and the bp's they have require you to visit them and die multiple times. Still they provide a break from an otherwise endless tour of forest snow and desert. And the Sphere rocks. If you read this to the end Congratulations! You've won a free IPhone and all you need to do is click here to collect http //playrust.com/Did I mention dermatologists hate me?

review: Well I gave it a shot. After wandering around for a good 90 minutes beating a rock against trees and getting killed over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over again (presumably my rocks were the best rocks and everybody really wanted them) I have to say this game is one of the most boring ways I've wasted 90 minutes in recent memory. There looks like there might be a robust crafting system but as you need more than just wood to craft just about anything I couldn't craft since the only resource available within a lifetime's walking distance is just more wood. I did one time find a differently colored rock which yielded some other rocks when I smashed it with my rock but of course I did not have time to figure out if that helped me as I'd exceeded the 12 seconds allowed between deaths and was overdue for the bullet I caught from somebody somewhere hopefully they were able to use my rocks? Meh 3/10.

review: This game is a fantastic mix of Minecraft and DayZ. Hunting and gathering materials and building massive structures are very similar to Minecraft. The massive open world environment and harsh community are similar to DayZ. This game does take a massive amount of time however as you can play for up to 6 hours at a time and not run out of stuff to do. My only complaint is the removal of the zombies and the horrible degradation mechanic where items continuously degrade overtime until they can not be repaired again. Besides this Rust is one of the best games I have ever played and I am excited for what it will become in the future.

review: UhNot too sure what to write here so heres a recipe for Pancakes insteadIngredients 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour3 tablespoons sugar1 tablespoon baking powder1/4 teaspoon salt1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg2 large eggs at room temperature1 1/4 cups milk at room temperature1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract3 tablespoons unsalted butter plus more as neededNow to make it1. In a large bowl whisk together the flour sugar baking powder salt and nutmeg.2. In another bowl beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla.3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat.4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture and whisk until a thick batter is just formed5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes and the undersides are golden brown about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter adding more butter to the skillet as needed.6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit or chocolate chips nuts etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more being careful not to burn toppings.

review: Note This game will most likely force you to come back and check up on your character and your property only buy this game if you have a lot of free time.Story The year is 2025 after the Five Nights at Freddy's Fans taken over Garry's mod with their Steam workshop items relating to Scott's game King Garry has been overthrown and Garry's mod has been changed into Freddy's mod. Garry and a million other players escaped the F.N.A.F regime and traveled to the islands know as Rust. However the planes containing Garry and his players have crashed all over the islands. Garry managed to collect the players and promised to make a new game with no animatronics no maps relating to Chuck E Cheeses and no jumpscares. However King Garry was killed by his players due to the fact that he promised a game with paid mods. With no leader to control the people the players split up forming cities and houses in an attempt to survive the islands of Rust. However the players started to become vicious cannibals and bandits killing other humans for their resources which led to people distrusting other neighbors and making weapon blueprints to fend off the intruders. This went on for months until one day a bandit had made the ultimate weapon blueprint "The Atom Bomb". This weapon was capable of destroying any fortress and also leaving off a permanent area of radiation. The bandit and a group of his friends traveled to each island and blew up every urban building. The sound of The Atom Bomb had reached all the way to the Steam Community and made Lord Gaben concerned. To help the survivors of the explosion Lord Gaben has sent half a million pilots to drop supplies onto random areas of the islands. This only made matters worst as the Rust inhabitants fight off against each other to secure the goods. With no hope of helping these animals in the jungle Gaben purged all the inhabitants and allowed Facepunch Studios to have all rights to the islands. Facepunch use the events that happened in the islands and made the early access game called Rust to commemorate that tragic events that happened.Review Rust is a first person survival game that allows players to collect resources and expand their shelters to defend themselves against other players. In this game you can't trust anyone except the people you teamed up with like steam friends and other friendly people. In my opinion the fear of getting killed or having your shelter destroyed is one of the most important aspects in making the game fun especially when your collected resources is at risk of getting stolen. Another aspect that makes this game unique than the other survival games out there on the market is that you have the freedom to uncensor a Since now a days the media shows uncensored female parts why not uncensor a mans genitalia. The only problem I have with this game is that it forces me to come back and check up on my character and property just to make sure everything is okay which can really interfere with my schedule. This game features Wild naked people Thrilling survival experience and randomly generated large maps to explore. Considering that this game is also a sandbox game don't let creativity get to you. It's best to make something simple like a house so that you wont waste enough resources plus resources are hard to come by depending your location. I only recommend this game to people who have a lot of free time on their schedules.Cost $19.99Rating 83/100 Great

review: Rust is the type of game in which you need the maximum amount of patience to have a good time. So when you start off you have 1 torch 2 med kits and a rock. You have to get materials mainly wood to make a house tools and weapons to defend yourself. If you dont like PvP you can find some PvE servers ( player versus enemy ). That way the only thing that can kill you are the ridicoulousy strong bears and the hella fast wolves. Once you get a house you need to make some weapons to kill animals and other people ( when the time comes ). Animals will give you cloth and food which you still need to cook and players will give you anything that was in their invenory at the time of their death. For me i was killed a lot upon respawn so i suggest right when you spawn you move to a safe area thats not out in the open. This game was a 9.75/10 AcidThunder

review: I recommend this game even when it is still in alpha. Why? You can experience the updates!At the moment there aren't really alot of big updates but I love reading the dev blogs and looking forward to play the new content!Now this game is brutal. As in Don't whine about losing.Seems harsh but when playing on a server even noob friendly you are going to die. alot.Ofcourse this will suck. alot.But as you play more and more of this game you will get better and know how to defend yourself after getting your base raided a few times you learn and start to see the raids as feedback what to do different.I've met alot of noobs who kept complaining about dieing but as soon as they got geared up they enjoyed killing other players and forgot that they were beginners one day as well. So it does show some human instincts.Also when you have a base and gear the current end game content is PVP. Don't complain when you are killed just start over and try to get revenge. When someone kills you don't spam the chat claiming someone is hacking they aren't 9 10 times. They just got you. If you do choose to whine and calling people hackers you won't be taken serious. They will treat you like a 11 year old. I've seen 5 6 players who kept spamming about people being hackers everyone got tired of them and started hating them admins banned them for bad behaviour. If you get killed just say something as "Well played!" it is sportmanship if you kill someone you are happy about it as well so try to stay friendly and you will have a great time in rust.The game is kind of blank at the moment the biggest content is PVP which is great fun. Don't expect to much besides the PVP but it has great potential worth an investment right now if it is to blank for you wait 2 3 months and try again with the new content )For me this is one of my most fun games espescially to play with friends!

review: This review is about the game rust. Lately i have been playing the game for a while now and all i can tell you rust is pure chaos in a good and bad way (people who likes to Roleplay this game is not for you). The game is really HOSTILE as i had expierience. Things I like about rust 1.It is fun (depends)2. the game is a massive multiplayer game 3. It is challenging to get resources because of how much players there is4. there is alot of PVP5. RAIDSThings i hate about Rust 1. you can only go to 40fps even with 1080 amp extreme2. if you dont want to waste memory every week this game is not for you3. it's not player friendly for starter (modded or no KOS server for begginers)4. you cannot stay alive for aleast 5 minutes outside without a friend TIPSAlways play with a friendGo to combat tag server if you like the game for pvp or you want to practice on killing noobsWipe Server Reset is thursday or friday of every start on months (does not apply for community or modded servers)When you spawn always make a weapon to defend your self ( Spears Bow)Always go for the "Cargo" or Airdrop early gameBow can outmatch gunDont get to cocky there are better players than youMake some friends (neighbours Clans) they can help you alot.Don't bother finding each other across the map the chance is you coth will get killedSleeping bag are useful to set spawnpoint for you and your friendIf you cant access or do anything try holding "e"ConclusionRust is fun but overall if your looking for a nice time you should not play this game or go to a specific server of your intrest or else you wouldn't survive on the dry wastelands of the rust world(my english is

review: Rust is a survival game created by Facepunch Studios. Inspired by games like DayZ Minecraft and Stalker Rust aims to create a hostile environment in which emergent gameplay can flourish. The aim of the game is to survive. To do this the player should gather resources. Hitting a tree with a rock will give you wood hitting a rock with a rock will give you rock and ore. You can then craft a hatchet from the wood and rock allowing you to gather faster. You can go out and hunt a variety of wildlife such as boars chickens rabbits bears wolves and deer. Once you have killed an animal you can butcher it to gather its meat and skin. You can craft a fire using wood and cook the meat inside the fire. Then you can eat. You face two major dangers in game. Rust is a multiplayer game so there will be other players trying to survive in the same way that you are. Unfortunately for you they can find you kill you and take your stuff. Fortunately for you you can kill them and take their stuff. Or maybe you can make friends and help each other survive. Rust s world is harsh so you might need to make friends to survive. The environment is not kind. Bears and wolves will chase and kill you. Falling from a height will kill you. Being exposed to radiation for an extended period will kill you. Starving will kill you. Being cold will kill you.

review: It saddens me to give Rust a negative review because it used to be a great game. With the new implementation of the XP system it's much more difficult to enjoy the game without investing a significant amount of time into farming resources which is very boring and repetitive. I don't recommend this game for a few reasons one being time spent. You can play this on unofficial servers where things don't take as long to accomplish but either way it leads to my primary problem. Those that spend more time than you will always beat you regardless of your skill. There is such a large spike of power as you progress gaining access to certain items and weapons. If you enjoy hitting nodes and trees for literally hours this is the game for you.

Items Lots of items seems useless Like lots of food like items... While all animals drops chicken meat... Hackers I've seen a few hackers so far. Quite annoying... Building options Quite ok for early access but it definetely needs more depth...Overall the game is quite fun I recommend it if you don't mind too much for all the things mentionned above.If you have friends to play with it sure is a lot of fun.

review: As the game is it is an amazing idea and the mechanics are very intuitive. However there is definitely quite the hacking problem. I see that people are being banned and dealt with but it seems that they come as quickly as they're dealt with. My story is a short one. I logged in after work to find i had been killed okay that's fine it is Rust after all they happened to be in my house when i logged back in a i spawnded in my sleeping bag. i clubbed them to death with my trusty rock. then after 30 seconds they were back trying to kill me again so i threw my spear at them and killed them a second time. then the SAME person was back AGAIN within another 30 seconds. now i know that sleeping bags allow you to respawn but there is a timer to it. plus when they first killed me it was with an axe which they didnt have on their body. and when they came back the second time they were armed with a spear and it takes time and 300 wood to make one of those. so with my little rant over i must say as a game Rust is amazing even in its early(ish) state but the hackers definitely ruin the game. i've had too many run ins with them in my short time playing and because of that i dont think i will be playing it again for a while but definitely give the game a try if you find it on sale and want to give it a go just be warned that the hackers are everywhere. so i give the games a thumbs up because it is awesome. thank you have a nice day.

review: Love Survival Games?Is your favorite activity running around naked in the wilderness with a rock as your only companion?Do you wish to feel another man chase you down with his rock to eat your corpse?WELL THIS GAME IS FOR YOU!I personally find RUST fun. The server I am on is relatively small to lessen the chances of getting into an encounter. My Listu Pros No Zombies Just good ol' fashioned mother nature and a server filled with s all to ready to teabag and loot your corpse to contend with!Once you pick up the basics it becomes easier to follow and understandNatural land generation makes for beautiful surroundings.Hunting is fairly realistic (unless said prey is stuck on an invisible wall).Constant look out on your overall condition and what factors bode ill for you.Loot is fairly hard to find outside of RAD towns and Airdrops making them more contended and a definite target.Cons Blueprints are rare as balls even in places you'd expect to find them.Forging is a process which takes too much time and way too many resources for minimal turn out making it a bit of a chore.Random spawning can sometimes drop you right next to players all too ready to paint the surrounding area with your innards frustrating for new players.The building system can be extremely confusing for novice players.The randomly spawning Prefabs are often just for show outside of RAD towns making them nothing more than disappointing landmarks.Often not enough warning about dangerous animals being nearby (They should be louder and growl/bark when they are charging giving you time to react).You can't see someones name until you're literally close enough to lick them. Making friendly fire a constant issue as people panic.

review: Taking in my experience of Rust so far I cannot recommend this game to the average player. To skip right to the point the only reason anyone would want to buy this game is for the basebuilding and communication between players. Combat collecting resources walking(Moving in general) etc is completely unenjoyable. The lag is so bad in some of the servers (Primarily the offical server) that you may glitch backwards and or be unaware of a players location as well as your own players at any given point. This server lag is unbearable as well as destroys attempts at combat gather resources... This is only one of the major problems with Rust hacking is another huge reason. You will find a hacker on every server (Official Servers) Its unaviodable and destroys the survivor experience. The admins of these servers are hardly on and if you want to report a hacker you need video proof. Most people will not go through the work of taking and sending a video to ban another hacker so these hackers aren't leaving. In combination of the lag and hacking this game is very unenjoyable. I highly do not recommend this game unless you are tolerant easy going care free etc. If you are going to purchase this game don't play on official servers even though there are fewer people you may more vastly enjoy the game with a decrease in lag and hackers.
title: Rust

review: About as much fun as hitting a tree with a rock which is incidently what you'll be doing a lot of.Maybe when it's fleshed out it'll be a good game. I personally enjoy DayZ a lot more as there are so many different situations you can find yourself in (taking hostages bandit hunting being a bandit etc). In this game it's pretty much KOS or wander round with a randomer (or a friend if you can find them) hitting rocks with rocks to get rocks.Also while I realise this is a survival game I found it almost impossible to meet with friends. Although I'm sure if you bothered to learn the map layout you would eventually.A plus to this game is housing though which is implemented pretty well.All in all not a terrible game but definitely not outstanding in its current state but I suppose it is early access things will change (and hopefully improve).5/10EDIT Yeah even at release 3/10EDIT2 Also DayZ

I will say this if you can find the right server with the right people and admins this game can be a complete blast. I reccomend Rust to most people but not to the gamer that expects a fairy land of sweet bubble gum drops and roses... and ponies. PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK OF INSANITY. That is all.

review: I've played ARK since it was about the same stage this game is now and there is just no comparison this game is NOT a serious competitor.I probably would've spent longer trying to hammer through the usual noob confusion but this game has no single player mode which means no pausing while I Google all the things I need to know (since of course there are no tutorials yet) and also constant profanity and if I dare to ask a question verbal abuse from the other players. Toxic playerbases are the rule not the exception this is a constant in MMO gaming so I feel that a singleplayer mode is essential for those people who don't like to constantly cuss fight with everyone around them. I won't be trying it again until there is one.I'll check back in a few months. Until then my two cents If you have twenty bucks to burn buying games in this stage is always cheaper. But this particular one unlike some others I've played isn't very well done at this stage so buy now and maybe it'll be worth playing someday.

review: Do you want to kill yourself? Alot? This is the community for you. We kill ourselves on a daily basis and it's so normal people won't even blink when you say "Brb I'm just gonna kill myself". The odd thing is in this game you also value your life so much some people rage after every death because it means so much when you fall over screaming and bleeding out. Some people just can't handle it because everything in this game has weight. every gun every stack of wood each syringe you have has to be farmed or found giving it meaning. The only thing you sart with is a rock and a torch. Everything has to be earned found or stolen. You die and you are back to that rock. The crushing weight of failure will either make you actually kill yourself or make you stronger (after about a week of depression the first time around it gets better).Go out and buy this game it's a blast! (PS Trust No one. Not even your own brother. Girls are ok though they usually only farm and sort boxes. Just watch out if she got a black boyfriend stalking her he gonna fight you XD. ) Ask any Rust Vet they will tell you this is all true. If they don't they haven't played enough or are sheltered in some huge 30 person clan and will never see the light through all thier cancer. Peace Futures Nakeds

review: Fun survival game especially with friends! Just be prepared to fight others off if you're in a decent populated server. Things can get pretty hectic! You have to fortify and lay out defenses for your base while figuring out how to do this and stay alive with all your stuff while logged out when you eventually stop playing. I know that sounds intense and nerve racking! Because it is! That's what makes the game soo great though! Real people trying to steal and take your stuff while you're gone or aka sleeping ingame. It makes you feel like you need to be active in your game or your stuff will get taken unless you can stop invaders with traps and strong bases. That's why I recommed it! The game is interesting and can fully come to life with an active community. Just remember it depends on your server for how many people you'll have to worry about. Anyways I rate this game 8/10. It would have gotten more if it wasn't rage inducing to lose things sometimes...

Its a fun game but you have to spend hours and days on it just to watch your hardwork be wiped or get destroyed by other players.If I was actually able to kill somebody or make a gun or get leverage on somebody then there would be a fighting chance. Ive wasted so much time and have given this game so many chances. Its just not worth my time at this point...

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: I'd like to start off this review by saying that at the time of writing this I've only played around 20 hours so my opinions are subject to change (but I don't think they will). Primarily something which annoys me about the negatives reviews of this game is just how whiny they are. Oh no you can't choose your gender or skin color? Who the hell cares its a first person game anyways. Just put some armor on and you cant see what you are congrats. Also people complain about getting shot repeatedly as if they don't understand that that is exactly what the game is. Regardless you can circumvent that by just joining a nice semi populated community server. The first server I found was super friendly and no one RKed so the people complaining probably haven't tried to find a good server.Regardless I feel that this game is worth anyone's time. Buy it it's fun.

review: After playing the game for some time it has come to my attention that Rust is in possession of the worst survival community of them all. In no other game will you be shoot in cold blood so many times as in Rust. " You're a freshspawn they don't care they 'shoot to have fun'. "Perhaps it's the children within these that haunts every survival game of existence. For me Rust is a unpolished diamond there are some serious issues that has to be resolved for the game to be worth your money. But that being said I still don't regret my purchase. Hell I'd even buy another copy to prove my point. The game is simply unbeatable if and when compared to other survival shooters out there. It feel the most polished and even when counting its flaws people can get a lot of fun out of it.If you're planing on buying the game I'd suggest you'd want until the animal AI has been patched (fixed). At the moment as of writing this review I've been killed more than a few times from bears or even wolfs that're running strait through my base and killing me whilst I am either sleeping walking or crafting. You aren't safe unless you construct a base consisting of at least 2 levels (top one to sleep on). Not to mention that they some times just spawn strait in front of you and as such happens you're most likely not going to have the proper equipment in hand to take the bear/wolf down.It's a shame really that Garry doesn't priorities this in front of any form of weapon attachments and or a XP system.In terms of value for your money there is some but perhaps not enough to justify its price. I'll let you decide whether Rust is worth your money or not.

review: After playign this game for 30(+) hours I can safely say that this is one of if not the best survival game i have ever played. HOWEVER It's core gameplay is held back by 3 things game crashing bugs( as this is an alpha) graphical errors where textures will look like they came off a PS2 and the abrasive community. At it's very best Rust is an excellent survival game with smart crafting and Exp mechanics where you find satisfaction in every inch of progress you make whether alone or with friends that you've made. The world is beautiful and interesting while also being frightening and hostile. You have dynamic interactions with other players where you have to talk and act as you would in real life in order to make allies save your own skin or kill to survive. At its worst Rust is an uneven ugly cluster**** of more powerful players mowing down noobs before they can even begin building a base all while your framrate drops and your character stops moving i nthe middle of a firefight right as you crash. This game is VERY frustrating however once you push through the first few hours or so on a single server and you begin building yourself up you begin to see the fun in everything you do the pulse pounding stress of whether your base is going to be raided the race against tiem when you went out with all your gear and a helicopter shows up the fight against a bear who happened to be near an airdrop with life saving resources and weapons. All of these make the game so unique in that you never know whats going to happen next. Overall I say get it now or if you're skeptical wait until it's on sale. Overall I give it an 8 1/2 out of 10.
title: Rust

review: I highly enjoy this game because of it's great dev team and astounding progression and different ways to go about said progression.You start out completely naked with nothing else but a rock and a torch. Its from this point right here how you decide to progress. You can progress by gathering materials making yourself a nice home with a metal door and codelock or you can make yourself a bow and some bandages and kill other starting players for their materials. You can also sit by monuments and farm blueprints which allow you to make a specific item and that knowledge to make said item stays with you no matter what until there is a server wipe or you exit to a different server. No matter what method you use of getting higher in the game People will attempt to kill you or break into your home and take everything you own.What makes this game so enjoyable is the fact that it just gives you the tools and the community itself makes about 90% of the game. This game is made for the community to build on it. There are raiders people who build impregnable bases and camp their tower all day firing at people and people who partner with others to stab them in the back within 1 hour 1 week. You shouldn't feel bad for killing anyone and I mean anyone. Whether it comes to killing new spawned people or fully geared assailants you shouldn't feel bad for killing anyone.Now you may say "Why should I kill a newly spawned player? They can't hurt me and they aren't a threat". Although this is true at the time it's what they're gonna do TOMORROW is what matters. You battle for resources and eventually if he outfarms you you are on the losing hand and you have to waste more materials protecting yourself against them. So you've farmed up and geared yourself with metal and everything needed. What next? Raiding. Raiding is the main endgame of rust and it still manages to keep things interesting no matter what. You may find a base with so many walls and defenses it may just be full of so much loot and goodies that you can't wait to start to invade their home. Or you may hate someone so much because they stole your stuff drew hilarious signs in front of your house or are just straight up disgusting bandits that probably need a lesson. All fixed with a little clever invasion strategy. To invade someone you need to know a few basics. 1. The base layout. How large is their base? How many walls are there? What kind of walls are they? Do I have the materials to get inside? Are they online? Can they retaliate?2. Invasion tools. There are MANY tools you can use to invade someone's home. If they don't have a tool cupboard you can build straight over their main walls. What if they have a roof? Find the weakest spot of the base and use any explosive you have to attempt to get inside. The tools you will most likely use to break in are C4 Rockets paired with a Rocket Launcher Grenades or pickaxes/axes/bone clubs.3. A raid base. One of the most important things when raiding is a small base you create to make yourself a spawning point extra materials and a safe place to keep all the enemy's stolen belongings.There is so much more to this game. Finding weapons exploring monuments and clever decision making in dangerous situations is what builds a smart player in Rust. Always think a situation through and never trust anyone holding a gun shouting "Stop for a second".

review: I have put about 50 hours into this game through its development from a zombie survival game to a radiation based faction shooter all the way to what it is now A cluster . If you have come to me to ask whether or not you should buy this game you should first ask yourself "Why am I stupid enough to come to Dylan? " And if you still need my advise then I would highly reccoment Rust. Rust is a versitile game that caters to all playstyles whether you enjoy a game that you can jump into for an hour and have some fun or a game that you can easily put 1000 hours into and build an empire. Rust takes an overused and washed up genre and makes it fun again. You can truly feel completely enveloped by the games serenity and chaos because Rust has the captivation that grabs you by the balls and has you singing for your mother. I give rust a 8.5/10 because of all of the factors listed and many more and I hope to see it develop into an even bigger masterpiece.

review: Sighing Simulator 2016First 20 hours consisted of being shot within 5 minutes of respawning every time I spawned.I filled the chat with nihilistic musings about how no one makes any progress if everyone's a complete and utter low life br&gt Other voices joined me and soon I was running Skyfus' Sanctuary for the Sick of being Shot at. There weren't many members of the building but we helped nearly every newspawn that turned up on the door. We were loved and adored and all the neighbours were on peaceful terms with us.Then the squad moved into the neighbourhood. We don't know what they actually call their group so we've developed the affectionate term "the squad". They harrassed (and continue to harrass) the entire area including us. We had to cut off the charity toward all nakeds because the area around our base was a constant warzone.The squad has maybe 6 members but the most notable are (nicknames instead of steam names) the Psycho the Caesar and the Cynic The Psycho was the one to initially declare war on us after the time I tried to help him and he attacked me leading to a teammate of mine killing him.The Caesar was a player who added me on Steam after a random encounter that we both passed off as a misunderstanding. After talking for a while the seemingly nice man revealed his nature as one of the squad and proceeded to raid our base with them.The Cynic heard my complaints about how we're just trying to be nice and challenged me. No matter what I told him about my prior experience with KoS (Kill on Sight) culture in survival games the repetitive frustration it creates or my empathy for helpless newspawns stemming from the fact I used to be one he just kept citing I was in it for the exp sharing. If I really wanted exp sharing I wouldn't waste my time on newspawns and instead invite all my steam friends to play. Oh well...Everyone else in the area remained strongly out of favour with the squad though and to this day the only thing keeping the squad in our neighbourhood is the fact they have the most advanced recipes. The day they fall is the day we can finally be of service to the community once more.TL DR people are s the game is sighing simulator 2016 and you'll need to invite friends on or form alliances with randoms (careful with that one of my allies got ed by a mole) if you want to make any sort of progress.Oh also animals scale vertical surfaces built into the terrain instantly and walk through your walls/foundations. Bears death10/10 Would sigh again
title: Rust

review: Rust is an amazing game in my opinion. It feels like survival not only against the environment but like DayZ against other people as well. I myself prefer a smaller server with up to 20 people max and like to go on a server either while it's new or fresh after a wipe. Because otherwise the difference between you and the other players can get way too high. You can be naked with a rock and they'll have full kevlar and M4's and can raid your base rather easily. Stay modest with this game unless you have like a full clan of people with you. But while there's all that you learn to have fun with the game itself farming from the animals and from the radiated areas as well.All in all as it is 8/10

review: The game is great fun building mechanic and pretty simple to get into. Plenty of things to invest your time in and every now and thing you'll meet a friendly player. However the 95% of the players you meet are gonna make you hate this game. This game's community is one of the worst. You'll get shot for no reason and the fresh spawns will rush you with their rocks because what do they have to lose. Because the fresh spawns do that the fully geared players will shoot on sight even if you're just passing by minding your own buisness. I really hate talking bad about the game's community because some of the players won't KOS and are really nice. If those players made up the majority this game would easily be an 8 out of 10. review: There seems to be so many mixed and poor reviews here for this game and I'm unsure why. It is a blast to play even for someone like me that only recently purchased it. If you like a mix of survival pvp and a sprinkling of building mechanics this is YOUR game. The Legacy version (included) is still going strong and you can find active servers quite easily. It is PvP though so I would highly recommend a lightly loaded server in order to get your feet wet. The experimental alpha version is less populated but that is still in development and is missing quite a bit of the content of the legacy version (as well as the number of players.) That being said it is still being developed very actively with changes that seem to come on a frequent basis. The graphics are also quite nice in comparison.Pros Tons of online servers some modded as well with a very dynamic builder/pvp gameplay mechanic.Actively developed alpha version which looks to become a great game if legacy is any indicator.New Alpha version also comes with anti cheat software which should help guard against some of the legacy issues.Cons If you are new to the game prepare to be killed a lot. Trial by fire is the best way to learn to protect yourself and your belongings (think Day Z style gaming not co op minecraft.)The newest version is indeed alpha. Content is scarce but it is growing frequently.Although there is a lot of building mechanic within the game this is survival and pvp up front and building shouldn't be considered the main points of the game.

review: Rust is my all time favorite game. It brings me the most joy adrenaline and stress of anything I've ever played. The ability to succeed is based on experience skill and trust. It is the ultimate PvP experience and with the way the team over at Facepunch rolls out updates it's only uphill from here.Experience allows you to know which walls to hit with C4 how to sleep in that bush while you have the Airdrop on you and how to build a near impenetrable base. Skill is used to wield various weapons and know your limits when matching up against people. Can you kill those 4 nakeds chasing after you with only a spear and a hatchet on you? That's your call. Trust lies in the people you surround yourself with. Rust is an almost completely unpredictable game because you have no idea how people are going to react to the way you play. Killing that silly naked who wanted some food for free may have seemed like a hilarious idea at the time but maybe not so much when he shows up with 20 friends in full gear to your front door. And allowing that guy access to your whole base after you've only known him for 2 hours? I can tell you from experience it's not fun to log on and find that your base is no longer yours. They let me know that loud and clear as they screamed at me over their mics )Be friendly or be mean it's your call either way you have the ability to succeed immensely or end up homeless.PROTIPS Throwing spears are op AK is best gun pipeshotty is best gun for the poor don't build next to a spawn find some friends don't be too friendly don't eff with a clan unless you can back it up wall off your toolcupboard have an "airlock" in your front entrance pillars are 100% worth sharing sleeping bags saves 2 hours trying to find your friend if you wear clothes you will get shot 90% of the time if you're naked you will get shot 50% of the time everyone can hear you c4 people saying "friendly" almost never are nakeds aren't always what they appear to be hv ammo isn't worth the gp building on rocks makes for easy defense ladders really don't cost that much don't keep all your loot in one place keep up to date on glitches craft on the run have a ton of sleeping bags you can never have too many doors you can smelt/cook 4 items at a time don't plan your house too big salvaged tools are bad burst fire your gun deers come installed with vtec don't trust beancan grenades explosives can blow up the chests inside geared doesn't mean good or smart follow these tips and I'll still kill you )TL DR Best $20 I've ever spent.

review: Before I start let me just say I enjoy Rust but I write reviews to help people decide whether they will invest their money in a game or not. I will list the pros and cons with a nuetral approach (as nuetral as I can get). With that said here is the review Rust is a great game with barely any bugs/glitches. The main "issue" is the playerbase. Most people who play Rust will only befriend you when you are fresh spawns and 75% of the time they will betray you later on. If you find yourself in a situation where you are a fresh spawn and they other person had a gun they will shoot you because they like wasting bullets for rocks and a torch. Also 50% of the fresh spawns that you will encounter that won't betray you later on are the ones that charge at you with a rock without saying anything.Aside from SoS PvP there is your base. If you don't want to get raided you must spend the first 3 hours collecting supplies so you can get 1 layer of honeycombing so you don't get raided and don't even think about using a standard key lock because if you forget to make a spare and don't have 100 wood lying around when you die you are trapped in your base with no key to unlock your door and escape your own home. On your first day of Rust you will be excited if you made a base. If you did your research on base building you might have a nice home to come back to the next day. If you did not do your research chances are you left the game with your base made of twigs which can get knocked down in 5 swings from a stone hatchet.In conclusion you won't have a problem with rust if you are patient enough to get supplies before interacting with other players or you could take a chance at befriending a freshie and maybe he won't betray you!

I've tried a bunch of servers all resulting in the same thing an advanced player kills me and takes the stuff I spend a lot of time gathering. Seriously what am I a naked guy with some spears and stones supposed to do when a guy with armor and a gun comes running at me? Don't think you'll find a server where nobody randomly kills each other because apparently that's just part of the game Rust. Some servers just have more of it than others.I gave the game a second try in the hopes I'd find a server where me and a group of random people could work together to survive. Typing that makes me laugh knowing how this game really operates. If you don't mind working hard for something only to get screwed over by someone then by all means give the game a try. review: This is a fun and original survival based game. It has a good amount of weapons to craft and the system of blueprints is very creative and makes it a game where you actually have to work and have an objective to grow as a threat to others. The building system is all around pretty good and the resource system is as what you would expect chopping down trees and mining rocks. The system of character generating is a downside forcing you to stay as the randomly generated model 50% of being a man or woman and the skin color is random too. I see why they do that cause it would be annoying with a bunch of little black midgets that blend in with the dark attacking you even though that would be a flaw of character customization it still takes away from the experience of being your own person that you want to be. The combat system is also flawed with so many hackers and really weird and difficult struggles when shooting. The optimization needs to be fixed cause I run games bigger than this with way better frames and this is choppy unless you have a really amazing computer. Overall there could be improvements but it is still a fun and unique open world survival game.

review: Ever since the defeat of the Galactic Empire life has been pretty slow for me so I decided to have a look and see if any games were on the market so as to pass the time. I came across Rust and as Foremost Military Commander of the Rebel Alliance I fancied my chances in this videogame. After downloading and having some ill fated attempts at playing solo I convinced a good friend of mine to accompany me on my escapades. It all started well. It only took a few seppukus in order for us to locate each other and we promptly set out on our merry way across the lag/wooden spiked yet strangely beautiful landscape. We made early gains creating a lovely home and gathering a plethora of useful supplies and we couldn't have been happier. My friend then decided to take upon himself the role of the team explorer and made some excellent finds that increased our Net worth dramatically. However like any true capitalist he became greedy straying further and further from our little bastion in search of blueprints and granola bars until finally the truth of the situation in which found himself dawned on him. He was lost.At first we didn't make much of it and I carried on as usual gaining planning permission from the local council to extend our house and add 4 more floors and a balcony. My virtual roommate however by this stage had gone mad with greed as he amassed loot faster than Taylor Swift amasses ex boyfriends yet I was impressed and for a while even encouraged him. The story of his travels is one in itself and I refuse to digress so let me return to the matter at hand. As I returned from a wood collecting trip I was jumped so hard not even a good samaritan could save me and the naked white men who emptied my naked pockets took the my and locked themselves in the house.Not one to be trampled over I wrote these two strapping young men a strongly worded letter over chat and resultingly guilt tripped them into returning my house to me after they had stripped it clean and they remained true to their word. Slightly shaken and with new found agoraphobia I decided to wait for my friend. One hour later and with no sign of him returning soon I build up the courage to leave my house but alas a wolf finished me within seconds. I face my demise cheerfully before remberring the very fact that I was locked out of my house again and alone. The wolves were relentless in their attacks but I eventually fought my way to the house and waited outside. It had been been like 3/4 hours by then and my friend finally made it back. Our embrace was sweeter than any John Green book could ever claim to be and we lived happilly ev..*Speared in back by 12 year old*TLDR If you are between the ages of embryo and 14 then don't get this game but other wise yeah it's perfect for interstellar travel.

review: I played this game for a while now and its all the same stuff over and over again. You start off as a naked man just wanting to start a family and build a home. Once you get enough wood and find a nice area to start building you get murdered for said wood and get back to chopping. Once you get enough wood and find a nice area to start building you get murdered for said wood and get back to chopping. Once you get enough wood and find a nice area to start building you get murdered for said wood and get back to chopping. Once you get enough wood and find a nice area to start building you get murdered for said wood and get back to chopping. Once you get enough wood and find a nice area to start building you get murdered for said wood and get back to chopping. Once you get enough wood and find a nice area to start building you get murdered for said wood and get back to chopping. Once you get enough wood and find a nice area to start building you get murdered for said wood and get back to chopping. You may catch a lucky brake after the 100th time of dying and getting wood again. Durind this break you get your foundation up and start actually feeling good about your experience playing the game. Eventually you cut enought trees down for a nice log cabin and can start upgrading. You go out and find some nodes get some stone iron and sulfer. After you wander far away from home bashing rock after rock after rock you decide its time to go back home. On your way home you see a group of people who you might think are friendly neighbors. Upon approaching them you see that they have guns. You have not gotten to the point where you would be able to defend your self so at this point you have to hope for the best and be as nice as possible to avoid being murdered for your progress. They will shoot you 100% of the time and you'll realize that this game sucks and like me uninstall and find a game worth playing. Oh yeah and people also cheat all the time so have fun with that )

review: Played this game for a little bit almost 2 full days worth of gameplay I can honestly say it isn't as good as fanboys make it out to be but still damn good. Going to go over pros and cons then my personal experience.Pros Great Survival game really keeps you on edge and in suspence especially during night. Building your own house is a pro and a con it's very repetitive annoying when you make mistakes and boring when you don't unless we are including the adventures you could have gathering materials. This is all especially true if you want a big house it would take me a couple hours to find a spot build a house at least 3x3 in size with 2 floors that is entirely secure with metal doors/bars a watch tower and a storage room. Great early game when you are running from animals helplessly with your stone hatchet getting your first weapons like a bow and settling into the game is where it shines. It has alot of petential to get better. With the game being early access it could be terrible but it's already good the devs have stated that they will most likely keep an option to play this version of rust forever so if the game starts to suck you can always come back to the original.Cons Late game is honestly pretty boring when you get to that point where you have a fortress and are decked with guns and kevlar clothing it can get easily boring unless you plan to go F with people for satisfaction all you really do other than that is kill red animals hoping they drop more stuff for you to potentially use or stockpile or find research kits so you could play the entire game again (on that server) without having to farm red animals for drops Dear god the community I've mentioned before that people can pretty much only F with others for enjoyment at late game but it's to the point now when about 10% of players won't kill you on sight and if you want to avoid being killed by a player you should join a server that you know has regular users that are all offline. At the time of posting this there are several available methods of hacking that are undetectable that can do things like allow you to see invisible admins on modded servers go invisible yourself and the usuals like wallhacks and aimbot these are most likely temprary because as the game get's better the methods of revealing hackers should eventually arise.My personal experiance It can be a super serious game where it's as if you were a sociopath who will have to shoot anyone you see or it can be a funny game where you will be chased by a jumping naked man with a rock blasting music through their microphone causing you to die because you fell over laughing IRL. I rate it 12 alpha models out of 10.No but really it's like 7.5/10 and it could possibly get better when the updates roll out.

review: If you like any kind of realistic survival game this is the game for you. This game is so much fun and there is so much to do. You simply start off with basic tools and have to collect food metals stone wood etc.. and build your base. The only way I could easily describe this game would be to relate it to Minecraft you have to survive and build your base while hunting and gathering. Other than that there's no mining and it isn't exactly like MC its better. The game is also exacly like DayZ just less developed less zombies and it focuses more on the aspect of surviving. Note that the game is still in Alpha and being developed but the game is easily worth $20.

review: The beuty of this game is that its only as good as the innovation of the players. Facepunch leaves you with basic mechanics and lets players continue on from there. But eventually it comes down to this your either an elitist or your scraping by just to make a living. Will you get killed by players yes? are there players who are friendly who will lone you a hand when you need it? yes Form alliances know your neigbor claim your plot of land once you establish a place in the server this game becomes incredibly fun. and how you have fun is completely up to you one of my favorite things to do in rust is find two new spawns in rust and force them to fight eachother to the death with rocks. The winner becomes my slave. Another day i might give food to a starving new spawn out of sympathy. The most important thing to remember in this game is there is going to be a point where a gun is going to be aimed and how you play this game is going to decide whether your on the other side of the barrel or your the one holding the gun.

review: Like being creative and making unique fun bases and settlements? Rust has that.Like PVP with full loot? Rust has that.Like investing countless hours and forgetting what time it is? Rust has that.Like constantly being on the edge of your seat not knowing if your next breath will be your last? Rust has that.Like raging at your screen because some naked guy just snuck up on you and threw a spear at the back of your head and then took everything you just gathered for the past hour? You're such a masochist but nonetheless Rust has that.Rust has a lot of quirks and other interesting mechanics that really make it stand out from other sandbox games. Despite its brutal nature and the countless hours you can waste from losing everything you just worked for just to have your base raided the game itself is extremely addicting and just a blast in general to lose yourself in. If you really do like PVP and being creative this game is a great combination of the two. Just a forewarning though you will die. You will lose everything you worked on. You will occasionally get trolled or griefed.If you're completely okay with all of that you will have fun.

review: For the price this game has been set on I would definetly recoomend this game a shot. IF your computer can handle the hazard world of rust. I've got 100+ hours on this game and this is what I have to say.Pros Making new friends (Still don't trust anyone.) Good Community (community likes to share ideas) Still have lots of more to add (more in store for the game) Doesn't feel too repettetive (Something new everytime) Graphics are amazing Listens to Community (sometimes but mostly yes) ing Garry ( I love you.)Cons Latest nerfs have been for solo players (nerf pipe and crossbow) Very clan sided (currently) Requires a beast to run well (still lags a bit with a 1060) It is repettetive in some ways (grinding with the new xp system) Crazy load times (can be annoying) Graphic options and Settings are quite confusingIf your overall feeling of this game is good but one little thing makes you upset you should remember that this game isn't perfect by all means. It's still in alpha and it has more to fix and more to come so you should always reconsider what you think about this game. If you really do have an issue then just press F7 in game and send the devs a message yourself. They need feedback in order to make changes that people want so before you start ranting about one little thing focus on the positives.9/10 would be mauled by a bear again.

review: Rust used to be a promising prototype for something bigger and better. This Rust is now called "Legacy" and was superseeded by "Experimental". Experimental scrapped essentially what was good and tried to introduce "cool" features none of which are actually inclined toward gameplay.Seeing how it goes I don't think the game will ever be good at some point. Spending a year redoing all from scratch unable to reach the point where it was before going procedural in a game where you need to be able to navigate through easily adding visual effects you will turn off after an hour of playing because you can't see (hello lens dirt!) or clothes that won't balance anything breaking the ING BOW! (with all the games out there featuring a bow they could have gone with anything but what they did...) and last but not least running like an asthmatic turtle even on a decent PC.I think people put too much trust in Garry a guy once able to create a great sand box where people did cool things in (Garry's Mod) but unable to actually create a Game with fun in it. Because the best things in Rust are the mods made by the community. I hope for them it will last.

review: You know lately I've been feeling a little constricted by modern society. But now that this game has come out I can freely run around naked in public hitting people with rocks and get eaten by red bears that give off chicken meat when you kill them. Yes chicken meat. Although it is still in the Alpha stage Rust gives off a vibe similar to the popular game Minecraft. Rust tests your survival instincts and skills as you explore the abandoned cities and encounter other things such as mutant wolves and bears. I mean my first time playing a cute red doge came up to me and practically ate my nuts. My second time I was chased by 8 bears and 5 wolves not even 1 minute after respawn. ALthough the process keeps repeating for me playing with friends or just playing solo Rust is a game that definately has potential even though it is great now. My point is don't get your nuts eaten by a wolf.

review: Everyone who's complaining about the community just never got a foothold in the game. Yes you get killed a lot even as a naked but it's not really without reason. You will do the same to others because you simply can't risk betrayal or a blindsided attack. If you've been farming or you're carrying gear you do NOT want to die. And naked guys WANT what you've got for the quick come up. So you cannnot trust ANYONE. Kill that naked and let him cry. Die as a naked and don't be salty it's survival after all. I personally roll around as a naked but you better believe I've got a shotgun I'm not showing you just in case you decide to pull one out too. Your adrenaline will never flow in another game as it will in this game. The critical nature of dying is what makes it more fun to live!

review: This game is like no other.This game is one of the most addicting bittersweet games I have ever experienced. I hold most of my greatest memories of playing in this game. I would recommend it to anyone weather they are solo have friends or are looking to make friends. Many of the reviews are negative due to the reviewers lack of playtime. This game has gone through some rough growing stages but the result is amazing.Grind is talked about a lot below me and it is a double edged sword.It makes every loss crippiling but makes every victory one of the greatest feelings in your life.This game takes time to learn.This game has a lot of hidden features and bugs and takes a while to master the PvE portion (300 hrs). The PvP portion is much harder to learn (1k+ hrs) but is much more rewarding.This game is hard for solo play.One of the most ed about topics on this game is the lack of solo abilities and while htey are at a disadvantage there are many solutions.Head to reddit.com/r/playrustlfg to find a group or clan to joinLook in the steam discussions to find a friendAsk in game for a group (you may get double crossed)Talk in game and make friendships.Look in chat for people recruiting.&gt Go to a solo/duo/trio server and play solo there it is much easier and requires less time to know what your doing.Combat is a crazy experience in this game there are many ways to improve.Look on twitch and youtube for adviceWatch people PvP on youtube or twitchFarm for PvP'ers for the to teach you about the gameGo to a battlefield server to practiceGo to Combat tags (Under modded) to practiceCraft a p2 and spam click.Building is one of the most creative things to do in this game and many clans are always in need of a builder to help them not get raided. The way this is mastered is throughMath major and know how geometry worksLook at Youtube videos and take the basics out of it (dont copy)Download fortify to master youir building skillsGo to a building server and do it in game.Rust is an amazing game and is def worth the buy.It is very cheap on or Buyrust.com as it is always on the humble bundle for a really low price.

review: Personally I do enjoy this game and while this game certainly does have its ups and downs I am not here to praise or criticize this game. I am here to offer a phenomenal 4 Cheese Ravioli recipe!Here are the ingredients you will need!Ravioli Dough 2 cups all purpose flour 1 pinch salt 1 teaspoon olive oil 2 eggs 1 1/2 tablespoons water.Ravioli Filling 1 (8 ounce) container ricotta cheese 1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese softened 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese 1/2 cup provolone cheese shredded 1 egg 1 1/2 teaspoons dried parsley.Pesto Alfredo Cream Sauce 2 tablespoons olive oil 2 cloves garlic crushed 3 tablespoons prepared basil pesto sauce 2 cups heavy cream 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese 1 (24 ounce) jar marinara sauce.1. Mound the flour and salt together on a work surface and form a well. Beat the teaspoon of olive oil 2 eggs and water in a bowl. Pour half the egg mixture into the well. Begin mixing the egg with the flour with one hand use your other hand to keep the flour mound steady. Add the remaining egg mixture and knead to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth 8 to 10 minutes add more flour if the dough is too sticky. Form the dough into a ball and wrap tightly with plastic. Refrigerate for 1 hour.3. While the dough is resting prepare the ravioli filling. Combine the ricotta cheese cream cheese mozzarella cheese provolone cheese egg and parsley and mix well. Set the filling aside.4. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the crushed garlic and pesto sauce and cook for one minute. Pour in the heavy cream raise the heat to high and bring the sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the Parmesan cheese and stir until the cheese melts. Remove the pan from the heat and keep warm.5. Meanwhile in a separate saucepan warm the marinara sauce over medium low heat.6. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Beat the egg with the tablespoon of water to make the egg wash.7. Roll out the pasta dough into thin sheets no thicker than a nickel. To assemble the ravioli brush the egg wash over a sheet of pasta. Drop the filling mixture on the dough by teaspoonfuls about one inch apart. Cover the filling with the top sheet of pasta pressing out the air from around each portion of filling. Press firmly around the filling to seal. Cut into individual ravioli with a knife or pizza cutter. Seal the edges.8. Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Stir in the ravioli and return to a boil. Cook uncovered stirring occasionally until the ravioli float to the top and the filling is hot 4 to 8 minutes. Drain well.9. Grease a baking sheet. Place the cooked ravioli on the sheet pan and bake in the preheated oven until brown about 4 minutes.10. To serve the ravioli divide them among four warmed serving bowls. Drizzle the marinara sauce over the ravioli and then top with the cream sauce.
