review: Rust is a very enjoyable experience. It is a beautiful environment to run in with a decent crafting and building system. Getting killed and losing what you've spent time gathering may seem frustrating but it does put more value on anything you possess in a way that other games don't. And the potential for you taking someone else's stuff or breaking into their buildings kind of makes up for it. That being said I have to add that you probably are not going to get far solo unless you are on a private or low populated server. Team up or you're probably going to have a rough time generating some sustainable progress. The game is still in developement... the means of unlocking item creation is being tweaked yet... some animal behavior and pathing is goofy... etc. This didn't really bother me though. I've become cautious after getting burned on games in developement (Star Forge) but I feel like I've already got my money out of this "work in progress" game. I recommend Rust to the survivalist who likes to create. If you like to look over your shoulder while you gather form alliances or just want to build on your own private server try Rust.

review: This game... is 'MAZING! almost reached 500 hrs and this game still gets be playing and coming back to it!What makes this game want me to come back? well if you want to have fun in this game you must comit to it! you will need to plan out your base and how you would protect it extra walls? extra Traps? Trick Rooms? This game will force you to come back to add in more things around your base! You will ACTUALLY WANT to go get resources and explore the landscape! the weekly updates keeps the game Surprising and somewhat Fresh! NOW not to mention the more stuff added the more stuff added the more bugs are addedTHE DEV CARES!The Devs may not be paying much attention to people (or atleast dont respond) but they do Care for us if they add something that causes Many Bugs they will fix it as soon as possible... usually with many other survival games I've played you'd have to wait for the next update for the bug fixes but here in rust they will respond to the bugs as soon and as best as they can!THE COMMUNITY Now the Community in Rust is quite complex if you play Rust Legacy Vanilla well pretty much everyone besides russians are Friendly Rust Legcay modded EVERONE and I mean it's like a god damn battlefield EVERYONE would attack you the 'new' Rust has it a bit differently In Vanilla if you manage to see people on their own or nakeds on their own or in groups (while you wear gear) they would act peacefully in the new rust Vanilla it is a bit easier to create a community in modded well it's just like legacy a battlefield unless you manage to find a builder (a person who plays teh game for the building and survival other than Action/killing)GeneralThis game is very Unique and can attract many people different ways for example Building Killing making friends Raiding Roleplay or even Just Explore the RANDOMLY GENERATED WORLD OF RUST this game contains many things that will get you hooked up onto it for ages!If you miss the old Legacy map (like I do) They will be adding in PRE MADE (user made/ Dev Made) Maps that a server owner could use for the server and my god I am excited to see the legcay map in the Modern RustNOTE There are soooooo many things that are still t be implemented into the game like City ruins Metro Ruins more clothing gear CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION (&lt cannot wait for this) and so on! this game is still an alpha and is doing so wellHope this made you decide if you should get this awesome game or The nether / DayZ / 7 days to die etc.I MUST give this game a YES If I am bored I play this I need to spend osme time I play this I want a game to get addicted to This agme get sme addicted everytime I play it! Worth the 20 euro.... I LIKE!

review: Don 't get me wrong the concept of the game is good infact the gameplay gunplay survival or overall game mechanics of the game are great. BUT its the people or community that play it which lets it down. For example you could be strolling along you have a good base built with a metal door and a 9mm pistol and you decide to pick up some supplies. All of a sudden some random bandits confront you and same something on the lines of "Yo what's up ma n***a" and then instantly shoot you in the face with a shotty. Garry is a great dev and he has made a pretty good game but there is just something lacking in Rust that can put a pretty solid wall in between pure banditary and just holding someone up you can do this easily in DayZ but due to the more fast paced feel with rust it truly hurts the game. TL DR a good game with some solid mechanics and a great dev but a horrible community.

review: Nice sandbox concept. When I got the game with some friends we spent 24 hours on it in a single weekend.For those who know it it is similar to a post apocalyptic Wurm Online played in first person with much less building decay (actually none if you are active in it every so often) and no skills only blueprints to learn.Main problem is finding a decent server I guess. First one we joined was filled with a group of s who raided our house 5 hours into the server then spent the next 3 days finding our new home to raid it again. The other one we joined was filled to the brim with admin abuse. We kept ourselves discreet and raided the BIG guys from the server. That's around 80 C4 we stole plus all the we couldn't carry we threw it away. We knew they had another base which he had raided earlier (nothing left). 2 hours later they come knockin' at our door filled with kevlar and bullets...It didn't get much updates from since we bought it and we have already gotten bored of it but if it gets consistent update we'll surely get back to it.Another noteworthy thing the game runs on Unity. Interested to see what can be done with that.

review: Rust has changed since this post was first written and not for the better. If we overlook the issue of hackers which in fairness was a problem in Legacy the game is still not what it was. The resource gathering has gone from relatively time consuming to flat out boring and far too grindy to achieve anything of note. Again the time it takes to get any form of decent equipment is much too long for the game to be fun lower teir combat is irritating to put it mildly. But don't worry some guy with a gun will come and take that tacky house you have spent four days building. The Random Gen maps are also really annoying. It wouldn't be so bad but the devs have made them far far far far too big. A game is not fun when you have to spend two hours looking for your friends but then die horribly to some bear. Although it may look prettier and now has a workshop rust is not the fun game it once was. It breaks my heart but i can no longer recommend this game (LEGACYRust is hard to describe. The trailer does quite well. The PVP aspect of the game is strong as well as the gathering of resources. Rust is a survival game unlike most. The buildings could be improved however raiding them is extremley exciting even if you're the victim. If you have just bought the game and have suffered from your first raid then don't worry you'll be soon drawn back! The map is huge and full of great content as well the ideal setting for cavemen to do battle! If you're reading this review then tell your friends as the game is quite hard if you go solo. A party of 4 6 is best as you work fight and die together!
title: Rust

review: Guy shot me and took all my stuff 2/10 would collect stuff again
title: Rust

review: Starting with the good things The maps are huge and randomly generated for the most part. There is a decent amount of order in how the map is generated which makes it easy to find out if your friends are near you. Landmarks like Lighthouses or other buildings can also help with this. Exploring is fun. Finding a rad town or walking along the road and breaking the barrels and finding items you want is very exciting. The crafting system is complex but pretty easy to figure out. You don't need to go on a wiki to find the crafting recpies although the rust wiki can be very helpful for things. Building is fun but expect to run out of materials fairly fast. The game is a grind but is for the most part fun if you're patient.Now for the bad things Raiders. Pretty much if you have a life outside of this game you are going to get raided frequently. You better have a large group to play with if you are playing on any server that regularly has players. Yes you can protect your base but there are always ways to get in. Being a fresh spawn is VERY hard If someone who has anything sees you you are probably going to die. 99% of the time other players are hostile and unforgiving. They don't care if you're new. They don't care that you have absolutely no way of fighting back or even that you have nothing on you but a rock and a torch. They kill you just to kill you and for no other reason. Very toxic community. If you even dare to ask how to start off as a noob you will get bombarded with rudeness (for the most part) or people saying you're butthurt or "cry more lol" if you so even respond to them killing you. I really dislike the "This is rust be good or get out" mentality of the community as if because it's hard you're supposed to just suck it up and deal with it. Suggestions for the game Singleplayer mode This would be very useful for people who just want to get some practice in before playing on large servers. Nerf the raiders It is far too easy to raid small bases. Anyone with some C4 can raid an offline player. It should be more of a challenge to raid small bases even if you are further ahead than the people who built those bases. It's also impossible to protect yourself even if they have guns unless they have terrible aim and you can somehow kill them with your axe or rock. It should be possible to protect yourself as a newish player against enemies.Overall right now expect an early access quality game. It's buggy as of now because it's still in alpha.Would recommend if you're into survival games and are willing to help test out an unfinished game.

review: Have you Ever wanted to Be killed by Russians over and over again? Have you ever wanted your chat feed to full of the Gorgeous russian Language then this game is definatly for you. I actually learnt russian right so that i could feel like part of putins secret army. When i first entered into the game i discovered i was naked. So naturally this felt like caveman simulator 2K15. I then brought out my rock and with passion in my stride i went over to the closest tree and hit it about 20 million times and got 100 wood. Now for the most climatic bit. I heard gunshots my heart started beating faster the adrenaline rushing through my body no one was friendly in this game. I understood that. Then came the russians. They were clutching there AK. They walked up to me. He said something in russian."Please dont kill me" I whimperedInaudable Russian. Gunshots. Im dead. That my friends. Is the most climatic and exciting thing that has happened to me in rust. And if you're lucky you may actually build a house. If you're lucky. And if you're even more lucky you might get a gun. Lol jokes only the russians get the guns. And if you're wondering why i hate the russians. Just play this game. 10/10 would want to invade putin again.Get killed by russians simulator 2K15

review: Have played 200+ hours on rust mainly during the period where experience was a thing. It was rewarding to build your base and make allies for trading and defence. I originally started in a server about 3 days after a wipe so other players had already begun to establish their bases and become pretty menacing. Community is pretty toxic with majority of people kill on sight for freshies but that's what made it so fun! We had to break our resources into little shacks so we could gather enough to instantly sprout a large base. Definitely worth playing with friends as it makes it so much more entertaining even when being raided. Successfully defending an attacking bases is what made it so rewarding. With the xp system even if your base was completely destroyed you could get help off others in exchange for crafting given you were a decent level. However without it when your base is griefed (a downside of the toxic community) you have lost everything and have to start from scratch. All in all great game but without the xp system there's no reason to be loyal to a server if you have been griefed and they begin to die pretty quick after the wipe. Part the reason for my low play time recently. BRING BACK THE XP. (Also didn't play when blueprints were around but heard they were great so either xp or bp. But the new system is such a grind.)

review: Got it ages ago played for a few hours and had a blast but stopped when my friends pc could not run it. He recently upgraded his graphics card and we decided to give it another go. We notice a new xp bar in the bottom left of screen. After what feels like hours of cutting down trees I look in the bottom left... Ding! Level 2. I still cannot craft a stone hatchet. This new xp system ruined the game completely and totally and it also made all the complaints I have that I was willing to deal with stand out more. Why the hell can I not change my race or gender? Why does Rust literally have the worst player base of any other survival game I have ever played? Spawn get shot spawn get shot spawn get shot. In my few hours of playing this game I came across about 10 people. 7 shot me in the face. 2 attempted to shoot me in the face. And finally one man decided that my naked woman needed to get down and dirty with his naked man. I've put hours upon hours into DayZ modded and standalone and never have I found such a player base. And DayZ is infamous for KOS even against people with no gear. Xp sucks maps feel too small for the ammount of players. Instead of meeting another player being an interesting experience that can have multiple turnouts you constantly hear shooting then fall on the ground letting out a bloodcurling scream. Like I said I can deal with the fact that I am a naked black woman. I can deal with players being I can even deal that the only thing the enviroment can do to you at all is throw a bear at you. Food and water is ing everywhere no wonder people are constantly killing noobs once you have a base built what else would you ing do? The xp system is the final nail in the coffin for this game. Maybe the game gets better once you used to it. The same could be said about catching yourself on fire. The beginning game is simply not fun and leaves you feeling completely cheated out of your money. Waste of time money and hard drive space. Don't buy until the xp system is gone at least and even if it is removed make sure you are willing to deal with rage. I'll give it another go if they remove the xp system but until then this game.
title: Rust

review: This coming from someone who has 900 hours in this game.. I am telling you to not buy it. If you do not have AT LEAST 3 very active friends (30+ hours/week) you will get on. This is not me saying "you might get on" or "you'll probably get on." I am indefinitely telling you that you cannot play this game. That is unless you just want a to join a server with such a small population that you might as well not even be playing because all you're doing is PvEing. This game used to be fun it used to have a lot of bugs a lot of issues community was still toxic but now it is a new breed. This game is not a survival game and I honestly think they should remove that genre from it's steam page.. It is a pure long term PvP game. Plain and simple. I have so many AMAZING memories from when people would just get on and play by themselves or with friends and talk to each other talk raid argue and fight. However this was all in spirit of Rust. Now the spirit of Rust is still the same thing but slightly different. Youhave talking and arguing and fighting. However all the raiding is people who have more people on the server with them than you and/or play WAY more than you. I'm talking kids who run 90+ hours/ 2 weeks on steam just on this game. In the old days people didn't care as much. People honeycombed and tried smart base designs but I feel most of them were more creative and appearance heavy while still trying to protect. Nowadays you are FORCED to build the most compact honeycombed you can. It actually isn't an option. If you want to wake up after a single morning still alive you HAVE to build this way. I'm not sure what has changed but people used to not care. People used to build their way and it was not all the time but generally mutual. Now everyone's bases look the same/are built the same way. When you blow through a wall that's not a 2x2 you better believe there's another behind it.. and behind it.. and sometimes behind it... It requires way too much work for so little reward. Like I said if you or your friends have even a small bit of a life outside this game you CANNOT play it.

review: Seems like a great game when you watch the trailers. However the world is very bland and is an incredibly hard to run at a smooth framerate. I have people I know playing at low medium settings with GTX 970s and still not getting great framerates. I played this game with a laptop with an 3rd gen i5 and a discrete graphics card with at least 1gb of ram. I get 11 fps at minimum settings. I made the mistake of buying this game without looking at the reccomended specs. The problem is this limits the playability of this game to fewer people. The expanses of what you can do in the game are very limited and I wouldn't reccomend it for anyone who wants a game with many different possibilities.

review: I've played 64 hours of Rust most of them in what's now called Legacy. What seems to be a "throw everyone in an empty world" simulator it ends up being most appropriately compared to human fecies. We've had alot of fun mostly due to funny bugs and ugly animations. Two hours after joining a server starting with nothing but a stone in your hand and a torch in your bag you feel like you've "completed the game". You're now seated in an impenetrable fortress with 30 000 wood in your chest and 10 furnaces running an industrial smelting operation. And you can craft everything in the game.As far as a survival games goes this really is comparable to human fecies animals can't attack you Zombies are removed. Gathering metal from one vein gives you metal for days and 10 trees chopped down would suffice for building an impenetrable house.

review: JULY 2016 EDIT So recently man babies have been whining about the recent XP update. Just get some friends and you're fine.Should you buy RUST? I say yes.But why? Well I can't even answer this. Perhaps it's the fine mix between scavenging and PVP. With the map's size (CURRENTLY) you can always find a player in a playsession in a server population of around 10. Unlike DayZ where you can go a literal 42 minutes without even seeing a player. In RUST you have to stay on your toes. The gunshots are loud espeically from your perspective. You can even scare yourself when a radioactive bear tries to make you his next snack. People can hear them from quite far away and that's why many fear shooting at all. But there's nothing more horrifying than hearing voices outside your house during the night or even worse no voice but footsteps. Is it a player? Or an animal? If it's a player are they friendly? Do they have weapons? These questions race through your mind during those crucial moments and determine your very survival.Base building in this game is amazing. You can literally erect a base in minutes but if you're not careful it can be destroyed in the same amount of time. Gathering wood is your main task and it's not easy mostly due to the fact that wood stacks can be found in large fields and there is no cover there. And unlike DayZ updates are often mostly on the experimental. Recently the entire game has been remade and updates are pushed out on the daily. Friday updates are something I look forward to and the community while they can be quite unfriendly are open to ideas (sometimes) (Seriously sometimes i'm not even kidding.)So this concludes my RUST review. TL DR Buy RUST It's unique!

review: I just thought I should come and write a review after seeing that some of the negative reviews are misleading.This is now my new favourite game.Going into it I had prepared myself to the thought of being owned that I would be killed on sight and stand a good chance to be raided and thus I have had a magnificent experience.The graphics are good they do a decent job of what they have to.I never experienced any problems with optimization and with my 960 gpu have had very smooth gameplay.It is hilarious playing this game as you run into such funny situations here is a small list of somethings that I have come across in my short time 3 man death squads where you must frightfully and with alot of fun escape and hide from. a group of naked men blasting reggae music through the mic and spreading positive vibes. a group of guys travelling around looking for other people to have rap battles with and also giving you all their valuable items. good members of the community teaching me how to build and giving me tips after breaking into my house leaving as friends.The community isn't that toxic as I thought after reading reviews (South African servers) not at all it's survival of the fittest and if you want a post apocalyptic survival game you can't be surprised that it sometimes resorts to killing on sight and that you can't trust anybody.I have been raided killed and I have lost everything its heart breaking and very terrifying. but not as much as it is a learning experience.I can't wait to sink more hours into this.I wish I had found this game sooner.You won't regret buying this game I say get it.

review: Ok This game IS SO DAM GOOD but also has some INCREDIBLY ANNOYING STUFF in it I have played Rust 170+ Hours and i enjoyed every single one. This game is really fun! Has some amazing Funny Modded servers to some Hard and challenging Vanilla servers. There is Battlefield servers there is x100 servers. Alot of different play styles. Ok i gana be honestt i DID have some Bad memories Which is LAG. The performance of this game is GARBAGE i Have a GTX 960 and I7 4790 Quad cored and 16 ram (To be Brief). And when it comes to some 2v2 Ak fight i drop to 30fps Which is a PAIN IN THE So I lose the advantage of the fight. ALSO those God Dam Animals can climb 90* degree angles (Some Superman Ok i gana give some Advantages of the Game an Disadvantages.Some Pros+Amazing Survival+Good Hunting Idea+Super active Devs+A lot of Guns+Need some skill+Can Wrek Some Noobs+Adictive Gameplay+Really good Crafting system+RAIDING WHICH I LOVEOk now for some Cons Hard for Single Player Dudes Really hard to master Hackers Performance is GARBAGE Animals climb rocks Really Buggy A bit to grindy Need to be super active on the game (If not you'll be easily raided) Really not friendly peopleOk this is been a fun time making this review I honestly moved from Vanilla to Modded as i am not super active in this game. So my review may be different But i had play Vanilla for a long time.I give it a 8/10 Just abit to rough on new people and Buggy I DO RECOMEND THIS GAME WITH SOME FELLOW FRIENDS ALSO FOR HARDCORE SINGLE PLAYERS!!!! BEWARE IT WILL BE HARD

review: Rust is the best survival game on the market. With that being said it has some flaws in it. let me give you a run down of the Pro's and Con'sPro's if you like a competitive survival game you will love this. the building element is strong. the fights are balanced. the game is very populated. the game is updated every thurday with new stuff coming out every week. (Recently the updates have been dry) the game is supported in every popular language even pirate! It has a lot of potential very polished never really gets boring promotes team work (but also gives the lone wolf some light) Raiding is fun Defending is fun Con's To run the game you need a average or above average computer the game contains nudity if you did not know (you can blur it out in the F2 menu) the game is stuck in Dev Hell its been in alpha for 2 years and will prolly never leave its state of alpha the thursday updates have been slowly becoming more and more dry as the year has evolved the devs have not held up to there promises (i remember during march they were saying they were going to drop cars in the coming weeks then drop a generator sometime after that and now were in december almost in the next year and they havent dropped anything really game changing then If your raiding in this game chances are your going to raid someone that is not even on which isnt even that fun the crafting system needs some serious help all in all i give the game a 7/10 its great its kinda going thought a slump right now its dry the community is tired of the same old same old. but its still one of my favorite games i can say that i have enjoyed my 500+ hours in the game (which is nothing) would i reccomend it Yes i would but the game has some issues stated above.

review: Rust is highly unique for a videogame in that it is not fun. Your average game of Rust starts with you spawning either in the middle of ing nowhere or on top of a bear. From there you wander around aimlessly until you find someone willing to put you out of your misery typically an armed 14 year old Lebanese kid on a power trip. If you're feeling particularly sadistic you can convince your friends to waste their money on this turd of a game. Finding them will prove ing impossible however unless you joined the Ukrainian boy scouts and possess the orienteering badge needed to navigate the generic environment consisting of plains with forests plains with rocks and rocky hills modelled I'm guessing on some Eastern European . If you manage to find your buddies you can expect to engage in the fun of building a base only to have it get raided by people with more advanced than you or better yet have the server reset after 3 days or so making any of the tedious t you do in this game utterly meaningless. The game used to have zombies too but these were removed likely because the developers thought interacting with the the borderline community was close enough to fighting a zombie that having NPC zombies was effectively redundant. Game sucks Early Access is a total scam and Valve can suck a for offering one and only one refund per Steam account. If I were able to get a refund for this terrible game I would absolutely want one. Infact just avoid all these online survival games (Day Z State of Decay Dead State etc) as they're universally terrible.

review: I recommend this game to those who are patient and ready for anything to happen as you will get killed frequently and raided daily if you don't have proper preperation. The game in itself is well done and is updated weekly with meaningful features being added/implemented. The community though is absolutely dreadful and with nothing but a rock you still get shot with bolt action rifles and ak 47's. The game also has decent optimization but requires a good computer just to run on reasonable settings. That aside though the game may be repetitive in the aspect of building a base and raiding but from the other players you NEVER know what to expect and anything can happen but that's the fun in the game. I give it 8/10

review: Its a very fun survival game but the community and development is very very VERY . The community is so bad it can be so depressing to see your house raided every week after all of the hard work you put into it and now you have to start all over because of some internet wanting to steal your stuff. The community of rust is 5% good people 20% stupid mean people that shoot on sight 70% 'bandits' (which apparently are people who raid people's houses or pretend to be your friend until your guard is down and then they stick a shotgun up your and fire.) and 5% people that hide away and never come out of their base. And bandits don't raid to survive they do it because they think it's fun. Also if you have looked at videos of Rust on YouTube it's usually the creator of the video raiding people and shooting freshspawns. The Administration is a problem all the power goes to the people who pay to keep the server running so this could include people who teleport to you and kill you just for the fun of it. They will ban people just for raiding their base.Another problem is the development it is so easy to craft guns (which I think shouldn't be in the game) which only takes about 1 1/2 game days to make you almost never die from the causes of deaths in the description of the game and when you disconnect from the server there is something called a 'sleeper' which is just an NPC which sleeps on the ground holding all of your stuff meaning anyone can come along shoot you in the head take all of your stuff and leave. 8 hours of work gone right there.That's Rust everybodyThat was the old Rust. The new Rust is even WORSE! D
title: Rust

review: I am fed with hut simulators / grief simulators. I want a realistic survival game where you create / join a village and contribute further to it instead of build my own house and see it gone on the next day i login where the F are the guards guarding my hut / mansion / keep while i sleep? Every guy who joins to play the game joins to rule over others and not do someone elses bidding so put BOTS and AI for that why must i build a hut all day and see it gone over night? There are 2 sides here 1. Masochists who enjoys hut design simulator building a hut so it is destroyed by 2. Sadists who like griefing hutsTHATS ALL THE GAME HAS TO OFFERIt is not survival working for something to see it griefed or grief someone else die and then rinse and repeat. Survival is about picking a location settling down farming chopping mining crafting selling your goods recruiting NPCs to your village so it grows having farmers to produce food crafters to craft armor weapons clothes having traders to sell this food and materials at other players villages taxing people using money to hire guards that patrol your village using money to build walls and SURVIVE from bandits which do not grief from top to bottom but loot and burn a fraction of everything and kill a fraction of the civilians because they know if they kill everyone there will be NO LOOT next time or take over the land and claim it this is what a survival game should be and not a building hut simulator.

review: One of the greatest survival game out there even it's early access!This game creates communities and requires teamwork in order to keep your base up and gears safe from the other players. When you're out there in the world of rust just remember this Never trust in Rust!PROS + Graphics are great and getting improvements along with updates.+ Active dev which is constantly adding more things in the game and also fixes problems quite fast.+ Big and randomly generated maps.+ Fun to play even in +100 player servers.+ All kinds of modded and vanilla servers.+ Weapons are well balanced and they look like they're handmade.+ Blueprint system.+ Anti cheat system cheaters are going to enjoy long VACation after cheating in this game!+ Sleeping bags.+ Looting and gearing up.+ Great in game voice chat!CONS A lot of griefers and trolls Early access games always has some bugs but people uses these bugs as advantage to raid peoples bases. When you have good base you'll want to keep an eye on it almost 24/7 so anyone could not get in and take your stuff. Mostly impossible to play alone.Score 9 out of 10.

review: While this game is very fun and enjoyable it still has its problems. Currently the game really has a lot to it in terms of exploration and crafting. You can get a good head start by finding things within old ruins of cities and buildings. I really enjoy the survival genre and have it as one of my favorites within the genre. The major issue for me currently is animals can just run straight up mountains and walls which maybe wouldn't be so bad if they also couldnt just walk through walls into bases you've built. On atleast 3 different servers I've had to pack up and start on a different one simply because I build a base get gear And a bear clips through the wall with 500hp and 5 bullets and a few arrows doesnt even phase it. You're able to respawn at sleeping bags/beds you craft but this does nothing when animals that can kill you in 3/4 hits ignore walls and can just sit on your sleeping bag. It's so frustrating infact I would ONLY reccomend this game if you can overlook the current major flaw. Until this is fully polished up in the coming months/years I would highly reccomend The Long Dark another (single player only). Once a few bugs are polished out this review will change from a no to a yes.

review: Product received for free. The rawness of Rust really astounds me every time I log in I've found tribes of naked people gangs of hoodlums and community's designed for survival. Much like other Survival games you'll question why you put so much time into your base just to see it raided one day your shelter destroyed and valuables stolen. You'll lament at the fact you got murdered because you stepped outside to collect wood and stones. And you'll find yourself obsessively preying on harmless noobs when their naked body runs past you. Only to find they were carrying a rock and a torch. But you'll love every second of it.The enjoyment comes from being unattached to your belongings and contributing to the predator/prey game dyanmic. Whether it be working towards a sense of security for you or an alliance with other players or unleashing mayham for unsuspecting players you'll feel a sense of satisfaction from completing your tasks. Between it's various versions and different servers there's a good deal to do.

review: I waited thru 2 promotional sale events and a ton of negative reviews for this company to budge on that $20 price tag. The fall sale had to be when it would change. I bought so many titles for great prices. Still Rust didn't budge. Nada. I give in and buy the title a few nights ago to play with some friends realizing it is a great title that has come a very long way. The negative reviews are subjective. What a rush even with all the hackers and toxic players it's survival at its best! I can see this becoming a contending title hanging with some of the best of the genre. Music and weapons are awesome the maps are cool and the caves and image effects are realistic. Still needs work specially with the animals but wow. AAAAAAAAAND now it's $9.99. (Thanks for the punch in the scram bag devs)Yea I still recommend buying this title. For $9.99 &gt &lt

review: I can safely say Rust Legacy was one of my most favourite games of all time. I have sunk countless hours into building bases with my friends and raiding other places with c4 we found in a airdrop. I Know the whole Legacy map back to front where to find the best loot and where all of the towns and rads were. I remember building an eight story base with my friends and the intense moments of some other clan trying to raid us and we had to spend two hours defending our base. Legacy was what Rust should of been yeah I know there was rampant hackers who could raid your base and fly but it was so enjoyable to start fresh and build another base that it didn't matter to me. The low graphics didn't ruin the game because it made it more avaliable to everyone because it wasnt this big demanding and my old low end PC I had could run it. BUT the new Rust changed that at first I was thrilled that they had a more improved Rust comming but I think now that I have played it I find it to be absolute It was buggy and poorly optimised and still had ing hackers. They brought in more cancer than they got rid of and added this xp system. Sure it looks great but the game itself is so unenjoyable to play on your own. I loved Legacy but the new Rust is a up in everyway and should be fixed. Please FacePunch fix your ing game..

review: Great game the beauty and detail put into the graphics is amazing.But be prepared to spend a lot of time spent repeating your efforts because a bloody bear has spawned in your house for the 3rd time in one week.Wolves will also kill you.People will kill you.Starving will kill you.Gang wars that you stumbled in on naked and holding a rock will kill you.You.Will.DieBut honestly I have spent so many hours into this game instead of revising it probably wasn't worth it but I have no self control.This game is addictive
title: Rust

review: I have a love / hate relationship with this game.As a player with a couple of friends Rust legacy was brilliant but spoilt by cheaters which was a shame I must admit the game requires most of your spare time to build up on a busy server a game you would need to play every day or you will no doubt be raided and lose everything.Teamwork is essential it is possible to be a lone wolf but you will be beaten down by teams eventually. I have been a server admin on a few servers but it really isn't much fun in the long run. I owned a server for a while the amount of time required to maintain it promote and look after the population was essentially a full time job. I can honestly say that blurring the lines between gaming and work is hardly fun or rewarding in the long run (unless you are making money of course!)The new version of Rust started out extremely buggy and I did my part to report bugs and contribute via Reddit and the Facepunch forums after a few months of doing this and not seeing much progress I gave up completely. The team at Facepuch are quite good as game developers but project management is certainly not one of their strong areas. To completely dump a game's development and start from fresh during the height of it's popularity was a bad decision.It seems now that Rust has many of the features that legacy had and will no doubt become as great as the old version I'm just not sure that the timing is right. Much of the community have had their fill of the game and have moved on I don't want to slip back into playing for 8 hours a day as I have a busy life away from the computer. I have tried to get back into the game but find that the servers wipe far too often due to updates when these are less frequent I may give it another shot.I still recommend the game though I have had many laughs with some great people while playing Rust. A game that can hold my attention for 700+ hours is definately a winner in my book even with it's flaws.
title: Rust

review: Hello and thank you for reading this review and I will explain to you why this game has gone down hill and why I still play this game. There are a couple points I will be reinterating and some points that other people have made. So lets go ahead and begin.1. Building in RustThe building in rust is remarkable and that is what alot of people bought the game for when it first came out in 2013 and why I bought it. The original has had it's moments when people were building in the air and they destoyed the bottom so noone could raid it when it was at the top of the map and noone could raid or get you. They fixed that with stability in later updates and if people tried then they were trolled made fun of and people just gave up and made better bases. Now when it comes to new rust or what old time rust people like me call it still (Rust Experimental) they changed it in a bad way. They started at such a good way when experimental was first out and then overtime the little kids and Zerg clans when to reddit and every public forum and complained about raiding was too hard and costed way too many resources. Gary Newell then listened to the zergs and little kids and made it to where that people could place twig foundations anywhere in toolcupboard areas which basically means the tool cupboard is useless. I know alot of people are going to say "But without the toolcupboard then you cant make it out of Wood/Stone/Sheetmetal/HQ and place stuff in it." and yes I would admit that but the problem is though is that they might just make a update where you can put auto turrets outside and just let it camp you the whole time in building priv areas. Gary needs to bring it back where Only You and whoever has building priv be allowed to build in those areas.2. Aimcone on the AK47Remember old rust players when the ak47 did not have a aimcone and that it took skill to kill someone and it took luck to get certain shots on someone. Remember how the AK47 used to be cheap because there was no components (will get to the component system later). So many kids and Zergs later again went to Public Forums and complained about how hard it was to use the ak47 and people complained to everyone and supposidly new people wouldnt like how the ak47 was. So Garry Newman said it lets feed into the BS and make it easier to use the ak and make it more like COD where its point and shoot. More and More people like me and others complained about how the update ruined it and then Gary said that if you don't like the mechanics of the game then did you at least get your money's worth out of it (or something like that) and we complained and some people wanted a refund but I still think its stupid to refund if we put thousands of hours in a game that is still freaking amazing and terrible at the same time. I wish that Gary would just not listen to the Zergs/Trolls/Little kids and just listen to the community who has been here for years.3. ZOMBIESEvery old time rust player will remember the Rad Zombies that were Red/Green/Regular zombies that would kill people and ran really fast or really slow and took like a stack of arrows to kill. Well he listened to the dumb people on public forums and removed it even though everyone in the community later complained and Gary apologized but still wont add back the zombies. I think if everyone spammed the forums of every public forum that gary reads then I believe that he would add them back.4. Bugs in RustAlot of people have realized that the team has been taking less and less time to fix the bugs and more time adding content to please the masses. One of the bugs that they finally fixed was the EAC Disconnect which was a nightmare during raiding because if that happened then you basically got screwed and people would take your stuff before you could go back in which took either a minute or if your in a server that is heavily populated then it would take hours to get back in and you found out that you died and you would rage quit. There was also a bug that if you spammed jumped on someone's head then you would get disconnected and that took them a long time to fix it.5. Crafting System (Component XP Blueprint)Everyone loves the BP system and that is why some servers on Rust Experimental still use the BP system and almost none have the XP system because XP SYSTEM IS TRASH. Good old Gary made the BP system which actually brung action into rust and you had to go out and destroy barrels loot crates weapon boxes etc to get BP and it was amazing. They kept this for a long time because it was a working system. Yet again I have to repeat myself Gary listened to the dumb people on public forums to get the BP system removed after having it for such a long time and then Gary Announced the XP system and people were furious because of a couple reasons. Number one reason is because Clans/Zergs had fun with this because they would get there slaves to use there equipment which let the slaves and the maker of the item to get xp and so when the masters get off for the night and the slaves are still on the master can just get back on after a couple hours and they are lvled up so many times. Solo players couldnt play in popular servers so alot of people created Solo/Duo/Trio servers and people left populated servers for these types of servers. Gary listened after about a month or so and made the component system. Component system is not as good as the BP system but WAY BETTER THEN THE XP SYSTEM. The component system added more items into the game which made people like it because people had to go destroy barrels to get items to make a gun which sounds more resonable. Alot more I want to say but im writing this at 9 30 at night.Final Statement.If you love Sandbox Action Games then you will love this but you will also hate it because of the Zergs/COD AIM/Trolls and alot more. So many bugs/glitches/crashes and Ram Issues that make the game unplayable sometimes. The game is really fun so I do recommend but only if you can play the game and deal with the issues that come with early access games.

review: The idea behind RUST is amazing. I was excited to find it since I had looked for quite awhile for a game like it. However once playing it for myself I quickly regretted my purchase.Yes this game is Early Access. My complaints aren't bugs although I ran into plenty of them... my complaints lie with the fundamental idea of the game including the harsh start (trying to kill animals for food when all you have is a rock and dying from either hunger or attacked by a hostile animal when you cannot yet defend yourself)My biggest problem with this game however is the multiplayer features. If you do somehow manage to get ahold of yourself with food and shelter it can all be taken away in an instant by one of the many idiots that roam the land with you and will kill you for no reason even if you are running around with nothing but a rock. It's a major flaw of all games which incorporate multiplayer in this way... the problem isn't necessarily the game but human nature. If you like the kind of thing I've explained here go for it... but after all the frustration and anger this game has put me though (I don't usually get mad at video games but what I've mentioned in this review explains why I got so aggravated) I don't think I'll be playing again anytime soon unless some major changes are made. If I have time to waste I'd rather do it with a game where I will actually have something to show for my time within the game instead of countless deaths and nothing to show for my effort but maybe a stone hatchet and some sulfur.

review: Short Version A once great game ruined by developer hubris and contempt for players.Long Version A bait and switch which may come to define the early acess genre. Rust started out as a great game supposedly in alpha. Despite the rough state of the game it was easy to recommend to friends. We hopped in and quickly set about creating a feudal state which stretched its reign of terror over the entire server. Great fun. Then the problems started. The developer stopped fixing easy bugs or introducing any new features. He decided the alpha was in fact a tech demo. He threw out all his old code and redeveloped the game from scratch. He took the new game in a different direction. The new game is simply not fun or even that closely related to the previous game. If you raise a complaint about this however politely on the company servers you will be banned. IMO this is every unethical. Further the quality of the deployed code while never strong was much worse in the new version with many simple features failing to work. The developer treats early access as an excuse to have players test broken code as opposed to gameplay ideas and fails to follow simple tenants of software engineering. To top all this off once you start the game the developer taunts you by suggesting you tell them how they are bad at their job on steam. Facepunch you are bad at your job.

review: AMAZING GAME.I love Rust i have played about 300 hours of it on my alt account and its so good.Its one of those games where you have to start small and work your way up and im all about those games.It reminds me of Dayz one of my favorite games ever made.I have helped make or have been in a few films ar videos of Rust weather it be attacking a massive base or role playing in the amazing open word enviorment.If i was to give any advice for new players really it depends on how you play games like this.If you like being a "lone wolf" which is what i was when i started is to stay isolated stay safe and only kill if necasary.But if you are a team player and like having people around then have a group of about 4 6 people.If you build a base to stay in one area make it a armored one and big anough for all your members.In any case when you build a base make it isolated or far away from everyone else(so you dont get raided)to stay safe.Well thats all i got for Rust BLACKOUT out.

review: This game is increadibly unique although it seems like it might not be. This game has some amazing featers that greating make the enjoyability of this game skyrocket beyond my expectations but has some very intensly powerful cons to go with it. This game beyond any other has made me more friends on steam then any other game I own or have ever played and nor dose any other game come close. The intence high stakes high reward feature of this game makes the interactions with people more intence or scary and less like meeting someone in a video game as well as makeing the gameplay very addicting. This game also doesnt fail to make you want to be on all the time your constantly scared that your base might be getting raided you need to fix your house ect. It also is a very social game in that playing solo makes things much harder which encorages teams and gets people to convince their friends to purchase it I know I personaly got 3 of my friends to buy the game to play it with me. But this wonderfly sucesful game has its many flaws. I find myself in teeth clenching fist pounding anger for reasons I shouldnt be. this game attracts itsself a ton of hackers using things like aimbot and flying to make the game impossible for other players I found myself extremly angry when a hacker flies into my house takes all my stuff and destroys my house causing me to re start and I didnt even get to defend myself. As much as this should be expected it happens way to often to make the game enjoyable. Another flaw is that because of the high stakes people become very rude and it is almost unbelievable some of the things people will say and do to you. It also becomes nearly impossible to start fresh when a server is full because people with gear will shoot on site other lower level players with bows will shoot on site and nakeds such as yourself will chase you untill you or they die as well as the overspawned bears and wolves which are extremly hard to fend off. After this game being out for about three years now i find it absolutly rediculouse that they havent been able to fix this stuff and that its still an alpha. I love rust but at many times I think that its cons weigh out its benifits and yet i never stop coming back for more.

review: The summary makes it seem really fun find food build a fire build a house hunt protect yourself etc. It seems like there is fun stuff to craft and you can find blueprints and stuff. That's not what this game is at all.This is a deathmatch arena game where the people who have been playing longest always win. Stay away from every player you see because they'll track you down and kill you out of boredom or spite. This isn't a thoughtful survival game it's Call of Duty with naked people. Before you craft your first bow &amp arrow (and good luck figuring out how any of this works seeing as there's no tutorial or manual or guide) you'll have gotten shot by some troll with a rifle and more ammo than he knows what to do with.I think once you've crafted some stuff you start to get bored so you hunt down newbies to ruin their experience too.I should've seen this coming I mean the developers say "We haven't totally decided where the game is headed " and then say "We have a plan... trust us." Bull.

review: Wow where to begin?First off the game IS NOT optimized for mac. It crashes constantly the load times are unbelievably long it lags and animals bungie up and down when they're around cliffs. It also doesn't support the use of controllers and this is really one of those games where that needs to happen. Just type in "Controller + Rust" and you'll get a pretty good notion that the developers have no idea how to impliment it because the community has been asking for it for the better part of two years. Speaking of community if you enjoy hackers and people calling you a then this is the game for you! If can scrounge up enough wood to build a house and not get shot in the back before you've crafted your first pair of boots then enjoy having someone walk through the walls of your house to steal your goods or aimbot you while you're farming. You know a games good when some 13 year old who found script online can grab your stuff befor flipping around and claiming that the only reason you got robbed was because you left all of the doors in your house open. Seriously I gave this game a shot a year ago and NONE of the issues I mentioned have been fixed since then. I emailed Facepunch for a refund when I first played and they obviously care about their community so much that they decided not to answer any of my (5) other emails since then. Bang up job Facepunch!

review: As a precursor for this game and the comments ill recieve after I dont mind raiding at all. its part of the game getting ganked is normal. However this game IS in early alpha and isnt worth 20 dollars. Because of this im getting a refund. There is so many missed opportunities in the game that I cant bring myself to reccommend it.RESOURCESRust is a survival game based around living in the middle of nowhere during a post apocalyptic crisis. you gather these resources to build your base craft and keep your character alive. Its a great concept as its been done to death and really hard to mess up but rust does it. I walked around the map for an hour and couldnt find anything to eat and died 4 times in a row over the course of an hour because all the food is gone. and I understand that its a server based thing but what makes that okay? a basic element of a game is almost impossible to get because everyone else has it. in any survival game it should not be that hard to find food. Every time I mention there being no food in the game they tell me to go kill some horses or something. Wheres the horses? ive seen 2 animals in my 4 hours of this game. Your character starts out with a stone. its a basic tool. everytime you use it the durability gets weakened so you cant keep it forever. Not a big deal right? theres tons of rocks around the map I should be able to just hit one and get more stone? except theres only 3 types of certain rocks that are mineable all these other brown rocks are just decoration. the worst part? if you accidentally hit one of these rocks with a pickaxe or the rock that you spawn with its durability goes down every time you hit it. What sense does this make? So now because rocks are SOMEWHERE in the map you have to go looking for a rock. cant find one? too bad keep looking. the normal thing to do here would be to get wood in the meantime right? Now that youve got all this wood from this basic rock its dead and you have to get another one. You dont have any stone and the only thing that you can use to get more rocks is the stone itself. No game should trap me like this. Looks like you gotta do some killing. WEAPONSsince you dont have that rock anymore time to kill someone who just spawned in the game to take his rock. Take some of that wood and make a spear. before the player even had a chance to protect himself because the server was loading you killed him. My only real problem with weapons in the game is that you can make a ing rocket launcher in the middle of nowhere with scraps from a abandoned oil drum and some old fuel. for me the game is so oriented around killing other people and not actually surviving.

review: Oh god. how could I not recommend this game? It is excellent and is only in alpha! Not only are the core mechanics amazing the graphics are BEAUTIFUL. Even when you have the graphics on low and everything it looks great. Some say the game gets repetitive (looking at you. Frankie) but the community has diversified the game and there are a ton of mini games you can try. There is Battle Royale Ruskitball Role Play Team Deathmatch 1 on 1 Showdowns and many more that you can discover yourself. Now DO NOT BUY if you have below 4 gigabytes of ram on your computer it will lag horribly. I also recommend that you have a graphics card that can run games like Batman Arkam Night Fallout 4 WItcher 3 GTA 5. The community in this game is hilarious you will run into so many people with crazy personalities. For example one time I met someone who only ate his food raw uncooked. He said it was his fetish. After hours of spending time with him. He told me that he also likes to eat human meat. He then led me into his house and locked the door. He told me "It's nothing personal you just seem... Meaty" He then slaughtered me and cut up my body and of course ate it raw. That was a little long. Anyways... The building creation system is near perfection. It could use some changes but at it's current state I cant say anything bad. For anyone wondering this game is created on the Unity Game Engine. If your PC can run this game fine then BUY BUY BUY BUY BUY. Oh and the alternative Ark? If you want a game that uses Rust's core mechanics weird looking avatars and dinosaurs and costs $15 more than Rust and a ton of MMORPG elements then buy. If not save some time and money and just buy Rust.
title: Rust

review: You may have played "Garrys mod"? Anyway this game is being developed by the same guy (but not only by Garry himself).It's a mix between minecraft and dayz but the zombies will be removed in future updates. I have a high confidence about Garry and his crew i think they will make this game a lot better and hopefully it will be one of the most outstanding survival games there is.My recommendations for you as a newcommer is to look up gameplays before you decide to buy it. The endgame right now isn't that much yet but thats a high priority on their to do list.It's one of few games that i've actually enjoyed in early access._Pros_&amp _cons_+ Building and crafting.+ Large map.+ Garry and his crew (Yeah cred for the devs actually for being so tight with the community).+ Frequent patches. Lack of the endgame content.EDIT Garry and his team have started from scratch again with a better engine. Until it's finished you can play the experimental build (the new engine) or play the old alpha version that won't be updated. Check their progress at www.playrust.com.

review: The best way to describe rust is that it is a pure sandbox game. You can play the game anyway you like and this will definitely change your outlook on whether or not you enjoy it. You spawn in with nothing and are left to explore an island left in shambles to gather resources meet other players or more likely get killed by them if you're not careful. You can use the materials to build a base of any caliber whether it be for the best defense to be a shop or to be a simple home. If it doesn't work out like you had planned you can try a different approach on a different server or after the next wipe.Over my time playing the game I have learned that if you are looking for a high risk environment and enjoy actively fearing for losing all of your stuff servers with upwards of 50 players are what you should look for but if you're looking for a more lenient game where you can get away with being a peaceful shop keep or anything like that a small server with a close community would be best for you.I have really enjoyed rust over my 350 hours playing it at the time and it has definitely grown a lot since I started. I would definitely reccomend it.

review: Before I start i would just like to say that no matter how bad of a game I have played I have never left a review before because the reviews normally cover everything and I am just not normally the type of person who likes to complain. However with this game I feel like I needed to leave a review. I have logged a decent amount of hours on this game and feel like I have given it a fighting chance and to be fair the game as whole is really fun. The main problem with the game is actually the community itself. They are pure cancer I have never met a community more unwilling to help new players enjoy the game. I have also never seen this amount of cheating/hacking taking place with little or no repercussions because of how terrible the anti cheat software is. For example I had my multi layer stone base with about 30 metal doors broken into using just wooden spears and they were some how able to change the codes on the doors as well. That is just one example of how easy it is to cheat. There is not much much more that I can say about this game other than dont waste your time until Rust sorts it out!

review: Alpha Ver. Review For the new players definitely watch Rust tutorial youtube videos because they help a lot. Especially map tutorials because you can get easily lost in this game. I recommend to stay near the main road and find spawn resources of any kind. It's somewhat difficult to solo this game but bringing friends or forming alliances with other players will improve your game experience. When you find a research kit and something you like in the game use the research kit to learn that item. Once you learn how to play the game everything from that point is easy. Double wall everything from inside to outside the main wall because other players will try to use c4 to destroy your walls very easily. Once you die you will have to start all over again or you have to run as fast you can where you died so you can get your stuff back.My review This game is so addicting and fun I can't think the last time I had fun since I played Wolfenstein ET or Pre BC Vanilla wow. The game has great potential because its something new fun and cool. I can't wait for the new upcoming updates and actual game to come out. I would like to see a character customization choosing a side to play human or zombie more more weapons name plates zombie world events more zombies a kill count / death count list during in game. I especially would like to see the use of transporation such as cars in the game. The game would be really amazing if there were weather conditions implements such as thunderstorms fog snow etc. Third person shooter view option would be great as well. What I don't like are the death and respawn mechanics and the ability for other people building on your property especially if they don't have permission. I believe that in order to build on someone's property it should be the same thing when you /share doors. I've seen people loose their camps because they needed one more wall to build and they wonder off somewhere to farm and they come back findig someone has overtaken their property because of that last wall.More upcoming reviews... Thank you for reading this review.

review: Rust is a love hate for meI started and logged probably 150 hours in legacy. I loved it to death. The learning curb was massive due to hackers and KOS.But once you learned the ropes you could live peacefully and then it was kill or be killed. Then they redid the game. And at first I hated everything about it and kept going to the old game.Then me and a friend went in together and learned the ropes and now I'll log in every month or 2 to log a few hundred more hours and log off cause I'm one of the few if not many who are ready for the finished product. I suggest if you dont know how to play then watch youtube to get the feel before jumping in.Other than that if you can find a server that you love and avoid some of the more toxic people then this is the best survival game for the price and the content that you get. Thanks gary and facepunch for one of the few games that I got my money's worth on. Keep up the good work and I cant wait till you're out of early access. Till then I'll be back and forth to see the progress of a game I get lost in.

Rust is an iron oxide usually red oxide formed by the redox reaction of iron and oxygen in the presence of water or air moisture. Several forms of rust are distinguishable both visually and by spectroscopy and form under different circumstances. Rust consists of hydrated iron oxides Fe2O3 nH2O and iron oxide hydroxide Fe3).Given sufficient time oxygen and water any iron mass will eventually convert entirely to rust and disintegrate. Surface rust is flaky andfriable and it provides no protection to the underlying iron unlike the formation of patina on copper surfaces.

review: Unfortunately I can't recommend this game at this time. The game really is beautiful and has a ton of potential but there's just entirely too much wrong with it that shouldn't be. Let's first talk about the "Alpha" status of the game. The concept of a game being in "alpha" but still being released is fairly new and many indy devs have done it well (7 Days to Die Space Engineers Kebal Space Program etc.) while others simply don't. This is one of the latter. Even though the game is technically in "alpha " when you're charging $20+ for the game users should be able to expect to see some progress. Tagging your application with the "Alpha" label does not give you carte blanche to collect money will providing nothing in return. The payment for the game is with the understanding that the developers are making a promise that the game will progress until completion. Accepting payment then failing to progress (or suddenly progressing in a different direction such as making the game for cell phones with a micro transaction system I'm looking at you Peter Molyneux) is a breach of contract and players certainly have every right to be upset when this happens.When you have game breaking "features" missing these should be added promptly. Unfortunately looking back at videos from a year ago it seems as if nothing has actually changed. Here are some of the core issues I've found that seem little different (and by "little" I mean it was exactly like this a year ago judging by the YouTube videos) 1.) Setting up a server yourself takes a near act of God. You at least have to be quite technically savvy and there's no single player option. This means you're forced to play on servers where players enjoy sniping you with a bow from a distance which puts the "bleeding" effect on you. When "bleeding" you will die within seconds. 2.) As mentioned above the "bleeding" effect is entirely pointless. You'll die long before you'd have time to create a bandage to stop the bleeding. Worse still even if you already have one prepped and ready chances are you'll die before you can get it applied. "Bleeding" should be renamed to "gushing from the femoral artery." At the least they should just have you killed immediately by getting one shotted by everything in the game. At least then you wouldn't get your hopes up.3.) EVERYTHING causes the bleeding effect. Every time someone attacks? Bleed/die. Every time an animal bites? Bleed/die. I one time was completely by myself in the middle of nowhere mining ore and just spontaneously STARTED BLEEDING and died.4.) When you die you'll be randomly woken up naked and starting over somewhere else in the game.5.) There is NO MAP. I repeat there is NO MAP and nothing more than the position of the sun and moon to give you a basic idea of what direction you're moving. In procedurally generated worlds this means that after spending hours creating a house then getting a random "bleed " you're basically starting over every time. There's no way to find your way back to your house. 6.) When building better make absolute sure that this is PRECISELY how you want something placed. There is no way possible to "undo" what you've done until late late in the game when you can "craft" explosives to blow up your work. At one point I finally decided that the lack of foreplanning on the structure meant I would just be better off completely abandoning it and moving elsewhere to start over. (Which was convenient because at that point a wolf bit me and I bled out.)This is all just some BASIC functionality here that's pretty horribly broken. The game has its share of "alpha" level glitches bugs and balance problems but those are to be understood when talking about an alpha. However when charging people to play the game a year is entirely too long to wait for very basic gameplay issues to be fixed. I managed to make it almost 2 hours before finally giving up. Which truly is a shame. I WANT to like this game. I like the crafting system the interface is solid the graphics are beautiful but it's just not yet in a playable state. And apparently has been in this same state for well over a year. I'm actually quite surprised at the number of positive reviews. As an indy developer myself I tend to be quite lenient when it comes to Alphas but this one just isn't going to get the thumbs up. Not when I know that at the very least adding something as simple as a coordinate system reducing the speed of the bleed effect and adding the ability to remove a house object that you placed would take one developer less than an hour to fix and would make the game immensely more playable.
title: Rust

review: When Rust first came out I had a great time playing and exploring. I learned to distrust most other players fairly quickly because of the scarce resources. For most it's easier to kill a freshspawn and steal their stuff then it is to actually go out and find the stuff. I was ok with this though because in the end you were fighting for survival against wild life zombies and the elements. But the server crashes and overall glitchiness of the game was what put me off. I could have a nice metal shack within a community of friendly players in a good location but all that would be wiped during server downtime and I would be forced to start all over again for no reason it got real frustrating. Recently the game has been unplayable buggy features and unstable servers make for a bad experience. If you don't already own the game I would wait for at least the beta but who knows when that will be.

review: Disregard all the negaive reviews of this game. I am one of the most veteran players around my words hold truth.In this game you start naked and have nothing but a rock (and sometimes a torch). You must build eat kill fight and survive. That is the entire game so if you enjoy freedom of choice then there are many adventures to embark upon and many people to meet in Rust. This game is in development and has been taken down and resurrected again. Many people say that this game has taken too many steps backward that is and understatement seeing as how they had entirely started rebuilding from the ground up. This game has updates brought weekly and has had bounds and leaps of graphically updates implemented but most people see this as ignoring what we "the consumer" want. Yesterday I saw airdrops brought back rad towns exist again loot crates reappear and the thrill of being chased down after getting an airdrop. The developers are bringing it all back and from there they have stated numerous times that they are going to continue building up from there. I am proud of the work they have done and am ashamed of the people who call these men and women money grubbing monsters. Be very ashamed that these same "comsumers" who claim money grubbing are now playing a game that charges people for airdrops that contain end game weapons and armor.I love this game and I have seen soo much progress come forward since it's earlier dayz. If you are a true gamer you will love it too.

review: Ahhh Rust....Great Game.Atleast it used to be until it changed to Cry engineDont get me wrong cry engine is great and all but this made the game impossible to play.I had a great and easy time playing the old version (you can still play if you dont like the new one) but the new one makes it alot harder in the aspect of trying to run it.However with the constent updates to software and in game mechanics make it a well developed game.So if you have a great pc by all means get this game but i dont so i personally wouldnt play the newest edition.All that aside i will rate everything from the new and old versionOLD VERSION Graphics 2/10Gameplay 7/10Mechanics/Animations 4/10Gunplay 6/10Runable 4/10NEW VERSION Graphics 8/10Gameplay 9/10Mechanics/Animations 8/10Gunplay 7/10Runable 2/10Hope this helps you decide whether to purchase or not.(Also check out for rust much cheaper than steam.)

review: Overall OpinionRust is a promising ambitious game that tries to do everything and unfortunately fails to do anything especially well. It's disappointingly shallow in most aspects which is especially concerning given how long this game has been in development.In Depth ReviewI picked up Rust in a Humble Bundle about a year or so ago and had never gotten around to playing it. Since it had been released in early access several years prior to THAT even when I stumbled across it in my library a couple days ago I expected a fairly polished product (or at least something that really showed that this game has been in development for years.The first thing I noticed upon spawning in was how horribly unoptimized this game is. I have an excellent gaming rig and I nearly had to bottom out the graphics settings just to get it to run smoothly. I've heard great things about the graphics when they're maxed out but the fact that I can play much prettier games at full bore while being forced to lower my graphics substantially to play this is pretty telling.The next thing I noticed is that the persistent building mechanics make every world a massive mess. Literally anyone who logs on to a server can build and those buildings stay there until the server is wiped which oftentimes happens several times a week on a given server. There is hardly a patch of clear ground in the servers I tried and the poor building mechanics and the need to make your base as hard to raid as possible (more on that later) means that most structures are an absolute blight to look at and very out of place. It's a pretty disappointing system in that there are so many crappy structures that there's very little to explore and even if you like building your structure will be gone in a couple of days anyway and you'll have to start from scratch.Speaking of starting from scratch I hope you have hours upon hours to spend grinding out quality materials because if you don't you will get killed while you're logged off. Yes you heard that right when you leave to do other things you can still get raided your stuff stolen and killed. If you want to come back and pick up where you left off you better hope you fortified your base with top tier or near top tier materials before you log which takes several hours of straight grinding to achieve. Even then a committed team can still break down and destroy the most fortified structures so you're really just crossing your fingers that no one well equipped enough stumbles upon your base. Additionally you're forced to make your base as convoluted as possible to discourage raiders which makes it a huge eyesore and difficult to navigate. There's also little to no functionality to remove structures you've built after you place them meaning a wall or floor placed wrong means you need to either start completely over blow up with top tier explosives or spend a massive amount of time breaking it down with tools. The combat seems to be the main selling point of Rust but it lacks the same punch as games like DayZ or the Culling. In DayZ everyone had guns it was a piece of cake to find them and always ended up making engagements fun. In the Culling melee weapons were able to contend with firearms because guns were scarce had little ammunition and were difficult to use. In Rust you hope that the people who have been playing longer don't randomly kill you because there is absolutely no way you can contend with firearms if you're still using low tier weapons. There's very little logical progression either you go straight from spears and sticks and rocks to rifles and machine guns. Despite the fact that this game has been in development for years there's very few weapons to choose from at all. There are so many aspects of Rust that I really really like. I love the hunting I love the base building I love the friend or foe interactions with other players but none of it is really that good. There are few animals to hunt and there's no way to sneak up on them forcing you to do the same chase shoot chase action every time. The base building is clunky there aren't enough options and it looks awful in the world. The interactions are generally poor because the game is so shallow there's nothing to do but kill people once you hit a certain point.I really want to like Rust and maybe it'll blossom into an amazing game some time in the future. I just don't count on that given how long it's taken them to reach where they are now.

review: I can't in good consience recommend this game. I own over 100 games this is the first game I've felt compelled to write a review for. This game is a perfect example of why alpha's do not work. This game is older and has more funding than almost any other alpha ever and the problems are stil massive. For anyone who knows nothing about this game basically you run around gathering trying to build up a base and your knowledge so that you can craft parts to get better gear. Servers vary in their pvp culture but on the official servers most players are KOS. So you can imagine how difficult it can be if it's just you or you and a friend trying to get started with just a piece of rock when so many other players are running around with AK's. But that's fine I understand that's the game I signed up for and I'm fine with that. Where the frustration sets in is when you spend so many hours grinding only to have your progress thwarted by a server crash. I had just spend the last 2 hours gathering loot in one of the most dangerous places on the map and considered myself very fortunate to have almost made it back to my small base as I was crossing a river the server once again randomly crashed and when I got back on I found I had drowned and all the hard work I had put in was for naught. Things like this are common occurences. The devs are still clearly adding to the game which is great but they really should spend more time into making their servers not complete pieces of lag spikes are so common and the crashes are constant. Maybe one day they'll get it figured out and this will be a great game but for now it's far from complete and I wouldn't recommend the investment of time and money.
title: Rust

You get back on later you're locked in the room everything gone. You ask your "PAL" what happened. AT THIS POINT he tells you that he is a betraying head who took all your and you are now ed. F1&gt CONSOLE&gt TYPE SUICIDE. Welcome To Rust.
