review: This game is honestly an amazing survival game possibly the best I've seen but there's a huge problem in it right now. If you don't have any friends to team up with every time you play or you just want to survive in the game alone then get used to starting from scratch every single day. It's impossible to survive on your own and actually do well in this game. Clans just have too much power and if you're new to a server then for the first few days that you go on that server you're going to get wiped out everytime as you level up to get your first gun. I like to think I represent the average gamer. I have a job that I have to go to most days so I don't have a ton of time to put into videogames I can usually play for 4 hours usually give or take depending on the day and I don't have a ton of friends to play with maybe one other friend who might have the game and sometimes is willing to play. To actually craft your first reliable ranged weapon a bow takes a few hours of straight farming for the xp then even more time to actually get the resources to make it. That's assuming you're able to go under the radar long enough to not be interupted by constant deaths and slaughters for no reason. Clans are impossible to even consider taking down and usually even if you're able to build a little hut out of metal they'll still get in overnight while you're sleeping and take you out without even giving you a chance. That happens so often it gets to the point I'm just discouraged from playing anymore. I know there isn't a lot Facepunch can do about raiders it's apart of the game and they can't just remove it but something needs to be done to give solo players a chance. It's to the point where I'll build a 2x2 metal house and spend all day making it just to wake up the next morning and find it raided and me dead. I find my house again and try to rebuild then I have to go to work and when I get home I'm raided they blocked off my cabinet and walled me in so my only option is to use the kill command. I trust eventually the devs will do something about this and when they do I'll change my recommendation but for now I only recommend it to someone with 4 or 5 friends who have the game too and can all team up to kick the little guy.Update Nothing has been done to solve this problem. They've changed mechanics but the core idea is the same. To make matters worse ladders can now be put on the sides of walls and can be climbed even if you don't have buidling permission in that area and to craft a counter to that is expensive and difficult so the only way to protect against it is to complete a full roof. That's a problem if you plan on expanding up it means that if the enemy has ladders (and if it's a clan they always will) they will be able to get in your base. They added the ability to put locks on chests and cabinets which is a step in the right direction so theres that. Review still stands however.

review: Rust is a very competitive deceptive and manipulative game where your survival is based on the relationships you can form with those around you. You must do whatever it takes to survive collect resources and weapons store them in locations where no one else can find or get to them. I got this game because my brother needed people to play with. I have tried playing this game on my own but no matter how well you build a base fight off other players and collect guns you will be fighting an uphill battle because everyone else on the server is in a team. The minute you log off go for your dinner go to bed or go to school/work your character is almost guaranteed to be getting his head pummelled in by a rock while others are carrying your precious items away to their bigger better and superior bases.All in all it can be very exciting when you have a team who knows what they're doing. However if you're a lone wolf save yourself the trouble and don't buy this game.

review: So I'll just jump right into it.It's a great game with potential. but it just seems like another quick DayZ cash in copy / sloppy of a game. at least you don't get banned like the devs of "WarZ" do.PUTTING THAT ASIDE While this game is a ton of fun in it's own way it doesn't seem to have much of an end game. no real work. I personally got mid game gear by camping a town for it's spawns within an hour. some minor bugs have been fixed as well which is nice but still that's all it really is a bug fix.while updates are being pumped out at least somewhat frequently they've really not added much to this game.even the devs don't even know what they want to do with the game just yet. We are in very early development. Some things work some things don't. We haven't totally decided where the game is headed so things will change. Things will change a lot. We might even make changes that you think are wrong. But we have a plan. It's in our interest to make the game awesome so please trust us. y'okay. so we could be beating a rock against a tree one day for all we know the next day we could be drinking a beer and swinging our at traffic for bonus points.(in my honest opinion you'd probably have just as much fun doing that anyway)now let's dive into what EVERY SINGLE PERSON else says.I know what you're thinking GASP BUT VENN that's mainstream!BUT IT'S SO DAMN TRUE.the community is absolute S H * T. You WILL be shot chased camped mugged beaten with a rock and mauled by bears as well just to add to the mayhem.I wouldn't mind playing the game as much if it weren't for the community. you've got your aimbottersflyersKOS PVPersand just general s.and limited hours of potential gameplay. unless you enjoy having to log on EVERY SINGLE ING DAY just to make sure your house doesn't suddenly poof vanish into nowhere. bugs are annoying as well as crippling in some aspects.the map is incredibly boring.mm rocks and trees. rocks and trees. oh look at that what is it? A BIGGER ROCK.we've also go little to no variety. you go from rock to pistol to shotgun or m16. oh and what's this? they all look the same to others.the zombies (or rather mutants) are ridiculous. even in kevlar they will take you down within 4 5 hits.which do I even need to mention how easy it is again to get end game equipment?(cough cough air drop package cough)in short it's just another game that feels like it got a name a quick build (COUGH dayzcopypaste COUGH) and then slapped with a price.admittingly i enjoyed the game for a while but it's just dull.I'll be WAY more willing to come back to it once It's finally finished and polished more.but hey who am I to stop you? right this is only my opinion but don't and whine when some prick runs up and bashes your skull in at night when you log off!happy gaming.TL DR no variety. quick ending community. buggy. large map which is easy to get lost in. no beginner's guide.an unfinished bucket of crap.

review: Note I only have 3 hours of gameplay and gave up in disgust. My reasons for this are set out below.Starting with the positives Its a survival game You can run around and do mostly whatever you want to whoever you want for whatever reason you have or don't have You can do the above two points with friends Some scope to change the skins of assets/modelsNegatives lack of character/avatar customisation. lack of character/avatar customisation. lack of character/avatar customisation. lack of character/avatar customisation. lack of character/avatar customisation. lack of character/avatar customisation.Ok that's enough of that.I looked around the google sphere to find out why I couldn't customise my avatar or if there was a way to change it (even if I had to create and pay for a private server) and I came across this article (link below) with reasons stated by the devs for the lack of character/avatar customisation.https //www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/apr/13/videogame chooses character race gender rustTo me the developers reasons make no sense to me. If a certain player was to grief other players generally being a nuisance exploiting a game glitch trigger botting etc this is the territory of the ubiquitous "report player" ticket which invariably in some games lead to admin bans or the vaunted "VAC ban".TLDR Rust is what it is what it is and as a result of lack of character/avatar customisation I recommend the following two options 1) if you don't care/it doesn't bother you that a game chooses your character for you in game players ridiculing you over a player avatar you had no choice in making getting ganked within 5 minutes of joining a server and you enjoy the survival game genre then this game is for you.2) if character customisation is a lynch pin of keeping you immersed and enjoying a game then steer clear of this one.**To the Devs I implore you at least give the player community a modicum of avatar customisation allow us to choose male or female at the very least.
title: Rust

review: Product received for free. This game had amazing journey during it's early access. It was once rebuilt from nothing due to it became really problematic towards updating the game.In the current state (game just left early access today) this game feels super amazing looks beautiful and I get solid 150 200 fps with gtx 970 4gb and i7 3700k which feels super good. PVP is amazing even tho assault rifle is super powerful and practically impossible to kill with other weapons if the AK guys know what they're doing. Building the buildings works how it's supposed to and a lot has been experienced through the early access with numbers of bugs and weekly updates. (and all the experiments along with the updates)I hit 2700 hours in early access and enjoyed pretty much all of it. I'd suggest this game for everyone who likes to PVP and has time to commit in to the game as it's quite grind to get the weapons but after you get to that phase of the game it's super intense. As you get better in the game it's also faster getting the weapons and you get to that fun phase of the game. (even though lots of people enjoy the early game too and if you're good enough you can beat the "gunmen" with bows) Also I'd suggest everyone to gather a group before starting this game as it's much easier with a group.TL DRThis game has had it's up and downs. I've played it 2700 hours in early access and enjoyed most of it. Definently worth buying if you like PVP survivals with the building aspect and like to commit for a longer time than your average 40min CS GO match. As a tip for new players get a group for yourself when you start to play this game.

review: **Update 7/13/2018**Its just turned into pure cancer. The new team system is the most Anti Rust thing Ive seen to date. The vast majority of servers are terrible. Forget solo play unless you want to spend 200+hrs just grinding to have a few good things to just maintain. Its literally no good for anything other than making clan related youtube vids or watching someone just troll people. Too bad it was so promising. And I had some of the best PvP battles in my life in the earlier days. RIP Rust youre now a dead meme.**Update 7/14/2016 at Bottom** Important to read!Waste of money. This game was ok at first and had potential but now (mostly on US servers) you just have a bunch of surburban white kids talking like gangsters who will just kill you on site (even on "no PvP" servers) when you first start off. Compare that to when I first tried it before purchasing it on Steam when there were actually people who wanted to be part of a multiplayer online survival game. **Windows 8.1** (rust.exe has stopped working) I get this error constantly on my Surface as well as my 8.1 desktop.**Windows 7** (rust.exe has encountered an error and must close) I can get a few minutes of gaming before this happens. I have not yet played a session wherre it did not crash. So a 100% crash rate is pretty bad for even an alpha. This laptop was brand new/out of the box 30 minutes before I fired up Rust. Every other of my 50+ Steam games work flawlessly including DayZ.For some reason this new generation of the unlaid think that "thieving" and "banditry" include just killing a new player at random. Dont bother trying to point out that that isnt the definition because they agree with the Merriam Webster definition (as one player quoted) that said that killing a new player with nothing didnt fit into the definition but then claim that the definition fits perfectly. Thanks Common Core!!Wish I could rate this lower than a 0. There are free to play games online that are actually worth your time arent buggy and you dont have to deal with the massive amounts of losers. Just remember when the exodus of idiots migrate one way its best to quietly go in another direction.0/10 (I wish I could donate my game to anyone who wanted it because I would gladly do so)3/29/14 I gave it another chance put nearly an additional 100+ hours on it and was about to give it a more favorable rating. However as I thought I finally found a server that is good it turns out (just like many otehrs) the admins harass you for no reason teleport other plaers into your base to kill you or jsut teleport into your base (they are invisible) and kill you for no reason. I almost feel like I should go to the developers offices and do $20 worth of damage to something since I know I cant get a refund for this piece of garbage.07/14/2016 Tried again. This game just gets worse and worse. So Im running a 5930k this time running at 4.4ghz. Ive tried two separate types of cards a 980Ti Kingpin and Corssfired 290x Lightnings running at 1200/1600. DX12 runs like pure crap. They should've jsut kept it on DX9. It actually looked much much better. And it ran fairly well way back when. Thyeve also added a stupid XP system. So now just foraging (which is a hard enough grind in the beginning) isnt enough. Now you earn xp (slowly) which you then spend to unlock items before you can even spend the resources to craft them. Why is it that way? Because they couldnt just let the game be good. They couldnt just let it run smooth. So they "fixed" it. Want to get to know the game and go into a "No PVP" server. Dont worry you'll be KoS'ed anyway. Have a problem with that? No worries. There are active Admins who then ban you just for lulz. Its a sad story the story of Rust will always start "In the beginning it was a great idea with tons of potential..." and the story will always end on a sad but accurate and well deserved note. Facepunch will be the next DICE. Just keep pumping out the crap. I wish I could get back my hundreds of hours in this game. All except one hour...We had an epic war with another group. We blew through almost all our ammo kevlar etc. Guns were all over the place from our dead bodies dropping them. We were fighting hard to keep what we had built. And you know in all that time (even to this day) Ive never ever KoS'ed anyone. It was a lot of fun. But that was the old Rust. Back when Devs would come into a server check out your base etc. I have uninstalled it. It was on my computer since its release. I had faith in the devs. What a mistake. It will never ever be reinstalled. Ive successfully talked two people into my friends list to not buy it. One I offered to buy him a different game to promise he would never get it. That convinced him. And I wont stop getting people to NOT buy this.

review: I gotta a ton (almost 5000 hours) of time in this game! I run a small sever that I have learned to customize. I enjoy programming and customizing plugins for the game. Game Pros Clean menu ( servers can use plugins to add to the game HUD ) Players can host their own servers off their computers for free or pay to have it hosted on a shared/dedicated server Intricate base building system and 3rd party programs like Fortify to help design them Hunting/Gathering Day/Night Cycle Weather System Moddable ( soooo moddable ) Frequent updates ! Dev &amp Community blogs Procedural generated world Gives you a sense of paranoia Generated Biomes (Desert Snow Grass) Sleeper servers (Even when you log off you are still in game and able to be killed. Pretty much forces you put in time to build a stable base before leaving the server. Or risk being killed.Game Cons Game tends to lag/rubber band if too many people are connected to the server Uses a lot of RAM KoS ( This really depends on the person and server but what do you expect?) VoIP needs work (Causes a second or two of lag after letting go of the VoIP key) Framerate/Crashing issues at times with certain updates on AMD cards Runs on the Unity engine (Making it not the best for optimization but the dev team has found lot of their way to optimize) Animals don't follow rules of physics!! (They will run up walls and even into bases too close to rocks if they feel like it)Server Owner Chaos Rust chaos rust.com

review: So I haven't played a whole ton of this game so far this I'll admit. I've run into issues with this game over the course of the eight ish hours that I've played although a lot of them are based around player interactions. My main issue with this game that offers "skins" that you can buy for certain armor pieces that allow for further customization doesn't allow you to customize/change your gender.Now of course this doesn't seem like an incredibly large issue but for a game that goes as far as to have you pay for skins to customize your appearance but then to not offer you at least the choice at the very beginning of playing of whether or not you want to be male or female is a dumb design choice. From what I've been able to look into the devs have no plans of changing this and their argument is that the previous build of the game(Where everyone was males) had half the population upset with having to play characters that were not the gender that they want. So their solution to this is to make it "randomly generated" with no way to change it. What about the "half of the population" that was upset about not playing females but now STILL can't do so because the random generation decided they were going to play a male character permanently?The game itself is alright. It's your standard survival game that banks on it's PvP and community to put together a good experience for the players in game. If PvP isn't your idea of a good game then move on from this game because at it's core that is it's most interesting aspect. If customization was made to at least allow randomized characters but with selected genders I honestly would say the game would be one I'd recommend if you were into PvP(Or if the game was on sale) but with the current state I honestly would say there's games out there with far better customization with better gameplay mechanics as well.

review: I've had this game since early 2014. And it's only gotten worse over the years. The game is a unity asset flip walking simulator with no character customization game balance or game content. On top of that it performs like absolute Ark at 4k ultra I get 45 55 fps. In rust I get at max 22 fps. Now. Ark is much more visually impressive and much more detailed. It runs better than this piece of trash. By unity asset flip I mean that literally. Nearly every asset in the game can be found for free on the unity marketplace. The start screen is the unity quality box and they use the standard unity light maps from 2013 to handle the shadow's and lighting. They haven't even bothered to update what version of the engine. I know this because if you recompile the main map for rust in unity 2018 it runs roughly 10 times faster and gains ray tracing.Gameplay wise there is none. No level system no progression each item is a nightmare to make unless you have 20+ people. If you're looking for a survival simulator and don't mind a bit of scifi just go with ark.Ark has single player balanced weapons and armor a story mode and it doesn't require 20+ people to actually be successful in it. It also has some of the most stunning visuals that run rather decently. Overall I give rust a 5 / 10.0/10 for gameplay0/10 for balance 8/10 for visuals 5/10 for performance2/10 for controls1/10 for map design 10/10 for update consistency and long term development.I gave it 5 years to get its together and it never did.

review: This game has a lot of potential depending on your interests and what you are looking to accomplish in game. If you are looking for a welcoming and supportive community that is eager to help you enjoy your game play experience you will need to spend some time looking for those people/servers because there are a lot of jerks out there that take pleasure in your suffering. If you find yourself on a server where the main advice to newbies is Git Gud run and never look back.With that said I have really enjoyed playing the game at varioius times and find that it still has the potential to be extremely addicting especially if you are gaming with friends. If you are looking to get started quickly so you can dive into the fun I strongly recommend modded servers that have an increased gather rate. If the cutthroat every man for himself PvP world is NOT your main focus and you want to spend more time on the gameplay you can find a PvE server that would be more to your liking. Hopefully the devs will incorporate both elements in the future so that PvPers and PvEers alike can enjoy the same servers but time will tell.One problem at the moment is the mechanic that allows enemy players to build a tower over your wall into a protected zone at will. This makes it extremely difficult for players to build securely and definitely skews the advantage in favor of those who are attacking.

review: Around 100 hours its like DayZ but easier and easy to get used to 2.6k hours Rust has changed a lot since I wrote my last review. I came upon my old review recently and felt it needed an update. From my long time experience on rust I feel my first review is still some what accurate. I feel as now rust is a harder game for newer people. It isn't impossible but is harder. The main issue with newer people getting into the game is getting destroyed by already geared up people that already have everything on that wipe. There needs to be a way for tier 3 and fresh spawns to be split up. I have heard countless stories of new players refunding or not playing rust again because they can't get a start. I also think the AK recoil should be easier to learn so newer people aren't at such a disadvantage when versing someone that has spent hours learning the recoil. Overall the game is still a great game. My advice for newer people buying the game is to play with a team. Possibly go on a battlefield aim train or aimbot server to get a feel for every weapon. Maybe watch some youtube videos to get started to get a sense of what you will be getting into. In my oppinion new players should'nt have to do this. I feel the game should be "plug and play" to get new people to stay on the game.

review: If DayZ and Minecraft were to have a baby it would be called Rust.My first day in rust I was just running around aimlessly until a I came across a few friendlies. We set up camp and built houses next to each other . We spent the next in game week making one massive base together with metal doors to protect us from the bandits. Everything was swell until we heard gunshots in the distance. We climbed on top of our house to see what was going on and saw a few bandits in the distance. We thought nothing of it and went back inside. About five minutes later we heard a massive explosion one of my team said that it sounded like a C4 explosion. We go downstairs and sewe that one of our doors has been blown off. Next thing we know 6 guys in kevlar come into our house holding m4's. We were outnumbered 3 to 6. One of my mates pulls out a shotgun and shoots one of them in the head and kills them about half a second later he is lying dead on the floor. One of the guys tells us to drop all our weapons on the ground as the other guys procede to looting all our hard earned goods. I dropped everything I had on me except for a P250 and some ammo. For about 20 minutes the two of us were being led by these raiders along a road when a guy with a bow starts shooting at them. He dies pretty much instantly but it gave us enough time to run. As gun shots whistle past my chest and head I begin to think this is it I'm done for. We keep running we see some mountains up ahead. We start weaving through the mountains and we eventually loose the bandits. We set up camp and call it home. Over the chat the bandits are yelling abuse at us and saying that they will hunt us down let us re spawn and hunt us down again. That was 5 hours of playing Rust I can't wait to see what happens next.TL DR An amazing game so much fun and it's only in early Alpha!

review: After 30 minutes of failed attempts to join a server (Mac) i finally got on RUST last night. I'm am a console gamer mostly now so this was a little hard to get back into. Started off near a zombie that saw me first and took advantage of my ignorant struggle to find the sprint button. Never found it died. Respawn by a radiated town with supplies which I couldnt get to because I didnt know which key searched when prompted. Wandered off into the darkness. As my torch burned out I spotted another zombie running at me at full speed of course. Dead again. Respawn near a field and found a wood pile. Began cautiously chipping away at it with my rock. Looking around on every 3rd blow to make sure no one or thing was near. In time I made an axe with stone and wood and went on the hunt. Fell off a rock while trying to get a lay of the land and began to bleed. Found a player built building with a metal door. With no one around and no way to get in I forged on bleeding and hungry. No wildlife in site. Keep walking keep bleeding. Thus far I have met no one living. I think that if saw a person at this point I would be thrilled even if that person bashed my head in with a rock. Thats feeling of isolation you get from this game after just 30 minutes alone in the digital wilderness. Through the trees I see movement could it be a boar? The boar is the easiest to take down. As I clear the trees I lock eyes with massive bear. Respawn in a field. I'm convinced that this world wants me dead. Yet I want to retry. I want to survive.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a fun game if you like hardcore survivor type games. You have to gather materials while managing your comfort/hunger and health. It is exciting thrilling and at times sparks emotion. The sun has just gone down and your trying to find your way back to your shelter pausing for a moment as you spin around squinting to see the mountains in the distance when you hear the sound of grass crunching and a moan.... A zombie is going to get you!The downside of Rust is so far experience hasn't been super awesome because of the amount of hackers in the game. Once the Rust Dev's figure out a way to keep the hackers away this will be a solid game.

review: I cant really explain it better than this Its just a bad gameWhile i'm not the biggest fan of survival games I know a good one when I see one and this just is bad.First of all Facepunch should have gone with another engine. Unity is made for phones and while my computer easily meets the recommended requirements I still got horrible frames. Not to mention a 20 minute loading time even with the graphics at lowest. Plus i'm not a fan of the character creation system. I (like many others) like to customize what my character looks like. The optimization is bad(in my opinion) and the game itself is bad. Never should a game in early access already be selling items. Finally(while I never experienced this due to not getting an fps past 5 frames) from what I can tell from reviews is that the community is horrid. Overall this game is doomed. This is very disappointing considering it was made from the same people as Garry's Mod. I cant think of a worse title that is in early access.

review: If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan Romano &amp Asiago)Note grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling. In a small mixing bowl add the ricotta and mash with a fork. Add in the 3 cheese blend Cheddar cheese eggs salt and pepper. Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth paste like consistency. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough. Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water oil and salt. Mix. Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs water oil and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed. Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough. Take the dough out of the mixing bowl shape it into a ball and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic. Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters. With a cookie cutter or upside down water glass cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15 20 dough circles). Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells. Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough. Fill a small bowl with water dip your fingers in and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle. Fold the dough in half over the filling making a half moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a homemade touch as well. Repeat this process for all your dough circles. Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker. Roll the dough into two sheets Place one sheet on the ravioli maker and form the filling cups. Fill with the ravioli mixture. Lay the second sheet of dough on top and roll it out. This will seal in the filling. Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli. Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5 6 minutes or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test. If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time you can freeze the rest Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce grate some fresh cheese over it and enjoy!

review: When I initially bought the game I had a great time playing it but after a while I found myself doing the same thing over and over again. The game is quite repetative in its current state and soon becomes tiresome. From my point of view the aim of the game is to make a base that is indestructable and then go raid another persons house. In order for you to raid someones house (which is incredably fun) you need to make a load of c4 (which is not so fun) this recquires a LOAD of time. Raiding someone and taking all of their stuff is a load of fun but once you are raided and all your m4's kevlar and c4 are stolen you feel like giving up. This happened to me but I persevered and rebuilt after I rebuilt I was raided again. I rebuilt a second time and was raided again. I then went to a second server to escape the raider but found myself out of energy and interest to start again due to the amount of time and effort it required to do what I had done.In its current state I would not advise getting perhaps the developers will drastically change the need for pvp in the game to have fun and replace it with something else but until then I would advise buying.EDIT Played the new version of the game and my opinion has become even more negative. I decided to give it a second chance with my mates and the game has only become worse. In the older version it was relatively easy to build a basic house and find a weapon to defend yourself (might take one or two starts to happen). In the new version this is near impossible. I was playing on a server of 12 (that is including three of my mates) and I only ever once was able to build a chestplate and a pipe shotgun out of around 20 starts (about 5 hours) where I was then rushed by two players with stone spears. I was able to kill one but as I was reloading he stabbed me to death. My point is that due to the massive early game difficulty curve the game is not even fun in a Dark Souls fashion. You could say 'why not play on a server with no to few players?' well what would be the fun in that? I would be king of an empty server my guns only used to kill pigs. A good way to sum up this game is 1) Join an empty server and become bored because there is no fun2) Join a server with a few people die a few times from random encounters but eventually become well equipped enough to protect yourself. Join server next day and find that it is empty due to it not having any regulars.2.5) Players on server '2' were regulars. You join and continue where you left off (assuming you weren't raided). You continue to grind and finally reach top tier equipment. You go to raid someone and take them out. They rage quit because they lost hours spent on grinding. The cycle continues until the server is empty or you are raided and lose everything repeat step 2.3) Join a server with a large number of players. You die and die and die. Maybe you stumble upon some friendlies you somehow become friends. You work together. Or you somehow survive and build. Then step '2.5' happens (you raid everyone quits or you get raided and start over again).I know it sounds childish but I found no reward in this game sure I had fun at times but it all went south when I lost everything. If you're fine with that I still wouldn't recommend as the game is grindy as .

review: The devs say they have no story to let the player write their own story. But this is really what happend! Picture this the year is 2033 and the National Science and Preparedness Association (NSPA) wanted to see how humans would act if the world just suddenly reset itself. So they took all people they brought the civilians to a facility they described as paradise and it was for about 2 4 months. People started disappearing from the normal routines of the facility. The scientist were running tests on the people there. So eventually the scientist got all the civilians ready. So they sent them to the shores of an island. No knowlegde of their past and stripped of their clothing with nothing but a rock a torch and 2 bandages. The scientist had towns on the island covered in radiation and had undead in the towns. The scientist quickly realized the "nakeds" couldnt stand a chance amoung the undead they were to fast and strong. So they got rid of the undead and replaced them with radiated animals. The scientist were pleased with the animals challenging for the survivors but not impossible to kill. But the scientist also noticed the survivors were obsessed with killing each other for revenge or just to fend off there territory. The Dev I mean Scientist were not pleased they needed to rethink their plan. So they found a bigger island made bigger and better monuments (Nuclear Plant A Dome and Water Refinary). So they moved operations there they scraped the idea of radiation animals and just let nature take its course Man verses Man and Man verses Nature. Now the scientist expand the trials of the survivers weekly even recently adding females to the island. The Future of the survivers is in the scientists hands now as they overwatch the island expanding apon the research.And thats basically how the lore goes for this game Owl logging off!
title: Rust

review: I spent what I consider a decent amount of time playing this game. Used to be super stoked about the concept of it.Turns out its just not fun. People are super to each other more so than any other game I've ever played. People go out of their way to up your day. Sure people claim that its just people playing realisticaly concerning survival but I've personally seen this overstep this.I mean the only real end game is raiding which is why I'm not mad at the game because its honestly what you can expect when its designed like this. Its just not fun for me and it brings out a certain kind of sadism in others.I would not reccomend this game to anyone even for its sale price. review: So so far i've only racked up a measly 11 hours of game time but I have experienced some of the best and worst things the game has to offer. Starting out fresh on a server can be difficult at first due to the other more advanced players and the occasional freshly spawned naked guy who smashes a rock over your head when your not looking hence it is a good idea to start on server with few players on it 30 50 players was my happy medium ) Once you get the hang of finding a good location to build your base and making it semi safe then you can enjoy the many things to do in Rust which include but are not limited to Building Hunting Crafting Killing players (if thats your thing) Raiding peoples bases and so on. Overall a really enoyable game if you have a bit of patience and dont mind the learning curve of being killed a few times in the beginning but alot less often as you progress.Thanks for Reading

review: Every sever I go on I try to farm for 5 minutes. Then I get gun downed by some guys with Ak's and uninstall. It's not bad luck It's the terriable community. I don't know how many times I have been killed by some cancer squeaker or some salty guy who is extremly cringy. Then on top of it I have amazing friends who watch me farm and also watch me die. They don't help just watch... I always try to get started or get somewhere but I always lose everything I worked on with zero chances of getting it back. The only people in this game that are succesful are the huge clans so if your just a small squad trying to have fun or farm. In short period of time you will be ran over by some rude guys with Ak's playing on a server for and unhealthy amount of time. Those servers even say noob friendly or wiped but it doesn't take that long for the same cycle too repeat its self all over again. I try to have good times and meet people but the rarity of finding somebody kind or trustworthy is usually trumped by either only finding toxic people and giving up or having one of your many 2x1 being raided and losing your friend. It's been stuck in early access for a very long time I have heard and the survival gerne get's boring after awhile when all you do is mine chop build and kill. Also occasionally raid if you ever get that good. I do have to say there are those moments were you do something amazing like take out a whole squad who's raiding you with crazy good loot and you fell stacked. But then it's all taken away from you 20 minutes later again like usual. Let me describ to you what a normal start in Rust usually is. Wake up Find spot for base Get stuff Get attacked by plebs Build a little Then get attacked by pipes before you can even get a door on. Try again but this time you tell yourself not to go outside or bring back the loot then as you start off brand new you never find your spot and get killed a couple times by spears rocks bow's pipes ak's semi's and bears... If you can find a good server good for you hopefully you can make it far.

review: Although it can be frustrating Rust is a very fun and addicting game. I believe everyone should give it a try you will be surprised by how it draws you in. The people that don't get extremely mad and frustrated from spending hours and hours of gathering and crafting to one second being murdered and starting all over again will enjoy it. As it is still being developed there are lots of changes. My only problem with this game is the people who literally play all day and all night. This gives them the ability to keep crafting gathering and raiding all while you're asleep or at work. To be really good you need no life which is why I am only mediocre but make friends and play together it makes it easier and more fun. Just pay $20 for it it's worth it.

review: Rust is an impressive game with many interesting features. Experimental needs some work but other than that the game is a golden ticket. I found myself searching radiation towns for the slightest amount of food such as chocolate or tuna. Sometimes I even found blueprints to something like a P250 or a storage crate. I understand why some people give it such hatred but still thats towards experimental. Remember it's called experimental for a reason. Garry even explained that we should trust him in his hours of work. I believe that rust has the potential to become the next hunger games survival. I hope you all realize that even though you get killed by more advanced players with more advance weapons such as assault rifles this game still has a lot of interesting gameplay. Finding an animal and crafting a gun feels like an accomplishment. When you do your first raid you feel like you can cope with the bad and good of the game.

review: I would wait a lot longer before buying this game it feels empty in its alpha stages and the lack of singleplayer makes new players feel uneasy especially when they're easy targets for bandits and crafty other players. Many parts of the game feel underdeveloped but that does by no means mean it cannot get better. My advice is to wait and see how the game develops as it crawls sluggishly out of the alpha. Who knows it might bloom wildly for all I know.

review: I ain't play Rust as much anymore...But the game is pretty good and there are weekly updates from the devs that keeps the game fresh and adds a new something to it than just another bug fix. I have 100hours on record for a reason and I am more than happy to write a review about this game now.Pros Fun and Addicting (To an extent for me) Always something new to discover and explore (Because of the updates) Good community of somewhat nice players Good update system And many moreCons Stopped playing for a reason for me it got a little repetetive and boring at this point Still many game breaking bugs as of expected from an early access (Getting killed by a bear throught the floor) And a few others To do well you need people (Or friends if you have those)Overall I am recommending this game for those who are looking for some fun with friends to build ther best base and survive the nights and days of animal horror and player rampage.I'm giving Rust a 7/10 Good Comunity and a Great Survival GameI am only recommending this game for those who can work with people in a team/clan to survive for the longest time possible.

review: Yeah it's a little bit of a mess. Yeah they've scrapped the original build for something brand new which has temporarily dialed the feature set back.But you need to understand the commitment that the developers have for this game. I won't do it an injustice by trying to describe how impressive their passion is just watch any of the developer logs or updates and you'll understand.DayZ is a font of laziness and broken promises with /years/ of development time compared to the handful of months spent on Rust. Rust is not only already capable of matching the iconic zombie survival sim it is quickly surpassing it in every way.The best part? The devs don't seem to have any intention of slowing down. They are wholly transparent even down to their day to day workflow. The community is given constant attention. The product is displayed with humility with open and honest perspectives about the various struggles of its construction.I recommend this not because it is a polished and finished product or even because I feel there is $20 of game here right now. I'm stamping my seal of approval on this project because the team behind it seems to want it to succeed as much as I do. So long as they don't slack off or disappear like so many others I'll continue to support their efforts. That's what Early Access SHOULD be about.

review: Lets just start the off with rust is not a game for the weak. Rust is one of the best games that ive played to this date on steam. I love how every kill in the game is very rewarding because it provides you with resources that you would rather have to farm yourself but on the other hand you could be farming for a long time and just get killed in seconds. Another issue that you can run into playing this game is groups known as Zergs. What these are are Clans or groups containing of 4+ ganging up on one or two players. This leads to the zergs being able to surround the solo or duo players leading them to lose their gear unless they find away to kill the zerg group. Pvp in this game needs alot of work but its not bad. 1 on 1 fights come down to skill if you're using a bow or a cross bow. You have tp land 3 4 shots to down a naked and sometimes the fights last minutes or even seconds if you land a head shot but with guns this is where I feel like pvp isnt the best currently. Because of the XP system right now you have to be level 20+ to even craft low tier guns. This means that the clans can abuse XP share to level up fast and be able to craft guns that solo players will not be able to. This means that as a solo player if your base is being raided or you're farming you will have to fight of zergs with guns and armor with only a bow or crossbow. Another point where the game shines in the light is the building aspect. You can build anything that you put your mind to in this game. You can make exhilarating building that will look amazing but will also defend the raiders and make it hard for them to locate the TC and the loot. The last point I want to make is raiding. Today on 8/31/2016 raiding isnt the best. You have to offline raid most of the time to get the loot you want. If the the you're raiding is online then they can repair/defend the loot and even despawn the loot when they hear C4 or rockets going off. My only tip for Rust to make raiding easier is to make loot take a long time like 10 mins to depawnn. Over all I rate this game a 9.5/10 and its the only game I play other than overwatch. Would reccomend to anyone looking to play a PVE and PVP game. Just know it will take some hours of your life to start up on a server D!The two best servers I think to play Rustafied mediumRustopia Kamaros

review: I know a lot of people get extremely frustrated in this game and write bad reviews so I'm here for those of you who might actually love Rust. First of all you can play on servers with very low populations that are noob friendly. You won't be killed or raided if you do this. You'll have plenty of time to enjoy the game. I recommend playing on a server that has 10 or less people during your main play time. Talk to people. Many of them are friendly. It's only on higher population servers where it is a free for all brawl. That can be a blast but you want to know the game before you try that. I also recommend watching beginner videos on youtube. You can't get raided if you hide your self and your items well enough. Especially on low pop servers. The maps are massive. You can hide. That is part of the fun. Stealth. Strategy. If you aren't sure about the 20 bucks go play the game Unturned for free and get good at it. Then if you want a way better version of that you can buy Rust. The strategies you learn in that game will help a ton. Hope this helps.
title: Rust

review: COOL GAME BUT!Epic game I love the atmosphere of the game and how any mistake can end your life. I played Rust before in its original state on my friends computer but recently I brought a gaming PC myself and playing the new version of Rust currently called Experimental I had a lot of fun.The game is progressing quickly the devs are constantly working on the game and changing aspects that might not fit the game very well this can also be a problem but I will get to that later.The game spawns you in different locations of the map with nothing but a rock and a torch you are then free to run around like a headless chicken hitting everything and everyone OR using your time wisely to build tools and shelter and progress from there to survive.Survivors in Rust will find that it s better to survive together finding your friends can be quick if you are lucky or an absolute pain in the Do not trust players who don't have microphones it never ends well. Rust is very unique survival game no zombies just the player vs the environment and whole bunch of naked dudes swinging rocks or bandits going around "practicing" shooting._____________________________________________________________________BUT!!!Rust is an early access game so watch out what you purchase watch latest YouTube videos because the game changes very quickly features get fixed and broken fixed again or removed. this is a massive problem with Rust as much as Devs are caring for the game they change and remove features as they please meaning that in future the game might now be what it is now. For example my problem lays with removal of the Building Walls Removing option which allowed people to remove walls later on when they want to expand on their homes or fix errors they made by accident. the devs removed the features as they found that player raiding shelters (which is a normal part of Rust implemented by the community and Devs) would take down house when they get access to build in the area by authorising themselves to use the tool cupboard (an object which placed in a house forbids other players to BUILD on and around the building). I guess what Devs have not figure out that the raiders can build in the player's house and completely make it unusable by for example placing a staircase on the doors and upgrading it to stone this would make it near impossible to break through with standard tools near equivalent to the house being destroyed.Other problems include the performance issues the devs are fixing those problems and trying to make the game run smoother with every update but often lag comes from the number of players in servers and abandoned raided shelters (that are now not destroyed by raiders) even though those things such as destroyed abandoned houses in Rust give it its unique atmosphere it can be the game's curse.I have little performance issues when playing Rust other than a little lag every 20 or so seconds which makes FPS drop to 30. This is because I'm running Rust on NVidia GTX 980 oc Video card i7 4790K processor and 8 GB RAM. I have around 80 to 70 FPS when running around but in highly builder up areas it can drop.Overall the game is cool I'm enjoying it very much right now and I really hope the Devs will listen to the community as the new version of Rust progresses further. If you feel like trying Rust try finding cheaper Steam keys on websites such as and help out a charity at the same time.

review: Haven't had such a laugh playing a game since early DayZ (the mod). Dying in this game was so hilarious First I got eaten by a wolf cause went head on with my rock (bad idea) Second time I ate raw chicken and got poisend because I hadn't mastered the fine art of cooking. Third time fell of a rock couldn't run away from a wolf and got eaten. Fourth time attacked a bear with my hatchet which I thought was a pig (it was getting dark) got mauled and ran away but bled out and the last time I died I went mano a mano with a zombie (bad idea those f****rs are tough!) Though this type of game is also a lot about the pvp I've not encountered any people yet who wanted to kill me (except the guy who ran at me with his rock and I pulled out my hatchet and seeing that he ran away) but nice helpful people who explained me a lot of mechanics etc. I doubt I will keep meeting people with good intentions but we will see. Really looking forward to new updates and what will be added to this great game! Recommend 10/10

review: Ive played this game for quite some time now and rust has given me some of the funnest gaming expirences ive ever had. Now trust me getting started in this game is gonna be very fustrating. Especially if ur starting alone and on servers with lots of people. But once u find a group to be with and u become civilized (instead of a ravenge naked man killing people and animals with a rock to survive LOL). The game becomes quite interesting. Also look out for servers that dont have the anti cheat system if it doesnt dont go on those or ur gonna hate rust like all those haters out there. Anyways as u become civilized and ur 1x1 shelter becomes a house then a village then a full blown city. U become acustom to all the items in the game from a rock to automatic rifles. U start forging alliances with other groups or become enemies with others as u look out for any groups of people coming with c4s to take down ur village and take away everything u've ever worked for. Over all Rust is a extremely fun expirience in my opinion and i hope it will be for u as well.

review: IT'S A TRAP!This game has gone through so many changes that it is now nothing like it was when I purchased it. Yes alot of these changes have benefited Rust but the main issue for me is its transformation from a zombie survival game what it was advertised as to a normal survival game. This decision has made the nights "I guess I'll sit by this fire and hope I don't get shot in the head..." as opposed to "Crap! I better run from this horde of the living dead!"I don't have enough hours on this game to critisize the ins and outs of it but can say that I found it extremely difficult to "start out" in Rust seen as you starve pretty quickly because you need a certain weapon to harvest meat from animals and to make this weapon (which I think is a spear) you must spend time gatherng resources. Aside from all this I'm sure it's a lot more fun with friends after performing the monumentous task of surviving for more than one day.

review: Ok Lets start this off with the good points.Weekly Updates.(However at time of posting they have swapped to updates every other week so they have more time to refine each update but they will keep players updated weekly. Awesome.)great building system large maps 100 500 players per server All around the game seems amazing except one thingThe community.Everyone has the mindset of "go hard or go home". Think you can play politically? make alliances? join a group? you will be shot on site before you can get two words out. Think you can hide out and live like a hermit? You WILL get raided. Hell when you first spawn you will probably be killed and harvested for food and fat. I played for a while and got so fed up i decided "go hard or go home? fine the latter" tl drIf you are a hardcore gamer who is willing to log in right after a server resets and ruthlessly kills everyone else buy itIf you have a group of 4 or more friends who have the game and can form a group buy itIf you just want a good early access survival game....get "The Forest"

If you decide to play solo forget it as the 20 clan korean and chinese groups that play constantly 24 hours a day switching 12 hour shifts will you. Beware if you build anywhere on the map that there will be no nodes because of these guys. That is if you decide to join any official server. Doesn't matter if the server is EU or NA or Oceanic they will break through the 400 ping barrier just to come and your day. These guys WILL have 24 ak's by the end of the first DAY of wipe. Now not all of this is necesarily true if you are a modded cuck then you'll just have to deal with m249's and m9 pistols with decently sized clans to shoot as fast as frost to you. Moral of the story is that if you like getting ed this game is great as to my standpoint I'm kind of in the middle of the Yes or No Reccommendation of this game.

review: "After 5 days of playing I have to say something that will most likely be ignored. Awful community! This game is 100 percent not worth playing in it's current state. Wait for the overhaul." I've come back and other than the impressive pe to the nis slider that would make Saints Row blush I am sad to say that I'm still displeased with RUST. Since the text above I am re reviewing Rust as of 7/3/17. Since I have last replayed it I am forced to forever be a black woman and thusly and killed for miles away from hit scan weapons for some ironic racism meme. Hackers are the only way I can get fire arms (often dissing the game as they exxplain why they are giving them to you) as just as you get enough of anything for the game to be "interesting" (aka not holding down a button hitting a rock or tree) you are shot. With no gear you'll be shot miles away too and I am one of the players to see it as me not doing a good enoigh job surviving or being out played. But after a while I realized this is not the case. It's a lot like the current state of America and no not in the "ha ha people are way". I mean it's like the 1% VS the 99% economically. The 1% aka those who joined the server early when barely anyone was on it (not saying these guys have played for years on one server) and build a base in peace (because no one else is on) and then horde weapons and gear for a raid that will never happen which leads to them "getting bored" (what they define as bored) in the process and thusly with nothing to do shoot the 99% with said gear and weapons that after an update fire like a weapon from MW2 and with 3 times the range. Rust is badly designed and deliberatley wastes your time and as an Early Access game has no purpose. Garry has said he doesn't have any idea what it would make Rust finished as there is no end goal.http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 944256949

review: For an alpha this game is very playable indeed. There are issues that need to be addressed and I am sure they will be evenutally. On my system which is no slouch the game gets very jerky when engaging in PVP combat this doesn't seem to happen against animals or zombies.I think the PVE aspect of the game needs to be ramped up. The first hour is the hardest hour in the entire game trying to find and kill a boar with a rock before you get too hungry having to light a fire to stay warm. Then onto crafting a hatchet some clothes and eventually a gun.Unfortunately this is where the challenge ends you can kill wolves easily with a hatchet by this time you'll have more food than you ever need you never get cold because you are wearing clothes and as soon as you have even the most basic pistol with some ammo then the zombies are no longer a challenge.Something needs to be done to make surviving harder I think. The only danger of death after this first hour is through PVP. I have no idea what PVE players do for fun once they reach this stage because the chance of death is precisely 0.Having said that I can fully recommend this game. I just hope the devs take it in the right direction. It's worth 15 quid of anyones money even if it does get a little boring once you have built your house.

review: On June 12 2016 Omar Mateen a 29 year old security guard killed 49 people and wounded 53 others in a terrorist attack/hate crime inside Pulse a gay nightclub in Orlando Florida United States. He was shot and killed by Orlando Police Department (OPD) officers after a three hour standoff. Pulse was hosting Latin Night and most of the victims were Latino. It was both the deadliest mass shooting by a single shooter and the deadliest incident of violence against LGBT people in United States history. It was also the deadliest terrorist attack in the United States since the September 11 attacks in 2001.In a 9 1 1 call shortly after the shooting began Mateen swore allegiance to the leader of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) Abu Bakr al Baghdadi and said the shooting was "triggered" by the U.S. killing of Abu Waheeb in Iraq the previous month. He later told a negotiator he was "out here right now" because of the American led interventions in Iraq and in Syria and that the negotiator should tell the United States to stop bombing.Initial reports said Mateen may have been a patron of the nightclub and used gay dating websites and apps but Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) officials said they have not found any credible evidence to substantiate these claims. The Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) also conducted an investigation and said it found no links between ISIL and Mateen.

review: Rust is a naturally occurring phenomenon when certain metals are exposed to oxygen and water for a length of time. The actual chemical make up of rust is 4Fe + 3O2 2Fe2O3. The only metals that rust are steel and iron. Other metals may become corroded but they do not rust. It is an actual chemical change which takes place when metal starts to rust.Everything around us is made up of different chemicals. These chemicals are made up of atoms. The atoms can join together to create new chemicals. The atoms can also join and make up chemical compounds. Rust is a chemical compound. The iron atoms fuse together with the hydrogen and oxygen atoms. The formula for water is H2O. Adding the water creates a chemical reaction. The result can be seen as rust.Left in a totally dry environment iron or steel will not rust. It is when moisture is added that the oxidation process starts to occur. Because the air we breathe has moisture in it oxidation will occur even if there is no water added to the metal. There is enough hydrogen and oxygen in the air to allow the atoms to bond with the iron. This creates the chemical reaction known as oxidation or rust.There are things you can do to prevent rust from forming on your metal surfaces. The first is to keep things like tools in a dry area. Rust may form even if the tools are stored in a tool box. However the process is much slower because the exposure to the moisture in the air is decreased. If you are in a humid area you may consider investing in a dehumidifier. This machine also decreases the moisture in the air reducing your chances of rust forming. Things which are normally stored outside like bicycles and lawn mowers can be covered or moved indoors.There are products which will allow you to keep moisture from ruining your tools and other things. Silica gel packs help to dry out the air in small places like drawers or tool boxes. Keeping a couple of these packs in your tool chest will ensure your tools are not susceptible to rust. Also when items which are made of iron or steel become wet dry them off as soon as possible. This keeps the oxidation process to a minimum. You can prevent rust in this manner.

review: Rust is a great sandbox survival game with fun concepts and large open maps. As of right now features are arguably limited if you are not willing to PvP but even that is fun and exciting. Just making a house with your friends is fun on your own. Every step of furthering your survival seem like an accomplishment. It can be quite fun to compete for an airdrop by killing others who flock to it. People come from around the map to meet at the one airdrop which can oddly sometimes be a great way to orient yourself. I see myself continuing to play even after I have done everything I can do.My largest criticism is the way to find servers. There are the large official servers with many players but I enjoy myself more on community servers. I have found that it is near impossible to find a server again if you got on it from a friend. I can't see anywhere that extends the page to more servers and there is no search. The servers I have been on don't show up in my history and if I forget to favorite a server I will have to wait for a friend to get back on it.

review: Here is in my opinion what an ideal Alpha game is. I've seen many negative reviews on this game simply stating that it's a disapointment that they weren't able to create a AAA title in a year of the game being released. The drop of Legacy Rust and switch to Experimental Rust was also a huge negative feature for many users. However where Rust shines is the speed of progress. First off although Legacy was abandoned by the Devs the current version is infact playable with plenty of end game content and mods if you're bored with vanilla definitely worth the $20 alone in my opinion. Secondly there is the experimental version. Although this version was created from scratch very reently it is currently playable with plenty to do. Of course there is also plenty of bugs but those are being fixed as quickly as possible. Although it is lacking in content for it to be a full game the speed to which content is being released is surprinsingly quick with both Radtowns and Blueprints being released in the last update (although both being really buggy).Overall I would recommend this game but only for those with the mentality that they are buying in a sense an investment. The game is not finished not even close to being finished. Yet this game is one of the few that appears to be made for fun with the need of money not the driving force in the creation of the game. And with that in mind the investment of $20 in this game is definitely worth it.

review: One of the worst games and concepts ever developed. This game focuses primarily on wasting your real life time performing tasks in game that you could perform faster in real life. Once you've wasted a sufficient amount of time you will start being killed by other players for no apparent reason and with no given explanation even if you do not actually possess any materials or have completed any tasks. Whether this is the developers' implicit intentions or not it actually serves as a perfect equivalent for the Milgram experiment. The assailant rarely has a motive beyond "b but I was supposed to do it because that's what I was told to do". The procedurally generated landscapes are extremely poorly crafted with thousands of collision errors every square meter extraordinarily lazy methods of clarifying territorial distinction and numerous other nigh terminal extremely blatant flaws. The fauna that inhabit the procedurally generated landscapes possess essentially deific powers to defy the game's internal physics systems and the temporal nature of reality as it stands often bounding hundreds of meters up a mountain in a single step or moving backwards whilst their models' actions imply they are moving forward.The central aim of the game appears to be to gain power by ruining other players' experiences in the game. Anyone who legitimately takes a vested interest in playing this game is most likely sociopathic and would be much better off working in a biological studies lab tricking rats into traps to ascertain data on behavioral traits or working as an abusive (yet not reprimanded) low security prison officer (with of course an ulterior motive of being able to feel superior to their victim in both scenarios).

review: Summary Rust is a survival game created by Facepunch Studios. Inspired by games like DayZ Minecraft and Stalker Rust aims to create a hostile environment in which emergent gameplay can flourish. The aim of the game is to survive. To do this the player should gather resources. Hitting a tree with a rock will give you wood hitting a rock with a rock will give you rock and ore. You can then craft a hatchet from the wood and rock allowing you to gather faster. You can go out and hunt a variety of wildlife such as boars chickens rabbits bears wolves and deer. Once you have killed an animal you can butcher it to gather its meat and skin. You can craft a fire using wood and cook the meat inside the fire. Then you can eat. You face two major dangers in game. Rust is a multiplayer game so there will be other players trying to survive in the same way that you are. Unfortunately for you they can find you kill you and take your stuff. Fortunately for you you can kill them and take their stuff. Or maybe you can make friends and help each other survive. Rust s world is harsh so you might need to make friends to survive. The environment is not kind. Bears and wolves will chase and kill you. Falling from a height will kill you. Being exposed to radiation for an extended period will kill you. Starving will kill you. Being cold will kill you. http //www.metacritic.com/game/pc/rust.

review: The game itself is solid however the community is about as appealing as a Tuna sandwich that's been sitting in the hot sun for a month that's just been wizzed on by some dirty hobo. What the game is about The game has four main pillars. Survival looting player interaction and progression.All of these pillars vary greatly so I'll talk about the one you'll be getting most of. Player interaction is something that can happen either three ways. Most commonly you'll be a naked with little to no loot and someone will blow your brains out with a bow crossbow or some sort of gun. Once you learn PvP a little you might be able to fight back but chances are you'll scrap the idea of talking entirely and feed into the cancer. Second most common is that some other naked is going to run up and bash and/or stab you. Most likely for your animal fat. Third most common occurence is you DON'T get shot smacked over the head or stabbed and someone says hello or maybe even wants to team.So with that out of the way I'll be analyzing each tier of player interaction.Being shot as a naked is all too common. Hence why I said "Most common" and "The community is as appealing as a month old tuna sandwich." that's besides the point. If you want to survive your best bet is to stick to hills and toward the shore as a fresh spawn and beat up the rocks and trees for resources. Chances are you will be shot while walking around or be shot because a group of kids decided to sit outside of your freshly made wood base with a key lock door. It's frustrating. Sometimes you'll decide it's best to take a two day break. But you'll most likely come back for the solid mechanics or because you might as well make the most out of the game you can't refund anymore.2 The survival. You sure as hell won't be doing a lot of this. Not even high skilled players go for more than a few days (IRL) without getting their brains blown out. Food and water isn't the problem as you can drink from any river so long as you're actually able to find that sweet spot that the game decides is the ONLY place in the river you can drink from for about 20 meters. If your health is low you can abuse this to full health if you spam E quick enough. Animals are only a threat so long as you don't have a ranged weapon particularly the pigs and bears as deer chickens and horses either run away after getting one swipe or go down in one or two hits. 3 Looting/Farming. This can be anywhere from finding rocks to looting barrels and military crates at rad towns. I'll start with farming and attempt to make a mini guide to help the newbies. Most people understand the concept of hitting wooden objects such as drift wood trees and fallen trees for wood with their rock to get more wood. Not many people understand that unlike trees there are a finite amount of stone/sulfur/metal that can spawn in an area and that the giant cliffs cannot be hit for stone. You have to hit three little circular boulders that all have the same shape but are different color for those. Stone is the bright grey "node" or boulder The bright colored orange and red node is metal. When you break them you get metal ore. and when you finish them off high quality metal ore which won't be useful until the late game stages. The grey stone with yellow stripes is sulfur this is also not as useful compared to stone and metal at low levels with stone taking ab solute presidence.Then there's the barrel/crate looting. Barrels are simple you hit them and you get 1 scrap metal along with a variety of items such as shop fronts for stores if you want to own one blueprints for basic and generally decorative items spinning wheels for little games you can crate by painting the wheel. And some other items that range from useful to decorative. What you do with the items you do not want such as sewing kits spare gears and metal blades spare springs you take these into a rad town useually a low radiation rad town such as water treatment. The looting system at early stages is nice. You take a small risk getting things to take into a high risk area. It's actually quite entertaining but demoralizing if you end up dying with the 100+ scrap you lost. For higher tier looting there are monuments such as The Dome and Launch Site. The Dome has zero radiation but has military crates. which are where most people get their first guns during a wipe if they haven't researched them already. It is a HiGH PvP zone building near it is not advised nor is going there without at least a pipe revolver. Progression was directly fed into by Looting and player interacion.Other players can easily hinder or even completely halt your progression possibly even resetting if they're lucky enough.(Or if they have the raiding supplies). Looting is also luck based as RNG decides what you'll get where you get it and how much you get. There is also a slight cheating issue. I personally have only had two encounters w ith one guy wiping out an entire two squads of five in 6 seconds with an M459 and getting banned by the games anti cheat minutes later.The second was an encounter where some guy went through two locked keypads and many turrets without setting any turrets off or putting in any of the codes and taking over my base. He had done it to other people in the area. The cheating problem isn't rampant but it is something to take into considerationOverall I do enjoy this game. The game is fun with friends and punishing but gives you a chance even if that chance is small as with a group of 3 with AK's shooting at a man with nothing but a wooden bow. I would give this game about a 7/10 doesn't give enough incentive to NOT shoot everyone you see.

review: Pls read my experiences of rust. I have rated the most crutial aspects of the game I could find.1. Horses and other animals teleport out of existence or fly up straight vertical walls to survive. Impressive but... 0/10 Would kill self again.2. Spears magically disappear and don't hit the animal or enemy so if you somehow manage to catch it (for shame you flying wizard / hacker) it don't matter one thang gurl. ( out of D.3. Every person on this game wants to kill you or take advantage of you. But if you are a strong independant woman (which at the moment you can't be) who don't need no man this shouldnt phase you. Dat comunity dou. &gt (4. A surprising amount of floats high in the air. Anything from trees to bear traps to animals can be spotted in the sky soaring far from reach. Not a big deal but it does ruin the vibe and is very ugly.5. Animals are IMPOSSIBLE to find probably due to too many people killing too many animals (up the spawn rate maybe?). If this was a simulator of today's declining fish population situation then 10/10 m8.6. This may just be a personal peeve but the ratios for crafting stuff is WAY off. 300 wood to make a spear (is literally a long sharp stick in game) 200 wood and 50 cloth for a bow (the bow you make from 200 wood and 50 cloth is a long stick with a string on it mind you). Like how hard would it be to dial it down a bit honestly. I just find it stupid and it really bugs me.Basically lots of bugs many of which are large enough to lower enjoyment of the game (And YES I understand it's an early access and blah blah but still). Not to mention the tiring repetitive cycle of man spawns in man dies several times due to man or elements (mostly other players) and then MAYBE gets to enjoy his creations for a little before being "raided" as the cool kids say and having to start over again. The cold and vicious cycle of Rust ladies and gentlemen.NOW FOR THE POSITIVE 1. Blurred out dong everywhere. Yum.2. Dem graephics dou.3. Trolls everywhere (Might be a negative for some) and lots of lulz to be had.4. It's not finished and while it does have lots of both good and bad the bad can still be corrected. Here's hoping.Overall I'd say Justin 'Rust' Trudeau is just not ready (hence the early access label). And I would recomend waiting until it is finished or vastly improved before trying.Nice graphics dou.Error 404 Canadian Politics reference not found? The starting screen reads Play and Quit. I look at the rust dev blog and it looks decent enough until you try to run the game only to have it force quit 2 out of 3 times you try to connect to a server.I don't know why the game is so highly rated. For $20 I expect a bit more...game. I don't trust them. Game breaking issues like "Rust Experimental" are usually fixed within a few months. I can't imagine anyone competant is working on the game client full time. I'm almost certain the game is abandoned with updates coming out frequently on the website to keep suckering customers in. I regret this purchase wholeheartedly. I didn't even get to review the actual gameplay but it's really raw and buggy. Enemy hitboxes are god knows where regardless if it's a rock or bear you're trying to hit with your hammer (and that's the game in a nutshell.)
