review: Do you have anger management issues? Do you often feel you are being treated unfairly? If so I recommend Rust. You'll have a chance for growth to achieve a stoic zen like state where you are able to endure any frustration or setback any video game can throw at you. On the other hand there's also a good possibility you'll achieve a total meltdown and a ride to a mental asylum where you are given a 2x2 room of your own with padded walls floor and ceiling. But hey at least it's unraidable.For an Early Access game I think this one is surpringly mature and playable with quite interesting gathering hunting crafting and building mechanics and character progression. It's the so called community that makes the game unbearable for many. I say so called community because outside co operating groups a.k.a. clans there really is very little community. Well that's not entirely fair as there are always players that will help you in in game chat if you have questions about anything related to the game.However there is next to no community to be found in a sense that you would be likely to run into friendly neighbours and start working together. 90% of the time you'll be shot or swinged at on sight. Even of those 10% presenting themselves as friendly 90% will eventually stab you in the back. People will not hesitate to shoot you dead with their firearms when all you have is your bare a rock and a torch. Just because they can. For some reason this game seems to bring out the worst out of people and make most of them turn into virtual bullies always ready to prey on the weaker. Then there are the clans I mentioned earlier that can be even 50+ players strong. In fact lone players and small groups are such underdogs to them no matter what they do that I wouldn't be surprised to see this game go somewhere in a direction of certain number of tribes on a server amongst which the players joining would be distributed evenly.However if you're able to keep in mind it's only a game there's still plenty of fun to be had. Just remember anything you manage to gather craft or build is only temporarily yours. It will be raided and pillaged it's just a matter of when. As a game Rust is good if not excellent especially given it's Early Access state. As an MP experience depends on not only your server choice but also a lot on your own ability to tolerate losing everything over and over again with you being able to do little or nothing about it.

review: Product received for free. 509.8 hrs on recordPOSTED 26 MAYSo I've owned rust for maybe 3 years played on and off and for the most part enjoyed it.Don't get me wrong rust in itself is a good game. The BP systems isn't the greatest and can take a while to get what you need but it works. Harvesting building a base exploring and having the occasional firefight is also fun (talking about when i started 3 years ago)The game looks good runs well and have very frequent updates 3 years on. The one reason why I would not recommend this game is due to the community. It is by far the worst community i've had the misfortune of experiencing ALTHOUGH I have met a handful of decent players.When I started out 3 years ago it seemed quite different. Over time it has just gotten worse and worse and it really makes the whole experience frustrating and unenjoyable.You used to be able to mill about collect reasources build a base and get going without too much of an issue. The people you would come across would more often than not be friendly and leave you to your own devices. Of coure you would get the occasional hostile but it generally wasn't that bad.Unfortunately now it is a much different story. 99/100 people will kill you on sight even if it is within seconds of respawning... they will also often flame you out over the mic. I've heard every insult racial slur and homophobic insult many times every play session.The trend at the moment is to greet you tell you about how they are friendly wait for you to let your guard down and then kill you. Many players will scream about being friendly and then kill you straight after. For the record I am one of the few friendly players in the game but it gets very wearing after a while when everyone just wants to pretend to be friendly kill you and then insult you over the mic.Yes I expect to get killed raided etc in rust but dont expect it every 2 minutes. It's not fun. I cannot imagine how new players will even begin to get to grips with rust you simple do not have enough time from spawning to learn. I've seen quite a few get completely disheartened and quite on their first server.Rust is not a "pure pvp csgo cod shooter" yet so many players seem to treat it like it is.I like to play games to have fun and rust was... once upon a time. Just not anymore. There is no penalty for running around and being an anti social toxic idiot. This is a major flaw within a game like this. You can run around insulting trolling and greifing as much as you like along with forgetting how to interact with another humans in a normal way and nothing will ever happen. Rack up millions of kos kills nothing happens.Just because I play a game like rust doesn't mean I have lose all sense of decency when I interact with people. Yet 99% of players do and it is incredibly sad.There is a reason the community on rust is shrinking. It needs to be addressed as rust is a good game...without 99% of the other players.People who read this review can tell me to 'get gud' as much as the like or whatever insults you have stored up your sleeves but at the end of the day there comes a point where the toxicity becomes too much and it's just not fun... Welcome to Rust.It's a shame I cannot recommend rust as it is up there with being one of my favourites. The community has just sucked out the last bit of fun for me.Edit Im not against the idea of rust (included raiding fighting etc etc etc). Im solely talking about the players and how they interact with you. It's really killing the game.

review: Buy's rust has no idea what to do. But i'll wing it. Get's into world. Hit's rock on rock get's stone iron and sulphur. Hit's rock on tree get's wood. Start's to starve try's to kill deer deer run's encounter wolf during night die's. Next day i meet a naked dude he helps me we forage for supplies and we survive.We hunt chop smash and bash.We build a house gather an abundance of resources and make weapons.Next night dead. Survivours raid our house in our sleep and kill us.Respawn and repeat process.But with a twist. I have learnt i have mastered and i am ready now i survive day and night and kill the wrecthed dieseased naked men that come after me i have made gun's and clothes. I WILL SURVIVE! All in all this game is fanatstic at first it takes around 15 30 minutes to gather enough supplies to build a safe house and weapons. The worlds are huge and vast very dynamic and the widelife is awesome aswell. I bought rust on the 8th/12/14 and now its the ninth and i have nearly a day of gameplay because it is amazing you will forge alliances kill and raid enemy survivors or just chill on your own you can do anything.Rust has amazing graphics and runs smoothy it offers a good choice of graphic selections for all pc's and doesn't leave you bored. 9.3/10

review: Once I started playing this game I didn't want to stop. It is amazing.So you are placed in a world with just a rock a torch and a few bandages.Your aim is to survive but to do so you must gather wood craft build a house and be careful of who you trust.You can raid peoples houses or just attack them on sight. You can be hidden in the mountains or be out in the open field.Whatever you do and how you survive is up to you. This game may take a while to get used to but it depends on how fast you learn. You want to know and understand the map as soon as you can to avoid getting lost. Trust me... getting lost is horrible.Yes this game has had its bad moments such as the server DDosers but this game is great and the developers have done a great job with this game. I am very excited for how much better this game will get.So I highly recommend playing this game.

review: I have owned this game for 6 months now and have wasted weeks on end playing it but really it isn't worth it. Anything and everthing you do in this game is going to be erased but that isn't what is wrong with this game. The problem with this game is cheaters they cheat and it makes no sense cause there is nothing to gain from it. Most people have never even heard of rust let alone give a if your good at it. This game could be alot of fun but being the way it is just makes it a ing troll fest which I guess can be fun to fight off harassing noobs till they have nothing left but like I said the problem is cheaters. So you start off you get a good start finding everything you need to make a base and get started well thats good I hope that was fun because the rest of the game 70% of the time when you come across someone they are going to instantly kill you before you can even react. So man people toggle aim hacks in this game it's ridiculous. The game isn't easy and on a level playing field it's a good game but there is no way of stopping the rampit hackers. You have to spend hours farming mats and making gear just to lose it before you get a shot off. There is just no point it literally takes hours to get gear and you lose it in .5 seconds it's the most unrewarding thing ever made. It would be one thing if you went out to fight and lost it but really that isnt what is going to happen. Your doing to get some basic gear and a gun and as soon as you hear someone outside your base you will slow and silently cheap over to one of your many windows and peak out of the corner of it just got enough to get instantly shot in the head 3 times and you only saw the person that shot you for less than a second if even that. I have played this game over 900 hours tons of time in weapons training I can shoot and pvp very well but none of that matters because there are hackers everywhere that will instantly kill you I'm not saying there is a gun fight and this dude just keeps hitting you I mean this dude sees you for a tenth of a second and he spins around and get 3 shots off in your face before you can even move or twitch or finger. It's so abnormally fast it cannot be a real person's reaction time and accounting for recoil within a second. Only mahcines can do like that so I don't reconmend buying this game it will do nothing to waste your time and make you upset. There is literally a company that makes hacks for this game you pay and then you win. It's just grossly unfair.

review: I don't write reviews mostly as I feel I can never get my point or feeling across properly that and I'm too lazy. However I felt the need to write one for Rust which I must say is quite the accomplishment. If I could justify recomending it for getting me off my proverbial rear end I would. Sadly though this is not the case. I will start off by saying I know I don't have much in the way of shown hours logged blame me for doing things like downloading patches to client based steam and non steam games when I do play rust. I bought rust back in 2013 I think might have been '14 little fuzzy on that detail. I enjoyed the game quite a bit minus offline... I wouldn't call them raids more like vandalism. When it came time for the game to be split into legacy and whatever we call the current build I was happy for some of the changes coming. Frankly I was tired of staring at and running about the same map. I welcomed most of the changes that happened after that one though most of all I despised. That was when I found our character appearence would be locked to our steam id's. I didn't complain at all about it as I figured later on we would get to create our characters eventually. Over time that hope was well frankly stomped on and finally buried with this latest update. I know Garry runs this game like a little social expieriment seeing what happens when you tweak certain elements. I was okay with that for a while as long as it seemed like it was going to continue to be a game. After all I paid for a game something to enjoy maybe have a bit of an escape from reality. If I'm going to be participating in an expierment I expect to be compensated for it not to pay into it. No I'm not saying pay me jsut simply I'm not going to thro money at someone's research that I really have no interest it especially when I'm one fo the "labrats". I feel as though I can get into a game more if I make the character I want or if the character has a fairly fleshed out story if I am going to be playing a preditermined character. Rust however takes that away I am who my steamID makes me. I don't get to choose who or what I am I am simply thrown into random PC body #4 376 890. I can not connect with that character I feel unmotived to play him it just all around saps my enjoyment from the game when I can't play whom I want to. I simply can not play Rust anymore. As an addtion the responses to requests to add character creation gender change or something along those lines by Garry had led me to a conclusion... He's a prat.

review: Boooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooring.Unbalanced.In alpha forever.Playing alone is a really experience. Only "fun" to play on populated servers where you get endlessly killed as new spawn by clans that dominate servers. PvP is pointless. There's nothing of particular value for you to get when raiding especially when you reach a point when you're able to raid. Almost everytime you'd be wasting more than you'd get from raiding a base and even if you did get something good or destroy a well established clan in a server it all gets wiped anyway so nothing is really gained. I know this is somewhat good and bad at the same time as wipes are needed to keep the game from feeling a bit one sided but doing that also nullifies the point of playing the game for veteran players. Resource farming. ResidentSleeper.There's no PvE in the game. It's falsely advertised as a survival game but the survival part of it is easy af. The only reason to play at all is for PvP unless you want to kill bears and endlessly farm for guns you never need to use. The only 3 things in the game that can kill you besides other players are animals helicopters and AFK level stupidity. In order to die from the first two you have to be pretty dumb too as they're both incredibly easyBuggy as all hellAnimals clip through walls.Toxic KOS PvP community. Guns cost too much and endgame is reached in as little as 2 hours and is nothing but a resource grind because the PvP is crap in a PvP oriented game. Crap game. It's super boring and it's one of those games that's never coming out of alpha and what baffles me probably the most is... It's somehow worse than it was before being reworked Gl hf you got scammed.

review: I have only arround 700 hours but I cant stop playing. Playing since alpha I encountered lot of and lot of glory as well. This game is absolutely genius game. Survival with PVP included lot of roleplaying elements as well best building system I EVER SEEN in any game and good progression system (Some haters only cry because they cant hit barrels ignore them)What you can expect?* Dying* Dying again* Respawning and dying* Get spear bow tools* Make a base* Start collecting materials scrap ores everything u can* Start getting weapons and researching them* Turn into killing machine or just have fun!* Meet new people make new friends encounter strange nakeds* Great graphic look after last update and much better FPS as beforeMY RECOMMENDATION BUY THE GAME even for full price it is worth it. If you can pay 60 for 200 hours of gameplay in RPG game 35 for this game where EVERY single day is different every fight is different every new start if different and your skill MATTER and you see how you are improving every day just do it. JUST DO IT!All new people are welcome! Mature guys especially &lt 3 If you decide to buy the game feel free to add me (EU) I can help you out with basics and so on.CHEERS!

review: Got pulled into this game by a friend who really LOVES it. Me not so much. This is a PvP platform if you like PvP then you may like this game. If you don't the appeal is limited.First off for my modest system the load time is EPIC. Really 10 or more minutes. When you finally get in it is hard to see what took so long the graphics are not particularly awe inspiring. Also the game has at tendency to crash my system which of course requires a reboot and reload. Since the latest update the game is also prone to drops. As far as a PvE survival expiereince it is ok. Even more so than most survival games Rust tries hard to kill you early but once you get that phase it is pretty easy. The environmental puzzles and NPC encounters are fairly thin the most difficult challenge being finishing them before the NPC's start to respawn. None of this is surprising since the environment and NPC are just window dressing for the PvP action the game is designed around.So one of the few PvP encounters I have had in the game went like this My friend and I started a raid against a solo they knew my friend and knew it was coming and were cool with it. We start up and the solo has recruited a friend so it's now 2v2 which is cool. This new player is REAL good so things go bad quick. I get killed respawn at a bag that is nearby get the 'press any key to move' message but as often happens in this game this does not work. (Fyi the simple work around i know now is to esc to the main menu and go back in.) While i am trying to figure out how to actually get up so i can get knocked down again I get killed again. Respawning across the map i have just long enough to notice how far i would have to go to get back to the fight and my system crashes efectively taking me out of the fight. Even if i were into PvP i doubt i would have enjoyed that.So the upshot If you like PvP and have a decent system you may well like this game. If you don't or have a mid range system you might do better looking at something else.

review: I got this game back the the old times. Back when there were zombies back when Rust Legacy was simply rust and there was no experimental crap. Then things changed yes changed. The game was great just needed bug fixes and content and then the devopers decided to make rust experimental the official Rust. The lack of content hurt a bit. As did the aweful frame rate no matter what settings I used. It is almost impossible ot find your friend on the map. And to this day my hunger levels haven't changed. This my friends is why Rust legacy is the true rust and if the developers take the gamer further down the road it is on they will have ruined a masterpiece of the gaming industry. WE MUST PROTEST THESE CHANGES. Facepunch must listen to what the people want they want the real rust not the new bullcrap. There is a reason for all the recent downvotes. It felt like they took a fully finished game and sent it back to pre alpha stages. Please force facepunch to listen to us. Do not get this game until they are forced to change it back to the glorious work it once was.

review: Rust is a quasi survival game where you start out with nothing but a rock to bash away at things to get the materials you need to make better things.then you can use those things you make to kill people who have not made those things.kind of like a rock paper sissors game until everyone has the best stuff then its luck and who shoots first.its fun and addictive but in its current state it needs a LOT of work to truely be a great gameEdit Here we are just over 2 years later and this game has come so far its mind blowing. This game has went from fun for a few hours to a full blown addiction waiting to happen.if you havent tried this game yet what the hell are you waiting for? pick it up! the developers are always tweaking and adding more the game is about to release next year and it is now so refined that it could honostly release right now and be a full game.easily well worth the cost at full price and at a sale its a steal!Edit 2 4 years since my first review and 2 since my update... here we are again... and the game continues to change and be amazing! if you STILL havent bought it yet im not sure what else i can say to you to get you on board. You are missing out by NOT having this title!

review: 1/10 because even after years of early access this game is the purest of Dull and incomplex gameplay with a handful of different resources to combine and no goal to go after. It's a sandbox with extremely dirty and disgusting sand in it. PvE doesnt exist unless you call the most simple base building and fighting off wolves PvE.PvP is the worst I've ever seen in an online game. Insane base lag and hitboxes that are on average three meters off the target. Guns vs spears makes absolutely no sense and shows the simplicity of the developers minds. No interesting team fights or anything that would motivate the player to continue playing after a few hours of getting to know the game. The community is cancer mostly 10 14 year olds who either dont speak english or have the thickest accent one could imagine. Rage and anti teamplay is the only thing there is to find unless you join en empty server and invite your friends on it. So try it out and refund it that is the only solution. The only reason I see for Rusts existence is the community Minecraft has created over the years before. The kids who reached puberty now want to try out something different and find Rust as the successor.

review: a game that requires skill to be good but can still be fun with the large amount of weapons and small group of attachments you can really see whats best for you and while severs do wipe and you have to start over you can get back to where you were in about a hour or 2 with a group then spend the rest of the month doing whatever or until you get offline raided if your alone you can play on one of many modded severs which offer multipliers so you can do it in the same amount of time and solo severs limit big groups fighting you theres a sever for allmost anything if your willing to help build the player base so whether you dueling it out in combat tag going on a murder rampage in battlefield building raiding farming or pvp theres something for everyone while i have a lot of hours that dosent stop me from having a great time with a few friends for the night the right place to be is good enough so you can hold your own while still being able to enjoy the game and not feeling like a job (cough)(50 man zerg)(cough) and many things are still being changed and added as well as tweaked by facepunch many of which are bugs that the people say they do listen so if theres a problem just start asking the community all in all its a great game for only 20 its not the best and not the worst just get some friends which i met in game and have fun

review: Don't buy this game unless you have a state of the art machine and A LOT of spare time on your hands. Seriously unless you're rocking some 980s in SLI with a top tier i7 and naturally a SSD you will be spending half your time (at least) looking for workarounds to miserable framerates dealing with mysterious game crashes and suffering through endless loading screens.And what's even more alarming With every update and patch they roll out the game seems to run worse. I was able to play the game just 'fine' (which in Rust terms means it runs like sh*t but at least it runs) 6 updates ago but the situation deteriorated to the point where I am not able to play at all anymore. Literally the game will not start anymore. They have acknowledged the issue but there is no fix in sight.Although this steaming pile of bugs and bad code is years from completion they are dedicating more than half of their resources on the development of new skins game features and items/monuments/events just adding more errors to the already existing ones. Seriously I don't understand why they will not prioritize fixing gamebreaking issues first."..but it's Early Access it's just an Alpha bro! Give them time!!" Well I understand that it's just an Alpha but honestly it's been in Alpha for more than two years now and they have been cashing in ever since. Early Access has become an excuse allowing developers to publish unfinished games and then slacking off all the way to the bank.Remember Minecraft? Remember how smoothly it ran in Alpha? Mojang managed to create a whole new game genre adding awesome features over time without making the game gradually unplayable. That's an Early Access game I was able to recommend.Not this one though. My prediction is that Facepunch will never finish developing this game. I don't believe they lack the intention to do so though they simply are not capable of it. And at some point another studio will come along and publish a working version of a Rust like game leading to this one being forgotten.In conclusion don't waste your money on this 'game' it's basically a crash report and loading screen simulator. If Facepunch should actually finish the game at some point I will give it another shot and might edit this review. Until then my rating stands at 0/10.
title: Rust

review: So far after only 8 hours I have pretty much forgoten about dayz z . Sorry rocket you took way too ing long and although alot of clones came and failed this game is awesome! You can never log out your body stays in asleep so build a strong house and join a town! Build everything yourself or fight hunger games style over random ocassional air supply drops. Start with literally nothing naked cold afraid and hunted by everyone. Update 11/24/2016Im back and the game is better than ever. Literally my favorite of all the survival games. Amazing progress since the beginning which was already cool. Very difficult unforgiving game worthy the effort. Super fun raid and counter raid mechanics. Awesome Crafting. My favorite game curently. I cannot reccomend this game enough. Just understand it will take time to learn and master and it does have bugs. But this is the most complete alpha game I own.

review: RatingGameplayMechanics are great alone with the optimization. Graphics are beautiful and even on Potato graphic quality it's still not half bad. There is a nice server selection and the connectivity for those are well. The game itself is easily a 9.5/10CommunityTHE MOST TOXIC COMMUNITY I'VE EVER SEEN. Be prepared for every curse word racially/sexually charged slur in the books and tons of and kill jokes. The game seems to gradually get more toxic as it grows and the game has been ruined by KOS and clans. I understand that the game is a PvP but there was a time where you could walk up to someone random and they wouldn't kill you ASAP (They may give a warning). Same with clans its becomming a full time job opposed to something I enjoy because clans are there 24/7 able to take your house down.

review: &gt Waking up on the side of a beach naked&gt Walking to on the grass and suddenly sees a massive stone castle&gt knocks on the door and says "I'm friendly hello?"&gt 2 guys with hazmat suits and 2 more guys with metal plates on their chest get out with thompsons and revolvers&gt They make a circle around me and tell me to drop all my br&gt &gt I tell them that I don't have anything and begging them not to kill me&gt They tell me "Shut up you coon welcome to the slavery business..."&gt They all push my aggresivly into the castle&gt they put me in a 5x5 Meters room with a sleeping bag no windows nor any light&gt I start talking telling myself jokes and after 15 minutes i hear a voice saying "coon you're up?"&gt a guy came with bolt rifle pointed at me and drops stone hatchet and picaxe and tell me to go harvest some stuff&gt I go harvest for 2 hours and get attacked by wolf I run screaming to the castle and I get no reply&gt suddenly I hear loads of shots at once and i look behind me and see the wolf dead&gt I go scavange for more and then they call me back&gt I give them 10K wood and 5K stone and they asked me if that's all i got in 2 hours?&gt I told them that I don't have enough space and I beg their pardon&gt They told me to get in the castles yard&gt I then see about 35 men in a circle around a man with a beanie and a spear&gt they tell me to fight him and give me a spear too&gt I'm telling myself "no ing way this is the end..."&gt he runs at me screaming "ALLAHU AKBARRRRRRRRRR !!!"&gt I avoid his spear by an inch after he threw it&gt "that's it" I tell myself "he got no weapons that's my chance to hit"&gt I throw the spear at him everyone's looking at the spear flying at slow motion&gt the fighter looks at me with blank eyes and a cold face&gt I smile at the fighter and say "asta la vista moron"&gt the spear gets stuck in his head and he falls down dying&gt Everyone's quiet... no one knows what happened as he was their best fighter&gt Then in one massive voice everyone starts SCREAMING OF HAPPINESS " HE ING DID IT !!!"&gt I couldn't believe it I ing survived it...&gt the guys in the castle told me that I deserve it and gave me weapons and cloths&gt suddenly everyone goes quiet in the base and I hear a something ticking...&gt I get near the wall and hear the ticking even louder&gt one of the men who watch the fight said "is that a C4?"&gt I run in slow motion and scream "E V E R Y O N E TAKE COVEEEERRRRRRRRRR !"&gt The wall explodes behind me killing 25 guys&gt I get behind a wooden box and I see 7 guys shooting at the guys in the castle "they are bloody raiders" I whisper to myself... &gt I take my AK47 and shows a sign to all the guys in cover saying &gt 3...&gt 2...&gt 1...&gt FIRE!!!!!!&gt We are 10 men going out of cover spraying all these raiders down&gt they take 7 of our guys out we are 3 left and they are 3&gt I get back to cover and peak a bullet passed and pierced my ear&gt I get out of cover in a split second with my sniper rifle and noscope one of them&gt the other guy in cover peaks and gets headshoted&gt I can't believe what i'm seeing... this is chaos...&gt The other guy in cover peaks and tells me that if I survive the code to the vault is 67... *Gets shot in the head*&gt the blood splashes all over me and the wall i still see his eyes moving slowly and closing...&gt All I see is black now I see my death... "that's it take me" I said quietly to myself....&gt The guys come around the corner and I'm already surrendering I accept the fate...&gt Then the guys start laughing and saying HOLY GHETTO IT'S YOU !!!&gt I'm confused they take the masks down and I see two of my friends they came to free me from the slavery&gt we all hugged together and I couldn't believe it we're all happy&gt we get out of the castle all happy no more ammo in the guns and the loot on the shoulders&gt I run and say "I'M FREE ! I'M FINALLY FREEEEEEEEE !!!"&gt I didn't look behind at my friends but I hear a shot.&gt I feel something warm in my stomach... I look down and I see blood coming out...&gt I don't feel any pain I look back and I see one of my friends dead and the other one pointing a sniper at me&gt Josh wh what... what is happening...&gt He tells me "Ghetto it's nothing personal it really isn't it's just business"&gt He shoost me again i'm falling down blood is coming out of my mouth but I still don't feel any pain.&gt I try to say something and he steps over my leg &gt he tells me "last words are for fools who haven't had enough"&gt I see all my life flashing over my eyes I hear a shot for less than a split second&gt I see only white I look down and I don't see anything but white I feel my hands but can't see them&gt I take my tongue out but feel nothing no wind nothing&gt "I guess this is it..." i'm saying to myself but I can't hear it.Just make sure to know that everything I said is t.but not just any kind of t good quality t you don't see that everyday fellas.

review: I've been playing Rust for a couple of years now figured i'd write a review.Without all the ing about how Rust is ruined and the updated ruined the game. i'll try and give an idea of what new players can expect .its a very tough game to get into . arguably the most frustrating game ever created. you will die and loose all your progress over and over . then again . that's the game . so if you are easily off at video games and/or are not prepared to deal with Early acess you should skip this one . That all aside Rust is an absolute blast with friends.you'll have to fight for your life your home and everything you have worked for every second . one small mistake and you'll pay the price. its fun as hell (untill you die to a screetching kid with aimbot )

review: To begin with you can't customise your character. I know that this was intentional by the developers but it's ridiculous. Since the allocation of who you play is random I'm stuck playing as an Asian dude (a huge target for racial abuse and KOS) making it virtually impossible for me to team with anyone. Also some what upsetting because I like spending hours in character creation.The community is abusive if that isn't already obvious and due to constant server wipes a lot of the stuff you spend weeks making ends up gone in less than a few seconds. If you make a base on a server don't expect anything to be intact when you get back or you to have any stuff in your chests.The aim is to survive however there is little to no incentive to do so but that just might be because I'm done with the game 15 minutes in. Mainly because every time I come across someone they yell "oh it's an Asian man I don't like Asian men. Die Chinese man." Or some Kim Jong Un racial slur. So In conclusion even though the rest of the game is relatively alright I suppose this stuff trumped everything for me. Not worth the buy. If you want a free version of rust just go read the comment section on a leafyishere video.

review: This game is about survival but it is not your average DayZ or Minecraft type of game. The world is a post apocalptic wasteland with pockets of radiation zones scattered about. You are a survivor who must collect items and build your self a home where you can rest easy. There are other players who will be out to hunt you down and loot your stuff while there will be some who might be more friendly than others. Try and meet up with friendlies to help your odds of making it out there. The beginning of the game might seem like a pain to understand at first but once you get a feel of the crafting and resource gathering you will become a natural at it. This game is not the most fun to play alone so please bring friends with you. All "noobs" and legitmate players should take advantage of the offical servers to avoid admin abuse and hacking. Finally this is an Alpha game so don't expect it to be flawless. Now get out there and go kill some piggies and gather some wood for your home! Good luck out there!Summary for those who don't like long reviews Great game so far for an Alpha release. Get it now for $20 guys and come survive with me! D Just hope I don't shoot you in the face on an encounter.

review: Nope.I've been following this game for a LONG time now.And as it was fun at first like mmo's have this effect on you and only later you find out the POISON in the game itself. Now ofc this isn't an mmo but it works the same ing way. Dont waste your time and energy on this game and I will tell you why.My first experience. Here we go.This was almost a year ago and the game was still the old Rust.We picked a server and went on with our own merry thing we had a bunch of fun and i played with 2 other friends. And the 3 of us just build this massive fort and with massive. I mean really massive. It got the attention from a few players (that were apparently buddies with the owner of the server) they were chatting with us and quite fast it became obvious they didnt want us on this server and of how unwelcome we were. We shrugged it off even the silly threat that he would contact the owner of the server etc. We figured he was just bluffing.And when we went offline. (seriously the second after or so) and our buddy (who lives in America) when we left went online after us to do some guard duty. The owner used a cheat or hack or whatever to break through our (THICK SECURED) fort and steal all our *slow clap* this guy deserves the jerk of the day award. IT's save to say i didnt touch Rust for a REALLY long time because that really me off.That was a 3 days worth of no sleep building that fort. I had fun sure. But after seeing it breached the coward way i had no interest of trying again. Only to get your process destroyed the minute after. Its like showing a damn cookie to someone and then having to watch someone else eat it. Yesterday after almost a year i finally returned with the idea fine lets some up too then. Because honestly i didnt feel like building and have the same thing happen again. Also the anti cheat etc makes it so that hacking/cheating is no longer a thing and it will perma ban users from Rust or Steam completely.FIRST OF ALL. My friend had to instal the whole thing again because he recently did an entire reinstall of his entire computer. Oh well nothing new right he instals it. And the game doesnt even show many servers for him now this was... REmotely annoying but fine it was fixable by just stepping back in time so to say to disgard an update or go back to previous build etc. Because the game continues to get updated so much. Now he finally did that went back into the game only to have his character spawn in the air the entire time and to fall to his death. SWEET!He had to leave the game again reinstall the whole damn thing and try again.NOW IT WORKED. YES WE CAN FINALLY PLAY.We found a decent server that had little players so we could do our thing make a fort hunt gather recources etc. We had our good ole' nostalgiac fun. And the server promised it wouldnt wipe or anything. We started building etc etc.. And the whole time we were the only ones there. Fine i guess we wanted a small population so we would be left to ourselves.We logged off later that night in our awesomely build (still small) Fort. But it was secure enough so we wouldn get killed in our sleep when we logged off.Today we tried returning to the server.And with try i mean you cant even ing search for the server. Its not in your history. Oh you get the option to save servers to favorites meanwhile there is no tab for that. At all.The search function doesnt even work.So we had to skim through 60 pages worth of servers twice (to make sure) to realize that the server we build on. WAS GONE. *rubs temples furiously*I'm sorry no. But this game is NOT worth your 20 bucks right now.Please spend it on the Resident Evil remake or so and i will promise you will get worth your money spend.I really do hope this game develops and adresses all of these issues because honestly its a fun game WHEN YOU CAN PLAY IT. And this server thing needs to be fixed because im OFFICIALLY done and scared to go onto a new server and start all over again. No. It's just not worth it. Considdering the dedication i put into building etc this takes hours. And a lot of effort on our end to gather resources which are sometimes hard to find. I hope by the time its finally out of beta its worth to check out and worth the actual 20 it asks of you. Also on graphical note.It tends to be kinda laggy and the game doesnt even run on full graphic settings on my end.The fps is just low and this sometimes can be hell if you're hunting because it makes you an easier victim/target.But i will leave it at this. Normally graphical errors me off but the amounts of other stuff wrong with this game completely overpowers this one downside.Not recommended.

review: The summer wind blew as I worked to gather my resources. But the silence was broken by the footsteps of an unforseen predator. As I turned to face it I could feel its malicous aura crawling under my skin. I turned to him greeted by his stiff face and dead eyes. We stood for a moment as he looked into my soul seeing into my dreams and the life that we could share together. Suddenly the air was broken by his merciless accented words "gimme ur trousers m8". I ended up being imprisoned and forced to work for him for an eternity. Those cold hearted words are still ingrained into my mind forever repeating even to this very moment. 13/10 would be enslaved again and demanded for my trousers. (Based on a true story)

review: This is a game i do enjoy but for the life of me cannot figure out why i can get wolf meat from a bear...and a deer ....and a boar and even the occaisonal chicken i come across getting wolf meat from a wolf makes sence...to me! Anyway you start with a rock you grind away on trees and rocks to get ur resource you must build your house strong and quick or you will find other players killing you and looting all those resources you so tediously gathered over time and you will find some real pices of s#*t too! just to give an example after a hard time getting started i was lucky enough to have an airdrop right in front of me i go to collect and whilst retreving the goodies from the drop create im suddenly attacked from behind with my screen flashing red with every blow he delivered with his rock i turn to look as backing away and he delivers the fatal blow which leaves me wonded on the ground as i lay there he then kneels over me and and finishes me by crushing my head with his rock which took several blows! this upset me so i then took the liberty of verbly abusing him saying such things as ur mummas so fat everytime she turns around it s her birthday! this did not work. but i eventualy got him back by blowind down his front door with some c4 i found then blowing his f# ck#n brains out with my shotgun!(whom i named canoemaker!) i then waited over his sleeping bag for him to respawn then blew his brains out again then i destroyed his sleeping bag so he d respawn elsewhere THEN i took my time looting his stuff! then the verbal abuse started from him. i had tears from laughing so hard. and i guess this is what makes this game so fun (sometimes) so you ll have to expect that it will go both ways! I ll give this game 7.5/10

review: Ok so played for almost 2 hours. The game is a beautiful virtual world but there is little to do. I jumped on an empty server for about 10 mins and looked around then went to an official server where I was gunned down by a group of three players in full swat gear with machine guns while I was naked and had a rock. I didn't overly care about dieing as I can just respawn but then I played for over and hour collecting sulpher and rocks and wood only to get killed by another person who I saw in chat. I laughed if off and he said "Sorry but I wanted your stuff". Hmmmm. In chat I listened to a few people say they were bored and looking for what to do in this game. I went exploring and found stuff but no way to keep it without dieing or logging off. I guess there is crafing (A way to build a shanty home) but if the world is beautiful the housing is hideous! The homes are shantys of corragated sheets of rusted metal and bland stone walls that surround you but aren't suited to intereact with. There were no benches chairs tables etc. Just rusted out metal and stone shanty walls in a square pattern on everyones home. The doors had space age digial locks on them to boot. Then I found way to a place where two reactors were crumbled and burned out and ahhhhhh I put it together that this is a fallout world. A world after things go to pot and are being rebuilt. The game is fun if you have friends or find a public server where you don't mind getting killed and have some fun tossing rocks at fully armed men but other than that there isn't much to do yet. The only truly negative thing I can say is that I am a black man in game when I am very much the opposite out of. I wish there was a way to fix this. Over all I like the game and keeping in mind it's early access I have to give it a thumbs up for it has HUGE promise. Just watch the timeline to make sure the dev's don't leave it like it is for too long or abandon the project. Would be nice to know a major fix and update is on the horizon that makes the game look more pro and less indy.

review: Allrighty! Guess it's my time aswell to give you guys a little Review here i apologize in advance for my english but i guess in the end you all understand what i'm trying to say here pRemember that Rust is still in it's alpha as the dev's say "things will change"In my opinion the Official Servers are nothing for new players because you simply dont get the chance to enjoy the game in every single way. These servers are allways at full cap (up to 300 players) and you wont survive any longer than 5 minutes. I started on one of those but cant recommend them yet. So the alternative is either a Community Server or a Modded Server. A Community Server is a retail version of Rust simply hosted by other players just like you. Admins on those servers can change specific parts wich "converts" them to Modded Servers.I won't tell you much about the ingame environment i would like you to explore it yourself.But here are some Basics You spawn alone random and totally disoriented on the Night/Day cycle'd map with nothing but a Rock a Torch and 2 Bandages. How are you going to survive? You need to Eat! How to get Food? you Hunt! You need a place to live? Build it! ( There are different Hot Spots to gather items hunt down the environment and the best thing Group up or be a lonewolf and hunt down your fellow players!While beeing in Alpha this game allready offers stable servers lag free gameplay and a nice early access experience!

review: It is a fantastic survival game that invests you into the world with such a great atmosphere and great gameplay. The game has a large learning curve but once you master getting food supplies shelter and other basic skills all of which are fun to do you'll be opened up to new oppertunities that the game offers and this makes the game so cool. As you build you will see your progression as you upgrade your tech weapons and shelter and is very satisfying to see it playout. review: This game is like a rose. Very pretty but has lots of annoying thorns. Allow me to explain.The beautiful rose Nice graphicsThe sounds are niceLots of open servers for you to choose fromLots of crafting which allows for creativityThe survival aspect. The struggle of man(or woman) vs nature.The thorns The beginning can be quite rough and slow going (but that can't be helped. It needs to be that wayThe community can be terribleBearsNew players are at an extreme disadvantage especially on more populated servers.Need a better tutorial or a tutorial in general (dunno if there is one. I may have skipped it.)...BEARSClans can easily take over and rule a server. IF you don't know that a clan is dominant over a server and you enter. Well...GG get rekt I guess.Alright. Let me tell you how this game plays out.You wake up. Naked. Nothing but a rock and a torch to your name. You don't know where you are. All you know is that you must survive. So with your rock you begin bashing at a tree and collecting wood when suddenly...BANG! Someone has shot you for no reason. You have died. Respawn. You start again still eager to get into the game. You bash a tree bash a rock and make a stone hatchet. With that hatchet you can get wood faster and faster. Soon you have enough for a building plan and begin working on your base. SInce you are new you don't want to build too big so you build a small base. 2x2 or 2x1. Yay now you have a place to live. By now you're starving so you go hunting. What's that over there? A pig! Mmmm...bacon...you run to the pig waving your rock or hatchet violently. You want that bacon. You need it. However the pig runs which is to be expected. The pig approaches a rock and you think you have it cornered when it just...shoots up over the rock. Gone. So you settle for some nearby corn or mushrooms. Now night approaches it's getting darker by the second. You hear the howl of a wolf and the screech of a...something. "Time to go back inside." you say to yourself. You make your way back to your base and enter your place of living. Now the game tells you that you're cold...so you make a campfire and set it in your house. The fire brings light and warmth. But wait. What's this? You hear rustling? What could it be? A bear a wolf? WRONG. Your fire has attracted another player. They shoot through your base and kill you. Respawn. *sigh* Now let's say that you finally have gotten a pretty good base. You've found some items and have everthing fortified. Cool beans! Now you log off to go do something else. You come back the next day and you're dead. Someone raided you when you were offline. Wash rinse and repeat. That's the game.Regardless of that I still love it. You can find a server with only five people on it and stay there. That way you don't have to worry about asshats taking your stuff. I hope this was helpful to someone or at least a bit informative or funny. P
title: Rust

TRIED because it's pretty much unplayable on my end. I've got 8GB of RAM which gradually jumps from 2.1GB to 7.8GB as the game connects to a server and will inevitably crash after about a half hour of playing sometimes more somtimes less.I google'd around for a while trying to find a fix and it turns out some people have been having this issue for months. People suggest upgrading your RAM but as this issue looks like a memory leak of some sort it'd only stretch out your play time a little bit more before crashing.It's a shame because I think I'd enjoy the new game if I could play it proplerly. Be careful buying this game! review: So I've been playing Rust since its Legacy days and I've seen all the negative hype and bad press after so many changes. I just need to write this review because of the game in its current and up coming status. Previously Rust Legacy was a lot of fun. It had lag problems and some programming issues and other bugs that were bothersome... but overall the game was a lot of fun. I had a blast playing it. Then the devs started making changes. At one point the game became basically unplayable. That sucked and I was forced to take a long break from the game. I was disappointed in the devs and I took Rust off my Favorites list.Now with the more recent developer communication and with the more recent changes to the game Rust is back on my Favorites! I'm very very impressed with the devs now. I'm happy with the direction the game is going and I'm extremely excited about the future. It's been fun being a part of the development process and seeing all of the changes as well because I am interested in becoming a game developer and watching the process of development for this game has been intriguing. I expected to play a fun game when I bought Rust in early development and I did. I didn't expect the roller coaster ride but it's all working out OK. Lastly let me make a comparison I'm sure 80% of the people reading this review will understand. World of Warcraft is one of the most well known MMORPGs of all time. In some ways it paved the way for the current MMO hype. It brought a lot of gamers together and it brought a lot of people who weren't gamers into the gaming community. That being said WoW has at times a lot of gamers off. The devs at Blizzard made a lot of decisions that cost them players and gained them back. With WoW and with D3 Blizz has taken their fans on a roller coaster ride just like the devs for Rust. If you're a gamer and you're at buying Rust as an early access game and you're dealing with the disappointment and you're concerned about the game's future... be patient. Good things come to those who wait.Facepunch isn't the biggest wealthiest best staffed world wide phenomenon that Blizzard is... and yet Blizzard took their gamers on some serious roller coasters just the same. As a Gamer you learn to deal with disappointment. There will never be a game that meets every single one of your criteria unless you make it yourself.

review: Hey friendly Steam player! Do you like working for hours and hours and hours and hours scraping together stone lumber ore hemp and apparently the only organic food on the planet known as mushrooms (they SAY there are pumpkins and corn but good luck finding them)?? Well wait there's even more for you to enjoy! Starvation running aimlessly across barren terrain being chased by NPC's in blue suits dogs bears and the occasional guy who is somehow fully armored carrying a shotgun crossbow and long knife before you even have a chance to figure out wooden spears!! It's so much fun when two people gang up on you and then laugh as they steal your hard earned items you just worked HOURS and HOURS for! Then they call you a NOOB and laugh!! What joy!!!! Toxicity abounds without end no worries about ever running out of that! That said as a survival game straight up on a server that doesn't have any PVP players waiting to gank you while you are fighting a bear and a guy in a blue suit at the same time (no joke) it could be fun. Be prepared to have to urinate into soda bottles under your desk though because this game bleeds your time like a stuck pig (those are in the game too!) and doesn't really cater to being AFK. That's especially true with PVP'ers around since you will most definately be dead with all your loot gone after you "wake up" the next day to start playing again guaranteed. Just another ARK knock off mixed with some Fortnite but worthless if you don't have anyone to play with (team with) and are just starting out. MANY other games more worth the time and effort if you are looking for something fresh. I am persoanlly heading over to GW2.

review: Performance Only getting 100 FPS at the lowest settings with constant stuttering and lag spikes on an i5 4460 GTX 970 and 8GB of Ram.Absolutely unacceptable. Until the developers learn how to write code without huge memory leaks and performance problems do not spend your money on this game. Myself being someone who's used to getting at least 100 FPS on high/max settings in most games with no lag or stuttering this game is absolutely unplayable. Especially since the entire game becomes a PVP gunfight having constant lag spikes while trying to shoot at a guy gets you killed pretty quick.Avoid this game unless you have a very very good PC. Gameplay The game is pretty fun if you can get past the bad performance that I mention. And it can be pretty addicting too. The game however is very boring when you're playing solo without a group of people since you just get killed by clans with 20 players online in the serverThe game is a survival game as many other will tell you and it's not an easy one at that. It's a hardcore survival game no other way to explain it. It's really fun sometimes and it's really boring and tedious at times. That's what you get.One thing I'm not a fan of in this game is the gunplay. It's basically just 1. Download a norecoil script/cheat 2. on everyone. And the main reason is because all of the guns have insane recoil and it's pretty uncontrollable most of the time too. So unless you're using a norecoil cheat like everybody else you're almost guaranteed to loose every gunfight. If they changed the way gunfights worked then there wouldn't be much left to complain about.Community The community is super toxic. It's more toxic than CS GO League or any other games with a well known toxic community. The community is very unfriendly towards new players in general and most of the people who actually succeed in this game have huge clans with tons of players in a group. There's even clans with like 50 people who just run around and use their numbers to take down everyone on any server they can establish themselves on. There are the odd few people who are actually really friendly in this game and sometimes you find people who don't KOS and it's usually a celebrated moment when that happens.The meta in this game is "More numbers Bigger chance of victory" so there are many many clans with a bunch of toxic kids in them who just go on servers and use their 10 players to gather as many resources as they can and because they have so many people in their team they can just raid grief and destroy any base as they please. And how is a small group of 2 4 people supposed to fight them? The answer is They don't. They run.So the verdict is Do you have a insanely good PC?Do you like hardcore survival games?Do you have a large group of players to play with?Are you fine with using a norecoil cheat to actually gunfight?If you answered yes to all or most of these questions then Rust may be for you.But my opinion is I can't reccomend it right now. When the game gets it's performance problems fixed then it would be a decent buy.Right now though it's by no means a "BUY THIS GAME RIGHT NOW" but it's not a "Buying this game is a waste of money". It's more around the "If you're really interested buy it other than that don't."

review: Rust is an highly addictive game to play with friends your aim is to survive build a fire to keep yourself warm make shelters make towns and epic bases do whatever it takes to survive but i dont recommend the game as much as when you just spawn you either get killed by armed players or animals i really do hope Rust will add the zombies back in again. 'Why did they remove it in the first place anyways'The game itself has became pretty unenjoyable due to the removal of zombies addition of RPGs.Graphics 5/10 ( Graphics are not as realistic and the first person perspective of the sprinting animation is not as good )Realism 4/10 ( Kill a dear &gt &gt &gt Gets Chicken meat )Gameplay 7/10 ( PVP gameplay feels fast and solid )My Opinion to make the game better &lt &gt Add zombies into the game again&lt &gt Remove RPGs( grenades are enough ) ( Or maybe add RPGs and remove grenades)&lt &gt Add a water bar ( For the player to need to drink and eat)&lt &gt Add a third person perspectiveThe game itself will get boring after a while so i suggest the developers to kinda add in a map like survival mode where you have to survive as long as you can from waves and waves of zombies.&lt Remember this game is in Early Access&gt &lt This does not represent the final product!&gt From Allied Gaming Infinity.

review: A mix of Minecraft Dayz fallout. Get resources build structures and defences raid and steal from enemies make allies kill zombies and get loot survive and kill or be killed. A great game and it's only in alpha with little issues. At the moment you get infrequent lag spikes random rubberbanding and server crashing. But it's very infrequent these bugs don't happen that often at all and it doesn't remove anything from your experience. The game is only in alpha which means the game isn't completed the bugs will be fixed over time. If you don't like the idea of having bugs in game you should wait until the game is fully released. However the is a good thing about alpha more cotent will be added over time and therefore there will be more things for you to do in the game and more fun to be had.If you like the sound of this game you should probably pick it up now the game will most likely be more expensive when the game is fully released and also the game is really amazing and fun now so you don't have to wait for the game to come out and you can have great fun right now.

review: In Argentina religion plays a very important part in the traditions customs and culture of the society. Freedom of worship in the country has been guaranteed by the Constitution. The Constitution has not enforced an official faith for the country but it gives Catholicism a different status. The government also mostly funds the Roman Catholic Church and besides the religious freedom in place there are certain remaining traditions and customs that make it hard for a person who is not Catholic to become president.About 76.5% of the total population in the country are Catholic 11.3% Atheists and Agnostics 9% Evangelical Protestants 1.2% Jehovah s Witness and 0.9% Mormons. 1.2% of the population follow other religious beliefs such as Buddhism Judaism and Islam. Argentines demonstrate de institutionalization and high individualization of religious beliefs 23.8% of the citizens claim that they always attend religious services 49.1% rarely do and 26.8% do not attend.

review: I'm attempting to refund the game now.The community has destroyed an otherwise enjoyable game. I was literally chased around while some jerkoff screamed into the mic that all N*****s must die. Racism and bigotry of every kind is so concentrated in this game that you can't play for ten minutes without it completely ruining the experience. To put it simple the worst of gaming has for whatever reason culminated here. Reminscent of the CoD twelve year olds screaming obscentities into the mic for no other reason than to be annoying except aged and ripened to adulthood transforming children who's parents didn't pay enough attention to them into fully grown adults. Adults who have grown so used to throwing around homophobia and racism as if it were a badge of pride that they've actually grown to believe the t nonsense they screeched into the mic as kids. Gameplay was great though. If you're able to put up with the stupidity then you will probably enjoy the game. You could always play on your own server but the work invovled in doing that is a little much for a game that feels just a little hollow when played singleplayer. I would recommend this game if you can put together a private server of friends at least five or six of them otherwise I wouldn't ever touch this thing.

review: 3/5/14enormously addictive and annoyingly fun. Even in early alpha this is a game you need to have.4/6/16TL DR Rust is great filled with fussy 12 y/o's. Create a clan. Make friends. Improve yourself as a player constantly and you'll win. Leave the server once you have and find something where you're no longer just a big fish in a small pond.It's now been two years and change that I've been playing Rust. From it's original launch to now I've played and watched it evolve. The base building meta of legacy was abandoned for the superior system that Experimental now houses Raiding has shifted and evolved making larger groups all the more potent. Gathering has changed to be much more about roaming instead of a daily farm in the same area. Gunplay and hit detection has evolved for the better and armor mechanics now actually mean something.To this day I stand by my original review This game is crystal meth. It will be hard to put down hard to go to sleep and hard to stop thinking about the game. The community experience rivals that of Minecraft Younger folks playing badly and screaming that you're hacking in chat.If you pick the game up keep up to date with Rustified. Watch the dev servers. Read the devlogs and always try to learn more about what you're doing. If there's downtime on your server improve your aim on one of the Battle Royale or Battlefield servers that exist. If you've got the ability test base designs on a private server. Play around in Fortify troll about for base designs and improve on them. Pull people from different servers that impress you and take them with you to the next Don't stop growing your friends list and the people that you play with.You will see a lot of negative reviews about larger clans destroying all of their hard work Avoid being one of those people. Join or form a larger clan and encourage your people to continue bettering themselves. Compete on a higher level and don't just fall over at the first clan that prods your base. Rebuild when you get raided don't just ragequit and this game can easily become a part of your daily routine regardless of what kind of a schedule your life revolves around.At the end of the day Rust is a survival experience a social experiment and a potential way to better or sour yourself as a person. It is filled with frustration and anger and anxiety but it the moments of joy and satisfaction that exist are absolutely worthwhile regardless of whether or not the dev team will ever put out ing cars and electricity.

review: &lt &lt This review was based on gameplay on a PvP server your PvE experience may be more enjoyable&gt &gt Rust. Interesting concept with some well implemented ideas but stay away until the game is more complete and the hackers have been brought under control.I only have 8 hours played and have uninstalled the game until a much later date. The current build has "Broken" animals that spawn into the world dead. You can't build a structure to protect yourself from the other inhabitants unless you are lucky enough to find a blueprint for walls. This game is NOT for a solo player so if you hoped to log in and struggle to build a structure someplace forget it unless you are extremely lucky and an Airdop lands on your head at night when noone can see it otherwise you are in for an impossible fight with hordes of naked men with rocks and spears to get the blueprints to build a structure.The short and sweet of it is that Rust in its current state is like Darks Souls without the fun and twice the frustration. If running around in a game world naked and chasing other naked people with a rock sounds fun then jump on the flopping Dong bandwagon (they don't flop no physics for that yet...) but for now I don't recommend Rust.Steam needs to implement a NO rating option instead of forcing a yes/no option for a review as I don't think its fair to developers that the community can up or down vote an Early Access or Pre release game. Be smart and READ reviews before you buy a game

review: (Edit Yes I wasted 50 hours on this God awful game.)Rust brings out the worst in people. People tend to gank you completely unprovoked. People from my own clan who I thought were on my side regarded me with paranoia and killed me when I was and other members were completely peaceful. They had no sympathy and they delighted in griefing.This created a split in the rust players within our community. Two groups formed and the members of each avoided each other (i.e. they used different teamspeak channels). Where I got along well with some members I don't think things will be the same again.It will take you half an hour (if you are fast and lucky enough not to get ganked in that time) just to gather the resources for and craft a basic weapon (a pistol) so that you can have a fighting chance against other players (if they don't get you before you do so).While it takes a long time to progress (i.e. stockpile weapons armour and build a fortifications) you can lose pretty much everything in an instant. You are constantly at risk of being suddenly slain by a random player. Often while you are minding your business and being completely peaceful or even if you are being friendly.When you are killed all your inventory is dropped including your resources and equipment. If you don't have backup gear stashed somewhere then you are back to square one hours days and weeks of progress gone just like that.And after death if you didn't place a sleeping bag you will spawn randomly on the huge map where everything looks the same. It takes a long time to learn your way around and you have to travel everywhere slowly by foot.When you log off you are not safe. You avatar remain on the server fallen into unconsciousness. You will just be lying there. The average rust player will not hesitate to kill you in your sleep and take your stuff.Even if you build a secure house it will never be safe. It's just a matter of when it will be raided. Every single item you and your group owned will be gone if any of your stuff isn't valuable raiders will probably turf it onto the group so that it despawns just to grief you.I decided that building a big house to secure your stuff was like making a big sign that said 'RAID ME'. So on a few occasions I tried to stash my stuff where they were well hidden. Unfortuntely certain containers (including pretty much all the ones I used in this case) will despawn after a relatively short time (i.e. overnight) and take all your hard earned stuff with them.Most of the land is covered by grass. It makes it harder to see dropped loot bags unconcious (disconnected players) and more importantly your hidden stashes. Unfortunately most players have no qualms about turning off the grass which you can do easily from the console.Likewise you can potentially turn up your brightness so that you can see at night time when it is supposed to be pitch black. It's dissapointing that a lot of players will do these sorts of things to ruin intended game mechanics and give themselves an unfair advantage.So yeah you can't win.Additional Rust is an ugly game and after four months nothing seems to have changed.I didn't mention this previously but the guns didn't even shoot where you aimed them. I'm pretty sure they are just Half Life 2 weapons with alternate skins. I cannot understand for the life of me why people raved about the gunplay.A game that I would recommend as a superior alternative is 7 Days To Die. It is also in development but it is much much further ahead than Rust.It has a much richer world than Rust i.e. it doesn't just feature a huge homogenous ugly brown landscape and your building options are a lot more than ugly wooden shack big ugly wooden shack and huge ugly wooden shack.It has lot more interesting locations. There are currently at least 5 or so terrain/biome types. There is a lot more variety in the buildings located around the map.There is twice as many weapon available. This includes a chainsaw!New features and content are added to 7dtd on at least a monthly basis. The terrain has been smoothed so that it no longer looks like minecraft. Motion capture animations for the Zombies will be implemented in like the next patch. It now has in game voice communication.New methods of building have been implemented so that you can easily arrange and upgrade your structures. The game now allows you to use grief protection for your structures secure storage and lockable doors.You can basically do anything in 7d2d that you can do in Rust better and more. The main issue that I have experienced with 7d2d isn't the game itself. It was the lack of dedicated local Australian servers for long ping gameplay running an up to date build.If you experience the same problem in your region fortunately there is a single player mode which still allows your friends or other people to join you. Hopefully a permanent server is estabilished in Australia. I'll do it myself if I have to!

So right now Rust is a pretty sh**ty game fun at time but if you really want to succeed it going to take a lot more effort than before.
