review: Another reviewer hit the nail on the head when they summed up this game as "Call of Duty naked"...but Call of Duty actually has depth that this game doesn't even touch.For a 2 year old game that was such a big seller and is presently still high ranking on the Steam Stats I really surprised at how absolutely devoid of substance this game is. It is fairly straightforward what you're supposed to do once you figure out the controls progress through the linear "tech tree" building better bases and acquiring better weapons until you're the one killing random players instead of being the random player killed.Ah yes be prepared for much epic flailing of the default "rock" multitool you spawn with as another naked character (with blurred out genetalia... teehee?) flails a slightly more deadly weapon at you!If you go unnoticed long enough you'll then gather materials from rocks and trees (but ONLY the special boulders that spawn and trees that grow forget about that driftwood or stone outcroppings)... and we've seen this game how many times now?As for the other players that you'll meet... in my limited experience the Stanford Prison Experiment was called to mind if everyone were a guard. The players generally revel in their inability to play cooperatively and how unwelcoming the game is.The result is a predictable landscape that resembles a sad dystopia of a game sandbox populated by naked avatars looking to murder each other while long time players at the top of the tech tree (really it's a stick) pick everyone else off with their long range weapons from nearly impenetrable forces.Not really a gamer's game.
title: Rust

review: Disappointingly uneventful.The game itself is beautiful and expansive but the players within it are toxic racist selfish and so devoid of maturity that their behaviour belies the age rating that has been attached to the game.Four hours in and not a single step forward has been made. Constantly killed by other players to whom I posed no threat with one in particular shouting down the microphone "NEVER LOOK AT ME AGAIN!"...before shooting me.Had this game focused on team play and pitting official factions against each other I likely would have found this game to be far far more enjoyable. As it stands however I along with a great many other players I spoke to in game will be uninstalling it with no intent to change this.A game like this for those of us who are disinclined to listen to children shout the 'N Word' down the microphone before laughing maniacally would be well served by a non violent or team based version of this game.
title: Rust

review: REVIEW UPDATE 28 Febuary 2017 After adding a 30 hours to the game the latest 5 days after not playing rust for about 1 year i still dislike the game. There has been a lot of additions to the game but i still miss the old way of raiding peoples houses. Back then we took down the buildings we raided and the buildings which just stood empty. Today we have a giant map which is full of empty houses where people have been raided and they just are in the way or just sad to see.I am both happy and unhappy with that the developers ditched the recipe technique. As they added the recycling part and insane rates of loot have given the game a new concept. 5 min and armed to the teeth. Armours Guns Ammo and more are no longer rare or hard to retrieve. It's super easy.Rust has improved the last year BUT IT IS STILL NOT GOOD in my opinion.INITIAL REVIEW PART This is more of an review. It's a message to you to everyone! Dont hesitate to read this if you feel like buying this game!I just can't accept this anymore having the so called FacePunch Studios Ripping people off with this so called game. When i got to hear about "Rust" i was excited since "Garry's mod" had been such a success. The game sounded intresting with it's 2013 charm. "Survive hunt animals players and zombies for loot. Airdrops and more!" It sounded great at first but hey. By now It's all t!"Rust" was released on 2013 on the 11 december on steam as an Early Access Game... And STILL is an early alpha game. It was good looking It had great gameplay &amp performance it had a fair amount of elements &amp items and it was quite good for an early access game (Most early access games has tons of buggs and lack lots of playable elements).The buggs that existed was quickly fixed by Facepunch in the first days. You could play on almost any server without any problems well except Cheaters Abusive Admins and Locked servers. The gameplay was simple Start by cutting trees and stones Advance in tools and weapons Attack zombies &amp fellow survivers to gain loot Build a fortress unlike none other). It was good Really! And it had zombies! (The zombies were later transformed into Zombie animals like Zombie wolfs and Zombie bears)But this is where Facepunch executed their evil plan instead of keep working on the game they had made they decided to create a new fresh game version of rust. So they scraped the entire game and the only real update Rust got was an "Lockpick" with the desciption "Coming soon" (It didn't work and it never have). So they started reworking rust again and made it look better. New models (Looking like the original) New Weapons (Same as Rust) New concept(Same concept) and a newer world system (A random generating map).In late 2014 this new version was called as "Experiminetal Rust" and was released to all people who had purchased the game. The Rust game as we knew it was named "Rust Legacy". In january Facepunch seems to have awoken and started to update rust again. In the earlier January "Experimental Rust" was renamed to "Rust" and the legacy version was renamed to "Old Version". The new rust was also cool but it lacked all the elements that the legacy version had. No Zombies No Radtowns and no need to find the recipes to create guns (You had them already).Since Rust Legacy and New Rust are so different from eachother i will list what made each game good and bad.Rust Legacy GOOD SIDE It worked Perfect from start. It had a big map lots of cool elements as weapons with attachments crafting and building. It had good gameplay not to buggy. BAD SIDE It was ignored to much by the developers FacePunch Studios . When you wanted to raid another house the only way in was by blasting the door or walls with c4. Certain loot was only obtainable by Airdrops. The devs added a few things that just ruined some elements (Changing zombies to animals and adding items which couldnt be used.New Rust GOOD SIDE Raiding was now fun since wall now instead of being inpenetrable they had hitpoints with regen. More ways to build your house and more safety features to building the houses (Permissions). Fancier look (Doesn't improve the game) BAD SIDE The Raiding was removed in the latest updates. (They increased the hitpoint regen so much that they dont even budge anymore. not even for 4000 bullets which could in the earlier version remove 5 or 6 doors for an example. Earlier you had to make your building fresh by hitting with a hammer. Recipes that were added such as example clothes can be worn as the item the recipe is. You can wear a template of a shirt as a shirt. When new items are added to the games. Guess where they come from? Rust Legacy!So to summarize this review. Dont purchase this game. What you'll get in the upcoming year have been created in a previous game version. The game is constantly changing making it either playable or unplayable. Latest updates? Unplayable. And my opinion on Facepunch Studios "You guys really need to start focusing on the game you are releaseing and stick to the plan. As i am educateing myself in programming I can see that you are not sticking to the plan. You are constantly changing it. If you sold a product Stick with it. Dont change it! And sorry for these words but Get your ing together and work on the product you have sold and profited on You are Literaly SCAMMING PEOPLE!"This is my review and my thoughts on this game. Dont buy this game!PEACE! And no I dont recommend this game!// UPDATE 1 MARCHSO the developers dislikes that people raid other people houses so much that the remove 50% of all raiding posibilitys. This is bad since they keep adding items to make houses impenetrable. At first we had the normal wood wall and stone wall. Stonewall was basically impenetrable but we could get thru it after endless time and effort. Wood on the other hand wasnt completely fool proof and was easy to get thru.Recently they added twig walls. First and lowest point of defence when building houses but it was a starter for it. breaking it down would take about 5 seconds with a proper hatchet. Then they added metal walls. Which can take up to (Their chart) 11 hours with a stone hatchet and it doesnt even move when struck by other items either. And now when almost every house is impenetrable they remove the ablitiy to demolish houses. I STILL DONT RECOMMEND THIS GAME!Developers! Get a hold of yourself! Stop changing things that aren't broken! Stupids!
title: Rust

review: The most loveable hive of scum and villainy on this side of Steam.Experience what it's like to be born into a post apocalyptic nudist colony where everyone's best friend is a rock in RUST. This action/survival game is perfect to see humanity degenerated into various packs of incredibly adept shackmakers and riflemen where the #1 source of entertainment comes from religious cults dedicated to Miley Cyrus The Oompa Loompas and their character's genitals.The game prides itself on social interactions. As you climb up the Bear Grylls social tree you'll get to meet a diverse array of people that look exactly like each other before they kill you and/or become your 2nd best friend! Craft equipment and raid others to become top dog or finally fulfill that dream of becoming the hippie in the mountains playing tunes on your invisible acoustic guitar to passerbys.By finding schematics along towns and in the wilderness you'll be able to magically craft high quality grenades and remotely triggered explosives from RAW materials. Get your hands dirty and receive the full package by making a Kevlar suit disguised as a really ugly set of punk rocker clothes from decades yonder past and become an expert at creating Heckler and Koch weaponry in a snap!Getting a little bored of chasing people around rocks with rocks? Well then have no fear! Crafting and killing/getting killed is merely the SURFACE of what you can find in this title. Dig a little bit deeper and discover how YOU can make a difference as an individual. Become a greedy tax collector a bounty hunter/hitman or even a plantation owner who works off of nude slave labor. Explore your twisted dream as you see fit. But seriously go buy it. You'll love it.

review: 很少写评测 第一次 因为从游戏中享受的乐趣 我 不得不写第一次玩觉得很有意思 可以 自己建造 自己造枪 我最喜欢造枪部分 比较像古墓丽影掘起 9部里面的造枪部分 可以 给枪安装不同的配件 消音器 瞄准镜 其他的什么 我第一次进了一个 标准的服务器 就是所谓的的国服 是私人开的服务器 官方好像没有在中国的服务器 去外服ping200以上 要挂VPN 我不喜欢团队的和谐气氛 一个人玩 进去捡垃圾 砍木头 挖矿 建了个小房子 在这中间无数次的被人杀死 东西被人抢走 还有被狗熊咬死 被狼咬死 不记期数 然后 重新捡垃圾 砍木头 挖矿 没有等我把枪的配件弄齐 服务器说要 清档 然后所有的东西都没有了 重新开始 第二次我去贴吧看了些攻略 网上说可以把房子建在山洞里面 安全一点也接着我就在山洞里面建了一个房子 里面没有光 我的内心是崩溃的 黑漆嘛唔的 自己造个营火 然后接着开始 捡垃圾 砍树 挖矿 练矿 这次我很怕被人杀死 抢东西 看见人我都是跑开 这次终于我造处了一把小手枪 然后去打个猪 烤着吃 接着就是造步枪 因为材料都是自己造 所以我还得 接着 挖矿 砍树 捡垃圾 接着 我就造出步枪 AK 大狙 我的房子在底下 不能偷偷的打人 哎 造的东西没有用到 也是玩了三四天 就清档了 在这三四天里面我这记得 挖矿 砍树 捡垃圾 相比造枪的快乐 我觉得 挖矿 砍树 捡垃圾 给我的痛苦要大的多 当然 还有 住在一个黑漆漆的山洞里面怕出去被人杀了的恐惧 还有第三次吗 当然还有 如果我特别喜欢挖矿 砍树 捡垃圾 在电脑面前的机械重复 yeah 好吧 那我们去看直播 直播间看别人玩 几个人一起去炸家 出去抢劫 我只是不喜欢这部分 独立的 这可能就是我不喜欢团队的原因 不是玻璃心 只是游戏 游戏规则而已 想怎么玩 就怎么玩 很多直播间的主播直播游戏 感觉不到对游戏的热爱 可能是因为游戏本身不值得 老铁没毛病最后想想这个游戏给我的印象 FPS游戏里面最好的建造模块 模拟游戏里面最精彩最刺激的冒险 毕竟你可以被狗熊什么的咬死 动作游戏动作里面做的最好的打枪游戏 好吧 我的CSgo下载好了 古墓丽影也更新了FPS游戏的外挂问题不是一天两天的事情了 哎 我猜这个游戏有更多种不同类型的挂 贴吧四壁 天天有 游戏是有创新的 毕竟有那么多的元素 生存 开放世界 模拟 我暂时找不到游戏的乐趣 没有公主啊 动不动清档 还有传说中的权限

review: I logged in. I spawned with nothing but a rock a bow and a few trusted arrows. My inventory was meager but I did not let this diminish my ambition. As I looked over the horizon I saw a man. He was medium built and naked down to the boot. The only thing identifiable about this man was the look of hatred in his eyes when he turned towards me from over 200 meters away. Although we locked eyes for only a moment we both had a silent understanding. We knew that only one of us could walk away alive. The next thing I know I am sprinting towards this man with all the energy I could muster. The only thing on my mind was spilling this man's blood. As we approached eachother I pulled out my bow and nocked one of my few trusted arrows. I aimed the arrow high above his head and gently lessened the grip of the arrow until it jettisoned from my bow into his skull. In almost the blink of an instant my advisary was on the ground and screaming like a wounded deer. I knew I had to put my prey out of its misery. As I gradually approached the injured man I recognized I had to dissociate this man as another person. I had to rationalize them as an animal in order to sever any doubts in my mind to finish the job. I then raised my rock high above my head and slammed it into his skull. A man no more. What was once a man is now an empty cadavar a desolate shell. As I gleefully looted my prey and took his items I heard a warcry from behind me. As I turn around I see a naked man about 100 meters away from me jumping in sheer jubilee. The last thing I see is his wooden spear flying through the air directly towards my head. I did not move. I stared blankly into my computer monitor wondering what I had become. Credits to the owner*
title: Rust

review: Log in for a session to expand the complex me and the friends I have made here but I realised that I was close to dying from hunger. I only had with me my rock though and I sooooo needed a feed. So i went on the hunt.You should have heard the screams. review: Woke up naked on the beach a black man in the middle of a snowy hellscape. Did what any sensible man would do and proceeded to beat a tree with a rock and chase a deer made of chicken with a torch. I spent the rest of my morning expertely weaving clothing out of hemp while walking along the coast. Come early afternoon I found some guy taking a nap. He was tasty and came with a free machine gun. Here we are 2 days later. I write this as I lounge in my super fortress crafting C4 and taking pot shots at the naked people popping into existance on the beach.As the owner of 2 servers and the admin of 3 others who has spent nearly 900 hours ingame (as of the posting of this review) I highly recommend Rust to my fellow players. Below I've listed the best features of the game as well as things which need to be worked on and improved by the devs.Best things about Rust Extremely active devs who release updates every week and interact with their fan base. The game gets better every week as the devs release new content. Well balanced brutal fight for survival against your fellow players. Bears are s. 2 great events in vanilla the air drop and the heli which encourage both cooperation and pvp. Amazing modding community with thousands of amazing servers for those who want a little extra out of their game. Beautiful landscapes. Well designed building system. Improvements need to be made but in it's current state players can still spend hours designing new and improved bases. Dat BoltieThings which need to be improved Animals can walk through monument walls. Animals can run up sheer cliffs at amazing speeds. Lots of glitches which need to be patched. This is to be expected in Alpha games and everything game breaking has fixes but we shouldn't need to be spending time fixing right after buying the game. Performance enhancements which don't completely nerf graphics would be nice. Devs should consider hiring a couple more people to help accelerate development. Just a personal opinion. Quarries are currently useless. Their output needs to be at least 5 10x current to be worth the fuel used. Body assignment is cool but it would be nice if bodies randomly changed every couple of weeks of something. Switch things up a bit. Bicycles boats hint hint. Can we please get more options for building. Current system is great but could be improved. Prone position would be cool.I'm going to stop because there are tons of things the devs could add which would be nice but would not majorly impact the quality of the game. So far the game is amazing and I know we'll see lots of great things from the devs in the future. As of this time I would rate rust 9.5/10.
title: Rust

review: Okay so even after 180 hours in this game I still don't know everything about it. I literally just learned that because of the poor AI (this is the Unity's fault) you can set up a foundation and if you stand on it bears or whatever animals can't get to you. Now the concept of the game is rather simple you spawn with nothing but a rock and a torch and really there is no concrete goal except to survive. You can choose to play through different playstyles if you want to go gather all your materials yourself and build yourself a little house you can do that. If you want to craft a bow or spear and start killing people for their supplies you can do that as well. It's up to you what you do who you become allies with and if you play solo or as a team with friends.I have to say that in my short time playing this game over the last 3 months I've met many rather interesting people in this game. I've definitely made lots of friends the people you find I believe is what gives this game life. There's other games like this such as Stranded Deep where it's just a long grind of swimming from island to island building a shelter and surviving. Also DayZ which I've played briefly at a friends house and it seems just like running non stop and both of these games have a sense of isolation and you just kinda hope you run into people. Back to Rust generally you'll find that in a lot of servers people can be found everywhere not only that but people often team up in groups and sometimes full clans are made with monsterous bases that tower over everything else. Allies are made and so are enemies which makes the game so much fun. ****Side Note****This game is alpha still and of course it isn't perfect yet. The game runs poorly on most people's systems due to the fact it's not quite optimised just yet. Optimisation is rumored to start closer to the final release of this game which may be another year or two. It's just not something thats a top priority right now and there's other things to work on too. So just be aware of that if you want to purchase it now. Just as an idea of what I use to run the game I have an i7 4790k GTX 970 and 16gb of RAM and I run at about 80 90 frames on some servers with maxed out settings and other servers I get drops down to as low as 15 20. To add to that large gun fights usually bring things down as well you can be running at a solid 60fps and drop down to 10 if you get in the middle of a gunfight. Another thing a microphone although it isn't required to play it I would highly recommend one. Communication plays a big part in this game it can mean the difference between life and death sometimes. If you can make yourself seem friendly then there's a good chance not everyone will shoot on sight. But if you're quiet nobody can really tell what your intentions are. Of course there is a chat box to type in but if you're being chased you won't want to stop to type.

review: Rust Rust Rust. I have many a word to say about this...thing. So Rust started out with a bang it immediately caught my attention with its great graphics smooth gameplay and extremely large gameworld. I had a great time going around and harvesting building crafting hunting and exploring and for a while it seemed like nothing could possibly go wrong. I of course was sorely mistaken.You see Rust is a beautiful game and I'm sure that by the time it's actually released will be pretty darn fun to play but Rust has a sickness. A sickness that drains it of all fun and enjoyment. That sickness is called "Other players". This sickness plagued the game the entire time I played it. 'What's wrong with other players?' you may ask. To that my answer is this...dickery. In Rust there is no saving no progression system and no sort of protection whatsoever. While some will say that this is the point of the game to be difficult. I would have to promptly frown and shake my head because if that truly is what the game is about then it is what we call a "steaming pile of quot .I do not write this review out of anger because I was killed multiple times upon spawning I do not say this because I spent an hour and a half building crafting harvesting etc. only to be killed by two kids that had absolutely no reason to kill me whatsoever. I write this review because I truly believe that Rust has the potential to be the best survival game I have ever played but it needs a single player feature. It needs a singleplayer feature because without it this game has absolutely no rewarding gameplay. I gather wood stone bone fragments animal fat cloth. I build a house with walls windows a roof and a door that locks. I build a sleeping bag and a chest to store all my stuff in. I create a secret stash that I bury near my house under a rock with copies of my keys in case someone kills me. I do all this for what? Nothing because it was all taken from me in less than five minutes by two kids with crossbows just roaming around killing everyone because they could. I don't care what anyone says this game is in no way whatsoever rewarding.One last thing I'm not saying I hate this game and yes I do realize that there are PvE servers that you can join I get that. All I'm saying is this if you are going to buy/play this game just to enjoy some rewarding survival gameplay in which you can step back 300 hours into it and see everything you've spent your time on then this isn't the game for you because chances are you've been killed just 2 hours into it for no ing reason.TL DR Just don't.
title: Rust

review: Ok from a 5 hour burst play of Rust (alpha so far?) I like it alot!You start out with nothing but your birthday suit a torch and a couple of bandages and you are off on your merry way to chop for wood hunt for animals and kinda mine for rock and ore. So far the crafting system seams easy and simple to use and the only problems I would say exist so far are A shoot on sight mentality Americans seem especially good at this and B none of my friends have this game at the time of typing this and group play is essential for long term survival.After failing around for a couple of hours I eventually found how to get on the right path to survive in the long term got my camping bed crafting table and even a furnace to melt my ores into useable metals ofcourse all that was spoiled by a knock at my door some poor american bloke needed some food I opened the door and he machine gunned me down stole 5 hours worth of progression and destroyed my bed so I could not respawn I logged. If you are going to play this game bring a mate or 2! its good fun and plenty of time can be sunk.

review: People are giving this game so much There are alot of pros to this game and a small amount of cons. First of all people are saying this game is to hard and they complain constantly about their base getting ed by a group of hooligans with c4 and rockets but this is why it's fun. You will have to reasearch on how to make a good base design and how to get started off but after that you are set. The gun play is fun guns feel like guns. There is a countless amount of base designs for you to choose and use. You will need a group for this game but thats not too much to ask surely. There are alot of servers to choose some are bad some are good theres modded and vanilla and both are a solid choice. Raiding and defending is a huge part to this game and is enjoyable even though its a pain in the when it happens to you. Overall I enjoy this game for its frequent updates and its cancerous community but i cant stop playing it 11.8 hours in two weeks. Time has never been used more correctly than that.

If the developers had left the legacy version open I would play this game a lot more it may have been less developed and lack as many features as the "Full" game but at least it worked for the grand majority of people. Nowadays rust is just another reminder of the money I've wasted on my steam library and it sickens me to say that. I love Garry and the games he makes but this is a that's put no effort into making a game that's actually enjoyable. I'm sorry to say but I can't recommend this at least not for anyone like me.

review: If you are looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Cookies recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients1/2 cup butter softened 1/2 cup peanut butter 1 cup packed brown sugar 1/2 cup white sugar 2 eggs 2 tablespoons light corn syrup 2 tablespoons water 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 2 1/2 cups all purpose flour 1 teaspoon baking soda 1/2 teaspoon salt 2 cups chopped semisweet chocolatePreheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).In a large bowl cream together the butter peanut butter brown sugar and white sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time then stir in the corn syrup water and vanilla. Combine the flour baking soda and salt stir into the peanut butter mixture. Fold in chocolate chunks. Drop by 1/4 cupfuls 3 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.Bake for 12 to 14 minutes in the preheated oven or until edges are golden. Allow cookies to cool for 1 minute on the cookie sheet before removing to wire racks to cool completely.And eat it!

review: My first experience was great the people in the server helped me by guiding me and telling me how to start this may very from servers as you do get a lot of bags who just kill you for the purpose of killing you but if you overlook that part its a good game.Solo players can have fun on Rust aswell as groups a lot of people will team up with you just to make their life simpler and to take out other player easier. If you have friends to play with thats even better as you know you can trust them not to shoot you in the back.Building is very simplistic you gather basic materials and go from there hammer is for rotating and upgrading. Finding blueprints can be tiresome as RNG can be a . Combat is stable and once you get used to it you experience combat in a whole different way.Raiding. Being raided is intense especially when theres a lot of people after you but the accomplistment of getting rid of them is very satisfying driving them back to their raid huts and taking their resources from them is fun. Raiding someone else is fun aswell be strategic about how you place your C4 and Shoot your rockets is fun.I recommend this game to any player out there as you can experience the game either way.

review: Honestly I have to say that I am extremly dissapointed in this game and the company itself.First of the game would not even work properly even though I meet all the required system specs and I have tried everything including reinstalling directX and all possible drivers completely even tried it on a fresh installation of windows still no luck then I tried it on my linux machine nada I finally got it to work on a different system all together and oh god was it one horrible experience to sum it up Clunky controls Weird confusing UI Horrible community Have a naked man bash your skull in every 200 steps Have a naked man shout weird stuff over his mic blowing out your eardrums Have a not so naked man shoot you for no good reason 2 different "flavours" of the game as somewhere mid development they decided to switch engines uncreative boring gameplay mechanics mostly "inspired" from other games bland boring brown filtered landscape lack of resources lack of creativity lack of any common senseonward to the company after I have submitted a ticket asking politely for a refund due to the fact that the game is unfunctional on my system and therefor unplayable I was told that they do not do refunds as the game is "early access" and in alpha and that I should patentialy await and hope that someday it will be functional on my system.And this is exactly why I have taken time out of my day to share this with everyone do yourself a favour and don't buy this absolute attrocious game from a company with blatant disregard for their clientel I may have wasted 14 but I will consider it a good investment if I can help at least a few of you come to the right decision to save your money and not support such utter filth.

review: This game is in alpha but still so gooooood. Tons of fun. You can see peoples naked everywhere!This game is kinda like dayz and minecraft in the same game. You have to survive find supplies and killing other players AND you have to build your own house. House is needed as storage and protection against other players.Even if i love so much this game i think he is not perfect. I found 2 bad way in this game. 1st one is server life time if you come when people have already full stuff and explosif (c4) you cannot survive alone they will harass you and kill you many times. Impossible or really hard to build your house in this conditions except in no mans land. 2nd one is the power of group. If you are more than your enemy group you have 80% chance to win the fight. You cannot (maybe you can with hard skill) win fight alone against group because you cannot be sneaky one shoot and all of them will find you (and your shoot will not kill your taget).Otherway this game is really good. Build house is fun (expect you cannot remove fail wall or pillar etc...so you have to take your time). In some servers you could see city players are making awesome building sometimes. Map is big enought and need some experience to be learn completly ).tl dr &gt if you like survival game with craftable house and pvp buy it it's worth !(sry if my english is bad s)

review: THIS DUMB XP SYSTEM KILLED THIS GAME What I liked about rust was the fact that there was something for everyone. You could be that russian neckbeard who would play 10 hours a day with his 20 players guild and have fun. You could be that lone wolf who would just build a 1x1 house then only pvp and have fun. You could be that random casual who would build his house next to a bp spawn and drop a weapon bp after 5 6 hours of sweat tears and blood. You could be that guy who would play for a full weekend with 2 or 3 friends and have of fun. Rust is now world of warcraft with disgusting small flopping around. You need 60 ing hours of grind to get that end game weapon. Where is the fun in that ? Who seriously have the time to ing cut wood 8 hours a day for a week ? Is this game "obese neckbeards only" from now on ? I PLAYED 8 HOURS STRAIGHT YESTERDAY AND I DID NOT DIE FOR 6 ING HOURS. WTH. WHAT HAPPEND TO RUST ? WHERE IS THE FUN ? WHAT IS THIS ARK LIKE ?I spent 800 hours on this game and after this last patch I am ing done. This has to be the worse game designing ever.

review: I bought this game last January (and have 2 290 hours) so I have to say it's a pretty good game but I feel there are some conditions that have to be met prior to buying the game for maximum enjoyment. If you plan on playing alone you're most likely not going to enjoy this game you'll find yourself being trampled on by huge 4+ person clans with no sympathy or being ripped apart while farming for materials. Progression alone is nearly impossible unless you're experienced or lucky. There are a few PvE and roleplay servers but they aren't highly populated and a majority are private. My personal experience has been great but I play with a group of 5 8. Just know that this game takes a few friends and will take time to be successful as it takes more than a few hours to get to end game. In terms of development facepunch is making wonderful progress and is actually listenening to the community's desires (maybe even a little too much ( ing dumb rhinocrunch and his toxic followers)). In short great game but be prepared to get your penetrated if you play alone.

review: great game 8 out of 10. Developers are still doing a lot to improve the game. There's an update almost every week. Facepunch is doing a great job.Tip get some friends to play it with because it's a lot harder if you're playing solo. Also don't buy if you can't handle to lose all your stuff overnight especially in the beginning. This is something you just got to be able to accept in this game though I don't really mind it too much. Raiding and getting raided is part of the game. You can ofcourse play it smart and/or build a strong base to prevent such things from happening. It's just really enjoyable. Do note that this game is quite time consuming you can't just play it for a few hours forget it for a couple of days and expect everything is still there. Especially with the new upkeep system. There are ofcourse the modded servers for those who wish for a faster progression. But most of all don't trust anybody!

review: Brilliant! Best game on steam.. I literally cannot stop playing it and for the price.. Well... Worth every single penny. OPbviously it has it's negatives like all games do however the positives are greater and therefore you are literally guaranteed to have a good experience. I would suggest playing with friends as playing solo can be frustrating to say the least. With weekly updates and improvments this game makes for a great buy. Do it you won't regert it!
title: Rust

review: Product received for free. Rust Reviewso after my experiences with playing rust this is what i've come up with.Pros Fun with friends Lots of content so you won't get bored It's not P2W Raiding is fun Meeting nice randoms that won't KOS Large variety of items Sleeping bag systemCons EXTREMLY TOXIC PEOPLE limit on authorization takes a long time to smelt takes long to get stacked with good loot extremly graphic heavy and not optimal for most pc's long loading times for people with bad hard drives food is very scarce if you don't live next to roads or supermarket/gas station scrap farming takes a while attack helicopters have too much health and you should be able to shoot the driver or gunner isn't beginner friendly fresh water is hard to get when starting doorcampersSummary Even though there are lots of cons i have put on this list rust is a good game overall. you may studder alot (if you have a bad hard drive) but the gameplay makes up for it. Rust has really good art/animation and the character hitboxes aren't t like some other games. If they decide to optimize rust it would bring in alot of new players to the game. Rust is on my top list of games to play with friends and games to play when bored. Just the fact that rust has endless possibilites just makes the games alot longer lasting. The build system is the main thing i love about rust. The variety of items you can use to build just makes the game so much better because of the fact that you arent limited to one way of building a base. When to buy Usually you want to buy rust on sale but if you think that you can't wait i wouldn't say don't buy it when its not on sale but it is alot more worth if its on sale. Final Review Graphics 9/10Optimization 3/10Music/Sounds 5/10Gameplay 7/10

review: Product received for free. Now I'm going to be 100% honest with this sort of review. Are you ready?I've never played a game that made me so angry I could cannibalize my own hands and eat them. Being a new player the new XP system is rather helpful although on the reset I spent 3 4 hours building a house with a random Swede that I met in game. We joked and laughed about how people would have C4 soon and probably come blow up out below average house and steal all our spears.10 minutes later we hear a knock at the door "who is that?" I ask politely to which I hear back " ING OPEN THE DOOR MEN OR WE'LL IN' BLOW YOUR WALLS UP". Me and the Swede laughing to ourselves thinking "Ha.. It's just reset no one has C4". BOOOOOM!The ing wall comes down and in come two s full armoured to the teeth only an hour or two after reset (Offical servers might I add). Killed us and our half naked bodies to get a few spears and some wood/stone. I lay there dying on the floor only to see one of them remove their armour and furiously teabag what I can only presume was my face since I could see some female snatch slamming down on the screen.Lovely.On the upper hand the XP system and exploration is fun. 95% of the community are toxic little turds but you run into the odd gem who just wants to be friends and build together and hopefully not die. It doesn't matter what you have you'll both die. You'll die. It doesn't matter whether it's 60 seconds in 60 minutes or 60 hours in.. You'll die like the es you are.The crafting and building system is beautiful some of the player made structures look amazing and you would think they where generated on the map when you first look at them. This review is going to be positive just because the game is some what fun regardless of how much you die.Here watch my first time playing and judge for yourself First Experiences Playing Rust ProsGreat XP / Leveling system (still a little buggy)In game crafting and building is excellentman made structures look awesome in fact the full game looks beautifulYou can't run away from bearsEveryone starts equalConsDeath is comingNaked people gang up on you with rocksBears run faster that a fighter jet and you cannot escape their fury.95% of the people that play this game are br&gt Confusing crafting menu for new playersDon't lose your rock because getting another is a pain in the (maybe not now with the new system)

review: NOTE This review is for casuals gamers who may play after work for a few hours maybe once or twice a week. Some updates might have occurred since I last played the game so take my comments with a grain of salt.Now to be fair I downloaded/purchased the game without doing any prior research or reading into the community or game mechanics. So my suggestion if you are on the fence do some reading and gauge the community and game for yourself. The community can be ruthless. I couldn't survive long enough to make myself a map before a squad of kids came trolling over the horizon with their assault rifles shooting everything in sight. Now as I previously stated I am a casual gamer. Because of Rust's game dynamics that essentially makes it nearly impossible for players like me to succeed in this game. For example I spent a few hours playing one night and once my friends and I were finally were able to create a seemingly secure house in a remote portion of the map we logged off for the night. Well not a day later we log on and someone had already killed all of us while we were gone and took over our structure. So hours of work were for nothing. Because of the inability to save progress play PvE or ensure all of your progress isn't ruined overnight it really makes this game unenjoyable for someone like myself who may be looking to just goof around with a few friends. I could bore you with an even longer review but instead I'll finish up with my Pros &amp Cons List. I hope this helps someone to make a conscientious decision on whether or not to purchase this game or not. Pros +Gameplay mechanics are pretty simple+Controls and combat mechanics are intuitive+If you have a lot of friends to play with you can have a lot of fun+Graphics are very goodCons Customization. Your character's gender &amp features are auto generated. Community can be frustrating for casual gamers. If you don't login frequently you will likely be raided and lose most if not all progress No PvE capabilities If you aren't playing with a group most of the time you will be treated as prey and will be hunted down by groups of people No "Noob" servers to help newer players get acclimated to the game.In short the game has a ton of potential. But unless are a hardcore gamer and/or plan on spending countless hours each week grinding in the game it might not be for you as it wasn't for me.
title: Rust

And the also include PvE where you can spawn in a server get shot in the face but not die! This game is t toxic as hell unplayable when trying to just start off fresh (EVEN AFTER A SERVER WIPE) and it was a complete waiste of the 17 bucks i got it for when it was on sale. This game should be free to play like how cs go did because it needs to get the out of my inventory immediately as well as my money back ). if you're still reading this damn you've made it this far and i hope i've convinced you how rust actually is and that i won't consider ever touching a genre like rust (ex unturned and ing open world multiplayer tbh). review: The community is horrible. Almost all players met will kill on sight and you get no chance to even get to know the basics of the game while they do so. Trolls and s are everywhere and good hearted people are few and far between and constantly mocked trolled bullied and killed by everyone else. Griefing is basically allowed maybe even encouraged and players can destroy your house if they want. If you exit a server your character stays on the server and "sleeps" meaning that while you are gone players can easily break into your home kill you and take all your hard earned stuff. No one treats it as a survival game they treat it as a first person shooter and WILL kill you without warning or reason. Also with the "decay" game mechanic after not very long your house will fall apart by itself too unless you are constantly maintaining and repairing it which costs a lot to do. I was going to say that it has potential but it really doesn't it's a mess of a game and will probably stay that way. Do not purchase this game it is a waste of time effort money and patience. EDIT Plus I forgot to mention it also does not have singleplayer.
title: Rust

review: Survival is not supposed to be an easy task. But game controls are for sure. This game is a challenge in every aspect Wanna join a server? Wait for forever get bored turn the game off try again.Succeded to join? You get objectives no hints on how to control. Figure out what to do in game and figure out how to control the game. Do this in 1 2 minutes until a lunatic comes and kills you naked. Respawn and you have another couple of minutes to make sense all of this mess.To play Rust you not only need to learn the game dynamics but also how to start a game how to choose which server to join how control the game how to survive the toxic community how to ignore the pointless insults and brutalityI wish I had the chance to play Rust with a community where people want to PLAY with each other as opposed to the current community where trolls want to insult and ABUSE each other.

review: It's not about having a good time it's about making others have just as bad a time as you're having.On a real level Rust can be a frustrating tiresome emotionally draining game. Playing by yourself in large population servers can spell disaster and spawn killing within minutes. I would definitely suggest to new players as much as it can seem "boring" because of a lack of PVP *go play in smaller official and community servers!*Learn the building mechanics learn and get used to building decay and how many rockets it takes to blow through a base with 14 sheet metal doors. Use rustlabs.com to have easy access to a list of how many materials you need for what. Don't try to memorize everything!

review: I tried to have fun in this game for a while with a friend but we kept getting killed by anyone we passed by. The official servers are filled with large clans that dominate all the other players and even the community servers have their far share of 12 year olds running around with ak47s.Dont buy this game its great only if you have a large number of friends who are willing to play this game often. Even then it seems like you have to start building a base when the servers have their monthly or biweekly resets in order to have a chance at being successful. Otherwise huge castles and giant towers dominate every inch of the map making it impossible to build a house for yourself. It took me and my friend about 30 minutes into our two house building projects to get found by squads of people with ak47s who killed us and looted everything.This game is extremely not friendly towards new players so i would advise anyone looking to buy a game to look elsewhere. While you will be trying to harvest small amounts of resources the richest players can often be seen trading some of the rarest materials in the game in chat as if they were nothing.In short either you have already been playing this game for a while and have a clan that spends its time shooting people for fun or you shouldnt bother playing. But if you like running around completely naked with a rock while a guy shoots you for target practice in his skyscraper then this game might just be for you.

review: Leaving a review for both parts of the game.TLDR two games for the price of one hell yeah! (Quit complaining oldies. Sincerely a fellow oldie.)Rust Legacy review Perfect for nostalgia not so perfect for actual playing. The servers are far too unpopulated for my liking but if that's your thing than it could still be a great game. The gunplay and fighting in general is definitely more intense in the Old Rust however since hackers flooded into the game it's hard for people (myself included) to not call hacks at times. This game is honestly amazing IMHO. 10/10 would reccomend Naked Man Rock Smash Bros. to anyone. I could an entire game on this day and still have a great time.New(Current) Rust If you played Legacy Rust back in the day the transfer over to this version can be hard and almost intolerable. Don't give up though. It gets really fun once you adjust to the differences and accept the fact that it's a different game. The graphics are obviously vastly greater than Legacy graphics and the Official servers are actually moderated (HALLELUAH). The gunplay is slightly less intense but it's honestly more realistic. You can't get shot 3 times in real life and just run behind a rock and use a green box to heal yourself back to Superman Mode. No in New Rust every shot matters.If you get sprayed chances are you're dead if not then you're hobbling off with next to no health hoping that they took pity on your poor poor soul. The building on this version is far more customizable and complex which is a double edged sword to the community. Honestly I enjoy it though it brings so many more tactical options into the game. A HUGE and yes I mean huge difference in the game is that food is actually important in this one. "Hold up wait food can be important?" Yes and it is. In old Rust you would find yourself with hundreds of "chicken" breasts and the occasional cat food can. On this version you will find yourself actually having to hunt for animals instead of seeing a crowd of them out in the field. The maps on this version are procedural as opposed to the same map. This can make finding your buddies harder and getting lost easier. But that's awesome. It truly ups the survival aspect by a lot. All in all this game is just as great as old Rust as long as you weren't an old Newman or if you bear through the beginning critiques that you will have. 10/10 would reccomend New Naked Man Rock Smash Bros. to anyone.

review: While I do like some of the core mechanics I am not a fan of the graphics of this game. They aren't bad and I do appreciate it when devs attempt to make things look realistic however this looks both realistic and unappealing. I also really don't like the build system very much. It is pretty limited and too modular based. Ironically I didn't run into that many spawn campers that I see people complain about all the time perhaps that's because I didn't get super salty and cry when I got killed... instead I just said "gg" and moved on so they left me alone.But either way I can't recommend this game for its full price. I'd put it at about a $15 worth.One thing I will say in this game's defense is that I have a mid range PC and it runs fine. I think the issue a lot of people have is not enough RAM people trying to play new games with less than 16GB of ram and stuff. If you are trying to game with less than 16GB of ram then you deserve for games like this to not run properly. By this day and age it is very easy to get up to that amount of RAM and I simply don't understand people trying to play these games with only 4 or 8GB of ram. It doesn't make sense. 16GB has been standard for a few years now. Also you must have a half decent connection of at least 50 MB/sec which is still way below par these days but it will get you through.

review: This game is a huge piece of and a complete waste of time. You can get started or even last longer than a hour until you get raided and killed repeatedly by people who started earlier. Wherever you go you are attacked and raided by the same ing people that have access to guns and explosives. After hours of waiting and collecting resources you reach a point where you craft metal and armored walls but it doesn't do because they just destroy in a couple minutes. The crafting is horrid and not thought out. Half the you build you can't be moved unless you join a modded server or destroy it and most of those servers are filled with s that hunt people down. I played on five different servers and the same happens. You find some resources and build a small room to keep your items. You build wood doors and locks to keep things protected until someone comes along and destroys it and loots you. So you decide to start again and reach metal doors and locks and the same happens. Rinse and repeat people with better gear and more people destroy your *This game is a waste of time and the payoff doesn't amount to When you finally reach a large base and full equipment what now? Nothing you become the s that kill noobs and raid because this game offers nothing else. The people that appreciate the game or love are the ones that constantly raid and hunt because at that point you are unstoppable. So this game and its community.+ I love survival games and rarely complain about games like this but at this point the game turned into a pvp deathmatch with noobs getting caught in the middle of all the trash that game attracts.

review: I was logged on to the server just as it got wiped. Everything reset. A fresh start for everyone. It was my chance to shine without getting cut to bits by high tech level bandits and raiders.As I was working I had heard repeatedly over voice comms about a player who had gotten the first airdrop of the game which contained a military shotgun and M4 rifle. The highest tier weapons available.During one of my runs to the radioactive military zones I happened to run straight past the player who had found the weapons. He fired first and we exchanged shots. Luckily he wasn't carrying his big guns or I would have died instantly. Also lucky while my health dropped dangerously low I didn't bleed so I was able to make it out okay.I watched him for a while as he moved back to his encampment making a mental note of the part of the road he had set up beside for future use.Much later in the game and without a single player vs player shot fired since that point I had managed to deck myself out in full leather armor (One less than top tier) but still had only the basic cobbled together firearms. I really needed a weapon. I used two C4 to break into the guy's house. It was only logical. The weak are preyed upon by the strong and he had fired first all those hours ago. Breaking into houses is the whole point of C4. The wooden wall fell and stole two top tier weapons the M4 and Shotgun. As I ran gunshots pinged at my feet but I kept moving. I continually checked to ensure that I was not followed. Half an hour later my friend was chopping wood out in a field when he started taking fire. He ducked behind a tree but he didn't have any weapons on him aside from a pathetic bow. I yelled at him to stay alive and keep them distracted and I was able to nearly take down one guy before my friend died. I had taken two hits with a bow which nearly killed me but I got onto the other side of the cover the bowman was firing from. I took out my stolen shotgun and was very lucky to kill him in the first shot.I fired another shot at the other guy then pulled out the M4 but got killed before I managed to take him down. Luckily this was right beside my house and I respawned inside grabbed an MP5 from a crate and ran outside again. The surviving attacker was looting a corpse and I took him down. My friend helped me gather up all the loot from our two bodies and the bodies of the attackers and everything from inside the house and move it up into a stash in the mountains.When I logged back on three hours later to check on things I spawned in a field and I knew that while I was offline my character had died. I ran north to check. My house had a hole in the side of it which I was fully expecting. That's why I moved everything out everything. The mountain stash had gotten its door blown off and every last item had disappeared. Just as I was checking the last crate for any scraps I heard footsteps and I was incredibly conscious of the fact that one of our attackers had respawned and watched us take the stuff into the mountain. I had nothing to defend myself with. A man in black armor entered the shelter and blew me away with a shotgun.They started a war over a wooden wall and two weapons they replaced in a heartbeat.It is a war they won by good intelligence but also by attacking a defenceless sleeper.They have made an enemy they will live to regret.The Axe has tasted blood.

review: PROS Good PVP game teaches you about lawlessness. Had our starter crap house raided xD. Also nice graphics.CONS Very stip learning curve no tutorials at all very unforgiving for newbies especially trying to figure things out without a BLOODY "TRAINING OR TUTORIAL GUIDE WTF" BUGS.... BUGS EVERYWHERE LIKE LITERALLY No clip bears Deers running at 0.1 second in a 90 degree angle to a stip rock _ map is kinda small... depending on the server I found most villages to be too crowded could use more optimization for better performance especially loading the terrain. game stutters like hell there should be less resources all you do is go out and loot some... garbage. Literally people have tons of C4 now wtf needs more "ARMA" like combat maneuvers and features.How long has this game been in development? People told me 3 years and it still is in Alpha. Dafuq? Right now I'll give it a 7/10 at best. Devs needs to work better for this game. Has a lot of potential. It's just a free for all right now with no sense of direction. Yes base building role playing and raiding is there but it could have been executed better than just spawning you randomly on a beach surronded by tall fortresses and you get gunned down by auto weapons xD.

review: This game is tedious and unrewarding.It literally promotes clan and very large groups only making it impossible for solo/duo (but even trio) playing.The only palpable goal is to obtain a full leather vest with a wolf head and a bow and you inevitably always end up against people with rifles and bazookas and c4 explosives. There's too much difference and it doesn't matter whatever point you choose to settle and give yourself a minimum time to at least aim to have some fire weapon. We struggled for hours and hours being a duo I can't even imagine doing stuff if you're alone.It's literally unplayable.EXTRA a non largely significant feature I also didn't appreciate one bit is the lack of choice (even at least once per account) for your character's gender. There are a bunch of players who really don't care but there's aswell a large part that doesn't even open the game because of this. And honestly as this title is right now it's only a good thing.

review: No support for ultra widescreen monitors. When the dev adds support for 21 9 resolutions I'll change my review.EDIT I was incorrect. Uncheck the 'windowed' box and 3440x1440 shows up in the list of available resolutions. Cool! Now I can actually give this game a try. I'm sad to see there is no single player mode though. I'm not really into multiplayer only games. I dig the music though!EDIT 2 This game can be very addicting. I chose to play in one of the very few PvE servers (no killing of other players) so that I could spend my time building. And then I learned that while this game is still in Alpha the servers are being wiped every 3 months. So I guess I'll have my fun until the next server wipe and then unfortunately I'm done until the wipes stop happening which will probably be once this game is officially released (could be a few years). It's a great game and I can't give it a negative review just because of the 3 month time wipe. It's in Alpha so that is par for the course.

review: I've played off and on since legacy. Most of us knew the XP system was goign to change the game and would need to be tweaked and now it's being tweaked to combine both XP unlocks and temporary research unlocks to try and please both crowds.My review is half as a player and half as someone who appreciates a good game engine. I also suck at PVP horribly suck so keep that in mind as well.I really like Rust I really like the game engine and how flexible it can be with supported mods. Rust can be anything from a brutal PVP game to a full PVE RPG depending on the settings and mods (thinking of Oxide here) used. The worst thing about Rust is the playerbase so they say but I've found some community servers with a solid bunch of people who make playing this game fun. When you run rust and the server list pops up get away from the official servers as fast as you can click on community or modded and try a few out.For my money this is one of my best early access purchases.

review: This is a PVP game. If you are hoping to roleplay a peaceful life not going to happen.I joined a medieval RP No kill on sight server and helped a friend build up a great community.We grew quite big and as a part of our trust system we forbid locks on all houses that arent shops.Somebody didnt care went into my house and took everything. So I went gathering and after aquiring around 5000 wood and the same amount of stone some clan showed up and took it all from me again. This is frustrating and there is nothing you can do about it because roleplaying as a bandit justifies you to take everything and kill everyone.The community is ing toxic whenever you join a server someone is arguing making racist comments or just insulting people without a reason.You can get raided or killed without a reason at any time by dozens of people that are in a clan undoing everything you did for the last 20 hours. Building up is fun but it always ends the same way. Killed by a bigger clan. A lone wolf or simply a nice person can't survive not even on roleplay server.Creating a single server and playing it as a survival game is also not possible right now.This clan hierachy is anchored deep inside the roots of Rust and can never be removed. I myself do not want to be in a clan at all time robbing begineers and breaking houses while offline ergo this game is not for me.2/10 works well but community and not a game for someone like me who would rather play a good singleplayer game because you can not be killed on sight.

review: This game was fun at first until you played it for 10 minutes. You're going to die a lot of times in this game within 5 minutes. You might think hey! Dying isn't that bad right you noob! Well that's just the core but dig deeper. The npcs in this game are never really a problem unless it's like 2 wolves on you. But it's the player. As soon as they get in range of you they are going to kill you for no reason which is annoying because it's ever single player on every server. The blueprint idea is stupid you need to find blueprints by killing infected wolves and bears which are usually in packs and when you do kill one it's rare you even find blueprints to get high tech weapons. Everyone on this server has like pistols and m4s while you have a rock and stone hatchet if you're lucky if you didn't die within the first 5 minutes. The 2nd problem is griefers. You need a place to keep storage the only place is in your house which can be easily destroyed in 10 minutes with a stone and 30 seconds with c4 and all your progess on the game is gone. They should only be able to destroy your house when you're online that would make more sense. And if you go on vacation your house will be destroyed when you come back so hey be ready to play this game everyday if you want to keep your progress it's awfully flawed. I'd give it a 4/10 just because it has potenital and it's fun at times and if you play with your friends you will have a blast. There should be newbie towns where new players can gather resources without being killed by wannabe squeaker bandits. There's also a lot of hackers that usually never get banned they have aimbots and esp while you have a stone. And one more thing when you place your base down you better haev a good memory where it is because if you forget it only way to get back there is to die and lose all your resources. Heres my solutions Be able to toggle between PVE and PVP modes once you toggle PVP mode you can't untoggle it for 3 hours. You can't destroy houses at all unless the house is inactive. Get rid of blueprints or make them easier to find. Make a map system. Add a buddy system and a teleport system so players can easily find each other instead of walking 30 minutes to find each other which is unlikely since you will die within walking 2 minutes. Create small towns where players can live and which are safezones. Make a better anti hacking system Get rid of night It makes the game unplayable When a player is known as a bandit which is when he kills a lot of players within a small timelimit his name should be visible in a long range so players will know to avoid them like 100 meters his name will pop up in red.

review: I've seen a lot happen in rust. Met many great people now friends thanks to this game but also a lot of bad people too the game is 50/50 with me on people that play it that you meet. It's hard solo but can be fun thanks to so many changes in the game to help solo players. Might be hard to find a server with a community on it of somewhat friendly people that won't kill you on sight but other than that the game is a lot of fun and can be enjoyed for many hours and time sometimes can pass by quickly. Overall I do love rust and I hope it continues to be amazing in its own way I'm so happy to see it out of Early Access and its been one wild ride in this game. This may not seem like a review its more like my expression of how I love and see the game I don't recommend this game for the faint of heart but I DO recommend this game for those that want how to put this an interesting challenge in their life. That's the best way I can put it I hope the many future players of Rust from here on out like the game for what it is and the good side of it I hope they meet the good people and not see the bad side of rust hardly at all if hopefully not at all though it will happen eventually. Good luck to you all and may the rust gods be with you as well as the return of the frog boots.

review: THIS VIDEO GAME HAS NO OFFLINE PLAY. THIS VIDEO GAME HAS NO SINGLE PLAYER MODE. DO NOT PURCHASE THE GAME IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A HIGH END DELUXE GAMING COMPUTER WITH AN INTERNET CONNECTION EXCEEDING ONE HUNDRED MEGABYTES..The amount of time you see logged for this game one hundred seventeen minutes as of writing is not from playing the game. Imagine waiting so long for a game to load that you cannot refund it. "Rust" is that game. I have a one hundred megabyte Internet connection through Ma Bell and it still can't download it.Like "Sim City V" (be thankful if you've never heard of the 2013 AD incarnation of that series) this game has a compulsory Always Online system and requires connections to servers. The problem is that the servers are so large detailed and expansive that they take well over a hour to even retrieve. The Server I chose which was one of many on a list had over five thousand chunks to download. That took well over a hour.Then you have to load the Huge Monuments then the Medium Monuments then the Tiny Monuments then the Caves then the thing has to be "pre fabricated"... it was agonizing.I hate to rate this game down as I haven't even gotten to play it but the always online mandate and lack of both single player and local multiplayer game play make it untouchable. I have no choice but to write this because I am unable to get a refund this close to two hours.

review: Let me start out the review with saying that I love Rust but some circumstances that happened to me recently makes me think that Facepunch just don't care about the players. My Steam account got hacked and when I finally got back onto it it said that I was perma banned on Rust. I figured that I should email Facepunch and tell them what had happened. The email that I got back from them really made me mad. It said and i quote "Account security is your responsibility". I don't know why they think that I have control over when I get hacked or not but all I know is I still can't play this wonderful game.

review: Overall Rating 7.5/10(This game is very addicting it's much like a better looking minecraft. You can build make friends defend your homemade base or village rob people run around naked beat things with rocks. This game is hard to dissapoint where does it fall short at the moment? Customization.) Graphics 8.5/10(The graphics look good the issue is the way they move people stutter as they walk animals do the same. The way your character interacts with the enviroment is a little finnecky but then again this is still in alpha the weapons look nice on the players screen however on other's screens all the weapons look like an m4 this is a nuisiunce since an shotgun is more dangerous up close than an m4 we should be able to tell the difference. The graphics do look amazing though you'll need a good computer to run this baby.) Customization 5/10(You can not customize your character at all. This is a big issue for me I hate to see everyone running around as the same person you can however "Though limited" can add scopes lasers and what not to weapons and you can also customize the building you're creating by placing items where you like them.) Servers 7/10 (This is a big one the servers hold up most of the time however they are always being attacked by people using DDOS for servers that don't have the protection on them and there are thousands of servers many are different but there is no way to search the servers and like I said before if you off a kid that knows how to DDOS prepare for your whole server to be unable to play for an hour.) Replayability 10/10 You can't get bored of playing this game everytime you log in it's something different since people can build where they want and do what they want then it' leaves the world open to endless possibilites.EXAMPLE We decided to let two people into our base to research C4 for 1000 metal fragments. Well they researched it then they stuck the c4 to the side of our base and blew a hole in. One was shot with a shotgun the other accidently ran into spikes. But it was new and interesting.) Sound Quality 7/10(The sounds match what they should be in this game however they are not high end sounds. Atleast when you hit a wall with a an axe in this game it sounds like you're hitting wood rather than bullets being shot at you "DayZ".)My Specs MOBO Asus crosshair V formula ZCPU FX 9590 4.7ghz 8 coreGPU Sapphire Radeon 7970 (3GB &amp 356bit)RAM G.Skill ripjaw 8gb 1300mhzDISPLAY 60 inch LG plasma tv 1080P What the game lacks It needs a party system.it needs more ways to gather food... farming/fishingIt needs more items to help survival not just guns. (Regular flashlight gas mask smoke bombs hospital type equipments)(Review may change based on updates released if you have any questions just post them below!)P.S. Play at your own risk I became addicted..

review: The game is incredibly boring especially at the beginning where you expect me to whack trees with a stone and expect to be having the time of my life. And then once I have sufficiently whacked trees with a stone (top notch entertainment that is) some little terd comes along and murders me with a stick and then cackles like a bloody maniac for 15 minutes (yes high hopes for the next generation indeed). If you do happen to get off the ground get some armor a weapon and a few of your friends (preferably the ones that are jerks their type seems to be addicted to this game) then you're all set for some fun murderous antics right? Well murderous antics or not fun is not part of the equation. You'll walk up with an M4 and shoot some dude walking around with nothing but a medium sized rock and a pair of tattered trousers to their name and kill them. You'll have your little dance of glee (the d bag dance as I call it) and move on. And then some other sods who have more gear than you or simply happen to flank you kill you and do THEIR variant on the dance of glee. Then you cuss...... and cuss...... oh yeah and cuss a little more. And then you lose your s**t once you find out you lost all your hard earned gear. Then you disconnect from the game unplug your computer and throw it haphazardly and hit your puppy. Then what have you got? A shattered PC and a puppy with internal bleeding and a broken rib cage. 20/100

review: I played this game for two and a half hours after buying it on sale for $8 and resorted to issuing for a refund. It's not worth your money whether it's at full price or on sale. I bought the game on a whim due to the sale I hadn't expected and I am genuinely glad I did not buy it like I had planned to when it was at full price.That being said It's impossible to play this game by yourself. Unless you're getting a group of three people or more don't plan on having a good time. I was excited to play this game and I gave it the benefit of the doubt despite my friend's warning but the PVP aspect of it turned out to be exactly how you'd expect. You can't create your own server for free that I'm aware of and trust me I looked after my first hour within the game. It's not that I would want to play solo because that's not fun but I would like to play with people who are cooperative and make the gameplay enjoyable. I don't enjoy playing games where my progress is thrown away because someone thinks it's funny to be toxic and kill you off without reason. Yes survival is the goal but it's BS when literally EVERYTHING is working against you.It's a shame because the game is beautiful and there's a lot to explore. However within the two hours that I played I died multiple times at the hands of other players even when I hadn't been approaching them. When I asked why and if it was even necessary they responded with and I quote "it's Rust and you'll soon learn that everyone is an a**hole." That was all I needed in order to make my final decision regarding the game. Because... seriously what's the point? Not to mention I asked for tips and was met with silence. I'm not asking for friendship or a marriage here.Other than the misery that comes along with the PVP aspect the loading time for the game itself is outrageous. While the main menu spends very little time opening accessing a server is a struggle in itself. I spent 15 20 minutes loading into two different servers both of which had a different number of active players and max players allowed within the server. It IS a loading issue I know this due to the fact that I had no issue once I was within the server and playing the game.For those of you wondering your player starts off completely naked (warning you do not get to choose your character's gender or appearance) yet there are hundreds of other players around who are better equipped than you that have been playing since the game's release. The game and even some reviews warns you about other newbies and their desire to kill you with your (and their) starting weapon a rock but the real threat is advanced players who are ... wait for it ... BORED. If they see that you're new they're quick to shoot you down for no reason. You'll get taunted you'll be offered no help and you'll end up annoyed after spending an hour or so gathering resources that you can't even retrieve after you die.A final note I do not recommend this game unless you have a large group of friends an immense amount of patience and money to throw away. If I wanted to play a game where I get intentionally killed for enjoyment and competition I'd buy PUBG.

review: I understand this is early access but this is just... Wow...I do not understand why the Unity engine was used for this game. The game looks horrible plays horrible and for now is horrible. The game itself isn't so good but the fact that the player fanbase is the way it is just makes this game even worse. There is no teamwork. No cooperation. There is no incentive to NOT kill another player on sight. There are no robbing people and holdups like there are in other games (DayZ). You're very unlikely to meet a random person and team up with them. Bashing with a rock seems to be the most effective way of communication with most players. Many times I've spawned in and immediately been shot dead. The sleeping aspect is neat I'll give this game that. You may have some fun if you have a firearm but that fun won't last long. The guns are a pain to look at they're hideous. You cannot hit anything past a few dozen yards. Clipping through players and animals when trying to fight them is a pain. This game is unfinished to the point that it isn't currently worth playing.Maybe with future updates it will be better but as of now I do not recommend purchasing this game.

review: Game Title 3 Epic Title 2 Creative 1 Fitting .5 Average 0 Okay 1 Attack of the Mutant Camels 2 Ninja Baseball Bat Man Graphics 3 What s the point of reality 2 Beautiful 1 Good .5 Decent 0 Bad 1 Don t look too long at it 2 Paint.exe Gameplay 3 Did someone say meth? 2 Very good 1 Good .5 It plays 0 eh.exe 1 Knock off Mobile GTA Game 2 Wtf Audio 3 John Williams 2 Very good 1 Good 0 Not too bad 1 Bad 2 Wild Wild West by Will Smith Audience Kids Teens Adults Average Solitaire Players PC Requirements 0 Check if you can run paint 1 Potato 1 Decent 1 Fast 1 Titan 0 Ask NASA if they have a spare computer SKILL REQUIRED 1 Press E to Pay Respects 0 Easy .5 Gotta think 1 Easy to learn / Hard to master 2 Difficult 2 Dark Souls Grind 0 Nothing to grind 2 Isnt necessary to progress 1 Only if u care about leaderboards/ranks 1 Average grind level 1 Too much grind 2 You ll need a second life for grinding Story 1 Story? 0 Text or Audio floating around .5 Average depends an DLC 1 Good 2 Lovely 3 It ll replace your lifeGreat Video here https //www.youtube.com/watch?v fx qS h0blE Game Time 1 Long enough for a cup of tea 0 Short 1 Average 2 Long 3 To infinity and beyond Price +50% Free to Play +100% Worth the price +75% If u have some spare money left +0 Not recommended 10% You could also just burn your money Bugs 2 Never heard of 1 Minor bugs 0 Can get annoying 1 Assassin s Creed Unity 2 The game itself is a big terrarium for bugs Comments Multiplayer on hard mode. I hate this game but find myself drawn back to it. This game can be peaceful at times and keyboard snapping infuriating at others. You will lose hours worth of progress to the worst of the player base who will talk in your ear the entire time you desperately attempt to stop them all while blowing up your and or your friends hard work. You ll find yourself blowing up the phones of any teammate you re playing with to come home and defend the base because you re on the verge of losing it.After all that I still have some amazing experiences in Rust. The PVP is phenomenal. It takes true skill to play this game against others at times and then you might get killed by a naked with a rock while you re fully geared. This is one of the rare few games that drama is almost guaranteed in.There is more drama betrayal trolling death destruction and more than your average daytime soap opera. So if you ask me if I can recommend this game to friends the answer is yes. An unapologetic yes. Misery loves company and there s nothing quite like the misery of Rust. There is no better way to play this game with friends! Just be careful making friends because there s nothing like putting trust into someone in this game and getting shot in the back! Total Total 48/50

review: Do you like autism? Do you like losing your brain cells? Is door camping for 2 hours fun for you? If you answered yes to any of those then this is the game for you! Even if you didn't this game is still for you. Standing outside people's bases earraping for 10 minutes is hella fun. Meeting nakeds on the roads and all over the map is what makes this game rust. Pvp in this game is action packed and rewarding as well as entertaining to most who enjoy a PVP open world game that allows for free bullding of any design your little brain dead head can think of. I have 700 hours in this game and I still believe there is a lot of space for improvement. Each wipe you learn something new and learn how to adapt to certain cituations. Plus roleplayers are freaking funny and trolling as a naked yourself is the foundations of this game. Without the nakeds there would be no more rust.
title: Rust
