review: Here's the thing I played Rust about three years ago for quite a while before it got a total overhaul. In its infancy the game seemed pretty promising. In fact I was excited to see where the developers took it. The occasional hacker was bothersome but overall it was pretty enjoyable.Fast forward to now. I have never seen a more toxic depraved immature nor imbacilic community in my entire life. This game is absolutely horrible. I'm not speaking from a carebear noobish point of view either. I don't care about getting killed or mocked or anything else as long as the game gives you at least the smallest sliver of a chance to have fun once in a while. But unless you're playing on a ghost town server you won't stand a chance of surviving long enough to craft more than a club or a spear. I've played plenty of open world games with PvP elements that possessed relatively amenable communities. It's not "normal" for people with assault rifles and body armor to blast naked dudes with nothing but rocks and an empty stomach. That just isn't a thing. But it is in Rust. I don't know if the game simply appeals to the hidden psychopaths among us or if it's just boredom but either way... it's not much fun. The game gives people an awesome opportunity to develop economies factions etc. but instead of recruiting new players every server I joined simply killed them for sport. It's not like you get anything for killing players that don't have diddly squat in their inventory either.At the end of the day I'm sure the game will appeal to some people. If you plan on playing with two or three friends for example Rust might not be too bad. But the game is a strange dimented thing I definitely can't see myself returning to it anytime soon.
title: Rust

review: In my opinion this is the game above all games. Maybe not even a game but an experience.The thing that divides rust from other games is that you have something to lose. Now don't tell me about the battle royale games where you have something to "lose". Here you can lose almost everything you worked days / a fortnight on. Maybe even when you get something out in the open and are trying to get it back home you can still LOSE SOMETHING that you know matters. The developers are just amazing. Constantly listening to feedback from the community. Updates are extremley frequent.The only negative side is it's problematic learning curve. I sadly had to learn alone which i reccomend to avoid. Don't play alone at all. Especially on the official servers.

review: I've never got around to reviewing this game but i feel i need to.It really is fantastic. Definitely has some of the most caring developers of anything ive played. They truly listen to the community and experiment wisely without breaking the foundation of what Rust is at heart. Solid Updates WEEKLY. Check out their reddit if you're curious.Its a hard core pvp survival not for the faint of heart. You will get murked. Rust is merciless. But if you persevere through the t it will be totally worth the challenge.They say you can't play solo but I do quite often successfully. You just need to play on a solo or solo/duo/trio community server. Speaking of the community as a whole IS quite toxic but that doesnt mean everyone is. I've met plenty of good people in game. The game's depth comes with the experiences you encounter with other players as well as the building aspect. Building is definitely my favorite part and theyre starting to add more cosmetic items like carpets and chairs ect.Farm&gt Build&gt Loot&gt Upgrade&gt Roam. Not really in that order specifically but this is what you do in Rust. Sounds basic but it always tend to keep people interested week after week. You dont necessarilyTBC but is that all needed to understand this is real. good game. buy buy.

review: No game has ever made me physically ill before... untill I had played rust. I have played many gruesome horror games and none of them had ever made me feel sick from horror. It is weird that rust induced that type of feeling in me. Rust is a game in which you look for resorces to build your house and hunt to survive. Doing this by yourself or with friends. One thing that you have to watch out for are other players. It's is easier to get resorces from others instead of collecting them yourself so most players will trick you into coming out of your home so they can steal your stuff. They might even break down your door... No online game has ever made me question human moral such as this one. Strip away rules and people/players can be ruthless... Unleashing your evil side in rust is easy and that is what makes this game so great.

review: Time to update my review for the new rust I liked the old rust (aka legacy) a bit better because of how buildings more secure (requiring C4) which make you feel more safe. I really don't like the idea of players being able to raid a base just by hitting a wall for 10 mins. I liked the idea of having c4 to break a wall in the old rust. Now in this new version building is alot more flexible. I LOVE IT. I can make my mansion that I always dreamed about and defend it. I also like the way that animals just plop on the ground when you kill them it's funny and kind of realistic. The only thing that kind of gets on my nerves is the random maps it's very impossible to find your friends. There could be a main map like in the new unturned and 7 days to die where there's a main map and the server owner could chose what map to host A random Gen or for example the main map of rust is called Rust Island. Now admins in the old rust finally are doing something about hackers unlike facepunch studios that still not doing anything about it. Like come on facepunch just doing something like everytime you launch the game make it where the launcher replaces all files except the config file to make hackers have a hard time to mod the game. Overall i love both versions and this game deserves more but STUPID HACKERS RUIN IT! I pretty sure hacking is a felony correct me if I'm wrong. I give this game a 9/10UPDATE 8/10/15A map was made to be official one and unique stuff has been added. Sadly the game specs caught up to me and I can no longer run this game still great game though. Rating stays.

review: What began as serious fun turned into a complete ing nightmare. The updates are from hell and so bad that the latest one crashed Steam and glitched out Windows. I spent hours in an update loop that would crash Steam every time. About 30 reboots later I finally managed to uninstall this fiasco.I logged well over 400 hours on Rust (what's now called Legacy) which was a great game aside from the cheaters and 12 year olds screaming at you on the mic. Had they stuck with the original game design and just kept adding to that I'd still be playing and wouldn't be changing my review.This review is fair warning to anyone wanting to try this game out. Beware of the updates from hell and the ensuing disasters.I do NOT recommend this game anymore.

review: Ok so I've been playing the game for about 1.5hrs even though it says 3.6hrs those missing hours were spent just trying to join a bloody server had to restart the app serveral times. Frankly I don't understand why. maybe my computer is not good enough. It's a decent one not a high end one. But still I'll give this game more time untill my final reveiw on it. so far 3/10The building simulation is pretty intersting and fairly easy to using for anyone getting the materials however is lame unless its the server im on. I figured that if its a boulder then it should give stone right? well I spent almost 30 mins tring to find out thats not the case. At least the trees give you wood. More than likely its the server that made it that way. Building is very virsatil so far so thats a plus. So I will try another server as well. Till the next review guys...

review: (Read edit below My issues have been resolved.) This game has so much potential. Sadly too much is missing for me to recomend this game yet. Once it's out of "Early Access" I believe this game will be the game of gods but it just needs so much work. My main complaint is that there is no Favorite Servers system. The history tab doesn't work half the time and the server list is a hassle to work with. Also I can't find my friends. Ever. I konw this is supposed to be a survival game and stuff but games like this are always more fun with friends. But I can never find them. There are no landmarks and everything looks the same making it impossible to find the people you wish to play with. If they fix these things I will change this review in a heartbeat but for now it's not worth supporting unless you really want to participate in the development of this game.EDIT I SEE THE LIGHT NOW EVERYTHING HAS BEEN FIXED.

review: Solo speaking here.Rust is fun enjoyable and an easy to sink many hours into game without getting bored. Optimisation is not perfect but neither is it bad. I am not really allowed to complain about it since my specs are not that great either(RX 460 2 GB Ryzen 3 1200 8 GB DDR4 3066 MHz). It's toxic comunity is like no other being awkwardly funny at times and giving you a rage at others. Being crossbowed to the face as a naked and yelling for mercy but only recieveing a lifeless shut the f*ck up can give you a good laugh. If you however dont get crossbowed to the face immediately and make some progress losing all that you achieved will get you real salty.The developers listen to the commuity. The changes they made show their attention to the subreddit the forums etc.The reason for this review being negative is because the game keeps ing crashing beyond acception. Not while playing those are only 20 seconds freezzes wich may get you killed. When does the game crah then? Let me tell you.Wanna use the exit game button? No. It will crash.Wanna cancel the loading screen using the dedicated cancel button? No. It will crash 90%.Wanna click anywhere on the screen while the game is loading? No. It will crash 100% of the time.Wanna change the f*ucking audio option from stereo to headphones? No. It will crash 100%.Wanna change graphics settings while in game? Please no. It will crash 50% of the time.Wanna click anywhere on the screen while graphics settings are being loaded? No. It will crash 100%.It's not that easy to just wait and not click because loading times are very very big and you allways feel like having to check if it crashed.I am sorry but the way this games loads it's stuff is bad. Real bad.

review: Product received for free. So a friend gave me the game so we could play together. At first I thought the game was cool. Than we started having problem after problem. I'll start with the Pros and move on to the Cons afterwards.Pros You need to work to get anywhere in the game you can't spawn and rule a server.You don't "dissapear" upon logging out meaning you either hide or go inside before signing off.Crafting has variety.You need blueprints to be able to craft.Graphics are fairly nice.Other players are friendly. At least on the server I went to. Cons Loading times are insanely long.Neither me nor my friend could avoid lag.Game had issues launching almost always failing or crashing shortly after start up.Mid game crashes were harsh and constant.Some animals are considerably tougher than they should be.Did I mention to high computer requirements? You need like a god of a computer to run this smoothly at even half to max graphics.

review: Devs Troll the community no wonder why it is so toxic.22/02/2018Voip issue seems solved for me.Trying the game after 2 years... it has improved a lot in so many ways! Graphics looking amazing.Fps were just rubish for me even with this version before installing the game in my ssd just wanted to see the difference and while in some games there is non in this one the difference is huge. Fps go around 85/100 but I lock them at 80 for more smooth gameplay.Game feels a bit clunky now and then but mostly ok.Servers are not the best even official ones.I have had to verify the game files 2 times and reinstalled 1 also can t use msi afterburner or Rust wont launch but other games will work with no problems.Shooting in this game is still very bad compared to your regular fps but rust is not an fpsYes the community is toxic af but that makes it even more rewarding when you find that cool neighbour you can invite to your house or even trade with or share loot so he can research it and learn how to do it. He takes care of my home when I am offline and I do the same for him. Etc etc 08 12 2015 update.No until they change the VOIP system. Using steam voip is not cool IMO and it doesn t work fine for me. Will change this to a Yes if they change it again. Really good potential came back after a while of not playing it I think it needs more work and that is also obvious since the game is not finished. Still it is a good game and I believe that it is possible to have a lot of fun in its current state of ALPHA.This review is very old.

review: I played this game for a few hours (5.5 h) and can say some positive and a lot of negative things Most of the players will kill you on first sight (especially the ones with good gear even if you just started and have nothing good collected or crafted). I mean it's no fun if you got killed repeatedly just after some minutes. Where is the fun when someone kills you with a riffle 20m away from you when you only have a stone to defend yourself? The world /map is huge but also empty and you ll spend a lot of time running around and there s nothing to collect or do. That s probably my taste but I don t like the menus. They are clumsy to handle and not very intuitive and confusing. You can t change into 3th person which is a great pity because some players prefer 3th person over first person. You can t create your character. Your appearance is determined by the game itself and depends on your steamaccount (probably name and other data from it?)+ I think the graphics are quite beautiful.+ If you want to play on a more peaceful server you can google one (PvE) and join it instead of the unfriendly mainstream servers.+ If you don t get killed by other players you can progress fast and build your own house / base and craft cool stuff.So all in all I don t continue to play this game. Maybe I ll check back later but for now the experience with it was more frustrating then anything else.

PvP is destroying the core player base and alienating any casual players since you can't play this game in 20 minute iuncrements. review: Big Improvements.review edited.I have 145 hours on this game and I have to say from thorough contemplation and observation that this is by far the worst game I have ever played in my life. I didn't think such a high amount of suffering was possible in a video game until now. I had a more enjoyable time playing through Dark Souls without any online aid than I did playing rust.Since my original review I've returned to the game to find it has had massive improvements. The world looks a lot better and the scavenging is much less frustrating now that blueprints are no longer an issue. Although I would suggest clearer descriptions for armor pieces or maybe a guide for people on how to use the armor effectively.

review: Best survival game I've ever played. Many survival games are either too hard and feel unfair or become too easy once you've figured out the mechanics. With rust you're never safe and that's what gives it that exciting edge every time you log on. You never know if you were raided last night or if you're safe for another day. It's not perfect the animal AI is buggy as hell there's mediocre anti cheat protection that requires admins to pick up the slack and large clans have a significant advantage over small groups and solos players. However the developers are passionate about their game and regularly listen to community feedback. They're not afraid to admit their mistakes and start from scratch on something new if it's what the community wants.If you want to start playing this game I reccomend you look at a few youtube videos on topics like how to survive and mistakes that new players make. Avoid joining servers with inactive admins (usually the facepunch official servers) and instead opt for a vanilla community server. Be friendly but cautious to other players and avoid making enimies early on. Be friendly with your first neighbors and if you're lucky you may find some people to start a group with you. And most of all don't get discouraged if you get raided die or lose all your stuff. Experienced people will trick you outsmart you and exploit you. Keep your head on square learn from your mistakes and try again.

review: Rust is a game you will read about quite often. It's community is crazy the servers are bezerk and the gameplay is utterly hilarious. To those frustrated with being raided over and over again thus leaving this game a bad review try playing on an unpopulated server. Look into the game with a more open eye and understand that larger serves can't be played alone. It's not unfair... It's just how the game has evolved... In an eveolutionary stance the statement "Survival of the Fittest" could not be more ture.It is because of this that I highly reccommend this game. I feel as though if you're looking to get into survival games then this one is a great first choice. To those who are vets to that of ARK and simimlar this game is a nice simple and slower chnage to the older much more dynamic survival games. All in all if you don't like the game Steam always offers a refund.With that I leave you with this... Never ever trust anyone especially a NAKED!

review: NoteMEdown's Weighted Game Score 8.2/10Score breakdown Gameplay (Overall quality of the mechanics) 80/100Immersion (How well the game made me feel like I was the character) 70/100Smoothness (How well the game was uninterrupted by annoyances which includes bugs) 65/100Visuals/Sound 80/100Hours Played (1point per hour 100 points max +5 points for 200 hours) 105/100 Personal Enjoyment (How much I enjoyed playing the game) 90/100Score breakdown notes Gameplay A surprising amount to do in the game however the shooting mechanics have never felt right.Immersion When you first start playing you do really feel like your character however this ends quickly when you learn the best ways of quickly making a base which often involve abusing mechanics.Smoothness Bugs and hackers are way too common and are often what makes me stop playing during long sessions.Visuals/Sound Game looks and sounds good for the most part has some odd animations here and there.Hours Played This game keeps bringing me back with the amount of updates.Personal Enjoyment I can often enjoy the game until i get into the late game where there is not much to do.Overall Score (All scores added up then divided by 60) 8.2/10

review: At the moment (26.05.2014 17.07.2014) the game gets boring pretty quick. Some servers are mighty frustrating in general cheats crazy kids bloodthirsty nerds that don't get laid at all it seems. All of this plus the ability to get some serious firearms 5 minutes after a server is wiped and a small map make it hardly enjoyable for more than a week or so. The building and gathering process are both fine the combat needs a lot of work and the game balance is just missing (see M4 with kevlar full armor against a rock and no underwear on the same spot). Flora and fauna are not so rich and the only meat you get is chicken (KFC says hi apparently). Some weapons like hand cannon are obsolete by default. The destruction system should make a little more sense as in you can break everything but the pillars and foundation. What? It gets exploited all over the place and sneaky bastards will lock you up and block you as they please. Or you will lock youself away which in either case is an exploit and doesn't improve the experience.Experimental build (aka restart) still has nothing to offer. Why devs added it for player use while there's nothing in it is beyond me.So devs should keep up the good work and fix minor bugs asap. As of now I do not feel like playing it at all until a major patch gets out and I wouldn't recommend this game in its current state.It's as true as it says in the early access description "very early development".So I recommend you wait until it shapes up.
title: Rust

review: This game has so much potential and at its core its amazing. so whats holding it back? The biggest problem with this game is as you may have already guessed the community its horrible. So you keep spawning and magicaly you actually get somewhere you find an old base and set up shop its looking good oh nevermind heres a full gear clan to ruin your day looks like they needed some extra rocks to play with or maybe an extra torch well good for them. So the other problem. The devs. ugh dont get me started. You might say there trying there hardest to get this game playable but it shouldnt take 2 years let alone more because the game is still broke more power to the clans they say also there is core mechanics that still arn't fixed bears are just silly and they still havnt found a suitable crafting system yet no the componet system was not the answer. I would love to play this game but the clans and nerfs on us solo players is keeping me away until the community grows up and the devs fix the core mechanics ill stay away from this game.

review: Product received for free. This game is the type of game that you can really lose yourself in you can play dozens of hours a day and still have fun!This was in the good old days of Rust. I recieved this game as a gift from a friend for christmas (2015). Back then you connected to people and you "Roleplayed" and truly interacted with all of the players on a server. On these servers you got to know most people and you knew them as a community and interacted with them more than just in any other game. Before I played as much Rust as i did back then I played a fair bit of CS GO and Unturned one of which is a round based First Person Shooter and the other one a Zombie survival game with graphics all based on square models. Even though I came from these games that are considered very different from Rust I still fell in love with the game and lost yself in it. Now i nearly have 2500 hours in the game and i have completely lost the spark to play it.Updates and development was shifted from what the games core was (Blueprint system) and was tergetting bigger audience by putting out quick not well thought out updates many of which (In my opinion) ruined the game and the way it was played. Nowadays the game doesn'thave a goal for the week the 'wipe' used to consist of you and your friends farming and getting those recourses needed to get that one base or that one outpost after that you spent the wipe interacting PVP ing and gathering for Blueprints this knowledge that followed you till the next wipe where you could build better things from the start and it gave you an insentive to stay on the server for more than the timeit took you to die the first time.Nowadays Rust is completely changed everything that the developers do in terms of progress is being hidden away the old branches barely have anyt population because not a lot of people know about them the new resource system only involves farming and if you die or get raided you lose all the progress that you had made to that point nothing was gained from the hundreds of hours you put in that wipe just to have to reset and do the exact same thing again next wipe and so on. The playerbase got more and more agressive due to the increased rarity of items people now have to work extra hard jut to get a stone wall up. Now KOS is one of the most reoccuring themes in the Rust chatroom.For me the devs have to drastically change the way the game is played so that it better matches the playerbase no need to farm for the entire wipe and invest that much time just so that you can lose it immediatey to a clan of 20 or more players. (Obviously one can try to avoid this but what is the point in selective playing due to that) What the developers desperately has to do is to give the players something to hold onto on a server for the next wipe knowledge on item crafts specific components something just so that when a player joins a server he has something to hold on to something to bring with him to prove that his efforts was worth the while.I loved this game now I am sad to see what it has become I still have hopes for it but I think it has a long way to go still.I would give this game a 2/10 due to the reason that I have so much nostalgia from it however changes need to be made drastically.13/10 The game is Improved A LOT Facepunch studios re added a version of Blueprints to the game which made it viable to continuously play on a server. This is something that I really approve of. The game still has things to work with. Review of game based on score (8/10)

review: The game is an absolute piece got it way back in legacy and have taken breaks over the course of its development. The charm I find in it is the games visuals as well as community. Is the community good? NO but there is something about this game that just makes people act like a bandit from borderlands if anything I'd say rust is Borderland Bandit simulator and I love it. The community does have its good sides though but it exists outside of the game. You have people making modded and custom server to appeal to most players prefered playstyle or game mode. Also despite the fact that I'd agree 99% of the community is hostile I've made upwards of like 30 friends on this game and any players who have been hostile towards me have mostly been comedic about it so I've just never been able to stay mad at them. Rust is a weird one it brings out dark side in the majority of people who play it but its like a dark humor if anything it what I image a real apocalypse would look and play out like.

review: After over 2 000 hours I can comfortably say that it was worth every penny but that being said I hate this game. The concept for this game is really great and I've had soo many enjoyable moments but overall it's just a grindfest. You spend the first few days of the wipe grinding your off until finally you get some decent gear and then you go out and die with it. Also this game has been in development for what like 3 years now? Very minimal progress has been made considering how long they have been working on it which is very dissapointing. The developers please the community with little trivial items to keep them coming back but in reality rust right now is practically the same as rust two years ago. Overall excellent game but don't do what I did and sink over 2 000 hours into it lol. 7/10

review: There are many things about rust I didn't like I'll keep most difficulty complaints out of my review because I expected it to be very difficult. (I still found the community less than desirable aswell especially after reading comments on some other reviews that were along the lines of "Git gud")Now after playing 12 hours of Rust I must say it's kinda... boring... the maps can be really large however they don't look very good and some areas are just locked off by tempurature or radiation. I've accessed all of these and it's the same story. The best parts of the map are the landmarks and while they were kinda neat a couple of times they got old and samey quick and the "Loot" was mostly scrap metal and other garbage noone wants (Though I did find a large mace once it was cool but it wasn't better than a spear).After awhile provided you weren't killed on spawn (It happens alot) and noone downs you and just leaves you you may be fairly strong then all there is is farming and combat. And combat doesn't feel very good. Most weapons accessable to new players are difficult to use and guns are just overpowered and are really easy by comparison. Most armor offers hardly any protection and unless you have friends with you you will be outnumbered alot. There's no real depth to the gameplay beyond that which is rather dissapointing for a survival game and especially one that's been in development for so much longer than some of it's peers.

review: Compared to other reviews my play time is incredibly short. I have learned in that short time that this game absolutely hates small groups/solo players which I fall under. This game suffers from the Survival genre's tropes of people killing you on sight. People with guns killing people without guns for no reason even if you insist that you mean no harm. fresh spawns often mindlessly kill one another just to get a tiny leg up just to get brained themselves a minute later.I wish the dev team would implement a system that penalize late game players for murdering a fresh spawn. Someone without a base that has a cabinate and a sleeping bag within or a wanderer with a bow or adequate ranged weapon to defend themselves with. If you see a person with a gun advancing towards you the likely result will be death even if they say they're friendly they often want you to stay still so they can use less ammo to slaughter you.The EXP system is a terrible idea for a server based game. All progression does not transfer from server to server even on official ones. Not to mention that admins will restart the entire server making everyone's progression start from square 1. This advantages people with big groups due to the EXP system sharing amoungst friends/allies in close proximity to one another or shared tools.The aggressive wild life are real kickers as well. Bears often appear out of no where and have almost no sound when chasing after you. You need the situational awareness of Widow Maker 24/7 if you don't want to be blindsided by a bear or wolf. Both bears and wolves will outpace you so running is never the option and standing your ground against a bear or wolf solo is certain death for fresh spawns. Edit (playing beyond 17 hours)I continued my playtime beyond 17 hours. I had decent fun talking to people while I collected resourses for a small house which too approximately 7 hours stright. Most of that time was spent dying to fellow players the ones that would never speak to you and looking for a location for said house. I logged back in 20 hours later to find I have no sleeping bag and the kill message saying I was murdered by a weapon I stored away for an emergecy. I get this game is still in EA. But 3 years is an unacceptible amount of time to be in perpetual beta. It is a lazy way to free a game from any criticism.
title: Rust

review: Listen this game is great. Great concept great gameplay etc. But... Theres so many ing problems with this damn game i cant even fathom. These kinds of problems would be understandable in a EA game but now this game has been in full release for what 2 months now? The game continues to have crashing errors for almost everyone i play with. I shouldnt have to go into my system settings and change how much dedicated ram i should have for a set game. I have 16 GB of DDR4 RAM. I should not crash over RAM errors whatsoever. If your game itself is taking up more than 8 GB of RAM you're doing something wrong. This is not a AAA title. Another issue i encounter constantly is slow loading textures. I have the hardware to run this game at 90 FPS on medium graphics with a max render distance. You're telling me that something 20 feet in front of me shouldnt be loaded by the time i get to it? Absolutely ridiculous. Not only does this game have an astounding amount of internal issues its community is also the most toxic i've seen. After a 1000 hours of gameplay I've met maybe 30 people in the probably thousands ive played with that are relatively friendly. And Facepunch goes on to support this toxic behavoir by trying to "Fix it" by adding new landmarks like the "Outpost" where players continue to camp outside of and hunt down freshspawns. New players are constantly being turned away from this game after expierencing the massive waves of toxic people that play. Raiding should also not be the primary objective in this game. I've had so many people raid me or someone else and when the person responds negatively the raider often and usually responds with "Its Rust lol get over it Raiding is like the entire game" or something relatively similiar. Rust has now become a slow paced FPS game where the larger clans and such exploit the fact that guns and C4 are part of the game as an excuse to be toxic and people. Its completely ruined the experience. I can't say that i havent been one of those people because I have and it feels kind of . At this point in Rusts developement as I continue to play it regardless of its state hoping to find a diamond in the rough that makes the game magically better I cannot recommend playing this game whatsoever. Other than "having its moments" 90% of rust is a constant grind where you're rewarded with someone blowing into your walls or murdering you and calling you a . If thats the kind of community and game you seek go for it.

review: well i've played this game for 60 hours in total combined with my other account and thing is i started on legacy that is when i bought the game and i spent 50 hours on it in the first week and then i stopped not because i got bored simply because my computer broke down and i was going to school so i could not afford a new computer straight a way so now i got a pretty powerful computer or atleast powerful enough to play rust comftarbly and you see thing is i went in game i expected to find the same good old game that ill be able to play for so long now right ? well yeah let's just say i spent the next 10 hours trying to build myself a base which i failed over and over again i did it once yet it got raded when i logged off and you're probably thinking oh this retard can't build a base ahahahahah'' well before releasing your toxicity colected from rust onto me hear me out you see don't get me wrong i do like fps games i play a lot of counter strike and i play a lot of titan fall but thing is i like survival games too and rust used to be one of my favorite ones up until i tried the lates version of the game that they made i mean the community is simply garbage the first game i entered i tried to ask some guy with a AK on how the game works now a days guess what i got shot. i was like well okay every game has some toxic players or maybe he just did not speak english '' so i've met a naked guy also fresh spawn i didn't get enough time to even say hello he just pushed towards and tried to kill me so i've killed him and asked him why did he try to kill me like he knew i had nothing on me the answer i got was YOU '' so to be honest from my perspective survival genre in the gaming community is dead and no not because of the devs but because of the players the way they are i mean instead of just gathering recourses and building stronger bases they prefer to get a bow run around die and do the same all over again honestly i am done with this game and you see the game itself is nice it's better than ever i loved the graphics the mechanics and everything else it's just that the community is such a BIG flaw in the game that it does not even compensate for the game being good itself and that is why i think rust is dead and it will never be good again unless people change but we both know they don't. this was my review Game 9/10 overallGraphics 8/10mechanics 10/10community 0/10In conclussion if you like playing alone on empty servers this is the game for you and if you expect to meet friends and build a base and live ever after don't even try don't waste your energy on this game. GGWP

review: Cons If you decide to buy the game avoid playing more than 2hours becasue if you are a noob or new (like me) and start playing. Pro players will not be nice unless you have a mic to convince them. Players who have played this game when it came out will use you to get ur stuff. One player in a server kept killing me even though i begged for mercy and other players in opther servers would do the same. If you are able to live then I feel happy for you. Lastly sometimes the servers would start getting very laggy and not allow you to build or you start glitching and being unable to move. Also if yo dont build a house by the time you stop playing SOMEBODY WILL kill you and loot you and you will respawnPros My computer was able to play on high settings and it looked very nice my graphics card did suffer a little ( i have a RX 580) If you are a good survival fps gamer then this is certainly a good game for you. Also some new players or pro who happen to join a new server with you might team up with you if you meet up. If it werent for the annoying players this game would have been very good for me even if there were some hackers. Additionally there are servers that may help you getting used to the games guns and other weapons handling. I would not reccomend this game tho

review: In a word... sleeper. This means that when you log off you don't "log off"... your character simply stands where he was and closes his eyes. Until you log back in. Yes this means you can and will be found and murdered for your dozen stones and your stone hatchet. So essentially you get to start over daily. "But you can build a shelter!" you might think. This is true. However they can be brought down your character killed and your one measley box completely looted. Then they destroy your sleeping bag so you can't even find your barren house.There are also a wide variety of server issues that plague this game. Official servers only hold 128 simultaneous players aside from the stress servers and East Coast 1. This means when you want to get back onto a server you were on you get to try to reconnect over and over and over. Stability! The first two times I played Rust the servers crashed. The very first time it was literally within 10 minutes. And about 3 of that was spent rubberbanding all over the place. When the servers are stable the game plays well enough... but inevitably you'll face lag and eventually a server crash.And speaking of servers if you want to refresh the list of 11 official servers you also get to sit through the list of the 300odd privately run mod servers to refresh. "No big deal the official ones should refresh first " you're saying to yourself. Of course! That makes sense in an ideal world. But if you couldn't tell yet this is anything but.This game has SO much potential and I would love it if they actually implemented common sense in addition to the server stability (the latter of which I know will come with time).Oh! Not to mention the devs HATE feedback if your opinion differs from theirs at all.

review: Great game! 10/10 damn near perfect imoBiggest con are the other players! Finally! Found a freshly wiped server with 0 players online and started gathering looting chopping etc. until i FINALLY had enough to build the house of my imagination. I made it top tier in security placed the best walls and doors you can get in the game. Secured it with a ton of traps and defence. Having fun and feeling pretty damn good about myself.1 player comes online and we start to chat... Nice fella so I invite him over.. Gives him full access to the house and authorized him to build on / in the house.. He then asks for the pin code to the doors and I give it to him.. I tell him "whats mine is yours now" and he thanks me.. All is good! I got a new friend on a clean server and the best base ever! ...... Or do I ??My so called friend then started to wonder around the base doing... things.. I didn't even notice it but he is actually changing the pin code and finally removing my authentication to the base! Result? All traps turrets defense etc is now turned on me and killing me... repeatedly as I keep spawning in "my house" D What a I'm gonna get him for that! lol

review: Rust is in a state of total I as a player hope and trust in the Devs to make this game better however.You will see all these reviews saying this the devs suck they make things worse. To be fully honest with you the past 3 months with the components system has sucked complete I know by year 4 this game SHOULD be polished and fun but it isnt. If you are willing to put your trust into the Devs then play this game expect the game to change from when you buy it. Having said this this is what you should buy rust for.Clans. If you have a large group of people 5 20 then this is the game for you. You will dominate all the servers with tyranny and complete control. The people of the server will hate you however and have no respect what so ever.Roleplay. This is what you should play if your solo or if you have a small group of 2 4. Build a shop build a hospital do whatever you want! But be wary people will raid kill and hunt you down without remorse just for being a roleplayer. This is the most fun way to play the game at the moment. Build a town. This is what Rust was meant to be like build a town make neighbors surround it with a wall. This is the dream of most solo players out there this is the most fun way to play the game. People how ever are s so choose your community wisely or you will be backstabbed by some 12 year old.The three types of players in Rust.KOS basically s some people arent s but most are. This is the easiest way to play rust but the worst in terms of fun.Eye for an eye. You dont shoot me i dont shoot you. The fair and most fun way to play the game this is how it was meant to be played. ( expect to be killed because of aimcone )What most people call roleplayers but i call "too friendly". They will not kill you even if you are killing them. They are the Liberals of rust believing in a world that will never happen and in turn get too salty every time they get killed. The of rust in terms of fun you will feel like a Mormon looking for followers.What to take away from this review To have the most fun build a pretty looking base ( expect to be raided even if you build a big base you will still be raided so just have fun with it. ) dont kill someone unless they shoot first ( expect to be double headshot and killed because of aimcone ) make a lot of friends and make a town of nakeds you found on the beach roleplay and make a community hospital or a casino or a strip club etc. Remember if you play this game religiously or in any means tryhard you will hate it. Just have fun.

All of a sudden multiple naked men surround me with their rocks. I too was naked but I had a shotgun in my belt. They yelled on voice chat "GIVE US YOUR HUMAN FLESH" And I respectfully declined. They started coming closer so I pulled out my gun and said "I won't kill you if you leave me alone." One of their men came closer and out of fear I pumped him full of lead. They all started screaming and crying about how I just killed their friend.Then they harvested his flesh and bones while I sauntered off back to my base with an inventory full of goods intact.TL DR Shoot everyone who comes close to you with a rock.

review: So I bought this game thinking it would be fun and I was absolutely right. Myself and two of my coworkers got together on a server of about 20 players. Pretty quiet built a base ran into another group. This group dominated the server and had a ton of weapons and a massive base right near ours. Rather than slaughter us they let us go. The name of their leader was Bob Silverwind. And we owe him.Another one of our coworkers purchased the game. We decided to be and not let him live with us. Summary of events Coworker finds AK.Coworker runs into Bob Silverwind.Coworker kills Bob and loots him.Bob is Bob arranges to meet coworker at his house to get his stuff back.Our boss buys the game.We contact Bob and ask for the location of our coworker. he agrees in return for a lot of stone.We give Bob stone.Bob gives us coworkers location.We go on an hour long expedition to coworkers house in the middle of snowy mountains.Find coworkers base.Don't have C4. use mining charges. A lot. Doesn't work. Feelings of depression.Friend goes around house.Coworker left door open.Sent pictures and videos of raid to coworker.Coworker butthurt.Boss kills coworker with rock.Boss takes meat of coworker and cooks it.Boss eats coworker.11/10 would eat coworker again.

I completely recommend this game to people that like a bit of everything in a game especially topics like survival creativity and playing with others. Honestly I rate this game a 8 out of 10. review: This game is bloody awfull. It is a sandbox pvp game which means if you're joining a server now there will be players around your spawnpoint which gun you for fun. There is no option to play PvE or solo or start your own server. The tutorial is given on the way of your progression which can be tedious if you're surrounded outnumbered and outmatched. It really is trial and error and a lot of time investment just to be able to craft something like a house. I find the time invested already not worth it and I'm shocked they ask 32 euro's for this game.

review: No well defined objectives for the game.Be a noob spend 1 hour collecting resources and die to some random guy who shot you from the back with an AK/any other end game gun.Play solo grind a lot and get raided by zergs later raid offline because its too risky to raid online and miss the wonderous atackers vs. defenders that the game is focused on.Play zerg don't even bother if you die with your inventory full of c4 you'll get it back in about 3 hours of pure grinding go in packs killing every single noob you see just because you're bloodthirsty raid everything and everyone killing the server slowly..Get only about 3 to 4 fair fights in all the wipe cycle but they only last about 5 seconds and 3 of them are for reloading.Go into modded servers with x1000 multiplier to get the full game experience is about 2 hours just to bore yourself later because it makes it much more easy to notice that everything is technically worthless.Build a base which is pretty much a cookie cutter result because any other design will get you raided as fast as they can find it (Which is not slow because there's few places to hide bases).You're better off buying "Ark Survival Evolved" its this game but actually good.

review: For all those doubting how good early access games can be I am here to put your mind at rest. Unlike DayZ or H1Z1 which recieve updates maybe bi monthly( if you're lucky) which gives Steam Early Access a bad name Rust devs update the game weekly with a major overhaul coming on 7/7. The game runs very smoothly and throughout my 30+ hours of gameplay I never expierenced any crashes or game breaking bugs. Overall it is much like Kerbal Space Program ( the only other early access game i have invested money into) in the fact the game could be classified as a complete game but the devs want to maximize the game before they release into beta or beyond. As for gameplay.... my initial thoughts were that the game would basically be a "good graphic" minecraft but that couldn't be further from the truth. Instead the game has very realistic survival elements and hefty bullet drop/sprays which to some might be a negative. To me however these realistic elements give the game shape and form allowing the player to feel more enticed to play and get better with practice. I feel it is very important to distingush playing solo and with friends... When playing solo you will die and you will die ALOT but that comes with the territory. Although they can be boring after countless hours I highly recommend playing on lower pop servers in order to help make the game more enjoyable as you learn the basic mechanics. However even on these low pop servers the game is still highly enjoyable and you don't have to worry as much about Clans one of my biggest cons that I will get to later. As for playing with friends the game is A BLAST and there is no telling how much fun stuff can happen as you all work together to make a badass base and go looting for better equipment.The biggest pro imo is raiding. Raiding allows those who have invested quite alot of time and resources on a server to go and raid other players bases. There are two types of raids in the game Online raids and offline raids. Online raids are rarer and much more difficult to accomplish because online raiding literally means raiding someone's base why they are online but are much more rewarding and enjoyable if successful. Offline raids are the type 95% of players will expierence and occurs when someone raids your base while you are offline. These offline raids are the reason it is so imperative you make as strong of a base as possible before you log out and why playing with friends is much more enjoyable and encouraged.The biggest con goes hand in hand with raiding and is Clans. Clans are basically a group of people who form a huge base somewhere on the map and in order to protect their base and ensure server dominance basically give their members "jobs" in which it's X members duty to log in from 7am noon and watch the southeast side of the base for possible raiders or farm resources. hunt etc. These clans can be quite an annoyance and of the 4 servers I have played on 3 were ruthless doing anything and everything they could to insure dominance. If this sounds like something you cant handle I wouldn't recommend buying the game because nearly every server has a clan already in place.Overall the game is a refreshing survival game providing thrilling expierences as you go scavenging for resources raiding or just through exploring the map as you try your best to try and gain prominance in the server. For anyone interested in fps survival pvp or exploration I highly recommend this game as it masterfully combines all these games into a PC must own.Final Verdict 8/10 a great game well worth the $20 price tag and even more so if you can get it cheaper. However with the upcoming xp system about to be introduced and everything else the devs have in store I am certain this game can easily bump up to a 9 or a 10 and will update this post with more incite as the game evolves!

review: Rust at its very core is so bad that the only thing I can see this leading to is another project altogether. Now that they see that there's a market for this I imagine they will do a better version and repackage it to sell it to us again. I'm not buying it though and I regret buying this it's the worst game in my library.The graphics are terrbile and lags constantly. The AI of the animals you're required to hunt is laughably awful. The actions that you can take don't make sense from a survival perspective all the developer would need to do is watch an episode of the Survivorman show for better inspiration in what elements to add. The landscape is covered with shantyhouse skyscrapers built by players that ruins any immersion you might want to get out of a survival game. It's best during the night cycle when the screen is entirely black and you can use your imagination to fill in the massive failure in game design.The only innovation I witnessed is that you may come across people who are using voicechat and you are able to hear them talking as if you walked into their conversation or just walking past their campsite and the volume changes to the appropriate level in relation to your distance from the voice.The gameplay is driven along by the absolute ugliest qualities in online gaming. Greed cruelty towards fellow players bragging to name a few. It then rewards the behavior and through the conditioning I honestly believe makes you worse of a person after playing it. I've never considered stating that about any other game and hope I'm never compelled to again.It's like an online class "How to be a jackass 101". I think everyone already knows how to be a jackass online this game has nothing to offer IN MY OPINION. Thank you.

review: Great game. First of all I must admit that yes there are a lot of people on this game who want to kill and steal from. This is the basis of the game that no one is your friend unless you really do manage to get to trust them. However there are many different servers with different people on for example I started off properly playing Rust on a modded server which is part of a gaming network I play on (Vexatio Gaming) which I am player admin on so I knew everyone and people were friendly towards one another if one turned against another the rest of the server would team up with the victim and retaliate in defense of the victim. Basically what I'm trying to say is there are many different servers on it may take time to find good servers but once you do it is well worth it.There are many different types of server e.g Super Modded Servers with ridiculous gather rates like 1000x or even one I played on which was 1 000 000x (One that was extremely fun and I still play on regularly) though you can hardly expect to survive long you get resources quickly and OP gear within 20 minutes if you're even just a bit hasty. Though on this type of server EVERYONE is your enemy and will shoot on sight. You may be shot as a fresh spawn but eventually after a little while you will manage to get some high quality gear and rule (until you come offline and you WILL get raided). These are super fun but I would recommend playing with a friend(s) however you must also have a decent amount of experience to play as most are ATLEAST that good and will decimate you if you're not good enough.Legit Modded These servers are basically legit except there are additional commands like /tp /home and gather rates of 2X 3X This is the type of server I most recommend for new players to play on small community servers so they can get a feel for the game learn the bullet drop and how to use weapons effectively. Basically just OP but still legit servers so you still need to work for your gear servers with friendly players are a lot easier to play on while you gather your bearings aswell. Vanilla The most legit type of server I haven't played these much/at all though what I do know is gear is very precious and difficult to get as it takes a lot of time to get good stuff and be able to stand a change against the server regulars that have been playing regularly for the past month. Recommended for regulars with a decent amount of experience to dedicated professionals.I recommend this game to people with friends who will play with them (online friends or real friends it doesn't matter so long as there is a game trustworthy as in they won't just backstab you for your loot you will work as a team) who preferably have Skype or some other way to speak to them online. This game I think is extremely good for players with a friend to play with as you can cooperate to to gain power and gear.This game WILL take a certain level of dedication to gain experience and get good on. Though I enjoyed the learning process in which I started playing on a community server which I knew everyone on and gained power on there then started playing with my friend.My personal rating 10/10 as my favourite and most played game.
title: Rust

review: Okay.As a fan of survival games like DayZ (including mods Epoch OverPoch etc..) I bought this game. I've owned the game for a while but after the Xp update I decided to give this game a try and here is what I think.Having the xp system in game has caused many different opinions and even some player loss but in my opinion it's better than it used to be sure it does have some bad sides on it like it might take a while for a player to be able to create it's favorite weapon clothing building parts etc.About the game grafting tools weapons and clothes all together with building that kind of survival "home" you like are the best parts of this game.Rust is still pretty buggy but hey it's in early acces by bugs I mean bears can attack through walls sometimes and both wolves and bears can glitch in to rocks etc.About building there is a numerous ways to build your own survival "home" aka. base if you want you can build a huge military style armored base or if you want you can have a house build of wood or rocks how ever you like.Building system is very simple but the amount of supplies needed to build a proper base is a challenge.From a naked survivor with rock and a torch to well equipped long living survivor is a road of challenges and a lots of fun.THIS REVIEW IS PRETTY MESSY BUT IM NOT THE BEST IN ENGLISH AND THIS IS MY OPIONION ONLY. IF YOU AGREE GO AHEAD AND BUY THE GAME. LonelyFinn

review: I'm sure everyone is thinking this is a step down from Legacy.. and I'm right there with you. The only thing that allows me to see that they are moving forward is the amount of potential this game has. I have been getting on nonstop for about two weeks now and keep noticing things that can be improved on and things that are becoming perfected to the fullest. I agree that the game has it's repetitiveness and it's griefers/raiders but think about it Your stranded on an island with no food no clothes a rock and your wits. If you were on an island and saw a huge house wouldn't you raid that and take everything he had. It's hard seeing so many people with bad reviews on this game because last i checked it's still "ALPHA". If you are looking for a nice game with no problems or glitches or updates then Steam has an excelent selection to choose from.. But if you are looking for a game that is being constantly developed (but has a few issues that will be fixed through each update) and a wonderful gameplay experience then this is the game for you. I recommend it for an active gamer who is on every few days and does not get butt hurt about being raided. If your interested I'm positive that you will enjoy the time spent on this game. If and When you do buy this game make sure to check out rustinpeaceserver.com and join into it's amazing community and friendlyness. Having trouble finding the server add me as a friend and i can help!! Enjoy the Rust )

review: Ill be the first to say I hated Rust legacy. I don't know if I just didn't give it enough of a chance or what. But New Rust is fantastic Using a brand new engine is exactly what Rust needed and has allowed Garry to add some amazing features to the game that could have only been dreamed of in Legacy.I few warnings If you are looking for a nice community building Minecraft game then this is not the game for you. Other players will stop and nothing to try to destroy your base and steal everything you worked to get then kill you cook and eat you.Rust Is a lot more fun when you play with friends you can split the work in making a secure base and with more people protecting said base raiders will have a harder time screwing you over. During your time in rust you will find and learn Blueprints for everything you can craft in the game you never lose the knowledge of these blueprints while playing on a server so even if they do destroy your base and you wake up on the coast with nothing you still are farther ahead then you started you just need to find the resorces over again. Rust is constanty getting updated and Garry has no fear about making game changing updates only annoying thing about that is that the map ends of getting wiped every month or 2 making you start from scratch but that is kind of a good thing because you can get to powerful making a base that is practically impossible to raid which can get boring.10/10

review: Overall the game is probably a lot of fun if you have a group to play with or a large amount of time to play. As it stands however if you are planning on playing solo or have other commitments such as work family or school you are never going to progress very far in the world of Rust.The skill ceiling in Rust is very low. The gunplay is passable but not excellent and fights seem to mostly boil down to whoever gets off the first shot or brings the most friends wins. Players die extremely quickly particularly with high end weapons. This leaves very little room for strategy beyond just ambush and zerg tactics and there aren't really any "sick plays" to be had beyond pulling off lucky headshots when the game's coding allows it.Due to all of this the only factor that Rust really rewards is time invested in playing the game grinding out resources. If you have job family or school obligations that pull you away from the game or even if you just like playing a variety of games you simply will not be able to keep up with all of the people who are willing to spend 10 16 hours daily grinding resources. This fact coupled with the low skill ceiling means that 2 players will always beat one so if you are outnumbered you WILL lose and have everything on your body looted and players that have 10+ hours a day to play will always have tons of extra resources to build more guns no matter how much they die means that if you don't have the time to invest the game will punish you for it. Time served is all that matters in Rust. Skill is irrelevant.Solo play is further crippled by the nature of the crafting system. Crafting anything but the most basic items in Rust requires that you have learned the item's blueprint. In order to get the blueprint you have to first find the item through random chance in ruins or along roads or kill a player who is carrying it and take it off them. You then need to farm scrap an item available from junk piles until you have enough to build a research table. Then you need to farm more scrap to research the item ranging from a couple dozen units to several hundred depending on how good the item is. Researching the item destroys the original copy you found but now you can build more. In order to do that though you need to farm hundreds of more scrap to build a workbench so you can build items. Then you need to farm certain components to build certain items.The solo experience looks like this find a location farm resources build a base farm 625 scrap for a lvl 2 workbench and research table then farm hundreds more scrap for a handful of maybe useful blueprints (if you managed to find the items) all the while getting killed by groups and losing everything you were carrying at the time. Then you get raided by a clan and lose everything other than your learned blueprints. Hope you learned some good ones.The community is probably the worst I have ever experienced in my time playing multiplayer games. All in all if you are a hardcore gamer type or you have a bunch of people to play with Rust may be the game for you

review: I know that Rust is in early development but this is just unprofessional. This is not a working functional video game by any means. I spent 8 hours collecting supplies that was consistently destroyed by hackers. Over and over again you will lose everything you have become angry and wonder what the point of the game is.It's been months and this game is going nowhere. They claim to have created a hacking solution but it banned like 10 people and hackers still exist everywhere.This game is COMPLETELY broken and it's just getting worse. There is no point in the game other than hit trees and rocks with stuff and make pointless stuff. Even if you do manage to make a huge house it's just going to be destroyed later by some clan. This is not a video game think of it as a broken simulator headed downhill. There's no point there's no fun and there's no way you will survive through the dangers of pointless PVP combat glitched animals and HACKERS HACKERS HACKERS EVERYWHERE. The developers have truly disappointed me and countless others. I support indie games but not something this broken. Goodnight Rust. Good luck in the future. review: This curious (and often depressing) experiment in human nature is a tricky one to review.It can be played two ways either run around the endless countryside naked but for a rock screaming at people and bashing open their skulls if you can get near them. Or gather resources build a home close to precious materials but hidden from prying eyes and ravenous bandits hope to be able to survive long enough to fortify and stock up on weaponry to carve some kind of name and reputation for yourself and fight back against anyone who tries to take what is yours.Either way you will die. Frequently. Either by your own stupidity (that raw chicken looks tasty I'm sure jumping off this cliff face will be okay it doesn't look TOO high...) or most likely at the hand of a ruthless fellow survivor who liked the look of your leather boots. Death isn't to be taken lightly all the items you were carrying are at the mercy of your killer and anything he decides not to take might just be scavenged by another passer by before you can get back to the spot you were slain having respawned in a random location often quite literally miles away.Going solo is fun and challenging for a while but inevitably you WILL lose. Your camp WILL be raided by a group of far better equipped rivals and you WILL lose everything you spent literally hours painstakingly gathering and crafting.The ONLY way to survive this harsh reality is to team up with others and hope your combined efforts outperform your enemies'. Finding others who will trust you and permit you to join them can be tricky but once you've managed it the game really comes into its own and the real fun starts. A lot of fun can be had working together to gather craft and then (hopefully) conquer. Night time raids on rivals' forts to steal their supplies and kill off the competition really can be enjoyable and exciting and Rust does have a lot of strategy and thinking involved. Clan battles on servers are frequent and exchanging threats and taunts before descending on another group's camp en masse is all part of the fun.However again it's only a matter of time before all your best efforts and hard work is ruined. The time will come and you and your friends will be defeated and everything you worked for will be stolen your fortress smashed and demolished. Sadly in a lot of cases it won't even be a fair fight hacking is still a big problem in Rust with whole clans using an assortment of hacks and exploits to stay on top or simply just troll. I've played on many servers where admin abuse is not only obvious it's seen as some kind of God given right. Once all is lost (for the tenth time) this is where the appeal of Rust quickly starts to wane for me at least. Do you really want to start again from nothing spending hours smashing trees with rocks to build basic shelters and chase deer across the map to stay fed and alive? Unless you possess an iron will chances are the extreme nature of Rust will eventually get the better of you and you'll want to move on to seek more casual relaxed ways of having fun without having to sink whole days into chopping wood to craft into planks to craft into building parts to build a modest home that you'll log back in to find has been blown apart and raided while you were offline.But while it lasts this game can be tremendous (but very frustrating) fun and provide plenty of situations to mix tactics teamwork and good old violence to survive another night and maybe even grab a shiny new kevlar vest in the process.Even still in Alpha I'd recommend it.

review: I gave this game a "NO" for many reasons. It is possible to have fun on this game but the more likely scenario is that you will get ed over 100 times until you are so you will uninstall it. First off as far as anyone can tell the developers have given up on it so it isnt really a beta its a dead end. People make up for the lack of game content by hosting good servers with user built plugins that add more to the game the problem is it's next to impossible to find a good server to play on and once you do find one you have no guarantee it will stay open. Your progress doesn't transfer from server to server so if your server closes down you lose everything and servers close down often. That is all a hypothetical since you probably wont even find a good server. I have a lot of hours in the game because one of my friends hosted a server for my group of friends for awhile but the price became too much for him and he had to shut it down iirc its about 40 dollars a month to run a non laggy server.

review: Rust is a game where you can have so much fun regardless of the amount of time you have to spend playing it. If grinding is your kind of thing then go onto an official server the more of your friends you have will minimalise the amount of time needed to setup/ start rading etc. If you find yourself in a position where you dont have all that much spare time a modded server will have the necessary changes to ensure you can jump straight in and enjoy the action! The only thing id advise to a new player is to make sure you dont get dissuaded when you spawn and get killed by people who have been on the server a little bit longer than yourself. Dig deep and get that 2x1 setup so you can start progressing!

review: My advice as a non hardcore player of this game. Play on the modded servers which give you faster XP and 5x resources when farming. Also gives you some options for some starting items like basic tools.This subverts most of the issues people have which are slow farming at the start and not being able to compete with the speed at which large clans can level up and farm. Yes they still dominate the server but you can have an absolute amazing time solo or paired with a small group because you can build a credible base very quickly.Overall I love this game. But I did not play the original version.

review: I awaken on a beach it's daylight not another soul in sight. I decide to run toward the nearest structure i can see. As i begin moving i see him. Naked cluching a rock. He sprints at me rock held above his head like an enraged primate. Fearful i run from him. He's right behind me i can hear his heavy breathing. He begins chanting 'I'm gonna getcha I'm gonna getcha' melodic and in a New Zealand accent. I turn to throw my own rock at him. 'Oh watcha ya gonna hit me with now eh?' he says as he closes in an me. I try to run again but he is too close i lost ground having fruitlessly thrown my rock. 'I'm gonna kill you boy then im gonna eat ya ye hear me i'm gonna eat ya!' his voice somehow sounding even more sinister with his Kiwi accent. CRUNCH he hits me in the back of the head CRUNCH I'm on the ground writhing in agony screaming. 'Now you die and now i eat' the last word i hear as he rains his final blow on my head. This happened on my 3rd of 4th spawn was truely creepy yet entertaing.

review: This game is incredible in no way shape or form will you be disappointed with this game. An amazing life simulator that represents 5000 BC 2000 AD all in one map. You start out as a caveman naked alone with a rock in your possesion. After countless hours of crafting and mining resources you build your homestead. You learn how to PVP and kill everyone in sight without a thought. The world is cruel so don't travel alone. At times the game can seem like a horror simulator other players and clans will sneak attack from the bushes. Typically they have guns and you don't. But eventually after you respawn enough times you will have your first gun and go on a killing spree. Like a mass murderer. You get a flame thrower burn down a wooden door and loot the dead bodies of your victims. Take a second to admire the world around you go home assemble an auto turret invite people inside only to be shot into pieces. The greatest piece of Personal Computer lure ever synthesized 10/10.

review: Excellent game and a massive drain of time if one is not careful!However this game certainly is not every person's cup of tea. It is a demanding game that requires a great deal of effort to be put in. It also requires persistence and perseverance you will likely be killed at some point and lose everything you have been working so hard for. But if you can find the strength to retaliate and play on you will find it extremely rewarding (nothing beats sweet sweet revenge).I recommend this game to anyone looking for an adrenaline rush like no other. You will never be the same when outside alone.This review was written during the alpha stage of development. Although it is not technically in its final release stage there are only minor bugs and very few to boot even less than many AAA titles of late.

review: Just bought the game during the haloween sale and got to say it is worth the money. Thought I would hate it considering the "toxic" community I kept hearing about but I think people miss the point. Rust is rust. You will get killed over and over again by squeakers telling you how much they wrecked you with their AK when you are naked. Your base will get blown to bits almost all the time. If you can accept that and like games where every moment is dangerous then you will like rust. The building system progression and pvp is fun. I have a lot of hours in ARK and like the idea of weeklk bi weekly etc wipes. In ark when you get raided you might lose all tribe members combined thousands of hours of gameplay. In rust you can farm up the same amount of stuff pretty quickly after you get raided or just server hop to somewhere else. I would definatly recommend this game to fans of the genre but if you are fan of the genre you should already have it. I waited to long.

review: where do we start lol(my 2nd account alright im not 12 and have 30 hours) well personally i have really enjoyed this game through the 1500 or so hours ive spent on my main account. ive been playing for around 2 years and it has been one of the most rage enducing and toxic games ever. you die with a full inventory to someone hacking or just plain out roaming with a 8 man zerg. but yet you always come back.. never known why to be honest with you but from my gametime the community in this game has grown higher and higher and higher to be one of my most favorite survival games but along with that the community grew to be more toxic. i think that one of the worst things to ruin this game for me was the community. i make friends and enemies. my enemies are a 6 man group farming all day to raid my 3x3. i wake up to be raided than called the N word in chat. i started this game playing with a group of 4 cool guys on a 10x fun for a new player. but soon i wanted more. i play high pop official server and theyre quite ing ridiculous on your Facepunch servers with the hackers. ive recently wanted to compare this game to hurtworld dayz and miscreated. reason is that the fact that it seem like you put these updates out that are quite honestly irrelevant. boats. really? its fun and all at first but why toxic 12 year olds on land is bad enough let alone pirates. this game personally gets alot better when you ARE better. i learned the ak sprays just recently before this ak patch i learned it was good with it found satisfaction in kills wanted to play more. than you changed it AGAIN. why? i no longer learn it and just whiff on people like they do on me. this game has always and will always be focused on groups. sad. to have a 20 man group to raid another 20 man group on day 1 of a wipe is quite dumb and getting rolled up as a solo by them on is worse. this game will definately will always be high priority on my list will always come back to when bored desperate or have a group.sadly for any new players that have never seen a youtube video on this game or have no friends i do not recommend this game is stressful and very rage enducing hah what am i saying i ended up here after dying to a 7 man group with aks on a 40 pop server a day before a wipe on rustafied odd. Personal things i believe should be added or fixed Go back to the ak before this this ones ing annoying you add dumber sprays people cant learn so they dont wanna learn it and script. solos vs. large groups. yes weve all seen ing Hjune alright what a god he fights a 12 man zerg he has 7500 hours and specializes in solo cool. not everyone is a ing dad like him grind for scrap. for real here. to simply make an ak you need 2550 ING SCRAP! disgusting thats not including armor ammo and meds personally i like the whole workbench thing gives it a grind cant craft an ak on the go like component system which i like but miss tbh. invalid shots. alright this has been the death to me. the amount of time i shoot a man in the head 2 times and theyre invalid is quite stupid. is it because im lagging? the other players lagging? anti cheat? either way its dumb. performence. i have a 1060 i7 6500 8gb alright not bad better than most. i play at potato with max draw draw distance. i installed panjos fps increaser for rust did nothing. its not fps that it mostly annoying if i play between 55 120 i cant tell the difference. its the fact that my game stutters. i have done all these console commands that kinda work but it still does it. i have a good computer and ik thats not the problem.sadly i would recommend this game to nobody new to gaming solo or survival. this is not a survival game. this is just another toxic fps styled game meant to waste your time to get offlined by a "pro" clan. i think personally that my main problem is the COMMUNITY. horrible toxic disgusting. i like to be cool when i kill or get killed but i just get called a n*gger and get told to my self. i think overall this game could be fun again where people enjoyed it for a survival game and had fun with eachother.

review: The game is really nice really realistic and not based on farming The one thing that i dont like in this game is that its really unoptimazed and the community is really trash 90% of the people will kill you even if you have nothing on you . 1 thing i also dont like is the lack of scopes in the game there is only a 4x scope which requires to have a lvl 3 bench which is hard to make (there are other scopes but they are kinda useless)Everything else is really nice the building in the game is really nice you have a lot of options and the terrain wont block you from building things the pvp is really nice BUT you will have a huge advantage if you have a friend besides you as he will be able to revive you the bad thing is that if you see 3 people coming on you with good guns when you only have a bow then you know what's gonna happen )The servers are really good most of them have a unique map on them which means you will be playing a lot of different maps . they also have lots of players with really good ping 150/250 players 70ms . Well thats all . If you find the game on sale deffinately buy it if its not on sale still buy it
