review: Im naked hungry and cold. My arms are cramping from holding this rock for so long. I walk along a road that is littered with old cans. I break a can to find cannon like pistol. I continue down the road until i find a power plant it looks as if no one has seen the place in years. I craw through the place looking for anything to help with the cut on my leg from the bear. I hear a gunshot in the distance i shrug it off and continue on. The gun shots come closer and closer until they sound as if they are a couple of meters away. I peek out a rusted window to see a naked man laying down with two men standing over him. The men wear gleaming armor and red jackets their faces hidden to hide their identity. The naked man says "I have nothing you # #$ #$". The man with the ak responds "Oh don't be a sh$t stain you little c ck". The air rings with sound of mutiple gun shots. The naked man's face is gone. I gag covering my mouth. The man on the left points up to my window. I start to run as fast as i can to the escape. I hear a crackle and feel a pain in my left leg. I fall to the groud screaming. "Aww look what we have hear" a pause "You know i kinda like this one" ...."REally why is that" "Well look at the size of his d!ck its so small". I lay looking at the metal men as they mock me. The man with the ak say "Whats wrong shorty". The man crouches in my face. I cry out for mercy the men look at each other then i see a muzzle pointed to my face. Best game 10/10

review: Rust Start with nothing finish with nothing.I bought Rust back in the day's of Legacy Rust is a great game for making new friends because if you dont make friends you wont last long..The game is PVP dont expect to last long on a popular server. Unfortunately for me I do not handle well in PVP fights and usually end up second best. It is difficult to survive when the larger groups basically hunt you down and have the resources to raid your base in a minute or 2 while you just cower in the corner of your base waiting for it to end.Mining and underground home's with hidden trap doors would be nice ) I dont survive well above ground lolHonestly I would probably still pay $20 today for what it has become.P.S. I have to agree with other reviewers the xp system makes it near impossible to overthrow the dedicated few that spend every living hour ingame. Start a game towards the end of the week spend hours on hours making your base safe and gathering resources and next thing you know the servers going to wipe despite the name of server saying its fresh wiped.Killing &amp Raiding fellow players is the game.

review: Surprised by the negative reviews this game has been getting so think it's worth writing a review.I got Rust in the Humble Bundle in August2016. Around the time No Man Sky came out between the two I'd prefer Rust anytime but I understand it's not for anyone.Issue The survival part is tedious bears are too strong.It is a survival game so yes it's difficult but then is this specifically a problem with the game or the fact that maybe survival genres just aren't your thing.Issue Can't change race/gender of the character.Admittedly a controversial feature but I think it's quite fun to make do with what you have has put my partner from playing the game though so again not that he is a racist/sexist unlike some reviewers!Issue Clans dominating serversI've been playing on a low population server and have not seen or heard about all the problems people are facing with clans if being around a big group doesn't work for you then find another server. Chances are you'll get to explore a new map and that's part of the excitement for me. I m not sure how I feel about the server wipes (all construction removed and players reset to lvl1) I think it s one of the options in making sure the servers don t become too full of eyesore inducing landmarks .Overall I d definitely recommend Rust if you want a decent survival game the social/MP aspect of the game is super fun.

review: Rust. A game about survival against fellow players instead of nature. Well I take that back.. bears are a . Perhaps one of the most important aspects of this game is the persistence of you and your stuff in the online world. When you log off your body remains. Hopefully you secured it and your loot in a house with metal doors or else your will log on to find that a man named "Dank Hill" killed you in your sleep and took your loot. Beyond this Rust will probably end up surprising you at how savage other people are. Don't expect help from anyone. Do however expect to be shot on sight even if you just respawned. Player interaction of which is the key feature the Devs like to mess with. Facepunch always works on and improves opportunities that encourage players to come in contact with one another. Whether its a race for an airdrop or siply foraging for supplies you're going to have to meet players whether you like it or not. The only flaw with these systems however is that the game does not suit a casual player too well. The game requires hours a day of your time in order to be productive. Working with a group can help this tremendously though. PVP is a ongoing development but is pretty solid. Certain balance changes can make it frustrating at times. Though rust pvp does require a skill to succeed. Rifles have more recoil that has to be dealt with pistols/ smg's do less damage and really require head shots to do the most damage and even bows/ crossbows are deadly but have no good reticle to shoot from and have travel time. Building iss my personal niche in the game which offers a large amount of creativity and beauty. However most buildings are utilitarian. Built for defense and function. While id love to make a log beach house I guarantee you it would be raided in a day or two. Against flame throwers and explosives you simply have to make buildings ugly in order to keep the loot safe. Overall Rust is a wonderfully balanced "early access" game. New content comes out bi weekly on average and the devs do a good job at showing progress.

review: Rust Pros Rust is an extremely original survival sandbox game. The building system in game is amazing resulting in large amounts of variety with player bases. Several tactics are always used in building such as airlocks or roof camps but these become a common part of the game after you become better at the game. The combat in Rust is truly unique. Early primitive gameplay is very challenging because it comes down to bow and arrows and spears while further into the wipe there is more players with guns and high grade armor. Lots of servers offer a customizable experience such as PvP modded and much more. Player interaction is the back bone of the entire experience. Cons Servers vary but many reset weekly. After 200hr of playing it gets to the point where it feels that it is unnecessary to play. The further into the week the worse the game is. There are plenty of hackers and cheaters on the game. Clans and large groups can ruin the game at times. Side Notes I bought Rust 50% off around $9.99. I feel that the $10 price tag AND the $20 price tag are worth it. I saw myself buying skins very often wanting to support the devs more. I have 285 hours played at the time of writing this review. Rust is an early access game that is changing every week so this review might not hold up in a large amount of time. Summary Rust is a PVP survival game that is truly amazing. The building system allows for many strategies for counter raiding and customization. Combat is truly amazing leaving you with melee early on in the week in a primitive style fight to the death and with high tech guns and weaponry at the end of the week. If you get tired of busting your tail on survival you can head on over to an Embankment server and battle it out to the death with no risks of losing everything youve worked for. The people you meet and trust on Rust with leave you with many friendships over the time of playing. There are power in numbers with Rust so the game is more fun with friends. This goes for the other way too and the game can be very unfun when there is a group of 10 people outside your hard earned base. After several resets and successful base builds it gets to the point where it feels like the game is pointless. Maybe Facepunch can solve this one day. The Verdict Rust is great. I rate it a 7/10.
title: Rust

review: I am going to refrain from having the typical "Garry Newman screwed this up" review. So when I got the game before the new version was available the game was fun. It took a little to get used to before I really started to enjoy it. One of the things that makes it very enjoyable is playing with friends. I cannot stress enough that you NEED to play with friends. It can get really boring playing by yourself per my opinion. Since the newer version of Rust came out I had to uninstall the game because my laptop can no longer handle it sadly. TL DR If you are a loner this game sucks.

review: I recommend this game ONLY if you have a lot of friends and or a group. Now tho and I am talking for the majority of the players. I can not recommend it. Since they changed the progression system. It is now a nightmare to do anything if you are a solo player. I would advise FacePunch Studios to go back to either the componet system or the XP system. The better system would be the XP in my opinion it requires work to get up to speed with your life and it is not dictated by some stupid 2500 Scrap. The people who like or even say the Blueprint system (New and current system) Is good are clans or groups. This game needs a better progression system and the componet and XP were the best we had.If the game would not be such a and actually care about the majority of the players. It would go back to the XP or componet system. Fix this.

review: Welp I have well over 800+ by the time this is read Ill have about 1000 but it's all good.I run this game on a GTX 1070 and It runs well If I want more fps Ill turn the graphics down but other wise no fps drop. The main problem with this game is all the hackers. There are so many but Ill list the to three. Aim Hackers Jump Hackers and Mine Hackers. Alot of them don't mess with you unless you run into them in the wild or have alot of gear/supplies. I bought this game on sale for 10$ and feel that the 20 would be worth it. this game doesn't take much time to learn I'd say about a week but there is allways new stuff with weekly updates and bug fixes. If you really want to play this get ready to put atleast 2 hours in a day and many late nights on weekends having fun. If you want to know the trick to getting around hackers then play one week wipe servers in community these almost allways have plenty of people and admins to stop the hackers. Have fun and I hope this review is helpful!

review: &gt Buys Rust in excitement while on sale.&gt Decides to pop Rust cherry and jump into the first server I see.&gt Log in to find myself nude on a beach (not much different from my actual life)&gt When before I can wake from my slumber I hear footsteps.&gt Getting to my feet my voice is hoarse and will not make a sound (no mic at the time)&gt I see a nude black man running towards me with a large rock.&gt I quickly realize he is not the friendly neighborhood naked man and that he wants me dead.&gt I turn and run my man parts are bouncing between my thighs as I sprint for my life.&gt I run through several bushes hoping to break line of sight.&gt Stopping to catch my breath I look around to see if I'm safe.&gt Thinking I'm alone I walk off to discover this new land.&gt The next bush I run through lashes out and attacks me as someone had laid a shiny new bear trap under its cover.&gt Wailing on my back and thinking this is the end the black man shows up once again.&gt Helping me to my feet I start to think I've just made a friend.&gt Black man equips giant rock and bashes my skull in.&gt RIP10/10 would rather have this experience than any other.Game is great performance is difficult for older computers however no matter how often you die how big your base is how long your dong is the game will always give you a new experience each time you play.

The community is like if almost everybody was in a wasteland or stranded island farming and killing others on sight to survive. review: This game has potential to be really amazing and there are a lot of aspects that I find appealing about it. However the way the game is designed currently I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I think this game breeds the type of community it has (notoriously ). As a new player you won't have much room to breathe and experience the game mechanics without being attacked and killed often enough to make that initial "oohhhh I smash the rock with my rock to get stuff to get a hatchet!" stage enjoyable which I think is sad. You can always join a PvE server or an empty server to give yourself room to learn but to what end? Staying on a PvE server would get incredibly dull unless simply building a large base satisfies you. Once you grasp the crafting blueprint hunting and base building systems what other reason do you have to keep playing? Heading to a PvP server means dealing with everything you've worked for being constantly in danger because you aren't online 24/7. You could log in any time to find that you have to start from scratch again which is incredibly frustrating. And when you are online every single player you see is a potential threat and they will view you as such. Being someone who wants to say hi and not murder every new person you meet puts you at a serious disadvantage. If you choose not to be an you WILL lose your progress more often than otherwise. Not only does being a jerk keep you from losing your gear as much you will GAIN their gear. Thus S BECOME STRONGER S.I think thats where the "breeds toxicity" idea comes from and it makes the game unenjoyable to me. Part of the appeal of this game is the true "survival" and permanence of your character and stuff even when logged out but it isn't satisfying when everyone seems to want to destroy and kill everything because what the else would they do with their AK and C4.

review: This is one of the hardest things I have ever had to write. Not to be dramatic but it is almost like a euology at dead friends funeral. You remember all of the best parts of the friendship the bad moments and the definitive end. I want to state this clearly to be sure every single person who reads this is aware I no doubt had fun with this game. BUT. I had fun with old rust honestly the best moments I have ever had were in old rust and very little in old rust. I will admit to something I believe gives me a good amount of credibility in my review I am not one of those sissies who are "hero" players and all that t. The people who only help people in this game are absolutely foolish their cause is pointless and will never achieve anything. I have played since the old old rust whenever everyone ed about bears and wolves and when you didnt get a good blueprint from the rad town animals. In old rust I played in a clan I played solo and I have even (regrettably) played as a hacker. Not one of the KOS ones just one who gave people free stuff. In new rust I've been in vanilla clans modded clans I've played vanilla solo modded solo and even RP solo on a medieval server. I've been "part of the problem" as a KOS killer I've given new players tip and resources and I've snuck through the whole world avoiding all contact with other players.The only thing that connects old rust and new rust is the developer. Old rust players who have mostly moved on from the game (unless they were like me and were young when it first came out) and the group of people that have taken their place are why this game gets negative reviews. I've met people from old rust and I can certainly promise you none of they are openly hostile without at the very least talking to you and trying to fix something be that a tax or an offering. In old rust I was in a hostage situation I had to descalate a gunfight over resources I was raided by dubstep blasting swedes and Ive built some of the largest bases in hacker valley (I did that legit not through hacks tho). This was when people in rust had to talk to one another the common player had to talk his way out of getting his head blown off and his taken. In new rust there is so often no talking. The new community of this game seem to be all of the KOS players from DayZ leaving a dead game to join a thriving game to continue the absolute savagery of killing noobs. Honestly being someone who has done it often it is so funny until they actually die. Once that player with nothing died you check their inventory and in your mind go "what was the actual point of that?" as you see only a torch and rock. But you just can't stop doing it. All of this game is getting bullied and bullying others back. Once someone kills you the need for vengence is instant and it doesnt seem to matter who it is. The next person you see had to die to right the wrong you faced. Anyone who denies this just hasn't looked at this game objectively and their actions likewise. This game's players will not often spare you they will blow in the wall of your house and kill you while you're at work and they have a day off school. I remember getting excited whenever I had a day off school and it wasn't a holiday that meant people from other states were offline and their bases vunerable. Oh and I almost forgot in all of my hours in this game I'd wager I've been raided around 100ish times and I truthfully only remember around 15/20 active raids (raids where I am online and able to actively defend) of my base. The rest of the time you will definitely get your walls blown open by a middleschooler with the day off. Anyway back to the main topic of this paragraph. The community in this game has taken a "shoot first taunt over voice chat later" theme and I just personally get behind it.This game's mechanics are fantastic the optimization is eh (it's being worked on tho facepunch is a great dev) the gunplay is intense and quick but the community will ruin any humanity you have going in to this game. You will kill out of fear and you will kill players out of greed for loot. You will enjoy this game if you played Dayz and would kill without remorse or asking questions. You will dislike this game greatly if you want a community that is sometimes hostile and would talk to you and wouldn't shoot you in the face without seeing if you'd offer resources for your life. If human contact doesn't bother you buy this game and do whatever you want the only people to punish you are those you have wronged and the best clans in the server.My last warning is to all the people who buy this game and think they can be a "hero" and save the population of this game from everyone who murders them. You will quickly fall into the rythm of kill or be killed there is no way around it. Being nice in this game is actually so rare people use it as clickbait titles to attract viewers. Idk about you but to me that's pretty ed up.

review: First of all I want to point out that I'm still playing this game a lot. It's hard for me to decide if I should write a positive or negative review. This game has potential for sure. Without all the old and new bugs it would be a great game. But I read ingame that they wanted us to tell them they suck at their jobs and well here I am.They shouldn't be doing weekly updates. This is my first point. Why? They are putting pressure on themselves and releasing semi stable to completely unplayable content.They should spend at least one hour with testing their update if its finished. Devs themselves with their different PCs and specs should check it out before releasing the hell on everybody like people who can't see some building parts and cheat unwilligly because they can just walk through loot boxes killing people game crashes galore after retrying 1 2 sec on the server it happens again and so on. But when I saw people fly away with airdrops I wondered if Facepunch is doing night shifts with lots of alcohol or what the hell is wrong with those coders.I understand the definition of alpha but they should try to fix at least the major bugs before releasing. They shouldnt do weekly updates and they also shouldnt even announce when they update comes because right now I am waiting and waiting and waiting and I am so bored that I even write a review. When the update launches I can guarantee there will be some major bugs once again."3 26pm EST Last minute fix for locks on armored doors just pushed... This update should hit any time now...""4 08pm EST Devblog 50 just dropped the update should hit shortly..."Facepalm developers were probably hammering some junk code into the gamein the last 40 minutes because they want to finish the promised content. In this kind of stress situations I am not surprised that such fatal bugs occur.After all its still alpha. I liked the last update except the bugs. Don't leave all the bug testing to the community do some of it yourself.EDIT This review was 6 months old. They didn't have any major bugs and I like the new content.Thus I changed it into a positive review now.

review: So where to start on this game. The devs arent that great at listening to players. Each month that ive noticed they keep adding certain things to help eliminate something people complain too much about even though it would be bound to happen. Ghosting can no longer be a thing now that the new team system is in (Dont mistake me for a ghoster). People who ghosted zergs succeeded because said zergs never set up traps such as shotgun traps or auto turrets that LITERALLY NEGATE GHOSTING. Instead facepunch adds a team system that allows you to be able to see who is where and if anybody is actually trying to ghost your team. So now they are INSTEAD of punishing ignorant zergs but helping them out. And that is another thing. YOU WILL GET ZERGED. Unless you play on solo/duo/trio servers (where you will still run into a bigger group than yours) you will get zerged. You cant escape them.On the topic of zergs good luck trying to play on any offiical server. A guy by the name of Neeko is what started this entire zerg how. Before when rust was actually good the only MAJOR zergs were CML and DMG. After DirtMcGirt disbanded DMG for IRL reasons Neeko made his own zerg to continue the "zerg v zerg" rivalry with a group i dont remember fully. But then after all of this he ended up making his own zerg and keeping it which then caused a bunch of other zergs to pop up in order to contest with a 25 year old man running 20 deep. So there is Rustafied Main in a nutshell. Now you got a guy named Jack Shepherd who makes a "friendly" leaderboard of every weekly wipe on the major zerg infested official servers (Rusty Moose Included). So not only do you have a game that heavily supports mass numbers but now you got the game turning itself into a ego fest becasue people want to be better than someone else. (Sure you will have that in games like this). But it isnt neccessary for groups to be rolling 30+ deep on a server with 400 pop. So unless you like playing on official where you can get zerged very easily or running on community dedicated servers that have braindead admins that will ban you for being good I would advise against getting this game. I have over 6k hours shared across multiple accounts and after playing it for almost 3 years it just isnt worth the stress that this game brings to you.

review: Rust is the best survival pvp shooter on the market right now hands down. The developers are constantly updating the game and do a great job of responding to community suggestions for better or for worse. This game is HARD and you will be punished constantly for your mistakes by other players but boy is it fun once you start to get the hang of things. Playing solo will be hard but possible if your on a server that limits group size. In my opinion the best way to play is with a group of 2 5 friends. Some say the community is toxic but i dont think its any more toxic than any other competitive game. Lots of people are complaining about the twig update but they are just affraid of change. The devs are constantly testing new ways to improve the game this is early access after all and nothing game breaking ever stays to long. The dev team really know what they are doing here and really have a passion for trying to make the best game they can. That is their only goal and thats how a good developer should be.

review: FunRust is a very fun and yet so annoying game. Something about dying can make me go insane. Losing the gear you have unless you get to it in time. You drop the object in your hand as well so you have to look for that in the grass.Rust is really fun to play with friends make a castle and raid others. You need lots of materials which might prove to be hard to get to make a small stone house.DangerRust has lots and lots of dangerous things like bears or that damn helicopter. The helicopter will appear from time to time shooting and bombing players with gear. The only way to kill it is to shoot it down and then the loot burns for what seems to be forever.Bears have lots of health and they can kill you with ease. One time about four friends and I attacked a bear it killed me and died after because of the twenty arrows in its face. There is also wolves but they not too dangerous.CreateIn Rust you can create castles houses towns clothing weapons and loads of other things. I personally like to build prisons for my slave friend Storm.Final thoughtsOverall it's a great game fun to play with friends and can make you rage with even a single death. It's hard but it's worth it. I recommend this game.

review: Day 1 Spawn get chased by a few nakeds with rocks. Make a small humble base for yourself if you're lucky.Day 2 You have some okay stuff you now carry around a shotgun and or revolver in your journeys of farming and looting. You proceed to meet a bunch of mean people who kill you.Day 3 You have a moderately advanced base and have a good amount of stuff after many deaths from both geared and non geared people. You decide it's time to raid.Day 4 You've raided many bases and now you consider yourself quite geared with lots of loot and a good amount of weaponsDay 5 You encounter a large jerk clan who forces you to do certain things for them threatening to raid you. You grudgingly listen to them but get raided anyways. Everything you worked for in the past 5 days is all gone. You spawn on the beach with the nostalgic yet bitter rock surrounded by mentally challenged people who of course are cheering you up.Day 6 / 7 You are now unmotivated and much too burnt out to continue the wipe and tell yourself "Next wipe I'll do better" and switch to another game for the rest of the wipe.Rinse and Repeat.

review: Cool game I did prefer the legacy though. Cons No character customization which bothers me a little More PvP than PvE which in a survival game doesn't sit right HOWEVER it ramps up the difficulty of actually surviving Bad Community most of the time I like roleplaying sometimes "innofensive" trolling but a lot of the people playing the game can be childish and outright offensive Farm for 10 hours lose it before you close your base door... P.S. Harder for solo players but not impossible.Pros Updates "Live" game A real sense of danger Mods Skins Not P2W Heavily concentraded on raids which in a massive scale are friggin awesome Awesome to play with friends Awesome possibilities with base building A lot of tutorials for "Know How" in youtube.TBH it's not my favourite game but if you like a heavily PvP focused survival game in which the survival aspect is absolutely present every second of your playthrough then this game is for you.This isn't my favourite game because of these aspects I prefer Solo and it can be harder in Rust. I like chill games so I can explore the world and build things I'm not a fan of the community you can manage but idk I dislike it.

review: I've played essentially every survival looting game in existence. Out of all of them Rust's building mechanics are the best the guns feel the best (not saying much) and it not too grindy. There's only one issue with it the majority of the community is complete and utter aids. You will deal with the absolute bottom of the barrel when playing this game these kids are just the worst. Get used to using a bow and spear and you'll be fine but you'll always have to deal with the kids on the game. You have 3 kinds of people.1. "Role Players" is the title given to anyone who talks to anyone else. It doesn't mean the same thing in this game because of how ed the playerbase is. Have a chair somewhere in your house? Role Player. Have a carpet at your front door? Role Player. These kids can't even categorize properly. You're an RP'er if you don't KOS or use a mic.2. "Raiders" are just infants who wait until other players are offline to raid their base and steal their These kids don't have the mental capacity to realize that you don't always have to raid they go as far as to mock people who use mic or socialize int he slightest. It is fun to do raiding but these kids are more on the sadistic side where they don't socialize and play the game for personal benefit only. The server wipes and they come right back to do it again...it seems this play style has very little benefit of enjoyment.3. Everyone else just gets killed by raiders while looting or killed by raiders while talking to role players. That's this game.You will 90% of the time wake up somewhere random having been raided while sleeping. Enjoy.8/10

review: ***********REVIEW AS OF 2 12 2018**********************As you can see I've changed my mind about Rust due to its recent return to a Blueprints system of which a vast minority wanted due to the simple fact that BPs break the core concept of Rust.I don't really need to explain this. BPs are only slightly marginally better than the leveling system was. Which was the worst place Rust has ever been due to the grind wall you had to climb to even be able to defend yourself with a basic bow. (Pretty sure bows and arrows were unlocked at level 6 or 7 so the were you supposed to do to defend yourself for the first 5 levels? Nothing. Die.)Now defensive weapons are behind a grind wall even worse. RNG BPs. The drop rate of which is abysmally low. During an hour of gameplay at a warehouse smashing barrels constantly I found only 3 blueprints all of which were decorative pieces for inside a base. No weapons. I found 12 pistol bodies 200 high quality ore thousands of frags from grinding all the useless components I was finding because I could not build anything. Then a double barrel shotgun guy ran up on me and killed me. That was where I uninstalled Rust... Again. The first time was during the leveling phase. Anyway don't expect to ever play Rust on an even field as anyone else ever again if they plan on keeping the BP system. Most of the components you find are completely useless to you even in grinding them down. You can literally do nothing with them. Carrying them just helps geared guys who kill you because they know you're carrying top tier loot because you can't do anything with it.Rust is in a terrible place right now. Certainly does not justify it's price hike. Buyer beware. Rust changes it's entire core concept every few months. This is another phase. When the devs are done jerking off over their hair models im sure they will redo everything again. Do not buy.Buyer beware.(This is all on top of the completely toxic 12 year old cancerous "community" who no lifes Rust to watch their virtual swing between their legs.)

review: absolute waste of 20 dollars ever since they updated it a couple months ago. this game has been ruined unless your playing with a group (5+) you probably wont even be able to play this game. instead of being able to make any item in the game as long as you had the crafting materials you now have to grind for hours just so you can get enough scrap to research how to make the simplest things like a sign or a pair of pants. 250 scrap to research a gun and breaking a barrel gives you 1 scrap. plus you cant research anything till you build a blueprint table another 500 scrap and a workbench which is another 500 scrap for a level 1 workbench 750 for level 2 workbench and 1500 for a level 3 workbench (you need at least level 2 to make guns) and you dont upgrade the workbench you have to build completely new workbenches as to build a level 2 workbench you have to already own a level 1 workbench. you also have to already have the item to research it and said item is destroyed once you research it. so as a solo player or even like i was with me and my brother. if your lucky enough like i was to get your hands on a gun you have to destroy it in order to make one yourself. just so i could make a gun i needed a total of 2000 scrap and then all the materials to make said gun. lets not forget bullets either as you need to research those as well. the way the game is now people in large groups have all the power and will kill you on sight so there is very slim odds that you will even be able to make a house. i played solo the day after the update and it took me about 4 hours just to build a house and in that time there was already groups of 10 or more people running around with guns and explosives raiding peoples bases. this game is absolute garbage now and i regret buying it. hopefully they fix the game and get rid of this stupid workbench update as it was so much fun before and now i dont even want to play it. dont buy this game it sucks now if you want to waste 20 dollars just flush it down the toilet and you will probably have more fun anyways

review: I can't reccommend this game and the reason is very simple its very frustrating to play.The first thing is that it is based on a leveling system something that DOES NOT and WILL NEVER work in a survival game like this. Players starting out will be very frustrated by their inability to craft advanced weapons armor and gear and be forced to spend hours grinding to be able to craft but will be killed often by players who just want blood.The next thing is the experienced players don't want to help you. They want to keep you alive long enough to laugh at you and then dance around your dying corpse and maybe not even that long. Even if you have good gear you're going to lose it within 10 minutes to someone who has a better spot on the map than you even better gear and more people. When you walk outside your base with good loot on you're going to lose it. And if its not the first or second encounter it's gonna be the third or fourth.The fun part about survival games is rarely the PVP. PVP is like the icing on the cake the core of these games is meeting the funny and interesting people along the way meeting your enemies meeting friends and meeting that Bill Cosby impersonator fresh spawn who for some reason just will not leave you alone. And RUST just doesn't create that experience the only types of people you'll meet are the blood thirsty wolves that just wanna be s and show you how much of a bigger they have than you by picking on the little guys.RUST succeeds in its gun play beautiful enviornment base building mechanics and how smooth it feels or how clunky it doesn't feel. Even all of this and an excellent development team at Facepunch is still not enough to make up for just how truly bad the experience is.RUST fails in so many aspects to deliver a real survival game experience and I truly expected more from a talented development studio.2/10 death simulator

review: Okay. So after about 800h and 2 years following the updates and changes i have some things to say. Not all bad and not all good.Sit down have a drink and listen to what this nobody from the internet has to say about this game.Firstly i would say that this game in its current state is meant almost a 100% for team players. Playing solo no matter how good you are will get you rekt and will leave you with a bleeding 9/10 times. Solo players live for that 1 time though where they wreck a clans day and leave them saltier than the Dead sea.As for the system goes..... I dont know really. It changed alot in the last year. I quit when they released the XP system and came back like a week ago. Nothing will ever be as good as the old BP system. If you are into base building then Rust is pretty much the best in that aspect. You can build pretty much whatever you want but in the end you will be offline raided by a clan with no problems at all. There are some smart people playing this game i will tell you that.If you are new to this than my advice and pretty much anyone elses who spent a couple hundred hours in this game is that DONT play on the official servers as they are full of hackers that are fine and ready to take your vaseline free and leave it sore and red. Community servers are a bit better regarding hackers altough if you dont play on Rustafied Rustopia or Rusty moose you will most likely suffer from a fatal disease called admin abuse which is spreading like a plague. If you do find a server that hasnt got any and can keep up high pop trough all of the wipe stick to it like on my toilet wall.This game is not for casual players. If you cant play for atleast 40 50 hours a week you will not get to experince the game whole and will only play what we call "Early game" and maybe "mid game". Low tier weapons and people trying to hunt down farmers. You wont be able to be there when high lvl loot raids go down and see the cryies of a thousand man clans of 12 year old who type or Turk amk in chat....what made me stick to this game in the first place was the community in the begging which was nice and helpful. later that changed into KOSing 12 year olds that can barely speak english trough their 1 microphones that they got in a 12 pack of dads beer. If you have a decent computer you will be able to run this game as it was meant and the game looks absolutely stuning on Fantastic. If you are like me than you will most likely choose the Potato setting for that extra 10 FPS. All in all i will say this game is worth buying for 20 . This game wasnt meant to be played 2 hrs a day every week or so. This game was meant to rack up hundreds of hours in a month or two. The only way you will enjoy playing it if you dont give up afer being killed 10 times on wipe day by a screaming kid with a spear.I'm out and God bless

review: This game's development cycle has looped around for the worse.Not counting Legacy there has been BP which people liked. XP which people seemed to like but it wasnt well recieved apparently components which had no progression and made the game as a whole worse and now components with blueprintsNow scrap used to be used to make components but now it's just a diet bp frag with components having to be recycled to get them in any amount high enough to be even remotely useful and scraps just function as XP that can be lost and workbenches just function as levels that can be lost.The Dev's work hard to produce stuff every week but they half literally everything and anything and all the while only somewhat listen to the community. They're too stubborn to let the fan base decide what to do and when they actually do listen its to the bad ideas just making it a self fulfilling prophecy to them so they no longer trust the community and self justify it with their own lack of thought.I legitimately want to like this game but not only do they keep looping around with what they do they remove the good parts and half bake their replacements.

review: Unplayable unless you either play with a bounch of people (which simply isnt fun unless you are terrible at the game because it ruins the challange of pve and pvp) or if your entire life is revolving around rust only.Did'nt use to be like this but after they made litteraly anything that is even remotly good completly unaffordable to solo/duo players it became dull as hell.Stylistically the game was at its best with the xp system actually giving solo players an even playing field with clans when it came to progression. These days you can pretty much forget ever reliably owning anything better than a semi pistol and wood armour if you're playing solo or duo.Facepunch has kept saying they are unable to find a proper solution to the unfairness between solo players and clans but its silly... since they had the solution in the XP system.The fact that they've also made everything which is somewhat decent exstremly expencive is yet another thing heavily favouring clans as they are the only ones able to obtain the high tier stuff giving them both numbers and gear advantages. This did'nt use to be a problem either when gear and guns were cheaper it gave solo/duo players even firepower at the very least allowing skilled individuals to actually put up a fight facepunch seems to have completly missunderstood how to make progression work making the guns expencive and hard as hell to craft is not the right way and the current system is just a mess.This would all be fixed if they just never went away from the xp system such a clean simple and functioning progress system the game could've been great with it now.
title: Rust

review: Rust My summed up thoughts of the game and how this review should influence your decision to be the one of the many thousands who purchase a copy of Rust or one of many who don't own it.Rust a progressive game followed closely by community support (mostly depending on what server you play)in an official server you are handicapped greatly if you play alone the only way to have the upper hand in combat is by outnumbering your opponents or by relying on your experience and confidence in landing shots and dealing fast enough to escape death that is if your opponent isn't using some form of assistive aim don't get me wrong all games have some form of scripters to assist their combat in some way and gain an unfair advantage which isn't a problem for some people but however Rust is an and I stress greatly a very time consuming game you either have to be a youtuber who can be on rust and make money doing it or a near no life to have the time to maintain a base alone that is and even then there is still a possibility of a scripter destroying your time spent on a server within minutes.with rust getting a price mark up I have one thing to say for people looking to buy rust.1 unless you can afford to play nearly 24/7 you can't maintain a base easy this game will destroy your will to play or give you an brain stroke out of anger when you log in one day to find your base leveled2 (official) servers wipe all bases and characters every week which is a problem even for people who do play nearly 24/7you can avoid this by playing on community servers that wipe once every month or two weeks3 (official) servers extremely are toxic if the internet hasn't given you very thick skin by now your emotional stability may not be stable for long4 even if you refrain from playing on official servers some community servers may be as toxic or may have abusive or admins that cheat players out of their well earned loot and why would you want to take that risk when you can just play officialI fell for one of the many pre alpha rust videos and bought the game upon release and it has less scripters than what you may come across today but the time you have to put into this game just isn't worth it only to have it gone in a week (or month) that is... if you don't get raided beforehand

review: The game engine itself is impressively massive with all the detailed info to be honest. However as a game it is not something a normal person who has a life should play.First of all despite having a more than acceptable rendering engine with tons of effects the 3D models especially the players/characters are very ugly.Secondly the loading time is ridiculously long upto the point that there was once I started loading the game poured myself a cup of coffee had it finished (without haste) and the game was still loading.Thirdly the game system fosters a very unbalanced gameplay experience where people with more friends will dominate the servers. The way that players' hardwork cannot be secured the way that players can form groups to bully those without and the way that players cannot save their progress and can be killed having all the hardwork looted upon disconnection all these turn newcomers into prey and the bottom part of the game's foodchain.All in all I don't recommend this game to any sane people who have a real life and don't have hundreds of hours to spend just to kickstart. If you don't mind keep getting killed and have your hardwork looted so that you have to restart from nothing but a rock and a torch go for it.I have a lot of games since I was a kid with Nintendo gamewatch. This is easily the worst game I've ever have.
title: Rust

review: I have over 60 hours in Rust so I decided to write a short review with my thoughts on the game so far.I play mostly as a solo player lonewolfing my way up in the brutal world of Rust just so you know my point of view in this review. As a note I haven't played Rust before the XP went live so I have no idea if it's better or worse now than it was in the past. All I know is that XP system works great for me I love that moment when I ding and new unlocked designs start poping up. That gives me the sense of adventure and progression I'm looking for in games.As for the graphics they really hit the spot for me the yellows the browns sunsets early mornings it's all beautiful. I have played other survival games like The Forest Ark 7 Days to Die and none of them was as good looking as Rust is from personal esthetic point of view. I have an old rig so I can't play on max settings but I'm amazed how well optimized this game is. I never had any crashes or bugs that would keep me from enjoying the game fully. Interface is clear menus are easy to navigate. Everything is very intuitive.Now for the community. Oh where to start. Let me tell you about my first adventure. I was butt naked and running around like a happy monkey just built my small base and put truly amazing lock on the door for protection. Oh boy was I proud and excited. While exploring I saw big metal dome and thought wow nice place I should visit there must be loot somewhere. On the spot I heard a loud bang that sounded like a shotgun. As I turned around I saw a naked guy running towards me and screaming Allahu Akbar! on the mic. Few seconds later I was dead. Quickly respawning on my bag I run down the stairs only to watch in horror that my murderer just opened my locked door and entered the house. Few seconds later I was laying on the floor wounded. He helped me up. The door was locked. I couldn't get out. I didn't know back then that you can lose your base when you lose the key. I knew I could kill myself with console command and respawn in random place but I didn't want to do it. I wanted to play the psychology game. My murderer started speaking with some creepy voice. He called me his princess (my character is female) and I think he was looking for a pet (or a sex slave). He took my rock so I couldn't do anything to him. I did the only thing that came to my mind I stood next to the locked door. He wounded me few times and helped me up while still speaking creepy stuff in his creepy voice but he couldn't get out of the house. I knew he didn't want to kill me he wanted to break me. I stood silently by the door blocking his way out. When I was wounded again he still couldn't get out. I really started to enjoy my time in Rust. After few minutes he got angry gave up and killed me I considered myself satisfied.Other things that happened to me in Rust include a guy wearing only pants chopping down trees next to my base while singing Rivers of Babylon to the mic cooking in the base while suddenly hearing that someone is at my door singing in high pitched voice opeeeen the dooooor getting killed on sight killing someone with a bow for the first time getting killed by a bear killing a glitched bear and many more.I wouldn't say the community in Rust is cancerous. For me such a community exists for example in DOTA a game that I have only played for few hours and never want to get back to again. Of course you will find trolls who will just kill you again and again and again just for laughs. There will be people who will want to ruin your game because they can. But there will also be people who will help you. People who will offline raid you but take only stuff they need and leave everything you need to survive another day. Rust brings out the best and worst in people it seems.If you want you can always find a mature server with active admins and rules about griefing and killing new players. But all in all if you can't find a way around in your mind about people who play Rust to ruin someones experience you might have problem with this game. But I love it because it's mostly full of creeps not trolls. This world is a mixture of Lord of the flies Mad Max and Arkham Asylum. If you can live with that and find yourself a place in it you will have an amazing time.Servers have a wipe from time to time your base will get raided. If you're not prepared to start from zero many times you might want to skip Rust. Or you can adapt. Make some stashes in the bushes hide your most valuable stuff. Strategicaly place sleeping bags in spots that can give you adavntage if your base gets raided. By no means I am a pro player and I don't intend to give any tips. I'm just trying to survive like the rest of players and having great amounts of fun while doing it. I'm making mistakes and try to learn from them. Build better bases and play Rust on my terms while accepting the consequences of my choices.For me Rust is a psychology game. One that will make you excited everytime you're going out of the base everytime you see a person on the horizon. Because you never know if it's a friendly player or an enemy posing as someone who needs help. People even play the sound of dying man to the mic to lure you out of the house that's amazing! Everytime I die I lose all of my stuff I get raided I want to improve and that feeling keeps me coming back to Rust.
title: Rust

review: Ever since Rust introduced the ranked matchmaking system there has been a large amount of strategy and planning beforehand required to even come close to the top tier competitive world. The only way to play the game is solo since the solo/duo queue was never meant for teamwork and choosing someone else to group with is a sure fire way of losing your edge. First things first You have to pick your runes and masteries. Normally cooldown reduction runes and perks that lead up to Thunderlord's will easily net you the seven killstreak required for the attack helicopter reward which will inevitably win you the game through sheer brutality and a higher score count. Just a quick reminder that you have to flame anyone in chat that uses the ACR since that gun is for nerds and weaboos. Pros always use the desert eagle as their primary weapon despite the fact that you cannot equip it in the primary weapon slot in your create a class menu you have to beat the game with legendary difficulty on at all times ever since you last left Helgen. If you manage to mine enough stone to make a pickaxe you can start mining for the next tier of tools which are iron tools.The rest of the guide can be seen on my Let's Play series recorded on the Nintendo Switch gaming console.

review: I think I can finally write a review for this after seeing more the the current direction of this game. After seeing the latest developments in addition to the fact that this game is STILL in pre release I can safely say that you should not buy this game (unless you are cool with a sandbox of perpetuating 'work in progress')I bought this game maybe years ago when it was in alpha. it had a decent amount of content. it was entertaining for a while as I played with friends. we quickly got bored though as we were not into this type of game. after all this time I came back to play a bit more. I played on some custom servers some empty servers some high pop servers so that I could see the breadth of this game. There is barely more content then when I got it however many years ago. that is sad. The conclusion is so simple that I really dont think I need to make this review all that big. The dev has absolutely no idea what he wants this game to be. He started with a concept and then broke down and let his (apparently) severe ADD take this game on a frickin roller coaster ride into nowhere special. Bugs galore fragmented purpose in the game. It does tons of different stuff and very little of it well. Half of what you do is meaningless in the grand scheme of even your own playing ofthe game. its a sad example of games that use pre release as an excuse to blow their lack of direction out of proportion and then claim they have some semblance of a good game. im being harsh because this game has been in pre release. . . . how many years now? and has barely more then when i started. Furthermore isnt going anywhere coherent.

review: Where to start? (forgive my spelling)I have been playing this game ever since the old Rust and over the years I have watched it grow into something spectacular. Even threw it's MANY flaws I adore the hell out of this game. Rust hasnt just been a game I have come to love but a game where I can reminice over all the good and bad that has happend while playing. I built Rome in a day. I concurred bases with an army of nakeds. I waged war on the Cosbys. I fought along side Pumkin agenst Corn. I developped communities castels cities and I defended them all from raiders. I have met good friends and I have met others that make you go off in chat. I have laughed countless times over the random moments this game has to offer and I have never seen such dedication from this games players. Much love to every corner of this community. I look forward to seeing where Rust will end up when it's fully done.P.s If you see a boar make sure its not a bear. Chase

review: I LOVED it. Once i started playing i couldnt stop i had to play the whole wipe. I'm family man and i cant spend all that time just playing. I bought this in summer or 2015 and man it was fun to learn all the things and to get to know the neighbours. Some of them were bloodsucking murderers and that caused me to get to know other ppl living nearby and doing teamwork to evict bad neighbours. And this game NEVER have i had a game that got me shaking this bad after i got some nice loot D Soooo many fun times.i played almost 80 90% time as solo i had the advantage of living in a timezone when i started my day in rust most ppl had gone to sleep and i could set up my base pretty peacfully on rustafied main. I had some teams at times but i couldn't stand ppl who joined everytime after the base was ready and set up with guns just to come and loose all the gear. And thats why i liked playing solo most of the time or maybe in a team of 2 3 at most. first iteration of bp's was pretty bad you couldnt get above 30% on research table. i got C4 blueprint maybe 2 3 times in whole year and i played almost 5 8hrs a day. OFC u could trade it but damn i found it hard to trust anyone on vanilla. On modded it was easier beacause ppl didnt care so much about the loot they just wanted to have good time. Many ppl took it way too serious thou. Once i had to research bolt on research table for 4 5 times and i had 3 bolts that was so many HQM that i couldnt make any guns after i got the BP. Sometimes i got AK on a first try. Afterwards they made BP system better you could add frags to get higher % and it was pretty fine. You had some way of controlling the % of the research.i played some time on pre release and the XP system was fun about 1 months before releasing it on the main game you could get XP's pretty fast and easily(but not too easily) after 2 weeks it was in the main game it turned into a grind but i didnt care that much. it was fine. I liked more about making friends and helping ppl. Im taking a break now until XP system stabilizes and its summertime here. I'v been playin way too much anyway. Its up to you if you make the game fun. different servers have different ppl and if your not having fun try other servers. battlefield servers are good way to learn to use the guns and teamwork with your team.. teamwork is really important on this game like REALLY important. try the modded servers community and vanilla and see which you like the best dont try to force yourself to have fun on a roofcamping server.
title: Rust

review: SOOOOOOOO where do we START. First of all Yes It has a toxic community yes playing solo is very hard yes you need to invest a lot of time and yes its hard to understand the basis of the game at first. But rust is much more than this it is a wonderful game most of the time sometimes you will meet some players that would be nice some not. Once you really get into it there is no getting back because each months the devs releases new updates that makes it more interesting (such as gambling *btw really adictive). The feeling of accomplishment when you get something done on wipeday is like in no other game. Try to get allied with people around you (so they don't raid you) and go raiding with them to get that 20 man korean zerg out of the server. Go and make plays with your spears when you are just a naked. To conclude Rust is a beautiful game not only the graphics wise but also the experience you get through time you will learn when to trust people or not. There is no better word to describe this game than the word RUST.

review: Product received for free. Rust is an amazing game the type that you'll find yourself playing for 17 hours straight without realizing it. The mechanics are amazing crafting system is great exploration never gets old since the maps are huge. It's extremely fun to play with friends but it does have one huge flaw you can't make your own private server for you and your friend. It's one of the game's only flaws but it is a major one since without a private server you always run the risk of being murdered forced to commit suicide (Report that when it happens) or raided. However it is up to you whether you play on a PVP server which allows behaviors such as raiding and killing on sight or play on a PVE server which bans such behavior. Now althoughPVE doesn't allow raiding killing or looting it is still recommended that you fortify your base since people will undoubtebly loot you if you make it easy (Dc'ing in the middle of nowhere with hella items.) The game's a strong 8.5/10 for me it's score lowered by the lack of private servers.

review: After several attemps at playing this game I've summed it's complete disaster of a game design down to one issue it is a social survival game that requires too much time. You are probablyasking why this is an issue for a survival game so let me explain.Rust is an Ayn Rand wet dream. Those who invest the most time will have an unimaginable advantage over others to the extent that the only way to contest this is to force server wipes to restore some sort of balance. And who are these people who gain complete control over the server anti social nobody's and kids. The exact type of person you would never get any power in real life because they lack all comprehension when evaluating the appropriate response for a social setting. Therefore the community of Rust is just childish and very unforgiving to anyone who wishes to play it even somewhat casually. First Impression You would think this would be an entertaining game but it is pretty pointless. EVERYONE kills on sight. And PvE is pointless because there is no reason to play an ultra easy survival game.Simply put people are dumb. Unless you have a IRL group of friends who will play this for you then you will not enjoy this.That said I will still probably play this from time to time. The game does need a way of easing the kill of sight t that make the game more about grinding for a monsterous amount of resources to hopefully incentivize the mindless mob to attack someone else's house..My suggestion DO NOT BUY THIS Dev Blog 121 Review Rust has had this problem since the beginning. I occasionally check back on updates when people like Faceless Zuckles or Rhino Crunch post videos on YouTube. Don't get me wrong the game is probably fun if you can spend 2 3 hours playing it every day without break. For that reason I basically haven't played rust in like a Year outside of like 5 hours scattered across a few patch tests.Rust consistently forces players to join clans and they offer no alternative play styles for people who would want to have a try at survival without dedicating hour every single day.Simply put Rust has (and probably will always have) bad game design because the developers will never address the very serious issue of unstoppable snowballing which nearly every AAA multiplayer game addresses effectively.People who join clans and play all day handicap skill with their time to the extent that casual players who might be clever builders/gathers and skillful shots will 8/10 get wiped. Adding to this has a severe shortage on mechanics which leads to these unstoppable groups steam rolling the quarter of half of the map where they have their bases.Basically this is ONLY for players willing to throw a solid 10 20 hours a week every week into this game alone. This game is essentially a part time job that you don't get paid to do.
title: Rust

review: While a huge percentage of the community for this game is simply "I see someone else lets up their day" this game can be enjoyed by yourself or with friends. I highly recommend avoiding public servers at all cost unless you have an army of friends playing with you. Because building up a few hours of work and having it all torn down within seconds is not fun. Maybe for the attacker but in this case you are not the attacker. You are the guy that got 1 shot from a gun a few yards away. While many can argue by saying that Rust's community is welcome to players that simply isn't true. As it was said in the Escapist the only time you will not be attacked is if the other person is either less or equally as geared up as you. I give this game a positive review because a good experience can be had for a day or so on a single server. You will have one of those rare occasions where you will not be hunted down or killed on the spot. You may actually get to have fun with the other players on the server! Yes I know I say "might" a lot. That is just the sad truth though. This review is not meant to please anyone I'm just stating a simple opinion internet which I know is a dangerous idea. So enjoy the game if you have friends or if you wish to nomad around until death "mysteriously" falls upon you.
title: Rust

review: Every once in a while a game comes around that is for actual gamers. Rust is one of those games.Rust is the ONLY survival game on Steam that is barebones and won't treat you like a simpleton. The game has it's share of babies playing no different than any other MP game the difference in Rust is the devlopers won't bend the knee for their kind and ruin the game at the expense of the core gamer. Rust is as barebones/hardcore as you the gamer would want your survival exprience to be. When you die it's going to be 100% your fault 99% of the time. The game will not hold your hand. As a gamer you need to be self sufficient and mindful of your actions. Common sense goes a long way in surviving a game like Rust. There's no gimmicky progression systems or item based mechanics. You can do anything from the start so long as you can get the recources to make it. There's no "progression wall" in your way. Rust is as good as it gets for the survival genre. No one else comes close the rest that tried ended up pandering to alternative gamers.

review: This is my experience playing Rust. There are plenty of good things but some bad things.Pros Such a fun game. Takes time dedication and persistence to actually go well which I like. Very rewarding in the end. Great game to play with friends. Raiding others and trying to defend your base is very fun. The developers have implemented the perfect items for raiding and defending. Great fun. The developers bring out good updates and aren't afraid to try new things (some may disagree with me) A game that you can play for hours and still have so much more to do. There is no real "end" or point that you are so overpowered there is nothing else to do. Great controls. Features such as ALT to move your head around without turning your body are VERY helpful. Facepunch always comes out with really good updates. I've never felt like they've released something too overpowered or glitchy it's always thouroughly worked on before released to the public so their updates are always fantastic (in my opinion). Facepunch always accepts community created skins which I think is awesome. It's great to know that the community can play a part in what the developers are creating. Pvp in Rust is just so fun. It gets your adrenaline going like mad and is so satisfying when you see the opponent go down. You don't just have to farm to get rich you can also pvp!Cons I don't exactly like the start menu (not the in game menu the start menu where u choose your settings resolution etc. This is my personal opinion and I dont think it is very detailed at all. It should all just be in game. This is not much of a problem though because it doesn't bother me. There is no exclusive full screen. It's either borderless windowed or windowed.Overall Rust is an amazing game. It requires persistence and patience and really gets your adrenaline going. I swear a game has never gotten my nerves racking this much! I rate this 9.5/10. Fantastic game but has it's flaws.
title: Rust

review: I used to love Rust. I sank a couple hundred hours into it early on. I had a server with friends where we would build massive bases and raid them to destruction. It was mindless make and break fun. Then the devs decided to get "serious" about the game and implemented a massive overhaul. Everything since has been a downward spiral.If you simply think you can hop onto any server and start playing you are sadly mistaken. You will be robbed griefed killed and laughed at. Even if you do manage to find a good server with good people you are still faced with some of the worst optimization issues I've ever seen in a game. Add to that the fact that this game will apparently be in "early development" until the end of time and you start to realize how pointless it becomes. Servers are wiped frequently new updates bring news bugs quantity is given preference over quality and the game remains utterly pointless.As much as I used to love Rust and as much as I want to love it now I simply cannot recommend this game as it is.
title: Rust

review: I'd say rust was a fun game because of all the challenge for survival such as Starvation Dehydration Coldness Bears and Wolves and fighting other players. Given that Rust IS a survival game and with that comes PVP sincec it has a combat system such as using pretty much anything you can get your hands on as weapons and wearing clothing and the like for armor for protection. I'd say PvP is really fun because that is where the thrill is. Aside from the occasional lag or server crashing nothing really seemed off with Rust. But then during the PvP fights I encountered players who seemed to be hackers because sometimes their bullets would go through walls and a number of times my friends and people I know are killed in less than a few sesconds after meeting them even when we were fully armored and covered. So right now I'd pretty much like to raise the issue of hackers in Rust since they pretty much ruin the whole gameplay experience. I hope Rust does something about the hackers since they have discouraged me from continuing to play Rust since my hard work is basically thrown away just because some players hacked their way to winning.
title: Rust

review: Ahhh a brand new world awaits me. I wake up with nothing but my trusty rock and a torch and venture forward into the vast unkown world. I wonder far and wide collecting many resources but no place yet to call home. After breaking a few barrels I manage to clothe myself and amongst the wreckage of barrels and discarded clothes I find it... My calling.. I pick it up and give it a mighty strum! I can feel the strings vibrate through the body and at that moment I knew.. My calling was to be a wondering bard! And thus I went serenading many a person with my unique talents. And as I traveled to and fro from land to land I find it. A suitable valley to call home. I set up a small wooden house make a small storage box and store any uneeded items and go forth to gather resources. After many hours I finally manage a stone house and have made myself more secure. I have a sheet metal door with a code lock and thus protect my greatest treasure safely hidden away. It has been 8 hours since I was born in this world and after 4 more I finally gather enough resources to upgrade over half of my house straight from rock to sheet metal. I could never have been happier all those hours I had been out gathering metal ore. I had never felt safer in my life! Long story short a guy waited around 30 minutes to an hour for me to come back so he could kill me and take all my stuff. 10/10 would play again.

review: Rust is an amazing game. this game should get a lot more credit than it does. Rust has changed my thought for gaming. I set up a survey about why people stopped and almost 90% of people said it was because of hackers. The reason why people hack is because they are just trash at the game and cant play fair but what really hurts them is when they get banned Others said it was too hard because they died once and gave up. rust is all about dying and restarting but sometimes when people mess with you you just got to get back up and get revenge. Another complaint is that the developers are doing bad. I think the developers are doing amazing and doing as much as they can to make this game even better than it is. Now I think it is time to make rust good again and I think its time to make rust the game that everyone plays and everyone talks about. This game in my head has Amazing potential now lets get it to that point. )

review: I love Rust.It was given to me by a friend as a gift and it was one of the best gifts I have received in a long time.It is a ton of fun navigating the map collecting resources building fighting raiding etc. You will get to lots of points where you rage and you will lose your stuff but you have to just pick yourself up and move on.The game is amazing but I have just over 90 hours and I am done. I have done everything in the game you can do. I am not sure if the game is really short or if I just play really fast. I look at people with 1000+ hours and I scratch my head and say "how can anyone play this game that long?". It is still the best 90 hours of my gaming life despite that.An integral part of the game are your friends. You need friends in Rust. Without friends you are a sitting duck because everyone else will be in a gang and nobody is recruiting unfortunately they will kill you and after they do that and take your stuff they will leave you for a day let you collect some resources and then come and take it all again. Without a few friends to watch your back you will be taken advantage of until you cannot play anymore and have to find another server.Rust is a fantastic game but you might spend most of the time in the dark hoping someone doesn't come and bash your door down but it gets really fun when you get weapons and become the hunter.We just won't talk about the hackers though. We are fortunate that there are a lot less now than there used to be.

review: After a short time playing I'd say this game is flawed (technical and graphical issues) but it's alpha so expectations need not be through the roof. The learning curve is pretty steep and I can definitely see it discouraging new players....learning the game and learning the behaviors of the community. Soloing in the game can be done but it does feel like you're progressing at a snails pace. As satisfying as it is to escape the insanity of the opening moments of the game surrounded by naked people with rocks all mindlessly bashing each other over the head for petty resources and finally find a space to set up your staging base it's in equal parts dishearening to have all of that time and effort wiped clean when you log back in the following day. It's a harsh reality that despite your best efforts at the time if someone wants into your base they're getting in. With that said I enjoy the challenge and look forward to logging back in to see if my base is still standing. This of course is a short lived goal but the world of Rust provides a great deal of freedom to players. I spent an entire day going around a server placing chests containing nothing but a story I wrote about the person who killed me earlier in the game. Another time whenever anyone would try to give me items I would immediately run away from them. As they chased me yelling about being friendly (while peppering in warnings that they would kill me if I didn't take their stuff) I would head for the nearest body of water and drown myself in front of them. Was it a waste of time? Sure was but damn it if it didn't make me laugh at the time.In the future I'll probably slave myself out and get more integrated into working with groups. Right now I'm enjoying soloing and I'm sure working with/against others adds a tremendous amount to the game as well. I would say that the game has a lot of potential but I feel the true potential of the game is in what the players can do with it not the developers. I do wish there were a way to salvage materials from abandoned bases but I guess that would compromise their defensive capabilities in the process. All in all I like the game and definitely feel it's the one of if not the best in the sandbox survival genre.

review: I will recommend this game to you since i have wasted many an hour in it myself. There are a few things to watch out for however. Firstly admin on any server are given too much privelege. They are allowed to spawn at will any item in the game and as many as they want. This means that a player savvy enough to suck up to admin could potentially become an OP a$$hole that ruins your experience on a regular basis. Admin also have that potential. One of the servers that i played regularily on had this scenario occur where the admin equipped a team with the best gear they could (some of which arent available to regular players) and created an unstoppable army of robbers. THIS CANNOT TAINT YOUR VIEW ON ALL SERVER OWNERS/ADMIN however there are a good many that are very nice people and very fair players. Secondly toons dont transfer from server to server so if you have a server that you regularly play you will have an avatar that is quite a bit more advanced than on other servers (this means they will be able to build more stuff due to more blueprints and likely will have more very usefull items in their inventory to ensure survival after a server reset) and that will lead to playing on only a couple servers. For some that may be no big deal but personally i would like to be able to switch servers if i find the climate in the one ive spent a good deal of time developing my toon in becomes unfavorable. Lastly this game is still in early development so there is a chance that in the future odd features that make no sense could be added or that some feature that we have come to know and love could be removed to alter gameplay in accordance with someones vision. This is always a possibility in early access games like these where players want their WoW experience in a game thats not WoW so they band together and through idle threat group rants demand these features be added or removed. 6/10 RATING WOULD BE HIGHER IF ADMIN WHERE TAKEN DOWN A NOTCH OR TWO!

review: This game is as addictive as crack. It's a brutal yet brilliant game. It takes advantage of the human condition and accurately portrays how life would be in a no rules post apocalyptic world. From manipulation for ones own selfish needs to groups banding together to survive. You can die and lose everything you had worked hard for by simple compliancey. You can also become the reigning overlord of a server. You can decimate someone's will to live (stay on a server) by taking everything from them. If you are weak expect to be taken advantage of. If you are cocky expect everyone to take you out...you can coexisit with other players or be a hermit with a plan of world domination.No game has giving me such an adrenaline rush when a plan is properly executed...one the other hand no game has made my completely rage when everything falls apart...but vengeance is always an option10/10 would recommend not for casual players though

review: After a couple of hours I feel like I can write a decent initial review.I really like the concept of this game. Starting naked with a rock and torch is a cool idea. I like the idea of having to find (or make) food and clothes gather resources hunt make fire and fight off other people. The progression seems intuitive and it doesn't take ages (most of the time) to get anything done. I still haven't figured out for sure if there are different settings in different servers but it seems like there are (i.e. amount of "gatherable" materials number of players allowed in the server maybe the size of the map). The graphics are very good and I haven't seen too many graphical anomalies. I do have some criticisms though. The game feels too focused on fighting other players for all of the other things one can do. It seems a bit unbalanced. I expected more crafting gathering surviving and exploring than i did fighting other players but it seems that player vs. player is the focus. If that is nor the intended focus then I think they have more work to do. If it is the intended focus then it is still unbalanced A player who just starts (naked with a rock) can immediately die if a person with a gun and armor decides to hunt them down. Granted the person with the gun and armor has been alive long enough to craft those items however it still feels quite unbalanced and at times not fun.Overall I like this game. Personally I feel that they should pull back slightly on the player vs. player. I understand this is part of the game and it's fine but it feels too forced considering everything else that can be done in the game.
title: Rust
