review: Anyone who lives in the San Francisco Bay Area will feel right at home in Watch Dogs 2. The important landmarks are there even odd intersections that may only stand out to residents. But I don't think you need to be familiar with the real Bay Area to appreciate how Watch Dogs 2's mix of nature and urban sprawl makes for a picturesque playful open world. Its people and places are colorful and over the top kind of like the real thing.And whether or not you understand the references that drive Watch Dogs 2's twisted take on Silicon Valley shouldn't matter either This outing errs on the side of irreverence and unapologetic fun trading in the original Watch Dogs' rain soaked trenchcoat and drab demeanor for a neon colored assault rifles and a pair of skinny jeans. The new attitude and setting are a great combination that allow you to experience the dream rather than the nightmare of living in the digital age.That doesn't mean the world of Watch Dogs 2 is all peace and love. Its gleeful exterior masks a troubled society in the throes of gang violence political corruption and rampant hacking. Our antihero Marcus is to an extent part of the problem but he's mostly on the side of good. With his hacking skills under your control you spend a lot of time thwarting nefarious jerks by tapping into their networks to hit them where it hurts whether that means dismantling their criminal enterprises or airing their dirty laundry in public. And when digital attacks fail Marcus knows how to handle a gun. He's a walking contradiction that hates corruption yet murders without flinching but his actions are so entertaining that you probably won't care for long if at all.

review: Rust is what you make of it.I personally love rust.i love how rude and volitile the community isi love how zombies (naked players) make the world dangerousei love how raiders make you think about how to build a strong defensive basebut i do hate.i Hate dieing from some one who 'Appears' to be faceing away from youi hate chaseing people while they rubberband accros the landi hate the hackersfortunately the problems have been getting a little better slowly over time.The community although they appear to be all savage 4 year olds with every racist and ignorent comment at thier disposal down to it they are people. and eventually i always find a group of good guys whom band together to compliment eachothers blue print combo's. Once we are together and strong we act like a Group of savage 4 year olds.and that my friends is when things get very funthis game should have an 18+ rating solely due to the community. and with that in mind Expect to be killed for no reason and tolled it's because your mother $%$% #$%$% #$ $ %$#% his %* &amp yesterdayyou will lose every thing and every time you do you will become more RUST or you just wont make it if you want to be hard core you gotta play hard corethere is a wipe every week for frequent updates this usually happened on fridays but has been changed to monday. this small change has made playing on the weekends more laggy and generally just less playable. if you have a monday to friday job you will not be able to compete with any one who has the time to start building on monday after the wipe.i changed my review to no because the hackers have become to much of a problem to recommend this game

review: Can't reccomend survival games like these. There's no point in grouping up with people. You get a better pay off killing everyone who isn't your friend than you do cooperating with others. It's very much hole simulator the game. If you've got a big group of friends get it. I'm sure you'll have loads of fun. If you've got a small group of friends or want to play alone (don't) then don't buy it. Also make sure you get on new servers. Joining servers that have been around awhile and expecting to be able to build a base isn't going to work out in your favor.

review: The game is making worse and worse updates 1 the forest. When somone walk in to the forest they just disappear 2 the gun fighting. The guns got so much aimcone/rng that even if u control the recoil some of the shoots just says off. i mean back in 2016 the recoil was much better because the bullets hits where u aimed at nowdays they dont. And thats making the game much worse 3 upkeep. The upkeep is so back in the days u could make a big base as a small group to protect urself from raiders and have a life at the same time because u didnt have to grind 24/7 and that ruins alot in my opinion 4bp/components. Ok to be honest i think 95% of the players are there for the pvp and now with the components and all the bps/scrap u need for the lvl3 bench research are just insane + you cant find bps in barrels anymore. What i think they should do is to revert to July 2016 when it was pvp the first day of the wipe because all u had to do is to find the bp in a barrel or something run back to ur base and grind mats so u could craft the gun

review: I don't know what to say about this game so here is a recipe for pancakes Ingredients 4tbsp plain flour (about 100g)1 large free range egg½ pint semi skimmed milk + water (about 300ml ¾ milk ¼ water)Pinch of saltButter for fryingHow to make pancakes Sieve the flour and salt into a large bowl and make a well in the mixture.Break in the egg and stir to make a breadcrumby mix.In a jug add 1/3 of a pint of milk and top up with water to make 1/2 a pint (200ml milk 100ml water) this makes a lovely light batter.Add the milk and the water mix bit by bit beating constantly to avoid lumps.Tip *If you have a food processor just throw all the ingredients in and zap until smooth!Pop a large frying pan over a medium heat.Add a large knob of butter (roughly 50g) and melt.Pour the excess butter into a small bowl and reserve it for later.Using a ladle pour a spoonful of the pancake batter into the hot pan and swirl to get a full covering cook for about 1 min each side (it's ready when it's easy to flip over).Serve immediately with sugar and lemon or other exciting toppings. We love cheese and Marmite for an extra British twist! Delicious!!

review: Rust used to be good 4 years ago right after they removed zombies. The map was amazing the crafting and looting systems was just right and building bases was better. The "new" Rust is not good with its random maps (which are horrible as is the not randomly generated one) crafting system which have gotten worse over time weapon degradation maps littered with horrible bases and people killing you on sight and so on. You will die over and over trying to get materials for a base. And when you finally have yourself a good base either a hacker will come along and destroy it in a second or someone from the 50 neighbouring bases will raid you. If you wanna keep your stuff you either need to stay online 24/7 or spend 30 hours grinding metal to build a thick base that can withstand the absurd amounts of C4 raiders can amass.Bring back Rust Legacy!

review: The community is toxic some models are pretty cringy and the pvp isn't completely perfect. But it's Rust and that's why I countless many times find myself looking at the loading screen. That rush of adrenalin as you turn the corner to come face to face with a pump action the surge of hope as you sprint to your base longing to be safe again and the wave of despair as you see nothing but a few foundations and a lone brick wall. You learn you create you rise and then fall again only to be more determined to do better the next wipe. It draws me in and I'm sure others can agree.People may complain and they may say that Legacy was better or that the community has gotten worse. It's not the developers' fault. "What you do what you cause in this game is up to you. We gave you the tools it's up to you to see how you use them." And that's what we did. It's not the game's fault that everyone is so cancerous it's us. We caused this to happen. And it's up to us to fix it.You either love the game or hate it. It's an aquired taste and takes a long time to see past all the bad things. But it does one thing better than any other game Show the brutality and primitive ways that we will devolve back to when given a rock and a torch then stranded butt naked on a island.The funny thing?We brought it among ourselves.We chose to be like this.Buy it or don't love it or hate it it's your choice. And that's the only freedom you have now so make the most of it.
title: Rust

review: I've spent over 2000 hours on rust and I've really enjoyed it. However it's really disappointing how the devs have chosen to progress this game. The game was in early access for many years and then they suddenly made the decision to take it out of early access they spent a month trying to optimise the game slightly then massively increased the price and reduced the updates from weekly to monthly. Since then the game has had very little if any work on optimisation each month the devs release more new content like the new bandit town which reduces how well the game runs even more. My game now sadly has a bug where it randomly crashes while in game I've seen multiple steam threads on it and this problem has been around for over a month and yet there's been no mention of this by the devs. This effectively makes the game unplayable for me. Overall I have got my money's worth however in its current state I cannot recommend it. It is terribly optimised so even the best PCs struggle to run it and the devs are out of touch with their player base.

review: Honest Review Review is based on current state of game.Game Pros Clean menu Players can host their own servers off their computers for free or pay to have it hosted on a local server Option for Directx9 for players with 32bit systems. Along with Directx11 for 64bit systems Intricate base building system Hunting/Gathering Day/Night Cycle Weather System Moddable Frequent updates and Dev blogs Procedural generated world Gives you a sense of paranoia Generated Biomes (Desert Snow Grass)Game Cons Game tends to lag/rubber band if too many people are connected to the server Uses a lot of RAM KoS (Really depends on the person but what do you expect?) VoIP needs work (Causes a second or two of lag after letting go of the VoIP key) Framerate/Crashing issues on AMD cards (Mainly on the R9 290) Runs on the Unity engine (Making it not the best for optomization but the dev team is managing) Animals don't follow rules of physics. (They will run up walls if they feel like it)Controversial Features Sleeper servers (Even when you log off you are still in game and able to be killed. Pretty much forces you put in time to build a stable base before leaving the server. Or risk being killed.Relateable Games H1Z1 The Forest DayZConclusionRust can be a very fun survivial game especially with friends. I put "DayZ" as a relateable game but let me assure you they are two different games and should never be compared other than them having a survival aspect. Rust can sometimes feel very slow pace on the official servers so If you want to quickly build and join in on the action id suggest a modded server with faster crafting and gathering. Overall if you have the money i'd suggest looking into buying this game. It is currently in Alpha so really look into it before purchasing. (If you found this review helpful consider giving it a thumbs up!)

review: I'll keep it short and sweet. People seem to like that. TL DR is at the bottom. Don't waste your time with Rust. A lot of people act like it's really fun but I don't really like it. I have 1380 hours in Unturned which is pretty much the same game if you get rid of all the "small" details. I tried it with friends too which is typically way more fun. I didn't like it. It felt like a waste of time especially because it seemed like the only servers with population were filled with could be esports players. I got it for like $7 I think and it still wasn't worth it. Rust is an interesting idea. It's just so dumb. And there was this feature that required you to upkeep your base EVERY DAY irl and unless they removed it that should be an instant dealberaker. The whole game just seems tedious and not fun the whole point of a game.TL DR Don't buy Rust even on sale unless it's free. It's no fun.

review: The community is harsh and riddled with fowl mouth 10 year old s trying to sound hard. Trolling seems to be the foremost priority for many if not most and it s hard if not impossible to play solo. The game does have a very active community and is constantly updated and that s a plus. I come from Dayz stand alone and I still love the game but the developers basically took the money and ran. Rust on the other hand when played in a group is a great game that comes with its own set of challenges. If you can get around hate speech from the active chat in game (no genre is left alone) a hard start or dyeing/restarting frequently then your experience will be great. If the developers could just slow the wipe schedule a bit it would allow new users and fresh spawns to get a foundation and be awarded the means to defend their plot. The wipes happen you can t change that but the Grind is real and even if you make things more expensive developers don t solve any issue for the new comer or the freshly raided induvial(s) they only hamper the game play and build a foundation for those in large groups to rule and close down a server. Just my two cents

review: I've played Rust Legacy for a while and it was so full of potential! Then version 2.0 came and it's been garbage for a long time. I have returned recently and the game has significantly improved. Yet so many downfalls!Pros Nice new maps. Improved graphics. Lots of choices when it comes to building clothes and weapons. Funny flavor items (guitars candlehats etc). Very involved community.Cons Variable FPS rates. The game will start to lag for no apparent reasons from time to time. Raiding is WAAAAY too easy. 3 metal doors will take 2 people with pickaxes and a repair table 5 min to break down so if you're planning to sleep or do not have the weaponry they've got bye bye base. Weapons are too easy to get. Today there was a wipe. 2h later half the players on the server were running around with automatic guns. No downside to being a Hurtworld's mechanics where you become infamous if you kill ppl and you only don't lose EVERYTHING when you die if you're not infamous made it so people think about it before KOSing. I've got no problem with being a PKer but let it have some downside if you want to give naked people with rocks a chance to start. The constant wipes. Every month or so prepare to have the map wiped out. In some ways it's not such a bad thing since the game gets sooo laggy when many buildings are constructed. Finally people bringing up "it's only an alpha!" when you point out any major flaws of the game. Sorry people when you sold your game 3 years ago and called it an alpha you cannot ride on that wave forever.TLDR fun has potential tends to be laggy too easy to raid bases or ruin people's life without any kind of drawback.

review: It's got some REALLY good potential But at the moment that's really about it. (shadow of chernobyl) I mean it's just.....empty. there's really not a whole lot to do in the game besides build a base get raided rebuild and hopefully not get raided. I want a bigger city element to it or at least a goal off in the distance. cuase as of right now there's just really no content besides farming resapawnning boxes in a lil radtown that's all of 5 9 buidlings. I want somwhere you actually HAVE to have a group of people back you up. but aside from that the gunplay handles well and i REALLY like the bows. but we need more content.it's a yes but a cautious yes. whish steam had an "enh" button.on a side note it can be VERY pretty at times.

review: This game is a very toxic one although it has good people it is a good game it has a mute button for people in the options. there is no way to mute people individually but it works. the actual game is good its a game about working your way up through the world by killing people or farming. At the time of me making this review they use scrap and components to make guns and other weaponry. The gunplay is fast paced but can vary. They have no lore in the game yet but they will be adding it speaking of that you should checkout the roadmap here https //rust.facepunch.com/roadmap/ so yeah. the armor in the game is slightly op but you can still kill people. About the server's so the servers are split into groups like official community and modded official are well official servers that are vanilla community are vanilla servers run by people who play the game modded are modded servers like 2x gathering or stuff like that like ark survival evolved the admins of these servers can do anything they want they can make it so you spawn with m249 if they wanted btw m249 is the most powerful gun. About the game (again) this time im gonna be talking about progression in the game from rock and torch to ak47 and bolty to get anywhere in the game hit things with other things and that usually gets you stuff. The guns in the game are pretty broken not in the buggy way but in the op way you can get killed by 5 guys with ak47's which kill you very quickly. You do have to use skill to win but if you're up again'st 4 ak guys you will most likely die if you have a revolver thats why i reccomend playing with friends segwaying us into our next section. Friends people who play this game should play with friends if you're not playing on a only server because groups with more people get more things becaseu more people are doing things at once if a guy with a ak is running around solo and 5 dudes with revolver's try to fight you they will most likely win. i have alot of time on the game and know alot of things about it so i hope this helped. btw i do reccomend this game it is good but its hard af and you will get mad at it when you lose gear js.

review: A major goal in any game is to create the illusion of reality a fact that is especially true for first person shooters. The whole point of the genre is to put you literally in the role of the protagonist. In light of this it's surprising that so many games have stuck to a blueprint that breaks the illusion at every possible opportunity with text based mission briefings jarring level transitions and weapons and power ups scattered around like decorative furniture. But Valve Software has obviously spent a lot of time studying the mistakes of the past. The result is Half Life the closest thing to a revolutionary step the genre has ever taken. Through a series of subtle and artistic design decisions Half Life creates a reality that is self contained believable and thoroughly engaging. And while it may be surprising that no game has utilized any of these ideas in the past it's clear that any future shooter will be remiss to overlook them.

review: Work very hard under terrible conditions around despicable co workers for zero pay and then get your wallet robbed after 2 weeks*. That's what Rust would be like if it was a job.It's alright but yeah... you need a few friends to enjoy this game and you'll be enjoying it because you're going up against people with less gear or manpower than you. Gunplay is dated and feels clunky and you'll often aim at a spot and miss despite reticle being on point. As for building it's alright however costs can seem incredibly high especially if you're playing alone or only with another player. You can play for around six hours just building a little base to keep your stuff safe while you sleep/go to work and then the next day it's all gone becuase a 6+ man clan got a couple bombs and blew off a wall. Later on (if you're dedicated) you can get pretty sturdy bases that are a pain to take down but then again no work is too tall of an order for a big clan. The zerg always wins and you can't do anything to stop it. I recommend getting a sizeable group of around 4 6 players or more if you want to actually enjoy the game.You also can't customize your character and the one you play as is randomly generated and bound to your Steam account for no reason other than the devs trying to force you to accept their SJW views of society. Funnily enough this is counter intuitive and means that many players with black characers are disadvantaged due to the meta of the game (I'm not joking for some reason the majority of players are legitimately racist and will shoot you on sight simply for having a black skin.) I got a white skin so I didn't have this problem but my friends do and it's kinda sad. Apparently the justification is that 'in real life you're born the way you are and can't change that and if we let players customize they'd all go white anyway.'So? Maybe that reflects the desires of people playing the game? We choose to get sucked into the digital world for a reason and it's not because we want to simulate our own lives. *2 weeks is the standard reset time for a server. Some go up to a month and there are probably a few that go higher.

review: Now that I am better able to connect to servers I can post a new review.Is it a good game? Yes. Is it the ultimate survival game? No. Or atleast not what I'm looking for personally.In order to like this game you have to ask yourself are you more interested in PvP or PvE? I tend to go for the latter. The environmental threat in this game at this stage in development I'm writing this (11 Mar 16) consists of two entities the bear and the wolf. For the most part even these are pretty easy to dodge if you see them from a distance. And... that's about it for the environmental threat. Hunger thirst and cold are very easily satiated.The game is geared for PvP. Defending one's base and raiding other bases. For what it does I find it does pretty well. Base building mechanics are easy to learn but designing a safe base is not easy. My personal issue with the game from the personal experience of playing the game in solo or in a pair is that it's just a matter of time when your base will be raided. It could be as short as two days in real time from the time you've set up. It could be even less. I also find it's a bit of a chore to keep collecting resources upgrading your base creating maybe other bases for security etc. It's not what I'm looking for in a survival game I don't want to chop trees and mine ores I want to lead a more of a "nomadic" existence. But it's not the game's fault it's just not what I'm looking for. It can also feel very frustrating at times to get raided so also be aware of this. It's not an easy game in more ways than one.But if you're interested in the PvP aspect the game offers then it's a very recommended buy. If you're more like me who likes PvE better then maybe look elsewhere. I still do feel I got my money's worth out of the game.

review: I tried and hoped to like this game. Do NOT buy this game if you have less than 3 people in your group. You will not be able to survive very long. There are absolutely NO friendly players what so ever. I played about 20 total hours (on different accounts) and did not kill another player tried to be the most positive and non KOSable player out there... to no avail. The game isn't optimized particularly well but still runs fairly smooth. The combat is a little glitchy (range/hitbox can feel really dirty). Rust adds some very cool aspects to survival games. Very interesting building and crafting abilities... But the community and combat and Lack of PvE/non combat based gameplay is pretty lacking. If you want to suceed in Rust play with friends and ONLY use resources to build weapon/armor until you've killed a lot of players and taken their stuff to build a base.I wish I could recommend this game honestly but the community aspect just makes it simply no fun. An hour of work gone in a minute 5 hours gone in 30 seconds...

review: 1. Download Rust2. Spend 30 mins to load it up3. Spawn in a server4. It's pretty Laggy...5. You get dissapointed6. You're about to uninstall then remember that you were running the game on integrated graphics7. Go back to the same server8. Amazed at how much better the game runs9. Start your adventure with a torch and a rock10. Find a fellow naked man and crack his head open with the rock11. Take his rock &amp Torch12. Remove his flesh with a rock13. Eat the flesh14. Die from uncooked human flesh15. Wake up again on a beach16. Find a nice Supple Tree17. Begin to smack the tree with a rock18. Figures out you need paper to make a planning paper19. Gamefreek "How do I paper?"20. No one answers so you google.21. You make a house with walls a ceiling fire and sleeping bag but you think you need a lock for your 1x1 house22. You make a lock and keep the key in your pocket23. You're starving go get some food you bum24. Chase a deer but the deer breaks the laws of physics and runs up a mountain25. You're a naked man trying to jump up a mountain throwing spears at a deer26. You finally kill the deer in vegetation27. You go to claim your prize but some put floor spikes in the bushes.28. You are dead.29. You wake up in your sleeping bag and proceed out the door to recover your belongings30. The key to your house was in your pocket so you can't leave.31. You find ways to kill yourself32. You get raided by a group of naked men33. The naked men seem nice they let you out.34. They chase you with spears.35. You manage to outrun them but it's night time.36. You head back to where you died and recover your long lost key37. On your way back a wolf decides that it's okay to take a nibble at your thigh38. You fight the wolf off with the spear39. You're bleeding40. More Bleeding....41. You make it home with your cloth and deer meat42. You feast awaiting another day.11/10. Would do it again.

review: This is a very nice change to the regular old minecraft stuff it adds an acrual presence of live or die moments in it. Even though it still is in alpha i reccomend this to peoople who like survival games with realism built into it. To me i think rust is based after a nuclear war on an island. The monsters on it can be very hard when using melee weapons but if you use a bow or shot gun the game becomes very easy.
title: Rust

review: I don't have a lot of time under my belt in Rust so far but what time I have played I have enjoyed. I was lucky enough to find a couple good servers and haven't been killed by another player yet and actually had a nice guy hook me up with a bunch of good gear. So far my time in the game has mostly been finding my way around. I haven't really built anything worth mentioning yet. Mostly I have just been sitting up a few stashes around the map and stocking up on stuff. Stability wise I haven't had a single crash nor noticed any major bugs. I have seen a few clipping issues here and there but nothing I haven't seen in plenty of other "finished" games. For an Early Access game I am very pleased with the performance and the game in general.Spec wise I am running a i7 4770 3.4Ghz 12GB Ram and a GTX 760 on a Windows 8.1 machine. I would highly recommend this game for anyone that likes crafting building and well just surviving. Like I said I have been lucky and haven't been grieved or anything. I have read that some people have problems with the PVP aspect. I so far am lucky. Facepunch has a huge hit on their hands. There is a good reason that it is out ranking DayZ standalone.

review: Once upon a time at the foot of a great mountain there was a town where the people known as Happyfolk lived their very existence a mystery to the rest of the world obscured as it was by great clouds.Here they played out their peaceful lives innocent of the litany of excess and violence that was growing in the world below.To live in harmony with the spirit of the mountain called Monkey was enough.Then one day Strangefolk arrived in the town.They came in camouflage hidden behind dark glasses but no one noticed them they only saw shadows.You see without the Truth of the Eyes the Happyfolk were blind.In time Strangefolk found their way into the higher reaches of the mountain and it was there that they found the caves of unimaginable Sincerity and Beauty.By chance they stumbled upon the Place Where All Good Souls Come to Rest.The Strangefolk they coveted the jewels in these caves above all things and soon they began to mine the mountain its rich seam fueling the chaos of their own world.Meanwhile down in the town the Happyfolk slept restlessly their dreams invaded by shadowy figures digging away at their souls.Every day people would wake and stare at the mountain.Why was it bringing darkness into their lives?And as the Strangefolk mined deeper and deeper into the mountain holes began to appear bringing with them a cold and bitter wind that chilled the very soul of the monkey.For the first time the Happyfolk felt fearful for they knew that soon the Monkey would stir from its deep sleep.And then came a sound. Distant first it grew into castrophany so immense it could be heard far away in space.There were no screams. There was no time.The mountain called Monkey had spoken.There was only fire.And then nothing.

review: I have only played Rust for a couple hours and I found that even though it lags a bit in full screen mode I really like the game. This game is a lot of fun to me I don't know why but I just want to play it so much even right now as I am writing this review I want to play rust. The game just appeals to me probably because of the sense of freedom you have while playing (especially in a server by yourself).Even if Rust lags on your computer maybe consider buying it (especially if there is a sale) if you think you like the game. I found that when putting the settings to 'low' and running it in a window it runs pretty good at least 20 25 fps. I think Rust is a great game sometimes you will probably get murdered or raided. And sometimes you will be the murderer and raider which makes it fun (for some reason don't think of me as being crazy it's just fun).Anyways I don't know why I feel like I have to write what could possibly be a page on a book but all in all I think Rust is a great game watch others play it to make sure you want it before you buy it and if it doesn't run good just run in a window or wait until you get a better computer.
title: Rust

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding lemon bars recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1) 2 cups Flour2) 1/2 cup Sugar3) 1/4 teaspoon Salt4) 2 sticks (1 Cup) Salted Butter Cut Into Small Cubes5) Filling6) 1 1/2 cup Sugar7) 1/4 cup Flour8) 4 whole Large Eggs9) Zest And Juice Of 4 Medium sized Lemons10) Powdered Sugar For SiftingDirections 1. For the crust Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9 by 13 inch pan with butter.2. Stir together the flour sugar and salt. Add the butter to the bowl and use a pastry cutter to cut it all together until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Press into the prepared pan and bake until golden around the edges about 20 minutes.3. For the filling Stir together the sugar and flour. Crack in the eggs and whisk to combine. Add the lemon zest and juice and mix until combined. Pour over the crust and bake about 20 minutes.4. Allow to cool in the fridge for a minimum of 2 hours then sift powdered sugar over the top before cutting into squares.(Use an 8 x 10 pan if you'd like the layers to be a little thicker.)

review: FOR STARTERSDo not play this game alone. The community is a toxic blend of autistics aging from 9 to late 30 something's who literally get all of thier joy playing this game online and making sure nobody else is having fun. YES I GET THE POINT OF THE GAME. it's a trust nobody cut throat game What with the "raids" and what not but i mean and i mean this the community ruins this for eveyone even each other. call me butt hurt all you want but every server i've joined i simply broke into seeminly abandoned shacks made of wood or stone using nothing but what ive made in the dirt for the first 15 minutes of life but you don't know salt and sound of a very territoral 14 year old's battle cry of unyeilding pain and agony because i made off with some crap I'M not even sure does and get away with it. hell running this solo is seriously the single handedly least fun experience i've ever had playing any game ever. The game itself plays okay and i like the idea of people scared of other players or seeing everyone as potentialy hostile. dayZ had this down much better as in 15 minutes in dayZ i can find basic equipment i need to actually play the game solo and still enjoy myself.I cannot stress the absoloute need for a friend or hell bring in a group of friends. that bumps up the fun way more. Sure you still get attacked but it starts to feel more like a game when you aren't spening ten minutes at a time attempting to just gather supplies to garnish yourself make hunting tools THEN a base THEN better equipment only to be cut down by someone about 6 steps ahead of you with a pipe gun. rince and repeat. With friends you stand the chance to enjoy the game's full potential.conclusion I don't have any friends who play games like these so i try to run them solo only to end up mostly hating them. This is the exception however The game is great but the people are the thing you need to prep for. Bring a few extra sets of hands. Gonna need em.

review: I've been playing Rust on and off since Legacy it wasn't until the huge update to Experimental is when I started playing alot. Despite lots of questionable changes (namely the Twig buildings bypassing the Tool Cupboard they just now rolled out) I'd still recommend this game as it is fun but is definitely not for the easy to upset players.I would not recommend playing on any Vanilla servers. Find a nice Modded server with the juicy plugins and features and just go. Some Modded servers even disabled Twig from bypassing the Tool Cupboard to make it feel more like before the update.Overall its addicting most of the times but frustrating to the max sometimes. Hiding loot from raiders is an art so get creative and just try to survive!

review: It's very hard to review this game. I've had great times on this game and absoluetly terrible times. I met a friend after learning he was a he got unfriended. I met another guy found out he was an I bought this game with another friend and it was always fun jumping on the big 5k pvp server and pvping against other players. I love the new update but hate how if you play with 1 other person you just get absoluetly stomped on and destroyed. Now when I come on I become dissapointed with the amount of unfriendly people and just plain s. If you don't play with a big clan and have a huge base you're screwed. I was on the other day with 3 other people and we had a nice little 2x2 ended up getting doorcamped by 5 people with semi autos and AK's. Logged off for the day came on the day later to find my base raided. I don't like the game but I love the concept of this game and I see how it could be improved. THE COMMUNITYI'm dissapointed. There's always somebody better and if there isn't then you're a zerg with a huge base. There used to be balance but now the huge groups will always dominate unless you're some BCHILLZ god or if you get scripts and/or hacks and there's a ton of those people. Oh and by the way if you do ever find somebody that is actually nice BE NICE BACK. That goes without saying but if you help 10 different people I'd say at least 7/10 would turn on you if somebody points out a bad spot in your base reward them. If somebody wants some materials give them some.MY STANDI'm going to be honest I'm just a 14 year old who might be overthinking but I think half the people who play this game would say otherwise. I don't know which box to click Yes or No. It's really hard to recommend this game because in general it sucks. But I also think about all the fun times I've had on this game with my friends. From what I've played I love the blueprint system and I honestly found the "freecraft" system comeplete t it let you craft an AK within 10 minutes of playing on one server if you tried really hard. Now if you're new to the game or looking to buy it the blueprint is an old system that was put back into the game after some thought by Facepunch what it's all about is basicially there's 3 tiers and you need to research items and you obtain a "blueprint" after researching. Buuut if you don't have the certain workbench you can't craft it. Anyways my stand on this game is quite neutral but everytime Facepunch puts out a new big update I always play it to see if I enjoy it.I guess I'm going to reommend this game but mainly because of the concept not the community I just wish and hope that there will be more nicer people playing this game in the future.Dang you got this far? This is more than I've typed for most of my English papers in the past. Good job man.

review: Pros It truly is a survival game. Hunting for resources and food is enjoyable and the satisfaction of surviving building is pretty darn good. A player can get completely enthused with the first few survival objectives (but thats it!!)Cons 1. Probably the most toxic community of players I have ever experienced. Hey kids ..just born naked? here have a hail of bullets from us a group of radioactive shielded armored tanked up morons. This community does not allow a new player to grow and survive. There's probably 10% survival efforts from nature/environment and 90% from other players who have settled in way earlier than you. SO the simple way to beat this? enter a server that has just started with very few players.. yayy! I am sure most have experienced this as well " hey man come here.. come here im not gonna hurt you..Boom!!" was funny the first few times but after that made Rust extremely boring for teaming up effort.2. Collecting stone? Which one would you pick to start digging two huge boulders of stone on a cliff staring at you or a small stone that you have to look very closely to see a bloody golden shine. Secondly I have seen sulphur ore gazillion times more that stone.. I'd like to know where on earth can we see a place that has less stone than sulphur ore3. I can understand twig walls deteriorating fast but stone walls that need constant upkeep? you want people to be playing 24hrs a day. Probably the developers think players stay in their parents basement provided for everything. Hell no I got no time for that.4. NOW.. Lets talk about a favourite subject here Game Servers!! Its actually good that the game wipes servers to balance things for all players bringing them down to the same level. But i just spent the last 3 4 hours building a 4x4 stone cabin and staying a couple hrs to maintain it. So what after that? there are way more things that can be done right down to making a damn spaceship and flying it. If solo players can't enjoy that level there's no point in playing twice. By the time a single player feels they have hunkered down and survived its time for server wipes!! Have fun doing that all over again.All in all Rust is the least realistic survival game at best. Im not even getting into high dehydration of human meat the fact that you can increase health simply by wrapping cloth bandages crafting doors and walls with a click breaking doors and walls and not being able to recycle wood or stone from the effort. Boxes that require just wood to make but after its placed there are about 20 metal nails embedded into it (Where'd the metal fragments come from for that?) Hoping the developers actually make this enjoyable in future versions (if its in the works)

review: I tried really hard to make playing this game worth it but between having the most base and racist community (not to mention the many many cheaters) horrid lag and performance issues and unparralleled atrocious AI and physics there is simply no redeeming this game. Stay away if you value the years of your life the stress of this game will take from you. I've played alone and I've played with friends and each are demonstrably disappointing in it's own way.I've been debating uninstalling for a while but i finally broke when a bear which for me makes next to no noise jumped me as i left my base. I tried to kill it but i couldn't react in time. So I die ok I go out with another weapon and kill the bear to get my stuff. My first shot isn't enough to kill the bear so it runs directly through a wall into my base so i can't kill it. I jump away to draw it out and luckily a headshot kills it. Little did I know that TWO PEOPLE are standing over my dead body while the bear circled right next to them! The two people kill me with my own gear.Do not play this game. Even if you hear they fixed the AI there are so many other things about the game to hate.

review: Rust is an interactive survival game that requires an immense amount of hours and eventually skill. However what sets this game apart is the deamnd graphics and multiplayer. When a game is demanding it means it requires a more powerful computer in order to run it at better settings and when it comes to Rust this game is very demanding. However demanding it may be the graphics make up for that greatly Ranging from "Potato" to "Fantistic" the better the settings get the more beautiful and filled with life the game becomes. This life sometimes includes real people. As soon as you start the game you may notice some bases that have formed around you or hear gunshots off in the distance these sights and sounds are from actual people just like you playing and enjoying the game to its fullest extent. In this world anyone can be your ally as well as your enemy greatly altering the difficulty depending on the circumstances. However a game wouldnt be a game if it was straight forward and predictable now would it?

review: First things first most of these bad reviews are coming from people that are butthurt about changes that the game has made that they of course didn't like. Of course the game still being early access has a few bugs but nothing that bad. The worst bugs include some kind of odd seizure thing before you can wake up which you have to frantically press every button on the keyboard until something happens animals have no clip and can climb rocks like champs and most importantly sometimes items that are dropped magically disappear. Now the good part. This game is probably the most fun game I have in my library. If you're new and find a good small server chances are likely that you'll find extremely nice people that just want to help and not pvp. A lot of larger servers are filled with who will kill you then throw your key away so you wake up locked in your house forever. True story. Most large servers I've been on are just s who kill anyone on sight thats no fun. Being able to find a group who will help you survive and build a cool base from nowhere then go after the patrol helicopter now that's fun.To wrap it up great game many possibilities and lots of cool people to find. TLDR hops on big server and gets then finds small server where he learns the true meaning of Christmas. 11/10

review: rust a beautiful looking game and by far one of the better survival games of this year ... *cough* standalone *cough*.my first experience wih this game ... smashing a boars head in with a rock only to find that it drops raw uncooked human meat ... good signs already 3after building a 2 story house and getting a crude but reasonably effective gun + a spear i realise there is a CRUD tonne of trees on the other side of the river ... i want them. swimming accross the river and nearly dying of hypothermia in the process i hear 2 very loud gunshots not sure if they were directed at me but they made me turn the otherway nonethless. on my way back i see a man lying on the floor ... dying. his last words to me are "kill ... me end it all" ... i humbly oblige by jamming my spear into his skull twice. his very unequipped friend thinks he can take me on ... he died on his friends corpse and his ... meat and two veg were slap bang on the other dudes face ... could not have asked for a better landing. night time came and it was time to sleep to reagain health but OH HO what is this ... you cannot regain health via sleep you must eat meat. so i attempt to cook my human flesh on the furnace does not work. then i try on the campfire ... ran out of wood ... at this point my field of view is near pitch black so i decide to light my fire stick (that's it's name from now on) ... this did absolutely nothing for lighting effect so i threw it away and waited it out.i left the server with the plan of returning later with my friends ... it did not save onto my recent servers list so i have no idea where to go or what to do.all in all this game is a 11/ 1343 "would put other guys nut sack into others face again." pronhub.
title: Rust

review: Rust made huge improvements.......but unfortunatley the game isnt really worth playing at all.Pros + they actually improved a lot of the old mechanics and designs in the game+ the sound and overall SFX is superb. One of the best atmospheric sound you will hear in a game shots are muffled from far away and explosions can be heard miles away its fantastic+ graphics improved a lot and are quite beautiful+ the game runs smooth and I never had issues with lag on servers+ crafting system is really cool+ a lot to build with great varietyCons they removed PVE making this a Kill on Sight PVP shooter which I dont have a problem with but forcing the players to hunt down other players just so there is something to do is never a good idea in other games players could still team up to defeat a zombie horde or something but here almost anybody will be an enemy and the playerbase gets toxic. the playerbase and community is one of the worst I have ever witnessed. They kill total noobs with full automatic weapons if you ask something about the game in chat you wont get help as every person nowadays thinks they have to be funny and "trolling" all the time what is up with this days internet community? This games taggline is "The only aim in Rust is to survive."This is flat out lying as the actual survival is absolutely boring and easy. You will never struggle to get water or food. The only survival part is the entire server players being hostile as there is nothing to do then to shoot people. It goes as far as people building huge towers in the middle of the map that they sit all day in and shoot newly players with sniper rifles......not collecting their loot its just about killing them just for the sake of it. You dont get points for it or anything. long running teams and players have always the upper hand as they have way more powerful weapons than starters its very hard to upgrade your weapons if you are constantly killed by the already powerful players and lose everything to them dont even bother playing this game alone you will have almost no chance most servers are capped at 100 or even 200 players per map which is insane copmared to the map size and only leads to more spawn killing and troll griefing you cant choose your character.....I found this to be very disappointing as I was playing with a friend and he had to play as a bald women that was randomly chosen by the game. I wanted my male friends character to represent my male friend. It breaks immersion if you have a female character with a deep male voice in the voice chat......if I play a game for hours and hours I wanna look at a character that appeals to me not some design to spawn controversy or social experimenting as of now the game has been in Early Access for 2 5 years.....I really wanted to love the game and tried it multiple times in different development phases. But after 2 5 years of Early Access I think there are way better games on the market right now than Rust. (The Culling for example is a good KoS shooter) with a purpose to its gameplay) Rust is just not a fun experience and the community certainly doesnt help.

review: Rust is the kind of game that fills you with moments of wonder as you explore a wasteland pregnant with objects buildings and people to interact with. The game then crushes any hopes or expectations you have for enjoying the game you want to play it and instead the community forces you to become a bloodthirsty criminal murdering anyone who comes a little too close friend or foe.Never before has a game made me feel such joy followed by such anger. Never before have I seen my humanity and patience slip away as quickly as when I turn it on.The gripes I have with this game are purely cosmetic and a little bit performance related but the game is getting better every week. I have very little to say negative about it.If you are considering purchasing rust I assure you that the $20 you will spend will get you your money's worth... even if you'll shift your perspective of "fun" to frantically chopping down trees in the rain.

review: Rust is the game that I started my gaming experience with and I am glad I did. Although sometimes the facepunch team makes changes that may not make the community happy at the time over time they always make the right decision. It has grown so much since I started and it isn't a game I plan to stop playing. The graphics quality is beautiful and the player models are being worked on but overall the graphics quality is great. The game mechanics are organized and are easy to learn. If you are not committed to the game you will not thrive in the harsh world of rust. The community is very toxic but that's what makes the game fun. If you are looking for a thrilling survival multiplayer game this is yours. And by the way when I first started playing the game I didn't know why there were weekly wipes which are basically where the servers wipe their game data and he map starts over but I understand why now. It's not like any other game out there and if you play for a wipe you will see massive Zerg bases emerge on the second day so if you don't want to just get raided every day forever then don't complain about the wipes.

review: MY OPINOIN! (づ )づI played rust before this whole scraps research and blueprint mechanic was introduced. My experience with the game then was significantly better than what it is now ( ). Said newly introduced mechanics utterly favors groups of sweats that can grind out everything in a day and run around shooting fresh spawns (pretty much the endgame) props to them ( ). But for casual on and off players like me it is way too tedious to farm a sufficient amount of scraps just to start developing a decent arsenal to defend yourslef ( ). If you do end up acquiring some firearms theres no doubt that the game itself will bend you over and tear the lining of your uterus and or prostate apart. Glitches ಥ ಥ. I can not even make this up but I was progressing well for once on a server and decided to make a move on some people building near me I approach them shoot one of them twice with a revolver and conveniently become stuck in the ground. A heavy stream of feces exit my as I panic manage to down one but run out of ammo and his freind just walks up to me and kills me with a melee (ノÒ益Ó)ノ. Which brings me to this review.There was a time when you could come on and just get right to the point ( ). Everyone could craft whatever without having to go through step by step and slowly progress only for it to be wiped by the server and start all over again. I understand that this was intended to give the game a sense of progression but all it did for me was make me a very angry boy grrr ( o ).

review: I would like it if 3rd person was re added or atleast the camera not moving so much while harvesting wood and stone.At times it gives me a headache all the moving.Though it probably adds to the difficulty of the game at times I find it impossible to find animals to hunt so thus far I spend most of my time naked since when I usually get enough cloth for clothes I get killed by a suprise bear attack while harvesting.I just recently found out that my body will stay there for a short period of time before dissapearing so well see if I can start being clothed more. Going with the bears they make a chirp while attacking and sounds like your being attacked by squrreils. Also Ive been killed twice inside my house from a bear somehow attacking through the floor.Also why at times does it sound like Im being followed by ghost chickens but none are to be found no matter how hard I track the noise.Bird sounds for ambient noise are one thing but if your gonna make chicken sounds let there be chickens we can hunt.I am very uch enjoying the game just wanted to add what Ive noticed so far that i think would help improve game play.One last tidbit.There should be a way i think for us to gather water using the water bottles or something.Though ive never died of thirst I rarely find water bottles and it makes no sense that im staying hydrated by eating steaks. Id definatly recomend the game to others and which I have.His only complaint was the rendering and the camera moving so much while harvesting.He was getting headaches from it.Id also like to see a options menu where I can adjust sound.I like to listen to my own music rather than game music.Thanks for the fun times so far.

review: I guess if there could be a neutral review this would be it but there isn't so it won't be Rust is technically a fine game it is a bit of a grind to get more advanced stuff but what game isn't. The problem isn't really the game it's how people interract with that game. The problem as far as I see it is that the world is too hospitable there is nothing to fear except other players and that is the same as any pvp shooter out there the only difference is that you have to grind to get the equipment it makes for a long boring game and even if you do go out killing to steal people's stuff it's only so you can hoard it and steal more stuff.I'm certain there are some doubting my critique but look to a game that's almost identical in style ARK it has the exact same grind the same progression yet it's endlessly fun and the way you play is dramatically different all because the environment poses a challenge so people are encouraged to work together to tackle it.I wish i could get a refund but i thought i'd give this game the benefit of the doubt. Don't make that mistake don't buy this game.

review: The best survival game on the market.For me it is very addicting to chop the trees mine the ores or build a base and craft items. The crafting and farming mechanics feel satisfying to me.Unfortunately very often during your adventure you are being killed on sight by the others.When you play solo or duo it is not very easy to progress fast and you can be easy target for bigger groups of people.However it is an adventure to take a boat and farm barrels or to go to rad towns for some scrap or weapons.Or just take a bow and kill animals and then make a barbacue party at your base.It is more satisfying when you are able to bring all the loot back to your base. People in rust are cruel they will kill you door camp you betray you and will have no mercy with you. Do not trust them.I like the PVP in Rust even though I am really a bad at PVP because I am not even able to get any decent weapons and armor. I remember the first time I started to play Rust. Nobody was helping me they were just killing me even though I was naked. I took me some time to be able to have enough resources to build a base and be safe for some while. So you need to be patient. However sometimes you meet people who like roleplaying and the game turns extremely funny.The experience in Rust is created by people. People are who make the game. Sometimes you are frustrated because you loose your base or loot sometimes you laugh because people are roleplaying as police and they put you in their jail or you feel satisfied that you were able to get some valuable bluebrint.However it requires probably lots of time and be nearly constantly online in order to keep up with the rest of the population on the server.Since I am quite casual player I will never be able to make any big raids nevertheless I enjoy the game very much.The graphics are great sound is even better and from all of this the night time is just astonishing.

review: A huge success in my opinion. Love this genre in general and so far this might be my favorite of the genre.Pros 1. shooting projectile system is on point (great gun battles)2. build bases turrets walls around valuable resource areas get super creative however wherever u want to build3. your base is still there when u sign off which puts for an amazingly exciting element of is my stuff gonna be ok?4. great crafting/great building interface5. addictive exploring6. great social aspect (if u act like a dbag u'll probably get slapped up often unless you have a bigger group of dbags with u)7. great claim ur part of the map vibe8. guns are fun to build9. research pretty much anything u find and with enough scrap and resources you can build it.10. lots morecons 1. takes a pretty heavy machine to play this one2. could get bullied and robbed a bunch which might demotivate u (takes a bit sometimes to find a server that has some half decent not dooshy people playing on it ((but then again that might just be the idea of rust im still gtting used to)) )3. cant play solo server4. wheres the fishing5. your wife or employer might be like hey where ya been?6. has the server finished loading yet?

review: Being a big time survival game fan (ARK The Forest 7 Days To Die etc.) I downloaded this game with high hopes. I wish I would have read the reviews first.This game is more like Fortnite in the sense that you pretty much just spawn battle and die. No time to build no place to hide. It's very hard to get into the game with cheaters/griefers everywhere. I've spawned and gotten killed before I could wake up multiple times. Sure ARK has their griefers too but at least you can hide.The longest I survived is when I teamed up with 4 other players which is extremely rare as everyone pretty much kills on site. We all met as fresh respawns yelling we were friendly built a base (after getting killed and trying to find each other several times) and then got wiped out by someone who was extremely accurate with an ak (don't worry he told us he doesn't cheat *sarcasm*Tried Official servers modded servers servers with low population "noob friendly" servers and everything in between.If your idea of survival is against Hackers and griefers this game is for you.Overall I don't recommend playing or buying this game.

title: Rust

review: Saw youtubers having lots of fun on this game. Goofy times and laughs. I haven't played it since legacy so I figured I'd give it a go. Big mistake but I'm glad I got it discounted on If you don't have a few good friends with a similar schedule don't buy this Even if you play on 100x server it's just not worth the effort as a solo player or even a duo. You'll spend a few hours getting your together. Making stressfull runs for loot and often getting killed before you get home. What you do manage to get back will feel great for the time you play that day. Log on the next day and oh it's all gone. Almost every time. Some clan will raid you while you're gone even if your base only looks mildly interesting. Good luck finding a quiet place to set up away from s. What was today a quiet valley with maybe one friendly neighbor in it will be some clan's warzone tomorrow. New updates to the system only make it increasingly difficult to manage as a solo player. Unless you get lucky it takes ing forever to get good gear and when you know it will all be gone tomorrow what's the point? Solo players can almost never reach a point where they can reasonably compete with groups. You might say "I'll just find a clan to join then!". Nope nobody wants you unless you've got thousands of hours logged into the game and even then its difficult to get recruited. I'm guessing this game will continue to push away new players as more updates come out to make it more of a grind. In summation if you like getting frustrated with minimal payoff buy this game. If you have good friends to play with you buy this game. If you don't steer clear.

review: It's fun to play with friends for a little while but after you realize your work gets wiped away every month it's hard to get motivated to play anything but sandbox servers. You start playing and gathering resources...and then you realize it's all for nothing and it's instantly less fun. It sucks because the rest of the game the graphics the gameplay is amazing. It's just hard to get into a game that deletes your progress every month. I understand why wipes happen but there are plenty of similar games that update without wiping players' data away.

review: This game Is good as an idea but the playerbase/"community" makes it not worth a damn no actual survival since bunch of "players" will either kill you on sight or grief you all the time (being "raided" is fine until youre killed every 5 10 min)Basically quoting someone who said it better "It's a survival game that is trying to capture the essence of human interaction and collaboration. What these people do these naked m4 bandits are things not even done by barbarians of the most vicious of sort and that is kill your own species for sport and without hesitation regardless of what rewards or otherwise negative outcomes could arise. You say it is a survival game but you don't actually play it as a survival game you play it like an FPS. Human survival requires fellowship something this game lacks and will continue to until either the community improves (doubtful) or an actual hard system is implemented into the game to discourage people from thinking this is a deathmatch with hunger."

review: The current status of the game has ruined the experience for both old and new gamers to the series. The updates to the engine have rendered the game almost unplayable considering the amount of constant lag and ping spikes. This happens on even freshly wiped servers as I thought perhaps the amount of abandoned building might have been a contributor. It's not. Not to mention the overall toxicity of other players in the majority of servers both dedicated and community. You can spawn into the game at the shore (where the building cancer is most severe) be alive for a total of 2 minutes then get run down by a 3 man group whom are outfitted to the teeth just for the mongaloid pleasure of killing someone. This happens even if you have nothing on you making the game almost impossible to get a good feeling for. No one wants to spawn into a game and immediately die over and over and over again.
title: Rust
